returning young giant lady sent hauing vnderstood full minde aunt entred chamber edoard taking sword prince hand brake foorth like speech somtimes thou didst remain seruice man losse famous fortunate little knewes thou art keeping since hap hath beene good gain thee dare auouch make thee redoubted homaged esteemed thy lord edoard gird thee putting vp againe sheath approched vnto bed spake order edoard awake captine prince hath thy hap light hand froward thy fortune approch place bid adiew thy former delight content thy selfe liue endles delleur court england sometime thy pleasure castle mine must thy prison youthfull affection wont thy sollace thou must forsake passe remainder thy dayes sorrow rue thy case giue thee comfort sorrow thinke thy misery giue thee remedie blood haue blood againe cruelty haue like rewarded thou shalt feele force chollericke moode reuengement bee sharpe trebble griefe thee sustaine prince vanquished sudden feare heare giant vse word fury put vp hand thought finde sword failing purpose presently sayd greenest grasse lyeth deceitfull serpent calmest water deepest whirlepoole place aman thinketh himselfe farthest mishap soonest assayled sudden mischance well quoth giant though anger doth vrge vnto great impatience cannot brooke open iniury done vnto mee bent seuerely reuenge thee thy kindred dealing shall make manifest great dishonour yet keepe thee first chaunced hand thou mayest witnesse rest displeasure thy life franckly freely giue thee seeing kingly lyon disdaineth vaunt conquered prey princely eagle scorneth stoupe flye besides thy life sufficiencie cause beeing first death father next distresse friend present griefe selfe lastly euer hereafter issue eternall sorrow appease life one tenne yet hundreth able make recompence suffice quench rigour neuertheles poore meanest sort minded vse thee thou list like thine owne choyse shall finde occasion recount thy posted pleasure also thinke thy present ensuing paine though griefe mee vse harde thy hap thou canst mayst refuse shall witnesse world misery thou art abide rarest misfortune euer man taste thy lucke law thy hard hap heauy hatred thou departest thou shalt sufficietly vnderstand time thou knowst haue authoritie thou shalt feele thy greater woo pretended iniurie hauing thus finished talke caused bee carried strongest prison top castle clapped great pair gyues leg minding furie neuer hee liued take againe edoard thus suddenly chaunged princely pompe present penurie court father cabbin foe presence ladie loathing life enclosed castle admirable prison vncomfortable dungeon dispaireable closing armes together entred sorrowfull mo e oh poore prince thy hope thou haddest great courtesie soone chaunged extreame crueltie didst thou credite faire wordes troth doest thou finde quite turned treason ala sooner deceiued well meaning man quickly beguiled mean honestly hath fortune hetherto allowed thee honour shee leaue thee taste horror hath thy life hetherto beene spent delight shalt thou end thy dayes direfull distresse ala hast helpe contrarie wherefore thou must holde thee content none neere succour thee wherefore suppe vp thy sorrow thy aged father misse thee thy louing ladie lacke thee thy courtly companion sorrow thy want bucephalus stoupe none alexander mercury pipe scunded none orphaeus euen proud soo may wayes intreated either must conquered strength craftily deceyued sleight farre thought deliuery farre comfort poore oppressed heart deere florida thou shalt call thy vnkindenesse question last departure thy presence woman opinion know care lesse trouble thy minde want thy comfort causeth miserie ala though haue thus left thee follie yet thinke still loue thee faithfully although thy griefe knowe great losse yet thinke sorrowe putteth extremity life prison amateth sadnesse opinion neuer againe see without whose companie life cannot long endure eyther dispaire vpon hard aduenture presently die sharpe assault inuincible prince primaleon griefe abide losse brother sorrow conceiue deare friend whose misfortune feare cause leaue parent whose tryed friendship mooue put life perill except soldan niqu e maiortes gatterit king tranies friendly perswasion may otherwise determine purpose though meere loue keepe home yet thinke mishap enforce sorry endeuour heare againe although vnpossible giue mee succour except giant traine vanquished queene daughter suffered spot dishonour crueltie greatly stood feare giant sister named eutropa cunning magicke neither zoriastes magitians deuilish art comparable helpe whereof knowledge death brother entered deepe heart shee vowed reuengement exceede cruell mischance hauing castell nephew sonne giant frenaque named dramusiande meant seeke sharpe reuenge shee tooke armes entred rufull complaint ah sweete nephew albeit thou art fatherlesse yet art thou friendlesse though thy tender time fortune hath framed thy mishap yet espect farder time art shall beginne thy manhoode finish hath thus cruelly murthered father hee himselfe lynage friendes familiar persecute extreame rygor like speech vttered shee prouided fortifie make strong castell least king england seeke ruine destruction giant kindred came eare treason shee pretended wherefore shee armed selfe kindred knowing resist power king asked smal defence remedy least worst happen enchaunted forrest round none could enter forreste without leaue vntill time yong giant dramusiande able beare armor receiue order knighthood processe time young giant grew able beare armor heart began thyrst reuenge father death accomplish hee desirous trauell aduenture strength according heart desired eutropia perceiuing courage minde exceed strength person de iled stay iourney would yeelde hand one hee might sufficiently reuenge death father thus perswasions changed minde dramusiande vntill hard fortune prince edoard brought castell entred without daunger good sworde kept force enchauntments hauing lost diuellish deceyte remained haue expressed vnspeakeablie leauing matter shall amisse speake somewhat state condition dramusiande albeit giant commonly rough impatient nature yet indued ciuilitie life honestie behauiour exempting crueltie surpassing stocke parentage courtesie long space kept edoard prison onely perceiued princely quality also sobrietie great gentle life hee caused fetter bee taken feete gaue leaue recreation walke castell vppon condition hee would seeme passe beyond limit without consent courteous prince gaue hand oath would passe one foote licence permit yet notwithstanding gaue charge vnto diuerse respect walking abroade hee respected aunte eutropaes promise many valiaunt knightes would aduenture liues searche strayed prince whome doubted haue also prisoner castell comming thither shee caused lye embush forrest great number armed men aide dramusiand hard hap misse purpose tssus passed young giant time pleasure eodard acqusinted himselfe former sorrowes chanceth vnto long time kept sight desire well want espoused ladie also griefe king father would conceiue ill luck yet gentle pastime dramusiand would often vse caused spend time pleasure else would haue wasted mourning thus leauing captiue prince forced content returne prince flerida left forrest sorrowfully exp cting glad returne lord edoard chap iii princesse flerida awayting returne loyal spouse edoard forrest deliuered two goodly yong prince sauage man walking two lion tooke feed lion withall happened sir pridos sonne duke galles search prince edoard princesse flerida lesse griefe mind agony whole person remained forrest expecting came well abandon diuers chollericke humour ouercharged impatient mind also exile eger passion still approching weake nature shee busied selfe gathering flower accompanied faire attaida diuers lady gentleman time recreation correspondent good liking heretofore could conceiue opinion like sudden fell remembrance lord edoard whose long absence admitted misfortune else vngentlenesse himselfe disdained presence resalue selfe shee doubtfull one might conuict selfe rash beleefe though might stand vpon good occasion betweene cogitation spent whole day yeelding complaint likewise vncomfortable night approching indeed seemed obscure griesly despairable night passed remembrance vpon hard motion fell resolute opinion neuer heare good tidings lord edoard knight spent labour search returned without tidings lord lady perceiuing passion extreame vpon heretofore beganne cast themselues whether might depart leaue fit stay still great griefe length thus concluded abide returne duke galles whose absence likewise princesse agreeued would haue bene bene present vncomfortable night gone cheerefull deawes phoebus displayed ouer earth duke galles returned glad sight prince lesse ioy attendant hoped wished newes lord heare become soueraigne expectation farre disappointed ignorant prince caused fresh hurt vpon olde griefe neuerthelesse intreated lord take themselues trauaile might fortune perswaded haue better successe meanetime would abide princesse comfort vowed neuer returne thence till shee heard tidings best beloued noble gentleman lesse loyaltie prince edoard loue bare princesse flerida addressed themselues presently fulfill request among whome pridos eldest sonne duke galles chiefe gentleman attendant prince rode along sea shore mette two companion likewise endeuoured themselues search edoard determined returne past hope good successe neuerthelesse auoyd euill conceit princesse angry moode aged father hee left rode solitary sometime exclaiming fortune hard hap againe blaming solly perceiued remedie midst whereof brake forth like speech meete mortall creature blame inuey heauenly creator iustly good reason may claime like occasion whose sorrow enioy one houre succor whose mone admitted halfe houre mirth whose extreame griefe taste sauour halfe minute rest horse haung laboured day take rest inne night little bird comfort selfe euery twigge fish sport make pastime himselfe riuer briefe euery creature enioyeth quiet pleasant life man onely excepted excelling creature forme feature inferior tranquillitie life surueying whole course man life beginning end admit phylosophers sentence either neuer borne quickly die good continued carefull complaint longer would haue done presence damesell caused forget mounted black palfrey attired likewise blacke garment comming still toward sir pridos made somwhat amazed yet took courage againe hope certified glad idings co cerning strayed prince edoard damosel behauing selfe curteously lesse audacitie wit exquisste quality maiden ciuilitie taking sir pridos horse bridle saluted speech sir knight presence doe argue presumption boldnesse breake silent cogitation seeme maydenly modestie eye let humble intreaty passe one tydings bring craue pardon paine take small purpose griefe ouerloade minde withall little auayle proofe whereof giue eare word shall somewhat ease minde heere make ende trauayle edoard prince whose noblenesse hath euer bene famous late aduentures hath proued fortunate liueth yet depriued libertie captiue whose anger asswaged long time must stay griefe sorrow wherefore thy knighthood charge thee certifie princesse flerida daungerous vse great impatience may cut time yet abate trouble might manifest princely magnanimitie minde conquering griefe valure patience fortune prepared another mishap happen soone referre shall feele shall know therefore giue vnderstand griefe needelesse state helpelesse vntill appointed time extreame sorrowes shall finish vnspeakable ioyes thus say argonida sendeth tydings losse displeasant selfe damosell ending heere tale gaue bridle palfray left syr pridos whose remembraunce knowledge lady presently came shee daughter lady enchauntresse isle eagle rauished ardesdegno begotten primaleon time excellent tryumphes made battayle fought knight vnknowne isle argonida edoard sonne named pompides large rehearsed booke primaleon let passe returne sir pridos hauing well noted tale argonida returneth place left prince declaring vnto happened shee became sorrowfull desired nothing company liuing ought haue yet aliue could haue sorrowes tooke deepe perswasion heart immediately shee fell labour lady perceiuing gentleman giuing place duetie many grieuous pa g incident taking happily deliuered two goodly men child ladie atraida receyuing two young prince wrapped rich costly clothes preseuted princesse holding opinion sight would somwhat mitigate great vexation mind taking armes mixing talke teares declaring motherly affection thus said ah sweete infant reioyce much fortune hauing wrought malice vppon mee yet twaine shee hath attributed disloyall accident hath done well shee cannot doe respecting haue lost friend father happie beene bringing twaine world departed selfe yet nature vrgeth mee recall wordes father absence appeased mother presence yet sharpe assault would hartily nourish twaine heauily brought dismaying life remaining heauie complaint two young child prouision made would baptized demaunded shee weuld haue named willed first might called palmerin name father effect misfortune might bee well compared passed borne forrest shee desired name might haue relation place birth thus determined florian du desert much say florian forrest ceremony accomplished required matter princesse receyued two infant vppon lappe one mournfull tune still theyr cry au teat bring asseepe euer minding harde misfortune lord neuer ceasing deplore misery life esteeming one excel hard happe aboue vnlooked mischaunce commonly hapneth pleasure without paine adioyned quiet calme accident conuerted rough tempest euen careful princesse whose extreame griefe mishappe added perswasion minde fortune done worst executed vttermost spight wanted accomplish quiet concerning absence louing edoard determined resolute opinion albeit farre incomparable losse yet nature willed forced content asswage vrgent passion presence two young prince time good hope end griefe present occasion serue somewhat satisfied marke vnkindely happened forrest long time remained sauadge man vsing companie reasonable creature became vnreasonable himselfe course life brutish beastly diet hearbs rootes ground apparell framed skinnes wilde beastes shewed man name nature sauadge man walking woont along forrest leading hand couple lyon whome vsed sometime kill game would serue nourishment vnhappily espyed princesse traine mooued withdrawe himselfe thicket tree neere adioyning pleasure behold ceremony vsed baptizing child nowe fortune determined second mishappe princesse shee vrged sauadge man goe take two infant sweetely sleeping mother lap giue food vnto lyon day receyued sustenaunce foorth among tree hee coms little astonishment princesse whose sorrowful minde subiect moytie feare great dismaying courtly attendant presence grim sire betooke themselues flight one receyuing courage hart abide princesse lady attaida neuor shrunke one foote would haue aduentured death princesse defence might bene answerable good stomacke princesse saw herselfe subiect hard mischance old duke galles vnarmed gladde flie indeede best help shee wished sir pridos hee departed london fetch charriot bring court vrged thus content selfe let suffice thee poore flerida thou art borne vnto misfortune approched sauadge man tooke two young prince neyther vsing word offering harme departed presently caue leauing princesse ouercome traunce whereout lady attaida diligent meanes recouered chap iiii phow syr pridos departed frow forrest left princesse came court king fredericke declared vnto losse prince edoard small griefe cittizens london princesse flerida left forrest brought court syr pridos seene byrth two prince hee resolued departe thence london ende might cause charriot bee brought forrest conuey princesse vnto court father k fredorick leaning chaber window espied sir pridos come ryding great haste caused cast doubt euill newes approching iudged show sadnesse instant time hee could perceiue like whereof resolued presently sent syr pridos know cause sudden arriuall whose griefe could conceale losse edoard teares laide open discourse grieued aged king heare galled heart recount king vnlooked newes fell extreame passion teares bedeawed aged bearde grieuous sighes issued heart syr pridos could hardly keep life life intreaty vse meanes patient perswasion aged king stroken debility hope betweene impatient assault doubt daunger hee thus began vse speeche himselfe edoard nature willes deplore thy losse intire affection make dye thy lacke whose presence staffe myne aged dayes whose absence sword wound death grasse hang heeles mercurie mosse abide stone sisiphus certaintie looked hand fortune whose sicklenesse seene chaunge whose frowardnesse chaunce long haue trusted late hath shee deceiued one folly fashion yet doubt thou enioy thy life substance thy valure shall exceede sharepnesse vengeance lesse welcome thee long wished ala well may hide griefe neuer heartily forget well may awhile brooke long time beare want comfort cut dayes doubt conceyue bring mee greater distresse thou present minde would satisfied spight fortune award mischance king continued great agony inde queene entred likewise vnderstanding losse sonne began adde another stratageme griefe bewraying motherly affection teares heauy complaint appease aged king thus began madame honour noble minde tried aduersitie extremitie griefe conquered patience minde minde impatient kept within lymittes moderate gouernment least crosse happeneth waightie paine sence farre weake reason pleased almightie giue v sonne wee receiued little comfort whome fame hath beene knightly aduanced trie brooke moitie displeasure hath caused accident happen keepe v desired yet depriuing v hope griefe haue lost comfort shall see againe meane time let v tollerate sharpe affliction two princely child till enioy fight father againe shall noble mother comfort sorrowes also endeuour abate mones one another shal beare equall share aduersitie partner also good fortune chaunce happen thus king queene remained one perswasion patience wholy vanquished force griefe whose passion referre iudgements haue tasted honour fame hatred fortune returne syr pridos time caused brother ride chariot forrest princesse might brought court placed chariot ready depart shee gaue heauy farewel place well lord edoard misfortune child attendaunts seemed drowned sadnes see princesse ouercome sorrowe come citie london cittizens comming greece onely excell varietie deuises also discouered ioy singular triumphes sorrowfull disposition bewrayed terrour losse yet intermedled showe ioy assage dolor princesse came court perceiued great chaunge woonted disportes king queene also nobility likewise vnderstanding mishap two young prince altogether begin world lamentation king dismaying good hope queene dispayring double extremity lord lady apparell iesture wholly exclaiming cruelty fortune inhabitaunts throughout whole realme england whose delight many time fit conceiue maruailous opinion lesse knightly famous aduentures prince edoard nowe sit sighing wringing handes pulling theyr bonnet ouer theyr eye vsing generall voyce amongst oh none vnhappy king hauing thus passed night lesse griefe minde sickly assault aged person queene princesse flerida equally considered morrow hee determined send knight court named argolant sonne duke horten brother traendos also bin amourous princesse flerida emperor palmerin constantinople let vnderstand late misfortune england ready depart rode thorow london streetes adorned blacke citizen arrayed black mourning manner bringing sea shore tooke shipping departed princesse flerida became feeble person insomuch doubt good recouery god suffering ende shee willingly would gaue strength againe little little comforted selfe best foorth company caused many knight leaue court liue search strayed prince edoard pitied case abscence thus remained fayre flerida chast penelope absent lord vlisses fayling one iote true faithfull loue though shee dayly contemned aduerse estate life hee likewise fayled constant loyalty preferred terror death falsifying faith lady iustly fulfilling neither distaunce place extremity fortune could part sunder hee willed might presently dismembred piece hungry stomacke required haue meate wife whose heart motherly pittie excelled sauadge crueltie indeede woman nature doe beare estimation mercie requisite men shee vsed kinde perswasions husband also finding meane prouide necessary saued liues infant satisfied hungry appetite husband louingly shee became theyr second mother carefully nourished beene whose redoubted behauiour hath wonne honour field dignitie fame mutuall consent aduentured limme life report deedes might manifest renowne knighthood shall haue knowledge behaued themselues worthy returne greece long trauelled encountred aduenture worthy rehearsall length arriuing bottom valley lacedemonia whe sun declined west part discoraged night obscure vpon beside thicknes tree made passage tenebrous else would haue bene hardly could finde way wandring still vsing minde seuerall imagination least comfort himselfe ioy esquyre sorrowed see lorde suddenly pensiue hee espyed gailant troupe ladyes bearing theyr hand lighted torch eache one well mounted lustie steede attyred blacke framing voice great lamentation primaleon surprised great griefe minde see fayre ladyes weare habite mourner tooke boldnesse himselfe beholde drawing himselfe somewhat nearer perceiued chiefe lady mistresse palfrey trapped black veluet vesture foure ancient knight middest bearing funerall couered blacke veluet primaleon perceiuing heauy lamentation nothing abashed presence helde iourney though seene tooke earnest desire must need demand cause mourned manner presenting himselfe chiefest ladie whose faire face sustained great blemish abundance teares issued eye manner prepared himselfe giue onset faire lady impute flattery call folly much rather nature cannot admit praise perfectio mind answered perswasion vnfeigned meaning esteemeth haue said albeit farre inferior could say desire vnder duety may demaund sute otherwise disposed may stand honour replie honesty request friend lady foe vnto none insomuch moytie desire rather hinder mishap dishearten danger briefe request thus frequent solitary place accompanied equal sorrow althougy worthy comparison may soueraigntie accompanie funerall heauie complaint considering pleasure court fit delight vncomfortable abyding solitary desart thus much knightly oath auouching knewe sustained iniury hand would eyther cause recount hee hath done hishonour constraine reuenge dearest blood ladie hauing well noted courtesie primaleon well knightly offer good opinion shee conceyued performance satisfied request gentle replye syr knight lesse good liking behalfe prince edoard hee meanes could direct fancy course promise passed princesse flerida withheld consent gladly looked auoyd therefore might happen refused vse company talke hee wont much displeased bellagris solda niquee death molerin eldest brother hee vnderstanding secret affection great good entirely bare noble prince edoard aduentured trie fortune fauourably prospered intent vnder tytle edoard entred sister chamber acquainting himselfe desire deceit time brought tho pleasure goodly sonne named blandidon hereafter shall largely certified pandritia giuing credite selfe misfortune departing garden damoselles house sadnesse supposing thereto end life losse loue remaineth place shut dore prince primaleon likewise endeuoring himselfe aduentures returne two young princesso sauage man wife carefully nourished vp beene owne child could haue vsed motherly compassion short time grew estate whole delight hunt sauage beastes forrest wherevnto florian affection brother palmerin vsed euery day beare bowe leade two lyon hee became expert sauage man himselfe thus ten yeares space liued two young prince beloued w greatest enemie fortuned sunday morning prince fletida walked forth forrest well sorrow luue lamet estate infortunate life hauing accomplished desired returned time florian wandred forrest lyon tyed vp meaning take force first wilde beast appeare sight hauing long stayed without prey determined returne last espyed mighty hart groue tree whereat let slie arrow force passed cleane body beast hart feeling himselfe wounded prosently tooke flight perceiuing let slip lion vaine swiftnesse hart outreached speedy pace lyon florian strayed farre lost sight lyon harte also way sauadge man house caused wander heauinesse till darke night ouershadowed espyed two shepheards making little fire stickes warme night exceeding colde florian arriued hee sate downe riuers side place mother brought world sitting pretty espyed knight come ryding attyred blacke armor spotted red bearing shielde figure gryffon certaine poesie vnknown lady himselfe excepted knight named sir pridos still aduanced himselfe search noble prince edoard rode pensiue sad till casting eye vpon floran heart beganne somewhat conceiue maruellous inward ioy countenance bare perfect image noble father whereupon sir pridos fell diuers demaundes florian courteously answered syr pridos fell great desire would beare company london wherein king court would present among number whome renowmed fame euer accompany young prince florian desirous leade life among braue gallantes passe time solitarie among vnfrequenten place wilde forrest gaue consent iournyed sir pridos english court presented king cloathed skinne harte thing small admyration king yet hee receiue graciously supposed one sonnes princesse flerida vnto whose chamber walked young prince manner beganne salute fayre daughter among grieuous vexation afflict weake nature loe heere honour syr pridos doeth present withall searching noble lord sonne hath found iewell hee offereth frustes labour trust oftner beholde sweete countenance conceyue opinion allyance sonne edoard princesse flerida little pleased glad present signe whereof shee imbraced sonne albeit vnknowen went straight way sir pridos certified found sitting place sauadge man came two lyon tooke two child mooued flerida suppose sonne fortune would yet suffer perfect assuraunce eyther hee know mother shee childe neuerthelesse shee gaue name desart training vp company young gentleman sonne syr pridos attaida named rosiran de la bronde whome leaue gentle prince florian know sauadge man palmerin seeing florian returned woont chap viii grieuous sauadge man tooke suddaine losse yong prince forian perceiued two lion returne washed blood hart slaine young prince palmerin walking sea side seeke brother accompanied siluian sauadge man sonne departed thence galley polendos king thessalie sailed constantinople presented emperor damosel mounted white courser bearing armes arriued court constantinople presented emperor letter sent lady lake gaue large vnderstand oappen yong prince palmerin long expected sauadge man returne florian seeing waxed darke hope deceiued hee measure disquieted absence florian whose company expertnesse towardnesse exercise commodious griefe would suffer expresse wherefore hee concluded thus young florian way distressed himselfe vtterly disdained fortune morning lyon returned home al washed blood hart slaine sauadge man percelued guide wanting thus pollnted anguish heart chollericke perswasi n dosperate moode hee slew lyon entred disquietnesse nothing could asswage extreame passion yong prince palmerin sustaining great sorrow absence brother walked sea shore accompanied siluian sauadge man sonne sitting comforting greene bancke naturs moued one nurture espied galley strike shore twaine disported polendos king theslalie chiefe captaine galley likewise directed iourney finding edoard commanded cast anker recreation sake would walke vp forrest also finde sweete water whereof greatly destitute palmerin siluian seeing king landed fearing least sustaine harme ignorant determined courteous deme let passe haue cause molest depart friendly perceiuing nothing courtesie polendos deholding beautie palmerin lesse ciuill comely behauiour bdth desired goe abrdad hee would preferre place raised honour finde thing equiual gentle nature palmerin whose fancy could hardly brooke sauadge kinde life rather desired acquaint himselfe courtly exercise gaue grant king requested albeit siluian vsed intreatie perswade contrary hee saw meanes deuised could take effect well great loue betweene inuiolate affection alway bare young prince vowed neuer leaue company either misery misfortune accident whatsoeuer king lesse delighted minde greatly contented manner palmerin seruants beeing returned necessary hee sent went abroad heysed sayles presently committing themselues god mercie waues riding pleasure king desired palmerin hee might lawfull craue much certifie concerning byrth parentage courteous prince right willingly gaue consent vnto declaring life sauadge man certainely supposed father many dayes fayling arriued constantiuople preset endued great heauines time past surpassed princely delight port hauen likewise nakedly prouided ship occean mediterranian sea scattered whole nauy search p edoard also know become noble primaleon yet time wished tydings heard emperor vnderstanding polendos arriued constantinople walked wn hauen accompany pallace come hearing tidings son became sorrowfull cotinued long time polendos put emperour sadde cenceyte presented vnto young prince palmerin accompanied siluian ca ing eye young prince entred presently alteration ioy beene sonne primaleon could hardly haue beene better contented wherefore commaunded knight conduct hm princesse gridonia willing giue seruant faire polinarda whose beauty excellent feature agreeable euery lyneament modestie decent vertue therto apparant rightly termed phaenix beauty famous among lady bounty empresse gridonia receiued yong prince albeit ignorant estate yet beseemed honor respecting sent went straightway present faire polinarda time caused aduenture good fortune among pike mischanches hazard daunger onely loue hee bought deerely gaue daintily proofe let suffice hereafter ensueth attend strange rare euent subdaine arriued emperor pallace comely damosell mounted courser white swan bearing armor also answerable colour haire spread ouer shoulder gaue cause meruaile saw come presence emperor little admiration beare company drew foorth letter delyuering maiestie behauiour meete gratifie honourable personage emperour deliuering one herald comanded read publique audience vnseaking began followeth pto inuincible renowned palmerin emperour greece salutation renowned emperor whose name enemy quaketh subiect reioyceth whose court name rich valiant friendship reward venterous wish thy state permanent thy deed hath beene puissant vnanimitie thy friend prosper longanimitie happy fortune yong prince thou hast receiued thy court albeit thou maist think incredible yet shall finde certaine time doeth must descended two puissant king christendome himselfe victorious uer wherefore let entertainment honour doth deserue estimation according valure doth declare must need defend diadem thy domiminions shall remaine destitute wished defence shall make thee lauded fortune loued thy enemy thy dearest friend likewise two infortunate prince world shall enioy libertie many haue shall attempt alone oidained finish exployr aboue fauour fortune shall exell nobilitie knighthood thus leauing summe promise gratious triall wish noble emperour greece may liue eternall honour felicitie dutie pen word way disclole lady lake emperor lesse amazed happy aduenture contented glad newes noble yong prince desired damosel might lady lake damosell replied noble sir altogether vnknowne thus much dare boldly assure maiestie letter presenteth shall performed worthy young prince speech ended damosell departed emperor perceiuing sent yong prince vpon vsing many cheerfull countenance desired noble gentleman standing might tearmed palmerin owne name thought better esteemed lady polinarda whose fauor greatly esteemed wearing lady color might giue cause beliefe empres gridonia still lamented losse primaleon whose absence court chiefest cause sorrow chap ix happened vernar prince allemaign search edoard controuersie betweene belcar duke dura vnfortunate forrest england haue declared vernar prince allemaigne sonne emperour trineus faire agrigola left court constantinople palmerin departed seeke prince edoard affaire gentle prince likewise behaued himselfe worthily many rare exploytes fame remaineth perfect type hononr allemaigne chronicle cause leaue rehearse returning happened prince charge speake fortuned hee hauing spent small labour trauaile arriued last great brittaine good hope heare newes end labour entred vnfortunate forrest ryding sadly mind somwhat distracted remebrance faire bazilia length met comely knight brauely mounted attyred gilt armour whereon wrought many leopard artificiall deuice yet crazed broken rough encounter beene sheeld bare serpent field siluer trauailing also search strayed prince likewise meet professed magnanimitie minde combate honour owne good fortune cause left lady english court among called knight serpent passing prince vernar vsed courtesie vnto beseemed knighthoode meete noble person altogether vsing thoughtes fayrest bazilia leysure beholde knight courtesie knight serpent supposing eythere hee willingly would perceyue seeing scorned gentle salutation vsed reuiued prince vernar speech syr knight mee thinkes might stand honour profession blemish way bounty euery way haue thought well meant ill haue gratified like courtier disdained passe vse courtesie prince driuen foorth dump whereto hee pleasure knight gentle proffer betweene iset earnest thus answered sir muy offended without blame iudge behauior bald would constraine speake hearing speeche matter minde would suffer see much lesse heare syr quoth knight serpent excuse farre simple denying hearing sight though statelynesse would suffer see yet leawdnesse speech doth iustifie might heare vernar hearing large language knight might quickly mooue anger subiect ouer much melancholie thus shortly replyed syr knight haue better licence depart leaue stay minde troubled metters rather requireth absence thea alloweth presence giuing farther vnderstand companie much heart strife may arise betweene v great harme knight perceyued small estimation vernar thus roundly replyed syr either bringing vp hath bene ouer churlish present behauior scant currant esteem courtesie like carter courtyer ciuile demeanour fitte holde ploughe fine quality honour person esteeme meete modest expresse friuolous motion doth represse abruptly nature friendly manner greater danger concealing desire damage concealing simple demand desire rather quoth vernar mine owne ruine simple graunt request much expedient none know thought shee onely excepted must priuie thinke wherefore esteeming thy manhoode small commaund thy might compell bury thought death intend satisfie thy desire leauing word fell weapon shiuering speares armour encounted brauerie glad take breathing knight serpent beganne thus charge belieue sir finde skirmish hote concealed thoughtes may esteemed wisedome estate standeth sharpe hazarde mute conceyts force yeeld sure helpe hope shall shew difference betweene carelesse groome courtly gentleman syr aunswered prince vernan opinion yet farre beyond purpose wide hope scant wise put intent hap perswade selfe thus courage haue foyle secrecie esteem mine owne faith shall ere long giue absolute answere whether shal perish determination thy selfe preuaile thou demandest shall craue longer forbearance sword hath taught manner would teach kinde modestie fell fresh combate dangerous first assault wearied sword endeuoured wrastling suppresse strength eache equal behauiour force losse blood great yet valorous heart would conceiue faintnesse knight serpent desire knowe fought began vse fair speech perceiue sir esteeme earnest opinion stand feare losse life honour deliuer vnto knowledge seuere chaunce happen vnto either v yet minde affected know secret selfe shall value life life qd vernar much willing loose much perceyue zealous know shall wherevppon beganne againe third time albeit faintly passed caused esquyres standing enter many heauy complaintes especially esquire prince vernar thus framed mone oh infortunate emperor ignorant fortune time depriue ioy knight serpent noting word presently coniectured prince vernar sonne emperour allemaigne entred combat grieuous emperor palmerin would take matter heard losse either beside would loth way displease gentle prince vernar wherefore assurance beheld broken shield wherein perceiued deuise lady bazilia coloured purple halfe burning heart midst armor prince portraite curiously drawne gaue perswasion hee hee thus vsed speech syr vernar minde constraineth giue ouer fight right sorrie haue continued long princesse bazilia cause sorrow feared vtter selfe declared pardon friende belcar hartily sorry rather desireth death see distresse prince vernar perceiuing friend belcar ran embracing armes giuing thousand thanks found meane cut quarrell taking helme theyr esquire best binde vp wound rode citie brique far forrest recounting happened search prince edoard chap x phow eutropa gaue dramusiande vnderstand arriuall knight castell whose valiant behauiour put cause feare word made presently fortifie castell auoyd anie perill might annoy primaleon knight eutropa spake came castell iusted deare friend edoard fight knowledge hope purchase deliuery ouercame pandare alligan two monstrous giaunts entring combate likewise dramusiande ouercam primaleon tooke prisoner castell dramusiande still retaining captiuitie prince edoard sudden aduertised enchauntresse eutropa aunte arriue certaine knight castell whose valour prowesse goe neere attainte honour also inforce life stand hazard giuing credite vnto perswasion likewise somewhat carefull auoyde imminent perill fortified castel sure defence thought sufficient award enemie maintaine intent vowed prosecute feare time maketh man become wise else desperate moode would set world wheeles dramusiande albeit famous deedes yet fearefull surprised danger vseth industrie aunte eutropa helpe friend whose courage knew equall wise foresight reuenged knight death father frenaque better accomplish entertained castle two hardy fearefull giant one named pandare alligan whose stature lesse vglinesse strength cruell resistance would haue euery thing due preparation determined neede would haue castle defended thus noble prince edoard knight came haue first honour fight next giant pandare giue fresh assault twaine faile misfortune auntes word made doubt mischaunce stout alligan obscure caue would giue last welcome whose countenance feareful saw whose might cruell hap feele fortune bending browes couragious primaleon earst aduanced honour determined vnhappinesse directeth course vnfriendly castle end trauailes owne thraldome left solitarie pandritia realme lacedemonia trauelled burgondie happening among knight come place triumph himselfe brauely mounted greene armor colour somewhat asswaged extreame melanchollies sheelde ground azure sea brauely painted bare deuice triumph bare away honour day trauailing iourney hee arriued manner castle dramusiande come neare castle noble prince edoard came foorth vppon bridge valiantly mounted armour blacke whereon resemblaunce little flame fire tormenting louers heart engrauen middest breast sheelde aunswerable colour armour middest whereof curiously painted image sadde conceited mind artificiallie framed beholder might easily iudge heauinesse knight according sad deuise primaleon lesse abashed brauery castle see knight well appointed armes began order vse speech syr knight would happy else hardy enter castle without offering combate well satisfie mine owne desire loath offer rude demean desiring request stand reason let passe choller vpon knightly courtesie edoard perceiuing comely behauiour primaleon whome hee ignorant knowledge shaped presently answere knew sir knight hard entertainment vnfriendly vsage knight whatsoeuer enter castle would loath spend speech fond request rather vse speed safe retire place may increase fame place may stay sorrow follie perswasions cannot withhold intent rashly runne continuall trouble knowe must first award puissance resisteth knightes seeke wilfully theyr owne perill admit fortune denie victorie seeke ouerthrowe vnder title valiance yet hazard passe doth discourage thinke dishearten trie trust sir answered primaleon word sufficient make feare bare minde c auen captaine heereof assure selfe neither perswasion daunger doubt selfe come cause feare show shall make fainte shadowe estimation alwayes beare mee harde aduenture brauer victorie sir take certaintie haue setled hope neyther remoue onely death selfe thus concluding speech couched speares began sharpe encounter wherin behaued themselues brauely stood castle beholding lesse commend theyr valour good intent eache othar shewed hope victorie last fiercely met togither vnhorsed much displeased primaleon beeing neuer life cast foorth saddle drawing sword thus approched prince edoard sir knight trye strength vsing sword equall force haue felt speare hauing made mee impatient beeing neuer ouerthrowen doth increse courage know hath done instant many attempt could done edoard lesse offended mishap amazed courage perceiued aduersarie began suspect knight endeuored himselfe brother friend primaleon cause moued think equall state strength time past often prooued doubt resolue himselfe thus began syr primaleon may rather tearmed presumption politique foresight would striue matche aboue manhoode mee might accounted rather foolish hardinesse friendly heede doe brauery exceede limites bountie striue friend dutie ought honour primaleon hearing friendly speech prese tly knewe brother edoard casting sword ground hee embraced prince louing salutation heart able thinke tongue speake selfe make manifest meane inward ioy conceiue high good fortune doo esteem trauells deare friend brother perceyue health happines primaleon liueth longer edoard reioyceth long haue desired happie day long haue sought good lucke daunger albeit neuer prosperous heare yet fortunate men come see edoard would haue answered againe giant pandare brought word dramusiande breake theyr talke come whose commandement prince obeying entred castle primaleon offering goe pandare beeing armed great yron mace hand strong shielde thrust backe churlish wordes stay sir knight meane see thou canst deliuer thee hand also thou warrant thine life primaleon beholding great pride pandare dishonor offred word also disdaine tooke thus controled gaue answer difficult answere thee thy wordes require dangerous correct boldnesse proud riuall scorne vse word peasant whose maners far honestie maister neuer come knowledge thereof whose plume may pull due reward shall thinke warrant better wisdome escape brag owne brauerie may hap lie lurtch pandare vexed reply primaleon knowing whether best answere word deed last sent blow yron mace primaleons shield shiuered piece grieued stading need made foe triumph hoped death hee espying part body pandare vnarmed reacheth blow reuenge shield began stagger hardly withholding himselfe fro falling earth dramusiande leaning edoard foorth windowe castell perceiuing courage primaleon daungerous combate desired know name whence edoard answered according desired giuing vnderstand onely many aduentures hee put life hazard onely sake dramusiande knewe hee determined primaleon apartner edoard keepe twaine captiuitie till fortune sent customer pandare seeing blowes bestowed smal purpose primaleon returned many shrewde greeting flung sworde target great furie pretending destruction primaleon yron mace many sore stroke passed either part primaleon followed determination well stroken pandares fowre finger wherewith mace fell ground stooping recouer primaleon gotten good aduantage hee stroken head ougly giant alligan obscure caue bene rescue stepping betweene thus saluted primaleon syr knight thou hast fresh labour beginne wherefore withdrawe thy hand conqnered come deale hope conquer thee therewithall primaleon fully prouided receiued cruell blowe head put danger primaleon seeing fearefull enemie mighty blowes still charged withall bethought friende edoard whose helpe fierce assault might doe small pleasure yet hee considered himselfe doubtlesse neede kept vnder hee might assist else hee perswaded himselfe would requisite helpe hee ready wish hee taking vp shielde pandare betweene alligan himselfe began hotteskirmish place fought altered colour theyr blood made manifest yet alligan rough behauiour little hope good successe hardinesse primaleon hadde martyred shield armour piece defence beare blowes fresh eager assault noble hearted prince brought vnto lowe estate supposed quight slaine mooued sitte downe rest faintnesse losse blood wearynesse long continuing battell made glad desirous little ease dramusiande perceyuing harde euent combat standing doubt fortune sinister meanes would seeke ouerthrowe depriue looked aunte laboured armed himselfe presently came foorth primaleon assailing first wordes syr knight friend please foe dare one may finde comfort distresse incurable mischiefe beare companie great daunger mee thinkes honour yeelde blemish knighthoode endure fresh assault great hazarde esteeme courteous offer see wound cured mine owne charge weake estate comforted beseemeth good knight primaleon well nothing honest word dramusiande fearing faire talke might beare fauor shrewde meaning made answere sir paine haue bestowed sharpe encounter haue eudured might purchase deliuery dearest friend ddward would make estimation courtesie confesse selfe life euer bound duty iudge meane nothing lesse reward trauaile desireth nothing heart bent vnto hautie enterprise intreatie serue shall gayned perforce courtesse esteemed compulsion may shall command oath haue made friend doeth discharge heart feare hope haue victorie bid rather die vanquished shall award reproch world true friend whose safetie tender owne soule dramusiande pause tooke occasion reply manner sir knight two cause account honour vse thee courteously first greatly pittie harme may ensue vnuised heade doth brauerie fashion glad bitter teares bemoane folly second cause conquer thee would rather discredite honour gotten victory considering thy vnfortunate miserable estate knightly puissance shall bestowe thee neuerthelesse charme proud speech thou hast vsed correct rash behauiour thy vnstayed wit thou shalt know tam mallepart bridle cannot rule owne manhood vpon word laid fiercely primaleon whose debility rather required quietnesse extreame stroke hee must needes suffer neuerthelesse hee employed himselfe nimble defence weary trauayle would permit mooued great compassion minde dramusiande see weakenesse body agree inuincible courage heart would thing haue slaine easily might haue done hee would vse perswasio discharged order sir knight thou maist see refuse fight griefe sustaine thy hurt feare haue thee doe harme token whereof set thee libertie one willing doe thee good desire haue bereaue thee life thou refuse courtesie desperately seeke thine owne destruction promise thee neither mercy may asswage rygour meane beside shall withhold reuenge carelesse ow e life great pitie loose primaleon casting eye vpon armour perceiued al broken battered piece also bathed blood issued fro wound calling remembrance lady gridonia whose heart might hardly brooke heare mischance best beloued walked little himselfe vsing silent cogitatios madame behold last day heauy departure last farewell sent teares bleeding heart subiect mine enemy striue conquere yet rather desire death lose honor name know next assault last tragedie time must refuse loue friend yet forsake remembring losse wel hard hap whe fortune hath determined extremitie seeke shunne would iustly repay deserued shame famous emperor renowned father whose thought far heauy case troubled heart void comfort yet let iust perswasion cut griefe may sustaine liues friend whose freedome felicity die freend whose thraldome misery desire finish ere shrinke one iot honour knighthood albeit losse blood ouerchargeth mee faintnesse long continuance fight oppresseth wearines yet shall neuer reported primaleon turned backe forgetting bounty left ield one hauing already conquered twaine ioy conceiue finding chiefest friend biddeth die ere leaue shall hee trie loue thinke deare father sweete gridon ia forget duetie law nature willeth beare desperately run mine owne death increase sorrowe continuall mones thinke haue ventured vpon honour loue estimation friend time commaunds mee hazard life wherein swerue obedience friend amitie pause hartened noble primaleon ran couragiously vpon dramusiande word defend thy selfe either win haue promised leaue life gage thy presence whereupon fell fiercely combate againe made dramusiande muse see noble courage primaleon weake defence hee himselfe last extreame faintnesse fell ground though hee beene quite bereaued life caused dramusiande beare chamber edoard comaunding chirurgions phisitions vse great care diligence sauing life might bee possible hee greatly affected saue life couragious knight edoard pensiue great daunger primaleon whose health hee lesse carefull hee beene venterous purchase deliuerie somwhat receuered knowledge eutropa great friendship good time come sustaine handes nephew dramusiande make double amends mischance happened thus leaue dramusiande vsing meanes might health primaleon also recouery pandare alligan last brought good constitution body ioy great comfort two faythfull prince liued loued reioyc others friendly company chap xi emperor constantinople made noble young prince palmerin knight diuers yong prince lord court hee honourably made knight armes ppalmerin remaining long time father beloued euery one princely behauiour esteemed best gentle nature grew vnto ripenesse age greatly desired order knighthood feare loose seruice lady mystresse polinarda vowed duty heart whole course life knightly aduentures withdrewe minde bold enterprise shee likewise ioyned equal affection modestie caused couer maydenly demeanour moue conceale shee would rashly run suspition frame whole endeuour reproach lady neither regarding theyr honor theyr owne honestie emperor remayned somewhat pensiue two sonnes seeing neuer knight returned departed theyr search caused remember lady lake comfort himselfe somwhat tydings concerning young prince palmerin whose meanes good hope vnderstand estate albeit affection would hardly permit trauaile wherefore willing content subiects stood doubt gouernment emperours decease hee caused tryumph bee proclaymed wherein hee would trie towardly beginning palmerin would encourage minde expect good successe vpon determination willed young knight de endants knight court bee readie prepared easter holy day rumor famous triumph caused many florendos flatir sonnes renowned primaleon matter thus dispatched went vp hall sumptuously adorned cloathes gold euery knight placed dinner according estate noblenesse birth dinner ended table knight beganne tornament one behauing himselfe valiantly two knight arriued among attired greene armor behaued themselues brauely presence emperour knight entred within list trumpet sounded begin triumph palmerin appointed begin first iust gaue curtesie lady polinarda himselfe thus opened present thoughs good lady whose beautie prize allureth field whose curtesie honour striue attaine let fauour remaine assured dare warrant selfe victory aboue beautie shall bountie conquer mischance wherewith hee couched speare libusan greece enduring abraue combate till last hee taught libusan sit ho aster palmerin nothing dismayed ioying hee conquered one chiefest knight greece greatly pleased emperour lady polinarda also whole company knight whose eye partner gallant exployt prince florendos encountred follane brother platir attenebrant blacke knight whose valure one lesse cheerfull beholder delightfull themselues gracian tragandor brake speares violence horse man sent ground berolde onistald dramian ran trusiande clariball hungaria emerolde faire fortune aduerse three first dismounted steede onistalde one fore leg broken next rosuell estrellant bellizart receiued countie valerian archillagus brother guendolin whose strength farre weake resista ce therefore bare dishonour forth field francian dridan tremoran germaine orleance lnyman burgondy met ioyntly crispian macedon foruolant strong flauian yet vnhorsed except tremoran kept saddle valiantly thus first encounter gallantly discharged small pleasure emperor nobility also regardants gaue great commendation hautinesse exployt libusan greece somewhat offended vnfortunate fall remounted fellowes entred field reuenge enemie berolde spaine receiuing point launce charmed bold attempt knightly behauiour esteemed one chiefe knight triumph rest deedes hereafter shew deserued lesse praise tituball red knight medrusian fearefull tracandor trusiande trofoliant clariball hungaria puissant frouolant one side young knight gracian frisoll dramorant onistalde estrellant rosuell bellizart suyman burgondie bazilliart francian prince florendos falling wrastling behaued themselues pollicie diuersitie subtill sleight polinarda gaue seruant palmerin small commendation empresse gridonia somewhat sad primaleon yet reioyced see towardly behauiour young palmerin knightes traine almost forced listes suddaine entred among two knight brauely mounted attired greene armor running two young knight brake speares valiantly laying handes swoords dealt knightly blowes amongst euery one driuen great admiration palmerin perceiuing hardines two knight doubting least traine endaungered bowed himselfe lady polinarda rode forward vsing speech himselfe sweete lady time dismay selfe hauing person mee whose sight sufficient conquere proud enemy time wherein name shalbe eternally honored knight esteemed worthy good mistresse aduancing one strange knight called euery one knight sauage man looked deuice sield wild man leading couple lyon hand well viewed knight ioyned combat fiertely handled either part passed farre incomparable fearefull assault regardants seeing equallitie strength could iudge victory likeliest caused emperour meruaile desirng might parted themselues would thereto agree wise twaine thus egerly dealt one another platir set vpon companion knight sauage man soone brought vnder puissance platir esteemed combate best euer sawe life time comparing fight himselfe giant dramaque encountring frenaque england neither combate betwe ne frisol france contentio picture empresse polinarda much lesse esteeming hardy aduenture betweene primaleon prince edward giuing onely praise aboue inuincible courage twaine emperor perceiuing drewe towardes night feared endamagement might come either sent comandement leaue fight desirous still victorie would hardly agree till trumpet sounded retrayt euery knight must hasten vnto captaine two greene knight would knowne departed secretly way came emperor knight departed pallace sumptueus banquet prepared euery one forgetting anger betweene turnament banquet ended knight fell dancing palmerin somewhat bashfull speak lady polinarda courted dramaciana daughter duke tirendos chiefe gentlewoman attending lady mistresse prince florendos would straine ouermuch cutesie tooke sister polinarda thought might lawfully bold platir chose floriana daughter ditree neece frisoll france gracian desired claricia daughter king polendos thessalie berold prince spaine delighted onistalda daughter duke normandie bellizart requested deiesa daughter king sparta francian amorous vernande daughter valiant belcar thus euery one courting lady fell dancing ended pastime night emperor departed chamber accompanied palmerin two noble sonnes primaleon empresse gridonia faire polinarda generally gaue great commendation braue behauiour yong prince palmerin emperor somewhat offended two greene knight departed without knowledge whence came courage made manifest two valiant approued knight armes deserued reward honour euer came thus reioyced emperour court remained flower chiualrie young knight neuer tryed themselues also couragious palmerin whose hardinesse knowledge two green knight behaued themselues worthily breake talke suddainly entred damosell attyred english fashion robe veluet middle skirt gold face endued lesse beautie garment adorned sumptuous brauery shee well beheld knight fayling person sought finde bending knee emperour thus vsed salutation renowned emperor whose name lesse honored deedes held worthy immortall memory pardon rude entrance bold maiden attend discourse shall deliuer maiestie great sauadge magitian named sage aliart obscure valley hartily wisheth continuall happinesse faithfull oath obedience kisseth hand imperial maiesty highnesse hath bin lately conquered much sadnesse small greefe courtly assistant also himselfe vnknown subiect promiseth losse shall recouered ioy neither fortune shall let mishap auouch contrary cause comming present shield maiesties hand giuen famous yong knight triumph honour day bear title perfect knighthood iust desert haue often heard yet dare cantcy credite tale noueltie importing truth lawes reuenge iniuries lady knight cause would aduenture liues well may finde perhaps misfortune denies fo haue safely trauelled many fortaine coast found rescue diuers noble knight euery straunge countrey till happening dominion least suspected doubt soone fell extreame daunger must eyther admit mine owne mishap vnkinde knight deny helpe faire lady great hazard shield charge deliuer maiestie reward knight whose desert meetest taken knight greene armor bearing shield sauage man leading two lyon thus willed certifie knight whose valure worthinesse hath deserued shield meete within three dayes forest cleare fountaine meete knight fetch away haue vnhappily lost vndoubtedly beare shield away cause circumspectly behold knight try fortune beene good know couragious minde entred trauayle thus hauing done duetie referre rudenesse discourse gratious pardon whose wisedome accept simple declaration considering maiden seldome acquainted eloquence emperor pondering damosel word friendly message sage aliart neuer heard sent empresse princesse gridonia receiued honorably hope glad tydings encreased comfort vpon newes diuers knight determined themselues goe fetch lady shielde resoluing thus fortune winne honour inestimable shoul gaine braue victorie whereupon clariball hungaria emeralde fayre crispian macedon flauian rotandor medrusian fearefull trofollant proud foruolant friend emperour came tournament seeke reuengement ancient malice bare vnto maiestie certaine predecessor felt force furie fresh spight engendred young knight giuen great disgrace lady wherefore would pursue knight sauage man win sheeld knight come come forrest cleere fountaine beheld sheeld hanging tree hard fou taine noble knight sauage man ready defend foruolant tooke courage giue first assault set beside saddle sheeld helmet hanged tree signe hee conquered long staid crispian macedo clariball emerald flauian rotandor bare copany whose sheelds helmet likewise placed vanquished trofollant seeing hard hap companion somwhat angry hauty courage knight sauage n thought haue done strength would permit dismounted horse vpon hauing recouered himselfe feete drew sword began fresh encounter time palmerin accompanied diuers noble knight gracian dramian florendos platir rest arriued saw trofollant sent conquered copanions whereupon prince palmerin began maner desire sir knight neither gaine glory friendly affection beare bind vp wound grieuous sight feele yet respecting friendship desire find hand mine enemy knight sauage man staying answer thus shortly answered sir apparance griefe take desire good may shal find occasion remaine deepe debt iudge either ouerfond else forgetfull selfe offer friendship stranger doth neither desire way deserue suppose rather come stay salue sir quoth palmerin estate see doth comand vse speech constraine might succour neither fearing doe falling one iote doe tell come desire intreaty copel force restore shield againe haue disloyally taken trauelling lady considering might diminish honour deale vngratefully seeme enemy knighthood regarding helpe wrong iniured lady knight sauage man beholding great courtesie palmerin esteeming word spoken aduantage conquered braue behauiour also inward affection naturally moue gaue answere haue often heard sir knight wordes deepely wound weapon courtesie compell cruelty may neuer conquer hath bin high good fortune time knightly demeanor haue seene gentle language hath entred lance cannot friendship woon either feare force may constraine seeing haue take paine find haue done instant could deliuer shield best worthy weare gift nature florish abundantly gratious nature doeth adore nobly word imbracing p palmerin presently mounted horsebacke departed returned prince accompanied knight greatly delighted beholding shield midst field azure placed faire palme tree liuely framed beene naturall tree wondred certaine poesie letter gold engrauen round side darkely placed none company could iudge meane length came court emperour newly rysen supper certified al happened much displeased mind whole desire haue knowledge valiant knight sauage man taking shield looking earnestly vpon hee sent damosell know poesie ngrauen damosell answered would gracious emperour power fulfill request ignorant therof must desire gracious pardon saw emperor giuen palmerin shield vowed whose memory touched booke primaleon declare order hee passed whole life aliart reputed lesse fame learning inferiour bare estimation aboue none durst offer iniurie albeit deserued none would contend stood awe seeing himselfe honoured mighty durst doe loued part excellent cunning beganne exercise himselfe martiall exploytes shewed bee sonne renowned edward hauing receyued knighthood handes giant garatie behaued himselfe famous exploites esteemed singular practised arte hee vnderstood father imprisonment noble primaleon castell dramusiande skill aunt eutropa endeuoured haue flower chiualrie happen nature desired solitary bringing vp forth company builded little fortresse betweene two great high mountaines kept light sunne away day moone night season dwelling called obscure valley others tearmed valley aboce clowdes entrance whereof could found aliart caused giant trabollant know cost son also lord faire castell velley neere adioyning aliart newly erected garnished within many faire bookes spending time long studie last got meane called sage thus liued sage aliart obscure volley often vsing castle dramusiande bemoning misfortune knight could way remedy till appointed time often repayring sage aliart caused eutropa doubt something dramusiande stand great feare yet could way hinder pleasure visite captiue prince sate one day pensiue study vnderstood art triumpes constantinople
