gentlenesse language prince palmerin vsed thus remayned sage aliart expecting time deliuery prince concealed griefes spent time silent opinion miserie would suffer litle rest inferre occasion yet neuer fallig one iote amitie though world woe constraine chap xv belcar vernar cured wound receiued one arriued castle dramusiande accompanied polendos king thessale combate entred betweene taken prisoner verna prince almaigne belcar duke dura remained citie brique till felt themselues good disposition health departed london english court disguised vnwilling knowne see happily might attaine sight prince flerida princesse remaining still pensiue therefore kept chamber fayling theyr pretended purpo e trauailed thorowe great britaine valiantly reuenged quarels lady enlarged report redoubted knighthood neither time weare memory death selfe meanes dissolue proceeding thus aduenturous trauaile eutropa gotten within circuite sure bene prison yet let alone awhile try hardnes fortune hauing spent day trauaile darke night ouercharging vncomfortable houres determined take rest foote tree farre prouision alighting giuing horse esquiers belcar sat dowe fell soundly asleepe vernar whose minde faire bazilia satte conferring shrine hauing stomacke sleepe hee might better accomplish amourous deuises withdrew himselfe little riuer pretty way friend belcar sweete harmonie little byrdes silent passion vsed himselfe gentle prince greatly delighted polendos k thessalie wandring way fortune tooke place rest neere prince vernar hee heard louely ditty sweete discourse hee vsed commendation fayre bazilia loath disquiet knowne neere last tooke occasion braue inuentions heard vttred prince vernar enter commendation owne lady faire francelina twaine manner passed away weary night morning might easily espye prince vernar hee could hide presence longer went salutation know syr vernar amorous passion extreame griefe scant suffer opprssed head enioy gladnesse remembrance faire bazilia hath vrged night bewray sundry assault afflicted minde whose farre distaunce presence hath made grieuously sigh would gladly haue slept wherof friend witnes little forrie vnderstand w e vernar embracing noble polendos declared great ioy conceiued company yet somewhat displeased priuy amorous complaint might cause bee iudged rather effeminate way famous earnest talking belcar came walking vnto reioycing sight king polendos embraced vsing pleasant sp eches care greatly take reuengement sharp assault gaue port corderia bare away prize repulse vernar loath wee fight therefore let v ioyne together like trusty friend many gratulations passed partes mounted horsebacke rode recounting aduentures hadde happened seeking prince edoard polendos rehearsed vnto howe hee brought young prince palmerin constantinople forgetting letter sent lady lake procured sage aliart obscure valley made belcar vernar somewhat abashed heare happy successe chaunced continuance talke came castell dramusiande euery one giuing verdicte braue e strength fortresse till length put foorth thoughtes prince edoard came vpon bridge order fought noble primaleon vrged polendos pause thinkes castle inuincible well prouided within good knight wee see without vppon accident prince vernar preuailed intreatie haue first iouste edward presently encountred onean large appearance knighthood edward loste one styrrops prince vernar vnhorssed hauing recouered himselfe drewe sworde came couragiously againe edward stayed deliuering speech syr knight may bee skill foote agreeable strength foresight haue horsebacke would might haue beene happe trye hath pleased wh subiect euery knight commeth allowed first exployte belcar desirous enter combatet pacifie prince vernar fewe word syr vernar since knight hath fulfilled first remaine beginne fresh challenge may refuse forbeare fight considering hath obserued dutie field wherevpon edward belcar beganne second encounter whose hap hard beare friend vernar companie polendos pe ceyuing began thirde iouste couragiously remained whilesome doubtfull battered one others armour much till last polendos dismounted likewise came foorth giant pandare commaunding donedward goein againe whose commaund obeyed sorie might speake knight last ranne withall entring castle prince vernar thrust edward presently said sir vernar hath ledde beyond witte place shall abide distresse life time cannot fall like danger desperate himselfe would little esteeme friend life vernar hearing word knowing halfe angry ill lucke made answere syr esteeme witte litle wisdome friendship simple scant impute troth word vnderstand neither year shall withdraw desire although buy mine owne death word pandare saluted mace betweene twaine fierce skirmish primaleon leaning chamber windowe tooke great pleasure beholde hautie courage vernan whose name knowne vnto dramusiande little glad father trincus also causer death father frenaque vernar long assailed pandare broken sword hand shielde c eane middle whereat pandare somwhat angry caught armes aud shaking sore threwe ground doubtfull life left wherefore presently carryed edoards chamber prouision made relieue owne estate gate held open ill belcar polendos entred presently shut againe came pandare belcar receyued couragiously yet brought vnder carryed friend verner polendos seeing hee must eeds enter combate pandare prepared himselfe first summoned word thinkes thy great honour also expedient reseruing thy health yeelde thy selfe mee rather respect mercie enter fight man cruelly mangled doo behold thine owne blood consider pro e ad bounty shall thy life saued mine honor reserued sir said pandare submit selfe thy thou mightst account wit euer weake would stand thy mercie shewe mine owne cowardise manhood wherefore resolue thy selfe yeeld thy death sume desire fell fight wherin polendos preuailed happily pandare thought past recouery whervpon cruell alligan came foorth defend finding himselfe also mated euery way frustrate hope victory way dispaired himselfe fine faint wearyed fell downe neyther gayning conquest edoard primaleon tooke polendos chamber three patient vsed wholsome comfortable physicke sorrie misfortune twaine bring many noble prince aduenturous knightes cruell castell yet remaine good hope found good hap appointed time deliuered strange knight hardly knowne dramusiande went cure sicke personnes might good health knight happen come chap xvi phowe recinde king spayne aruiedes king france left theyr royall dominion wander searche strayed prince edoard aduenture hapned betweene black knight knight dogge arriued castle dramusiande recinde king spayne hearing great pursuite many noble knight make enquyrie two young prince edoard primaleon absolutely determined himselfe trye hazard fortune employed paine might compasse good lucke leauing whole gouernment estate duke orliande marquesse richard lesse valiancie true nobilitie departed body esquyre attending many countreyes till came courte france royallie gratiously receiued king arnedes vnderstanding summe noble determination selfe affected woorthie prince commited kingdome queene melitia trauelled recinde hautie enterprise long trauell arriued english courte disguised knowne could see princesse flerida would stay departed theyr iourney hearing knight lost forrest great brittaine entred seent returne made theyr course way till mishap brought cruell castle sudden met two knight excellently well mounted one hauing armour spotted red crimzen colour shielde deuise bare dogge vppon azure fielde knight blacke armour shield colour without deuise foure mette together striuing first enter vpon bridge edward come foorth seeing controuersie sought ende matter word gentleman come honour zeale trie magnanimity courage striue order may returne great discredites let boldest first beginne shall finish iudge come vppon word recinde couched speare knight dogge offered stay syr seemes neither regard ciuilitie knightly courtesie offer mee great wrong came prepared therefore right ought beginne recinde somwhat mooued wordes shaped replie syr brauery seeke goe beyond mee peremptory wordes beare prize away farre deceyued word cannot cutface weapon feare first prouided therefore preuented edward perceyuing question like grow quarrell assayed set quiet thus began suddaine enmity driueth shr wde suspition come talke try manhoode rather ieast iust disposed let twaine come deale meane time may try shall first last knight dogge greatly vexed well word edward also stay recinde helde charged boldly maner since haue denied right offered wordes importing great rygor know reuenge wrong vppon person die field put vp iniury wherewith ran together fiercely arnedes prepared himselfe blacke knight betweene began hot skirmish wherein horse men al laide ground rising vp againe drawing foorth theyr swordes charged one mightie stroke singular courage made manifest valure theyr noble mindes dramusiande accompanied primaleon polendos knight stood looking forth window castle giuing lesse commendation notable combat behauiour knight iustly deserue yet none could iudge whence sauing edward knew knight dogge remembrance alwaies wont beare deuice couragious knight maiortes knowing comended well worthy maiortes throwing downe sword ioyned armes enemy try strength wrastling arnedes likewise reciued blacke knight blood issued forth vpon theyr armor althrough great weakenesse fell downe earth came foorth dramusiande noble prisoner whose promise made vnto oath would suffer start away taking theyr helmet primaleon knew blacke knight soldan bellagris certified dramusiande twaine recinde king spaine arnedes king france presently caried castle wound might cured themselues recouered dramusiande vsed knight honorably refusing take extreame reuenge father death supposed imprisonment punishment sufficient cause shewed himselfe milde gentle helpe good hope conquere isle lake kept giant almadrago time past taken force time maiortes knight dog soldian bellagris blacke knight arnedes king recinde obtained former health reioycing imprisoned dearest friend whome trauailed seeke happily found prince edward obliuious faire lady flerida also griefe hee supposed aged father whose sorrowe proceeded great misfortune time hee good hope turne great ioy chap xvii palmerin england desirous trauaile seeke strange aduentures tooke courage speake lady mistresse polinarda loth depart without leaue hauing sustained grieuous repulse departed secretly court taking leaue calling himselfe knight fortune yong knight made manifest great expertnesse many triumphes honour thier lady estimation helde themselues emperour grewe pleasant conceyts long time hee vsed like causing euery night dance deuises performed delight empresse princesse gridonia faire bazilia still refused company absence prince vernar caused spend time pensiuenesse palmerin england affecting strange aduentures desirng knight make proofe knighthood would gladly discouer earnest minde hee feared procure ill mistresse chanced night princesse polinarda sitting solitary palmerin came sate downe ouercome many grieuous passion striuing speake yet neither would begin commonly fareth march vnder ensigne amorous venus subiect many efeminate folly idle head dulled wit pale wanny face thought still silent yet alwaies worke mind mute yet neuer quiet speaking faintly behauing themselues fondly walking solitarie vsing sickly ieastures euer exclaiming cupid neuer remembring owne cowardise still cry fie loue meete correct folly life passion louer entreth idlenesse kindled desire set fire affection perseuerance helpe vtterly wasted desperation palmerin sitten good lady stil silent gaue occasion speake speech faire mistres might freely speake blame thought farre spot bounty esteeme self happy gaining leaue account selfe honoured gracious loue yet perswading selfe gentle nature quip friend giue crosse motion may cut fancie pardon presumption shall yeeld circumstance discourse gentle construction feeling selfe desire honour way attaine hautie enterprise haue thought good venter among pike mischaunces either encrease renowne ende life infamous reproch many wil send large speech defame priuate spight seeke worke discredite lo knight crept fetherbed fame doth allure warlike field hath minde maske venus march mar wearing gloue lady vse gantlet loue speech faire mistresse grieuous seruant patience expresse gentle nature suffer heare auoide well proue loyaltie vnspotted beare also shew dutie wherewith honour noble father haue vowed indeuour selfe attempt lesse welcome vnto seemely selfe hath long wished f vowed seruant neither danger withdraw mind doubt cause thinke mishap hauing licence courage trauaile gracious loue awardeth al trouble accident may annoy oppression may suddenly deceiue liued knight fauour die knight fame onely haue flower loue shall neuer fade till latter end life princesse polinarda perceiuing intent gentle heart loath haue absence soone teares standing eye thus made answere seruant hath courtesie hand haue found loyall continuance promised faith neither able gratifie would giue honour dutie princely behauiour made choose seruant equiuolent bountie made loued selfe loued none albeit none knewit little beside estimation father hath alwaies giuen notable desert hath euer selfe increased loue aboundantly chiefly loue yet flameth freshly nce desire departure groweth thorow mee perhaps occasion grieueth would glad know crime may make recompence rather giue leaue tarrie grant licence depart ladie quoth palmerin though cause yet crime though depart sake yet free suspect onely fauour haue found handes friendship haue granted continuall honour way recouer duetie ought albeit trauailed sake whole life see gratious person vnrequited selfe yeeres put recompence proofe might rightly deserue reproched men much refused sweete saint princesse arising maruellous choller highly offended passed talke gaue cooling quaile hot attempt haue often trusted beene rewarded treason placed stedfast affection haue bin soonest beguiled repent late bridle fancy see mine owne folly wherefore seeing fault rather afford roome company giue command poasting voyage wil thinke honour seeme presume presence bind duty straightly command obserue turning back flung away fume leauing palmerin alteration one could hardly iudge life left happe body present descrie heauy complaintes euery body conducted lady chamber sauing princesse polinarda stayed intreated went flinging gallerie greatly vexed left seruant passioned palmerin departing lodging tossing tumbling himselfe restlesse bedde euery thought lady discurtesie hee fell agonie bitter death suffering sleepe enter head still bewayled estate aduerse hap last aurora risen armes olde titan husband hee determined fulfill lady commaund albeit great paine graunting consent getting armour bare colour harte forrest thickly set little golden shrubbes bearing shield fortune holding tottering vnsteady wheele naming himselfe knight fortune hee secretly departed accompanied siluian sauage man sonne whome called brother nourished together hee bare shield palme tree sent sage aliart neither taking leaue emperor vehemency griefe mounted horsebacke rode away way rode siluian endeuored himselfe perswasion driue away heauinesse farre purpose prince himselfe deuoide patience rode vsing word ouercome extreame melancholy yet affection earnestly grounded lady vowed behalf aduenture life doubting duety hee would shewe absence win fauour againe grant presence chap xviii palmerin england vnder title name knight fortune still continued pensiue iourney till last happened castle honour faire ladie mistresse princesse polinarda hee conquered knight tearmed himselfe knight death still trauailed valiant prince palmerin heauy sadde greatly lamenting late misfortune neither resting pla e abyding place abyding company brother siluian loued highly esteemed last happening groue tree espied faire castle standing solitary beset round greene bancke sight whereof prince alighted siluian perceiuing alighted likewise aud ledde steedes pasture time palmerin seeing body neer remembring great vnkindnesse ladie entred heauie mourning palmerin son poore sauage man borne vnfortunate forrest great britaine soone preferred honor late thrown hatred regard haddest thou princesse thy selfe poore pesant estimation hadst thou modestie mooue great offence thy gracious mistresse whose loue state thy life whose fauour flower thy prosperitie ah sweet ladie courteous pitie let passe presumption hath dutie impute may rude behauiour clemencie may punish pardon yet good ladie respect trusty seruice constant loyaltie haue alway borne soueraigntie fault committed rashly deserueth repulse ingratitude much shew way suffer regard owne beauty stayed assurance seruants bountie shall perceiue word bee honour worthie hate preferre name aboue lady noblenesse yet contented abide hard doome according pleasure wast day distresse till either mooue recant spotlesse loyaltie relieue mishap longer deserre dolor remaining obstinate paine helpelesse gentlenes giueth hope displeasure shall end eternall delight thus hauing finished complaintes drew neare castle good hap heard sound musicke gaue occasion enter comming great hall espyed one corner one sitting blacke fair long beard graue countenance shewing sad complexion minde moane myrth palmerin would yet enter least break quiet exercise singing many sadde dittyes lute himselfe framed prayse ladie palmerin hauing heard singular report gaue ladie none might compare beautie brauerie much offended hee esteemed ladyes counterfeite fayre polynarda wherefore hee brake knightes sonnet kinde salutation thinkes syr either want manner modestie glorie lady thought none like syr late comparison hath vrged great choller ladie aboue beautie honour name beside beyond noblenes nature therefore worthie praise superiour auncient knight seeing one entred vpon suddenly correct pleasure sharpe word aduanced himselfe towards answer syr knight bolde entraunce place great offence haue offered person may happe set deare price shal cost blood would loath spare anie bee equall lady meete beare comparison whose remembrance maketh liue vnspeakable tormentes thou darest stay till armed make thee eyther denye thy bragges buye ladyes honour losse thy life breath reward thy presumption shall teach thee thy dutie winne heart desire syr said palmerin cease word execute wrath haue spoken thing displeasure reuenge selfe ende auncient knight withdrewe himselfe chamber esquire presently armed palmerin went foorth mounted horsebacke attended comming length came foorth knight attired blacke armour bearing shield portraite griefly death lying toomb couered blacke vsing word fell straite fight eache behauing neuer dismayed concerning harde choyce put eyther denye ladie leaue life suffice selfe rigor constraine death selfe may shall compell rather choose abide cru lty offer ladie great discourtesie answer take please palmerin comparing loyaltie knight constancie owne loue affection surely planted earnest desire himselfe satisfying himselfe conquest called syluian departed knight death returning castle carefully tended looked vnto esq yre greatly contemning fortune suddenly foyled chap xix phere shall vnderstand knight death renowned palmerin england conquered cause remained solitary castle lesse expertnes capacity knightly behauiour courage made liked saw loued knew chaunced floraman growing ripenesse yeares became enamoured altea daughter duke charles cicilia subiect king euandrin betweene twaine ioyned league perfect good liking mutuall consent faithfull loue supposed neither accident could hinder determination extreamitie euer plighted promise fortune enemie hauty courage prepareth malice well meaning minde loue could please king father meanes could thought still preuent king perceiued could hardly reclaime sonne affection still increased faire tea sent home duke father meaning matche sonne adriana queene cicilia floraman denied loue grant father minde rather endeuoured follow lady whose absence procured languishing life king well noting intent floraman could fancy father choise secret treason duke ciciliaes court found meanes poyson fair altea smal griefe noble father friend also gentleman courte whome beauty honored ciuility life greatly commended duke misdoubting vntimely death daughter procured vnnaturall meane soone sicke suddenly gone sent allaricqua bedfellow executing sundry torment confessed hyred king serdignia ministred potion cut flowring yeares duke hearde discourse lord soueraigns vnkinde dealing hee caused anatomie daughter artificially figured placed vpon toomb representing funeral thervpon golden verse writ epitaph rare vertuous life image death liuely drawn perfect proportion rare piece workmanship laid goodly fair chariot leuying great army went king serdignia whose comming floraman heard could finde heart enter battel lady father company wel appointed knight brake thorow rankes entred campe whence tooke chariot picture altea ryding presently porte sea tooke shipping coasted turk dominion building solitary castle liued bemoaning vnkinde acte father vnfortunate death faire altea whose picture hee would often report affliction minde sundry lamentable sonnet discouer praise owne paine lute hee often recorded onely meane perswade desperate intent place remained floraman till time prince palmerin visited haue hearde although good fortune palmerin conquere wasted mourning growne great debilitie exceeding sorrow yet floraman esteemed knight singular prowesse palmerin departed hee entred castle againe vnto ladyes picture appealed manner ala altea impute conquest right mine enemie rather feeble weake assault seruant extreame sorrow mishap hath caused griefe mine owne misfortune aduersly chanced wherefore make amends great mischaunce may knowe knight esteemeth none aduentures blaze memorie lady shall report onely altea cause know yet vnborne must equall long stayed comfortlesse place till last king father vnderstanding sent hee would shewe himselfe disobedient hee departed thence bearing ladyes portraite still vsing blacke armour shielde wherein death painted onely sepulchre great sorrowes vsing name himselfe knight death rare aduentures atchieued honour ladie great reputation himselfe shall large certified sequell historie chap xx ppalmerin england hee departed floraman knight death happened come saw combate fought betweene three knight knight bull named pompides commandemens lady kept passage bridge knight fortune bare away victorie renowned knight fortune conquered floraman knight death brother siluian proceeded iourney neuer shewing signe liuely disposition heauy pensiue way rode siluian desirous might remedy vsed word vnto good sir wast time woe vse pleasant recreation seeke ruine selfe hee regardeth lenderly profered courtesie rather extinguished memory hath lightly left thinke iudge mindfull vnto word knight fortune thus shaped answere siluian deare brother friend thou cauldest discerne drop blood fall oppressed heart thou perceiuest moyst teares issue head thou couldest iudge world woe abide silent thought thou doest perceiue motion outward appearance thou wouldest rather wish graue see remaine remedilesse griefe way remedied onely last extremity death albeit thou saist esteemeth passion rather merry mourne laugheth languish yet shall neuer sayde palmerin liued without fraude therefore dyed faith preferring honourable death haplesse life would bene blinde first saw beauty stayed father enioy vngentle friend wee might haue liued quiet estate enioying one houre rest albeit liue spotlesse loyaltie yet rewarded vngentle loyaltie let suffice vnkinde thou vnhappie bent crueltie yet thou liue die constancie desiring longer life may free spotte promised loue heereupon syluian assure thy selfe beauty shall hazard honour thousand launce shall confesse selfe palmerin aboue loyaltie thus passing time talke one knight fortune great paine syluian still continuing perswasion arriued bridge saw three knight would haue passed ouer resisted knight fair white armor kept passage bearing shield deuise bulles head called knight bull one three knight couragiously gaue combat knight bull wan quickly set beside saddle fine knight bull preuailed three griefe glorie knight fortune knowing three knight bene foyled emperours court luyman burgundie germaine orleaunce tenebrant little sorrie mishappe presently menaced courage knight bull met stoutly togither dismounted charging one another sword betweene began doubtfull skyrmish last knight fortune happe good strooke downe setting foote vppon charged tell hee wherefore kept passage knight bull seeing himselfe brought vnder hearing demand loath graunt last discouered himselfe thus syr knight hath bene alwaies desire keepe selfe vnknowne hyde name feare till noble exploytes might deserue make knowne since fortune receiue first conquest must declare stand desirous know vnderstand sonne edord famous prince england argonica lady enchanted isle hauing name pompides concerning keepe passage thus certaine lady cured wound receiued last encounter two knight slew commanded keepe passage vntill conquered knight greatly desireth way come knowledge haue remained space twentie dayes yet neither happening knight conquered present knight fortune hearing word suffered arise gaue answer thinkes sir might ame also happinesse good fortune linke life simple enterprise aduance selfe trie hazard place place sit idle abroad might better imployed think amisse leaue lady command siluian departed vanquished knight greatly desired haue knowledge knight fortune sorry suffered depart without vsing conference neuerthelesse supposed renowned palmerin deuice sheeld deceiued bare purpose would known otherwise name knight fortune well rid pompides went lady fortresse might haue wound cured made hanged great many sheeldes neere tree caue den etrance whereof lay trunchions speares broken sword like weapon declared beene many combat fought place caue came knight black armor bearing shield vpon ground sand faire white swan hauing espied knight sauage man presently sounded horne vnto house neere adioyning sound horn window house presently opened laid faire cloath blacke veluet cushion came faire lady damosel leaned thereon see combate knight swan determined haue knight sawe comming sight mooued knight sauage man stand great maze well behold faire lady also seemely knight place small frequentation study reuiue knight swan sent page summoned sort lord master sir knight behold way escape hath kept passage sixe moneths aduancement honour disgrace smal company good hardy knight shield suffice witnesse hang yonder tree haue left behind vnable withstand yet hath vanquished none therefore hath sent name sollicite cowardly feare enforce faint daring venture many hath beene vanquished permitted choise two extreames wherof must chuse one receiue authority wil charge withal first must passe returne whence came boud knightly oath make knowne euery one shamefull repulse sparing tell truth fauer selfe manifest cowardise commendation lord second desirous would needes passe without endamaging selfe foresaid perill must fulfil wil loath either esteeme knighthood happy state life must first giue shield placed name written vnder intent knight happen way may know came like knight departed hence like fainting crauen shall extreame rigour speech procure meanes eternall shame beside must vow sorrowfull lady companie spendeth time wailing neuer reioyce remembrance griefe part er sadnesse life endureth none twaine please come lord ease knight sauage man smiling discourse menared disloyaltie also threatned danger sent knight answere word goe tell thy lord hath met one neither respecteth proffer regardeth puissaunce minding goe forward yet returne till hath caused know hath much authoritie constraine himselfe hath command vpon answere met together valiantly charging knightly blowes lady gaue great commedation fight hardly iudging likest victorie breathed fell againe knight swan accounting himselfe well ated knight sauage man thought indifferently matched length victorie chaunced knight sauage man reioyced conquered good knight vnclasping knight swan beuere quite ouercome grieuous trance wrought meanes get life againe charged tell also wherefore lady liued vndertooke keepe passage vnto request knight thus answered sir knight loosing life might profit euer sought please finish must brought ende would rather imbrace death ten satisfie desire craueth thing would neuer shew seeing griefe cannot holpen way greatly eased way hauing authority command wil accomplish minde euery point called blandidon sonne sorrowfull lady pandritia hath long yet longer must abide castle called house sadnesse griefe yet way remedied shee hath vowed end life misfortune continue mourning long liueth onely loue shee bare knight trauel sure haue heard lesse famous hautie deedes armes aboue al knight atchieued victory called haue heard many edward england cannot find meane perswade mother fro sorrow full kinde life still remaine v wed heauinesse haue determined garde passage making conquere partaker griefe forcing refraine shame haue heard wherin honor desire trie many good knight encreasing fame though neuer sustained like mishap hope meete man shall doe againe knight sauage man hearing tale blandidon esteemed knight lesse valor good fortune desired leaue solitarie place beare company forrest great brittaine declaring renowne might gotten day life time heauie passage blandidon would haue graunted right willingly pensiue estate sad mother perswaded contrary hee loath leaue yet desirous keepe knight sauage man company earnest haue knowledge length little departed knight sauage man thus perswaded blandidon sir knight account selfe happie meete good knight would condemne selfe altogether ingratitude requite gentlenesse farre without mine owne harme may whose company would gladlie haue yet vnwilling ladie mother remaine destitute guide resolue shall know called knight sauage man name knowne many good knight haue tried found gentlenesse hand farther disclose name till better acquainted selfe yet intend hazard selfe aduenture great brittaine whereas many noble knight doe enter heard afterward meane beare company else ende great danger blandidon would gladly haue assaied aduenture also faint estate himselfe great care vsed mother pandritia would suffer depart wherefore vsing friendly greeting departure beseemed profession loyal intent curtesie knight sauage man tooke way iourney blandidon castle comfort mother also haue wound recured assuring strife betweene wrought maruellous endeuours either part afterward hath seldome heard shall reade sequell wherein vertue noblenesse vnanimitie conioyned faithfulnesse desirous one delightfull chap xxii floraman knight death prince serdignia arriued constantinople emperours court caused tent pitched honour faire altea emperor hee made chalenge knight court defence lady beautie fortune good hee ouercame prince gracian brother guerin knight aduentured lady sake great sorrow knight death sustained foile palmerin noble knight fortune giuen whereof reuenged hee visited king father sent continued trauell long last arriued constantinople emperor pallace erected two faire tent artificially made workmanship al black silke gold whereon giuen view braue picture rare beauty lady altea also whole course mournefull life spectacle great delight tooke occasion see one tent prepared furniture lodging stoode lustie courser speares weapon maintaine tournement top betweene tentes placed perfect image faire altea tooke duke father two army waging battaile knight death hauing euery thing readinesse two esquire attending entred emperor pallace attired accustomed armour made emperour somewhat abashed yet well pleased ciuill demeanor perceiued kneeling downe kisse maiesties hand suffered would kept backe abiding patiently began fire eye vppon empresse courtly ladyes see could finde ladie might beauty compare altea good while pause order began render speech puissant emperour let boldnesse admitted ill intent rude behauiour merite gracious disliking whome onely vowe heart hand vnfained seruice houre death vnhappy knight whose misfortune bee recounted life hitherto hath bin nothing miserie threatned spende life infinite calamity hath drawne minde debilitie neither honour grace behaue selfe gladly would first appointed minde quiet estate thought mishappe could alter extreamitie chaunge resolued selfe infallible ioye aye one fling fortune ouerturned heauen happines became hateful hell youthfull yeeres allured loue fancie made choyce mine owne good lyking esteemed self happiest man aliue though chance hatefull griefe vnfolde spight onely berefte ladie allotted poore selfe exreame ill lucke forsooke courtly companie onely determining waste tune solitary kinde life spent remembrance regarded still lauding beautie esteemed aboue remayned mee thought merrie though indeede mournfull time yet fortune satisfied rubbeth fresh greefe vpon greene wound sending knight breake silent deuotions repining extoll lady aboue saint vnknowne entred fight returned foile bare away victorie vanquished thus haue bene euer indamaged euery way distressed may say knight say onely man mishap reputed ingratefull lady one repulse shall make forsake sweete shrine haue vowed prince court extoll beautie referring comparison esteeme none equall knight honour lady dare contend altea either beautie bountie ready giue combate allow superioritie none concerning order appointed fight would obey none break thus vnder gratious leaue requested knight esteeme quarrell good enter field beautie ladyes shall bring portrait whose sake aduenture wil honour fame lady beside hap good gaine victorie must enter tent render armour name registred booke haue tearmed sepulchre louers enemy preuaile contrary expectation shall lord rich remaineth tent beside selfe vassaile stand pleasure fauour must request grace none shall enter combat sword able mate iust cause coming procured knight yt gaue ouerthrow protested himselfe court cause desire may begin knightly enterprise returne tent expect comming dare first presume thus taking leaue departed tent emperour remaining desirous know whence declared court floraman sonne ancient king sardignia report emperour sorry entertained according vallor nobilitie birth next day knight prepared themselues tent knight death emperour lady court standing ready behold combate first enterprised ye prince gracian death replying many good knight thought yet hath beene deceiued although bragge may hap haue hard bargaine without mor word encountred verie fiercely polynard ouerthrown arme greeuously broken incensed anger would haue bin enemie againe knight death gaue perswasion syr haue done enough time arme estate shall haue fresh combate speech vexed polynard became troublesome talke behauiour would neither yeelde armour obey order appointed field caused emperor giue great check wherupon departed giuing great offence knight death denying right tytle haue dealt fiue knight vanquished sending tent selfe answered knight fortune gladly knowe trauell partly seeke feare shall misse wee loke syr quoth greene knight cause labour selfe search hath done thing doth displease behold answere cause knight vngentlenesse neyther knight seeke griefes yet vnborne shall compell shewe wherefore proceede enterprise let continue bemoning misfortune syr said green knight much desirous depart much determined greene knight hauing good minde respect came couragiously wordes syr knight beginne fainte nay defend selfe hardly since would esteem gentlenes proffered shall feele recompence belongeth selfe ioyned agaiue till last knight fortune reached sound stroake brought knee aduantage offered motion haue slaine greeue knight considering estate beganne manner vse intreatie syr knight puissance esteeme selfe thinking time finde peere made mee vse presumption buye deare price life standeth courtesie whome know well frame intreatie rash attempt doth rather craue iust reward fauour showne yet thus much milde nature perswade selfe rather esteeme conquest death suffise selfe one though vnworthie deserue syr quoth knight fortune account victorie much thy death thou shalt knowe patience doth alway conquere anger giue thee thy life vppon condition thou make knowne mee knight sauadge man also whence thou art thou doest labour seeke trust syr answered greene knight concerning knight sauadgeman name whence speech might constraine forget rufull complaint giuing small attendance thereto made answere grace cleane contrary small amazement highnesse also courtly attendance greatly maruailed see vnfortunate desteny ahe power bereaue man reason vnderstanding amply verified sorrowfull prince sargignia emperor perswade extremity fit would rehearse diuerse perswasions owne knowledge beene subiect like infirmity either cut time desperation continued life bemoned person vpon word tooke occasion vse talke would sir floraman onely comend loyaltie likewise attribute high honor constancy teares could call dead life rufull mon recouer great losse yet doe consider selfe loue compels setled affection hath brought immoderate euill compare impossibility state condition griefe shal find one needlesse helplesse extreame refused maine recalled consider sorrowe eate heart presently withdrawne againe vexation haue woon chiefest place perswasion may weare tonge teeth ere bridle impatient desire wisdome man intollerate griefe may cost dearest haue quiet life doe thus remember selfe impatience bring sorrow sorrow sickenesse sickenes consumation consumation miserable anatomy himselfe error kinred eye sore friend delight enemy continuall heart breaking loue sooner end better mend side man apply himselfe exercise either trauaile honour himselfe fame countrey spending time martiall exploytes according estateis poore take paine rich paine pleasure artificer handie craft noble minde courtly gentleman either exploytes field exercise may auoide idlenesse eye directed sence quickened minde preserued heart quieted conscience vnpolluted affection gouerned loue bridled lust banished good name perfected vertue established honour well exercised fame enternized see difference betweene heauen hell betweene contempt life conte eternall soule seekes shall finde ouer fonde thinke thus selfe altea dead though shrinke beauty earth yet substance shouelled clay though delight image picture yet hath death made anatomie fayre person liued loued dead remember loue liue honour enterprise shall witnesse aduentures hazard shall manifest drowne dulled desire remembrance knighthood enioy manhood mourning display worthy deedes play amorous dities one moneths vsing medicine trust extinguish mallady floraman perceiued earnest wordes emperour honour name noblenes life replyed thus gratious emperour see chat goates blood molifie adamant little drop raine pierce hard marble wisedome reproouing wilfulnesse sheweth follie perswasion piercing obstinate doth friendship others doe force confesse affection altea hath ouercharged minde cleane dulled wit neither seeme doe ought sit musing loue hath life endamage mine owne life ouer fond loue since maiestie hath quickened mine idle nature reuiaed dutie owe vnto knighthood remember selfe forgetting though cannot exclude loue sudden yet tolleration perswasion time may doe something honor field asswage fondnesse dutie commaundeth mee employ seruice hazard selfe good fortune winne much strength haue lost yll happe wherefore desiring maiestie would entertaine mee courte vnder noble name seeke aduentures resolued forsake follie pursue valiantly whereto haue bene enemie emperour seeing change floraman heartily pretended himselfe desired thus answered thinke selfe highly honoured greatly steeemed fauour fortune receyue good knight whose endeuour hope himselfe shalbe worthily accounted fame courte euer extolled floraman would haue kneeled kisse emperours hand hee gratiously sustayned armes great thanks eyther side liberally bestowed time damosell lucenda returned court empresse among hir lady came walking withall chamber floraman knowledge giuen shee could reueale knight conquered floraman emperour desirous know willed make report began manner knight fortune hath accomplished noble piece seruice young prince palmerin polendos king thessalie present vnto ladie lake sent letter highnes happening castle mine aunt rianda gratious consent went visite rehearsed pensiue estate courtly ladyes seeing theyr knight sent sepulcher louers vppon report came hath fulfilled could done manie returned court againe mette hastily riding yet stayed desire behalfe craue pardon maiestie sudden departure intending returne vnto court till assaied aduenture great brittaine wherein supposed famous knight lost moreouer desireth highnesse bestow tent knight death power staine beautie altea euer dutifull affectioned ladie mistresse polynarda said departed leauing declare highnesse hath heard emperour able conceale pleasure heart receiued began thus promise faire lady mind somewhat perswade bee although would perfectly resolue thereon place euer shall aduenture dare imagine fortune shall preuaile comfort destressed satisfie longing mind tent shall bee bestowed according desire neuerthelesse would wish might well vsed vntill shall good lucke returne beleeue employ continuall victorie hee hath endeuoured win valiancie lucenda vnmindfull good newes also esteeme iustly deserue returning pallace ioy euery side made apparance glad receit wished tidings chap xxx recamon knight greene tree sonne boldly insomuch cause coming doth vrge enterprise one promise bindeth conceale name till haue tryed aduenture great brittaine wherein proue fortunate giue greater courage bewray selfe hath bene greatly famed abroade iust proclaimed court beautie lady named altea aduenture self haue trauelled hither maintaine lady mistresse called lucina deserueth perfect praise aboue beautie since arriued hath bene told knight departed court bearing renowne triumph away newes little displease desire contend ladyes behalfe wherefore may desire much courtesie know whither departed shall thinke selfe place valour behauiour vnknowne place heard euery neuerthelesse might counsell would wish minde changed fond enterprise hardly beleeue aduenture wil quite labour good opinion hold answered knight maketh affectionate seeke famous deed greatter estimation shall conceyue deale one fortune stand friend conquere well liked doubt reputation shall gaine constraine thinke well repose good affiance tremoran sonne duke lecesia nephew emperour trineus hearing proud wordes knight aduanced himselfe towards greeting imagine fortune hath greatly friend send hither gone least misaduenture chaunce meete wold settle armor shoulder would curse lady abide canuazado neuertheles albeit yet hath friend would bee sorrie depart without recompence trauell vnder emperours correction man shall bring acquainted knight fortune ere depart shall know hath left friend behind giue liberall entertainement seek manner knight halfe offended word tremoran made presently giue reply thinke sir good beare knight maketh foolish hardy appertaineth vnto yet dare aduenture much behalfe welcome knight brauery arme selfe presently would bee loath cold calme come ouer hotte matter emperour though vnwilling accepted gage cause misfortune shee doeth attribute knight sauage man lord taking distressed case hand giueth challenge combat meet dare grace allowe lord safe entrance return without disturbance hinder determination knight sauage man onely excepted king heard fame knight fortune extolled prince court sory arriuall moue request would willingly haue denied combate knight sauage man came maiestie vsed word gracious soueraigne knight fortune reputation neither may grace denie request selfe refuse enter combate albeit puissace hath vrged challenge aduantage gotten country maketh earnest haue deedes knowne yet neither greeting dismay courage presence compell leaue fielde wherefore desire grace grant request may haue libertie iust according hee ought otherwise goe well satisfie desire compasse affection haue selfe king seeing excuse would serue hinder matter knight sauage man would needes take fight returned siluian answere friend tell thy lord pleased offended request yet seeing demand standeth law armes way iustly denie graunt free leaue without contradiction better would haue iudged challenge beene knight lightly escape perhaps hee maketh account message siluian returned maister hauing heard pleasure king came prnsently place appointed combat king queen princesse flerida nobility ready placed behold noble attempt citizen likewise repaired thither see combate suddenly noysed abroade place filled abundance people knight fortune entred made obeysance king passed came knight sauage man accompanied many knight noble gentleman among company argolant brought speare rosiran de la bronde deliuerd sheeld marching king left vsing talke knight fortune know sir knight cause great challenge without iniurie neuer offended sir answered knight fortune behold ladie present haue offered small abuse see recompence constraine abide doome mercy trust sir quoth knight sauage man lady altogether vnknowne neyther haue offended body beside deserue thus vngently accused see good opinion haue owne manhood causeth earnest matter denym albeit could yet giue spot honour departing themselues fetch careere sound trumpetst hey met brauely together breaking halfe dozen staues peece yet neither able stirre saw could dismount one another tooke sword charged pollitique behauiour fight maruellous heare commendation generally giuen well wearied themselues horsebacke alighted endeuored endanger rigorous blowes thought combat would long last ere one slaine sheelds shiuered peeces armour broken blood trickled downe side fell wrastling one another gripe made blood issue foorth aboundantly yet neither aduantage strength equall could iudged likest victorie princesse flerida greeuing great effusion blood departed heauinesse known blood sonnes cruelly spilt king courtly attendaunts stroken maze saw take sword againe thought flower chiualrie present great heauinesso would giue ouer meanes knight sauage man seeing himselfe destitute sword sheeld armour began somewhat feare life would stand great hazard yet contented himselfe death ordained sustaine lesse reproch knight honour giuen ouerthrow wherefore pause thus began discourage selfe death seeing shall depart flower prime mine age end dayes hande onely esteemed good fortune yet oath haue made princesse flerida great duty find selfe desert constrains mee wish longer time might well exalt honour trie aduenture hath endamaged many good knight whereto euer bend mine affection onely enterprise life win renowne seeing falne great mishap fortune doth deny mine owne manhood faile yet behaue selfe vpon mine enemy hath woon vttermost shall boast conquest writ deliuer seale hope shall craue signet heart blood like manner knight fortune stood debating himselfe well vpon present danger also passed dollour forgetting ladie mistresse polinarda bene present began complaint madame behold time wherein anger doth kill fauour reuiue except beare cruell mind worke tragedy restore wonted clemencie encouragement haplesse labour since lyeth handes cast friendly looke man extremity none onely deny small request neither shall aduenture enterprise great brittaine doe honour heart hath euer desired shall flower chiualrie remaine great misfortune obstinacie accounted losse knight hath put mee danger euer yet neither v enioyeth conquest infortunate death returne share shall thinke selfe honourably failed handes poore heart cruelly martyred hard dealing fell combate againe able charge one another fiercely first yet labouring earnestly end strife one way mooued king discend accompanied knight fearing losse theyr liues sought set vnitie desire victorie couragious mindes middest doubt king faine returne would giue eare perswasion went hee chamber princesse flerida manner began vse speech fayre daughter noble sonne edward lord liuing may deliuered valour earthly creature perswade selfe one knight shall meane relieue aduerse estate combate greatly feare shall ende liues vpon hautie attempt farewell hope euer reposed shall lose selfe shall euer lacke might assure selfe heare sonne enioy court woonted estate againe wherefore beare loue haue alway protested fauour earnest desire vouchsafe paine walke vnto one word mouth wil enfore leaue combate shall possesse haue long wished honoured great courtesie princesse since absence lord seldome come abroad alway kept chamber wonted lamentation request aged king came walking downe foure damosel attired blacke attending selfe apparrelled manner sauing vaile head shadowed face none could haue full view behold beautie entred place iust great amazement present came knight fortune tooke arme word sir knight either make account honour lady manifest deedes owe duty request intreate leaue combate well auoyd hazard liues content noble company satisfied famous exployts knight fortune wel eying princesse perceiuing resemble countenance faire polinarda humbled himselfe knee word faire lady desire hath bene greatly bent end combate render knight victory hath well deserued seeing haue charged curteous command rather desire death yeeld deny sir quoth knight sauage man report estimation haue knighthood forceable charge haue hard award fortune haue sent way intreaty breake vp siege trouble cannot haue though vse neuer violence great mallice knight intent linked extreme purpose neither gentlenesse may intreate faire haue appointed vn worthy answer behalfe perswaded would informe v misreport thus dare awareant shall finde ready defend enemy dare presume way molest damosell hearing answer prince gracian serued fit purpose gaue hartg thanks calling teares againe remembraunce vrged knight pittie greatly desired enter combate company returned damosell beene knight informing likewise false report entred pauillion damosel curtesie gaue forth speech mathe enemy honour friend owne damage wil perswaded follow enterprise derision scoffeth noble assembly reporting weake dare shew themselues word vrged onistalde vnto anger presently brake forth speech beleeue tryed haue aduentured dare finde chastisement peremptory bragges aunswerable effect haue iustly deserued tush quoth polinarda easie enemy talke pleasure shall find trechery rewarded due recompence hee wish vsed himselfe freendely ladie hath greatly iniuryed francian desirous send defiance damosell would suffer lest dealing espyed worke surer deceite sent damosell depart presently whereto made denyall summon armes prepare fight maane gone message craftie gyrle vsed familiaritie prince gracian knight heat enflamed beyond riuer damosell reported prince gracian company endeuour themselues take castle mistresse perforce whereupon shee requested defend mistresse right cause know went disloyall enterprise prince floraman hauing well pondered word damosell returned presently aunswer albeit duettie defend distressed person gainsay mishap iniuried lady yet reason willeth v ere presume hastily acquai ted cause well aduised ere begin rash attempt else may enemie iudge come vpon brauerie knighthood may awarrant behauiour runne danger selues rightful cause hath alwaies victory wherfore thus resolue selfe wee first know reportes trueth least enter defectes may perhappes repent v demosell began rehearse promise time deliuered horse armour great necessitie cause desired accomplish promise threatning nobility might defaced denying word trust answered platir haue good opinion dealing would vse perswasion v vntroth wherfore tell v faire lady doth enemy still remaine resolute determination albeit companion deny ayd haue auouched yet abide intreatie king recinde got leaue first trie strength knight sauage man beeing readie prepared encountred king great valure misfortune sent earth arnedes alway trauaile borne company preuailed earnest desire hee granted second iust inforced beare king recinde company primaleon seeing friendes receiue dishonour face without taking leaue prince edward tooke speare ran couragiously knight sauage man brake speares yet neither thing shaken dramusiande desired see ende noble exploit commaunded speares presently brought foorth tooke choise fell enterprise againe third attempt fortune turning backe noble primaleon caused likewise dismounted earth mishappe greatly displeased prince edward hee taking one strongest speares gaue encounter knight sauage man discharged great magnanimitie horse themselues layde ground edward quickly taking feete againe maruayling puissant strength knight sauage man came vnto saluted wordes trust syr knight would esteeme selfe honoured fortune highly preferred vnto good lucke place doe seruice reward braue behauiour assure selfe knight ought beare general praise among men especially life time neuer sustained sharpe plunge encountring haue put syr esteemed prince greatly displeased minde dramusiande approched knight sauage man thus good fortune sir knight hath returned victorie beyond expectation good assurance thinkes moue haue respect honestie refuse curteous offer priuate pride shal cause run without regard shal vrged would loth giue fresh assault estate doth rather require ease may greeuous detriment great dishonour courteous deale one sauing fond word doth withhold pittie denying gentle offer doth vrge exact vttermost knight sauage man would make aunswer taking vp shield giant alligan much better estate owne aduaunced himselfe dramusiande shewing agility nimble behauiour fight though bene wearied yet dexteritie magnanimitie courage power abash hardy dramusiande esteemed aporooued beene strongest knight vnder sunne knight sauage man found enterprise worst yet attempted happy ending whereof sufficient win perpetuall renowne wherefore endeuour himselfe goodforesight prince receiued good occasion commend valour oftentimes desired hope victory doth encourage one aduenture greatest danger receiuing good opinion successe doth animate courage followeth purpose inuincible pretence edward primaleo maruelling hautie exployte seeing dramusiande neuer gaue blow fiercely rewarded verily supposed perfect nobility knighthood remaine thy neuer dismayning knight sauage man long time fight caused dramusiande vse speeces trust mee sir knight perfect proofe infallible minde constraineth lament present approching daunger greeuous expence blood cannot long sustaine vnhappy death fortune appoint ruine dayes hand like must force shall condemne selfe monstrous ingratitude hardy knight shall cut flowring yeares wherefore let intreate combate may take conclusion venter daunger imminent selfe may suffer grant yet ruine armour sore wound body blood hath coloured ground vnder feete think prouoke satisfie request good counsell better late followed neuer tendeth aduancement honour maintenance spotlesse estate knighthood sir quoth knight sauage man request doth aske scope argument rather desire renue combate consume time making aunswer hereupon assure selfe neither eloquence allude force compell hinder enterprise wil haue else resigne thee carkasse glut vp thy greedy minde word went againe cheerely deliuering forceable blow short time weakenesse withdrew hurt though knight sauage man great debilitie dramusiande brought great danger redants knew impute hurt giant would gladly knight made acception offer felt himselfe haue receiued small aduantage fight maruell knight sauage man weake indeede combat addressed himselfe thither hast made obscurity ouer valley done battaile darknesse departed knight sauage man taken away body could imagine way theregardants thoght haue carried castle could likewise receiued thing needefull order vsed till dramusiande giant recouerd former health brought forth againe accustomed chamber greatly displeased dramusiande would behaue himselfe friendly conference reposed oath would attempt thing contrary wil pleasure exempted discourtesie heart continuing wonted friendlinesse captiue prince alwayes grounded perswasion point marueilous ingratitude breake vowed oath man made friend hee would greatly dishonour himselfe bee esteemed reputed one alienated estranged himselfe course vertuous deedes chap xl knight fortune staying house ancient aged king fredericke caused placed house ensignes amongst armour many famous knight renowed knight fortune occasion left speake remained long house ancient gentleman hoste woundes perfectly healed body well able endure bearing armor siluian prouided new armor like shield vsuall deuise fortune vpon departed way thought soonest finde castle dramusiande last arriuing foote mountaine espied little pauillion wherein great many lighted torch darke night somewhat entred gaue great shewe light place strange sight moued take way thither well see might driue fancy away greatly annoyed mind entred pauillion perceiued two seemely knight one lying sumptuous beere like dead liuing creature making great lamentation pittious bemonings ouer hee presently knowe rosiran de la bronde cousin aged king england made suppose knight beere man great authority estimation comming rosian saluting friendly presently knowledge noble knight fortune began manner following sir see fortune hath greatly fauoured permitting see dead body knight sauage man alway mortall enemy yet could bee vanquish fight knight fortune hearing wordes rosiran ouercome heauinesse teares trickled cheekes began frame answere thus indeede neuer desire preuaile man minde laboured conqure hardy knight whose prowesse lesse bruted euery knightly behauiour deserued since death hath cut famed champion laboured know yet could neuer attaine wish end enmity hath bin betweene v sharpe reuenge vntimely death possible ghost imbrace friendship himselfe perceiue enemy become deare friend euer wherefore courtesie shew place hath receiued misfortune wil die hath bene death good knight trust sir answered rosiram arriuall hath bene lately ignorant happened mischance neuerthelesse aduertised one departed long came castle dramusiande knight remaine haue bin long lost hath sustained vnfortunate hap yet without iniuring traine memory knight shall remaine liueth albeit fortune would suffer end aduenture knight fortune greatly displeased see knight brought extremitie began conceiue better estimation aduenture euer albeit greatly abashed good knight failed enterprise began behold armour lay defaced hacked many place vrged commend strength vse man might resist extreme danger wherevpon saye may well perswade selfe hope end adventure altogether lost knight beeng dead puissance finish word approched beere see cleane cheefly lesse brother greatest thought suspected knight diuers markes knew ie face better assurance whereof called siluian willing behold knight report minde serued answer comfortable maisters opi ion giuing credite florian returned departed lyon vpon perswasion knight fortune desired rosiran certifie name knight sauage man insomuch neither disprofite one might resolue matter caused vse great suspition word rosiran thus answered sir knight may satisfie desire assure selfe best concerning name neither selfe know happy time vnderstand vsed name call himselfe fatherlesse time past hath often mishappes renowned english prince token great loue friendship disdained terrour hard misfortune beare company hautie heart honour rather ioy greater knight fortune contained magnanimitie courage aliart discouered full effect promise cittie presently noysed recouery grecian prince caused euery one make small account presumptuous brag soldanes babylon persia iudged themselues vnder surest defence might obtained euer esteemed emperour causing argolant brought chamber went straight closet empresse rehearsed argolant declared concerning successe knight fortune argolant departing next morning desired emperour knight fortune make hast vnto constantinople great desire see ye emperour court indued great ioy conceiued sorrow departure good cause hauing lost cheefest defence absence prince knight kept prisoner castle dramusiande accursed meanes enchantresse eutropa possessing freedome losse might well esteeme volour hardy knight change mutability fortune heart drowned greefe past hope sendeth happy successe requite former mischance likewise pleasure hath continuall residence soonest prouideth greatest mishap chap xlv english knight grecian knight honor emperour trineus faire agriola enterprised braue tournament wherein one behaued valiantly three strange knight arriued whose noble behauiour vrged royall assembly great admiration eight dayes emperour trin u arriued court knight among themselues determined triumph cause tiltyard many scaffold gallery built might better behold hauty attempt emperour fair agriola king fredericke queene princesse flerida edward primaleon noble lady gentleman court come place appointed see tournament english knight entred list meant manifest affection bare lady honour fauours feared hazard vttermost liues entred grecian knight euery one brauely mounted attired faire new complete armour graced person maruellously prince gracian generall consent chosen captaine referred state conduct day palmerin england would enter ioust friend left valour turne disaduantage sound trumpet prepared themselues encountring one another knightly courage estate present whole multitude people attributed great comendation hardy exployt dismounted one another either side doubtfull say company likest victory gracian ran fiercely eutrope beltran english knight great strength well esteemed fortune turned backe towards day could withstand knightly puissance french prince platir encountred normant proude gaue colde welcome faine carry forth field like manner carlente sped hand prince berolde consequently english knight albeit deed iustly merite eternall commendation tilte tourney vrged repulse grecian knight stronger side berolde breaking rankes vsing singular behauiour attempt greatly liked regardants came clariball hungaria setled themselues stoutly ech endured doutfull dangerous fight neither hauing aduantage equall condition passing betweene emperour royall company greatly affected therewith king recinde albeit sharpe stroke sonne receiued vrged take impatiently yet generall applause giuen vnto constrained thinke well valiant proceeding eutrope came assistance clariball accompanyed syr pridos archirin labert roquendar rugerald flocandrisse alberraz lamonstrant brutamont maintain quarrell prince berolde came gracian frisol luyman onistalde dram tenebrant rousel bazilliarde behauing themselues gallantly armes yet brunt weak resist hot assault valiant english prince stil maintained fresh supply noble mind doubt gaine ouerthrow suddenly entred field platir floraman francian germaine orleance vernar polinard others began brauery fight well worthy past without notable praise english knight came still afresh fiercely grecia knight neere constraint vrged retire behold sudden aide grecian prince entred three strange knight brauely mounted first bearing shield groud sand god satur u compassed starres second deuise greene field image house sadnes hird would haue shield knowne therefore bare couered three seeing english knight preuailed maruellously resistance couched speares ran among thickest great danger side began fierce battaile vernar tremoran tene rant others faine carried field sore wounded like manner diuerse english side till eite sounded prince gracian company retired campe english knight conducted emperour king pallace sweet musicke delightfull exercise ioyned friend former vnity sonnes noble edward prince flerida proofe whereof brought sauage man wife nourished two young prince long caue presence great ioy fully confirmed triumph ended emperour king fredericke returned pallace table ready prepared immediately sate downe take repaste sei ed honorable comely order prince greatly loue court england supper done king gaue charge knight prepare themselues dancing done sumptuous banquet presently serued table dancing banquet finished sitting pleasantly ieasting one another entred hall three knight behaued themselues brauely tournament many desired come neere would know whence hinder intent mist sudden arose hall light dimmed torch burned scarcely lady dismaied caught knight armes put feare mist departed hall cleare straight way beheld middest lion tiger enduring great fight together set vnitie entred faire damosell golden rod hand wherewith touched humbled themselues foot done shee departed arose againe forme two fierce vntamed bulles caused astonishment beholder wished themselues foorth hall knight seeing lady greatly discouraged perswaded deuise artificially prouided delight emperour would hardly beleeue two bulles fought vehemently one ouercharged wearines fight fell ground breathing mouthes horrible ougly blacke smoke hall auoided accident estate first might behold three knight head vnarmed would haue shield known found gentle knight sauage man presently went king kneeling downe kissed hand word gracious soueraigne earnestly intreate hand knight may receiue courteous entertainement grace afford request sage aliart maiesties affectionate seruant griefe hath displeasant thought himselfe perfect quietnesse till might manifest humble deuoite grace king fredericke often heard report sage aliart reason renowne fame spred abroad stoode doubt bee hee youthful yeeres much vnlikely embrace great cunning learning euery famed neuerthelesse giuing credit knight sauadge man hee embraced salutation certainely sir aliart bound duty make good account well vertuous dealing doth iustly deserue also bringing fatherlesse knight inso sound good disposition health wherein haue onely honoured likewise approoued vnspotted faith knighthood gracious lord answered aliart desire haue manifest loialtie seruice vrgeth opinion might liue neuer long could accomplish much duty doth require respecting great friendship haue found grace hand vndeserued vnder soueraigne pardon presume disclose great secrete shall content highnesse also illustrious assembly king supposing glad tydings toward requested prince vouchsafe audience euery one quietly placed owne content aliart humbling himselfe princesse flerida began followeth madame hard distinguish betweene extreame griefes passed sweete solace enioy present albeit thought beyond comparison yet time heauie wofull complaint equally vehement priuie aduerse case could easily beare vrgent cause referring long discourse matter esteeme selfe highly honoured lesse hauty happy famous knight fortune sake hath suffered annoiance paine recompence dangerous trauaile sustained time deliuered two child vnfortunate forrest lord left sauage man taken redoubted knight sonne florian brother husband child reported ladie argonida loe instant promise accomplished noble lord edward restored two lost sonnes safe sound recouered whose knightly valure hath sufficiently discharged sorrowe afflicted person suffered knight fortune sonne palmerin gaue name honour emperour palmerin father meanes knight polendos receiued son court likewise caused tearmed owne name aduenturous knight sauage man sonne according place birth called florian forrest haue nourished brought vp motherly care albeit knowen straunger thus knit vp former ioy thought good presume farre make partner knowen onely god selfe princesse flerida edward wel viewing one suddenly rauished inward ioy impossible giue iudgement thereon palmerin florian came imbraced moued king present vnto delight could conceale great pleasure conceiued whereupon king entred word trust syr aliart newes altogether vnlookt present albeit haue beene earnestly desired long time yet doe fauour certifie assured haue giuen foorth manifest troth may dare hardly aduenture beleeue good lord answered aliart fable case well worthy seuere punishment due falsely informe prince neuerthelesse giue better assurance thereof marke shall ensue answere satisfied drewe hee foorth little booke whereon hauing read prettie sauage man wife entred hall nourished palmerin florian long theyr caue presently two prince beholding went imbraced great courtesie like siluian hauing learned ciuility court remained father caue kneeled downe vnto duetie princesse flerida receiued exceeding ioy shee imbraced louingly palmerin thinking great dishonour vnmindfull nurse vsed gently tooke hand brought king giuing vnderstand twain deserued good reward recompence great affection brother found hand king taking ground armes promised labour honorably rewarded lifting eye vp heauen vttered ioy manner heauenly father last good happe euer desired see wherefore thy pleasure take miserable world vnconstant fortune determine mischance done tooke two nephew brought princesse flerida humbled themselues knee kissed hand great many time casting armes necke teares remembred great danger saw endured bloody combate time shee faine set vnitie edward fauourably preserued noble liues palmerin seeing time euery one prepared themselues chamber commanded siluian conduct father mother faire rich chamber prouided euery one departing king accompanyed
