time pleasure court aged king england prince palmerin florian brother cittizens passed away night merrily making great bonefires ringing bel manifest ioy likewise conceiued happy accident morning king went chamber two nephewes found primaleon prince vernar merrily disposing themselues together accompanied arnedes recinde went chamber emperour trineus beeing already stirring prepared themselues go heare diuine seruice accomplished maruailous great solemnitie returned vn pallace assembly people see two prince could hardly ascend staires great hall people gathered prease strange prince endcucured themselues entertaine sage aliart honourably hightest lowest greatly made account insomuch euery one thought labour well imployed seruice euery one desir u question florian guarantized wound receiued castle dramusiande dinner ended went chamber empresse agriola queene princesse flerida dined king desiring silence placed began order sage aliart let seeme displeasant vnto good sir presume remember promise made yesternight also deliuer doubt haue conceiued selfe may request much fauour tell whence great cunning science haue heard doth argue discended noble linage demand aliart presently returned answer determined deere soueraigne neuer bewray selfe auy since maiestie hath commanded whose word force compell prince potentate may constraine certifie neither friend foe could yet get knight whose name desirous know called blandidon concerning birth parentage prince florian large giue vnderstand cause passe furder discouer touching self knight named pompides selfe brother v sonnes prince edward argonida lady enchanted isle hath beene affirmed v oath diuerse edward sitting beloued flerida loath conceale thing might profite case humbling himselfe king father began followeth deare father sir aliart hath deliuered grace must auouch true sonnes wherefore desire entertaine nephewes sweete flerida let seene disliked long entred acquaintance craftie deuices argonida vsed perill life pleasure also company twaine fruit long familiar labour king came aud imbraced louingly presently florian instant request declared hautis exploytes knightly deedes hee tryed found noble blandidon flerida forgaue lord edward offence smyling subtill inuentions argonida vsed gaine desire bare english prince immediately aliart pompides came submitted themselues shee welcommed hartily beene owne child continued pleasantly talking till time required depart chamber palmerin england held sage aliart great estimation perceiued allyed kindred altogether framed delight company would attempt thing priuie triumphes sumptuous feastes continued daily aboundantly euery night marking dauncing rare deuises put execution grecian knight highly honoured lady england whose braue gesture courtly entertainement onely esteemed much commended returne court constantinople long continuance exceeding ioy arnedes recinde concluded depart kingdomes leauing sonnes accompany prince pleasure emperour perceiuing determined iourney towards allemaigne also prepared themselues take leaue edward prince desired vouchsafe paine see castle dramusiande wherein long time beene kept prisoner request pleased emperor well desired arnedes recinde beare company also would depart together intreaty quickly wonne morrow departed themselues thither accompanied lady gentleman english court greatly longed see castle much spoken caused great brittaine stand feare prowesse noble palmerin brought subiection chap xlix emperour trineus king england prince lady rode towards castle dramusiande way saw caue sauage man wherein two prince beene long time nourished way rode sage aliart presented many rare braue deuises vntill time arriued castle met strange knight honor beautie lady miragarda iusted diuers prince departed againe thence vnknowne sage aliart discouered palmerin england name whence morning knight behaued themselues worthily triumph prouiding new rich armor made great haste would bee ready goe giant drausiande onely would gratifie lady bearing company see castle departure foorth london king sound trumpet heralde caused proclaimed citizen offer follow hee determined many themselues none enter castle lady knight night hee concluded lye forrest therefore sent prouision tent pauillions arriued found euery thing owne contentment princesse flerida desirous sport selfe forrest walking place shee suffered extreame panges trauayle sauage man came humbled himselfe vnto declaring place tooke two prince nourished coue neere adioyning report knight desirous see caue taking leaue princesse walked thither primaleon maiortes soldane bellagris entred began euery one greatly amazed seeing caue containe large breadth length made suppose manner intricate de dalus walles hanged tapistrie gold silke caddis maner stuffe skinnes beastes two prince slaine finely laboured artificiall frame decked foorth chamber knight marueyled desart place finde fayre dwelling great stood debating one another strange conceyts perceiued caue made iudge time past beene solitary dwelling noble man exiled countrey therein greatly deceyued ancient edifice erected enchantresse mellia kept place great raigne king armace brother vrganda liued one time rehearsed history emperour splandian sonne valiant magnificient king amadis prince oriana wife queene great brittaine prince knight satisfied mindes beholding place returned pauillions lady welcommed louingly primaleon sitting downe sister flerida rehearsed manner caue two prince nourished little content minde place ruinated put obliuion night reposed themselues forrest honourably serued beene english court morning prepared themselues towards castle way delighted fiue deuises sent cunning sage aliart euery one tooke great pleasure princely iourney hunter pursued wilde bore hart buck noble game came wearily falling downe lady feete offered touch presently skipping farder side riuer deuises pleased emperor company gaue great thankes aliart frequented pleasant pastime al way rode last arriued valley perdition sight castle dramusiande went somewhat heart princesse flerida seeing prison wherein louing edward long remained emperour trineus king frederick fel great commendation sumptuous building castle often seene fayrer mooued intreate dramusiande founder singular peece workmanship demand dramusiande presently gaue reply gratious lord castle first builded mine aunt eutropa meanes hath remayned thus long knowledge trust said emperour trineus fortresse strength beautie ought hand one could imploy great abuse commonly see wicked thriue well good enioyas great account world maintaine action iustice equitie riding last dramusiande willed suddaine stay began manuer vnfold cause think see entrance bridge seemly knight ready appointed ioust perceiue body offereth resistance maketh supose hath attempted keepe passage vnlooked accident stayed behold knight well mounted gray courser armour spotted white blacke greatly pleased eye beholder sheeld ba e naked body lady beauty whose countenance excellently figured altea floraman accomplished chiualricus deed constantinople might seeme offer comparison beautifull spectacle neither faire princesse polinarda might presume equall selfe braue shape lady lower end sheeld letter gold written miragarda prince occupied eye beholding singular forme compacted sheeld perceiued esquire come towards done dutie began salute protestation faire lord lady noble knight maister behold bridge giueth vnderstand cause trauailes vnto place far countrey whence aduentured himselfe honour good fortune command lady whose humble seruant remayneth houre try knighthood castle hath beene blazed abroad infortunate arriued aduertised enchantment fully finished strength giant dramusiande retinew conquered valour hautie prowes knight named palmerin england hath deliuered prince kept captiue cruell meanes disloyall eutropa newes welcome vnto desired nothing yet loth returne lady place knighthood hath bene tryed passe backe againe approued craueth enter ioust disposed referring combate sword aduenture pleasure challenge encreased courage knight entred strife first runne strange knight king perceuing returned esquire answer friend tell thy lord enterprise worthy perpetuall renowne containe courage proofe message himselfe giueth show lady shall haue occasion vse according valiant attempt deserueth esquire receiuing king pleasure returned lord sooner made knowne tremoran shewed himselfe bridge inuiting strange knight ioust stayed accomplish desire encountring pleasant charge tremoran forced leaue saddle chance somewhat displeased luyman burgondie thinking reuenge repulse tremoran sent himselfe keepe company belcar desirous shew prowesse among young knight couched speare strange knight sent horse man ground presently rosuell tooke cause hand made pertaker mishap like manner guerin frisol blandidon floraman diuers serued moued king polendos vnto choller would haue ventured strange knight prince edward perswaded contrary went great murmuring amongst knightes supposed sage aliart brought champion art disgrace vnto attempt vsed meanes vnto might vanquished herein greatly deceiue themselues onely noble force knight continually animated beholding faire face ladie brauely proportioned shield floraman greatly bent knight beleeuing victorie proceeded beauty lady would put fortune hazard thinking feature faire altea soueraigne authoritie strange miragarda wherevpon thus began conferre himselfe albeit madame haue suffered name absent thought yet hath beautie bene alwayes extant memory neuer vowed title although mishap would haue vrged contrary wherefore time let beautie fauour may foyle mine enemy perfect honour fame encountred one another againe couragiously passing first course breake staffe second time floraman steede throwne ground violently making recourse former secrete speech began thus perceiue altea misfortune chanceth thorow froward opinion mee attempt honour repay still hatred vrge forsake seruice neuer assay thing hereafter warrant courtesie emperour trineus prince sad behold sorrowe floraman also see onistalde pompides reduced like mischance whereat strange knight triumphed florian stomaking see friend euery side foyled knight vant himselfe sort giuing conge empresse lady ranne violently strange knight three time met yet neither preuayling strange knight looking shielde perceyuing faire face lady somewhat raised speare began order talke himselfe execute selfe dishonour haue receiued suffering faire face polluted owe dutifull affection neither preuaile hath done endure long combate attached sorrow fourth attempt met furiously together layde along earth night approched fast palmerin could compasse meane enter iust made suppose hee displease fayre polinarda aliart put opinion came wordes good syr let seeme offensiue haue iusted knight valoure returne disaduantage lady mistresse would thinke great vngentlenesse thanke syr aliart answered palmerin courteous perswasion wishing might hurt albeit vnknowen vnto yet arte made manifest may request name knight wherein may make mee greatly beholding also cause vse circumspection mine attempt wherein onely desire escape anger lady polinarda question aliart shaped reply courtesie great mine affection cannot conceale thing may doe pleasure wherefore shall vnderstand knight named florendos putteth noble deedes proofe honour whose image may perceiue figured shielde euen hazard action purchase fauour lady sister word palmerin imbraced aliart giuing hartie thankes satisfied earnest desire vowed keepe secrete discouer florian mounted horsebacke againe somewhat offended receiued better successe strange knight perceiued esquire ryding away great hast loath knowne sped according hauty desire cause hee departed small sorrowe chap l strange knight departed sage aliart bewraied faire miragarda entred castle dramusiande palmerin gaue againe giant friend honour caused bee called inuincible fort fortune departing thence aliart brought castle obscure valley shewed many rare strange deuices whence king recinde arnedes taking leaue emperour king england departed home country emperor prince iourney court england edward discouered soldane bellagris blandidon sonne begotten sorrowfull lady pandritia strange knight speedy departure emperour prince ceassed commend redoubted enterprise greatly desiring know made importunate sage aliart laboured vaine would matter satisfie desire prince primaleon hee told secret hee personage great authoritie whose valour excellent vertue equally thereto apparant ladie whose portraite vsed sheeld bare affection would nothing disobey causeth absent himselfe company till hee haue attained title lady desireth himselfe deserueth satisfie lady pleasure hath ventured life arriue place thinking aduenture dramusiande reserued perceiued already finished prowesse knight voweth humble seruice could honour proffer ioust cause know bountie courage sufficient haue enterprised hautie pecillous aduedture eward desired shew name damosell vowed earnest affection whose aliart loth gaine say beganne order answer request lady knight hath vowed seruice named euery one faire miragarda whose face would take occasion contempleate behold perfect rare substantiall image beauty concerning birth daughter countie arla great authoritie dominion spaine whose singuler forme knight beheld could chuse thrust himselfe among pykes hazard insomuch none hath seene could withdraw effections haue aduentured limme life beyond comparison trust said king recinde haue bene well acquainted county himselfe exquisite perfection remaine daughter neuer time could gaine knowledge indeede left kingdome spaine litle none make account beautie alighting horse taking lady one hand entred castle dramusiande greatly delighted sumptuous building braue conueyance commodious place gallery chamber made ouer little fine brooke riuers magined commendation sufficient place dramusiande endeuoured himselfe entertainment according time yeere suddaine comming would permit good order euery thing disposed fine neate excellent quicke dispatch prince well pleased dramusiande accordingly thanked next morning concluded depart thence princesse flerida become somewhat sickly palmerin deliuered castle againe dramusiande reuerence worthinesse memorie owne good lucke called inuincible force fortune departing thence sage aliart conducted way habitation frequenting still singuler deuises lady weake nature somewhat dismaied prince themselues maruellously delighted arriued obscure valley behold castle sage aliart ingeniously edified strengthened sure industrie stay recite opinion hereon weary mind tedious discourse stayed space foure dayes hauing royall seruice meanes aliart supposed owne court vnpossible bee princely serued arnedes recinde desirous owne kingdomes tooke leaue emperour company one taking way towards france towards spaine hauing body ech one esquire attending sonnes left still prince yeares fit endure trauaile yet incline themselues ease world returned emperor king frederick rest traine english court emperour faire agriola tooke leaue likewise greefe either side departure iudgements sufficient conceiue ceasse speake soldane bellagaris maiores hauing kissed hand king fredericke came embraced prince edward whose sake left country partner imprisonment prince accompanying part way began order soldane bellagris trust syr base memory remember pleasure vnder colour name receiued sister law pandritia realme lacedemonia lady cause cannot admit obliuion labour growne knightly issue assure selfe knight named blandidon sonne vntill time haue kept secret yet thought discouer time place required amend default faith passed vnder supposition selfe wherfore brother long since dead people sorowfull austere kinde life shall manifest honour espouse last beside shall enioy princesse excellent beautie sonne highly esteemed knightly bountie bellagris paused hereon prettie debating minde qualitie enterprise supposed craue deeper iudgement remembrance offence done past last hauing remained mute good space required prince edward answer credite sir neuer amazed thing either fortune hath sent mischance mine owne folly accident report haue vouchsafed disclose farre thought natiue country neuerthelesse make estimation blandidon accompt selfe happy haue sonne affection beare wil accomplish else neuer thought haue done hereupon bid hartily farewell vowing send word proceeding shortly possible may thus departed soldane bellagris maiortes accompanied polendos belcar vernar loue faire bazilia called home constantinople shortly prince primaleon left english court trauailing alone himseife without company hee meant trie aduentures fortune could way present vnto sparing person would ieopard himselfe place perill danger knowing well life loyalty couragious ought imploied defence misaduenture kept restraint terror time sorrowfull seruitude chap li primaleon departed court england arriued realme lacedemonia intended visite sorrowfull lady pandritia tristfull valley met knight behaued himselfe well iust castle dramusiande behalfe beautie lady miragarda hauing giuen himselfe name knight twaine entred dangerous combate till pandritia lady faine come set vnitie primaleon knowledge sonne florendos primaleon hauing left english court taken himselfe honour good fortune made little stay place till hee arriued kingdome lacedemonia forgetting last conference sorrowfull lady pandritia touching manner solitarie sauage kinde life concluded visite againe try shee continued former constancie either vpon mallice misbeliefe haue reported condition woman lincked vnconstancie certaintie might reposed dealing wept wantonnesse smilde subtilty teares full treason pleasant conceyts mired spightful attempt opinion gentlewoman farre thought noble sexe farre wish disliking misconstruing saying long rode primaleon without aduenture worthy rehearsall till last come tristfull valley knight entred presently conuinced sadnesse espied two horse comming castle pandritia one hee knew belong knight maintained iust castle dramusiande made somewhat amazed see wander without maister last casting eye hee espied knight setting behinde tree attyred blacke armour hand shielde portraite lady whereto hee vsed many amorous complaint primaleon desirous heare alighted deliuering horse esquire drewe neere vnto knight farre rauished beholding lady counterfaite perceiued comming primaleon thinking body neere continued discourse manner madame desire hath sight sweete face quallified meanes till come againe presence happy may esteeme themselues onely haue continuall view heauenly beauty partaker incomparable courtesie sufficient inueigle mindes god hath larger force intrap heart earthly gallant often doe imbrace picture vnfained heart powre foorth complaint middest mishap liuing nobilitie name elephant doeth ayre reioycing shrine god knowes far substance oh florendos borne great happinesse thou esteeme thy parentage brought infinite mishap thine owne perswasion thou doest contemplate thought without end beginnest loue endeth likeing thee well mayst thou call thy selfe miragarda good occasion gaue thee name poore heart hath paide indifferently shall thou vse rigor continuing great many like speech primaleon well knew sonne florendos whose greeuous passion caused call memory like sorrowes himselfe endured spent trauayles princesse gridonia wherefore drawing neere vnto would yet take knowledge saluted tearmes sir knight would impart greefes sorroweth see ouercharged heauinesse truly sir aunswered tristfull knight receiue contentation troubled thought haue vsed long good liking would bee loath priuie passion onely selfe alway welcome make selfe hardy disturbe contended exercise certainly dare expect either force repent discourtesie bring vassaile lady mistresse calling esquire arme primaleon mounted presently horsebacke greatly offended sonnes word would make answer stayed comming pretty way tristfull knight ready prouided bethought himselfe vngentle wordes came vnto primaleon speech sir knight pardon pray haue forgotten selfe towards assuring sorry wordes gaue choller tush sir answered primaleon nothing may vse talke please prouide selfe determined trie courage would attempt giue dare word couched speares deliuered either side force tristfull knight sent earth primaleon bearing company girts saddle broken either greatly abashed drew sword charged one another fierce stroke primaleon vsing pittie vnto sonne hacked armour eagerly bene greatest enemy world may perceiue furie little regardeth freendship affinitie extreame father childe stretcheth beyond reason limit nature long fight dangerous either part armour spoyled body sore wounded strength much altered one would haue supposed death next remedie withdrawing themselues pause little cast eye vpon house sadnesse window couered blacke pandritia damosel st behold combate great greefe see two champion endure long primaleon greatly afflicted behold ladyes also angred hautie courage sonne stayed hand entred speech sir knight trie instant portraite lady stand need deuotions vse vnto deliuer hand faile beyond expectation shall know vaine spend time foolish cogitation trust sir replyed tristfull knight stood need ayde make resistance thinke would willingly grant thereto witlesse moue rash presumption ere long haue doubt shall deerely know price fought good againe primaleon seeing sore wound giuen sonne beganne rue daungerous estate whereupon vsed speech following thinke best sir knight leaue weapon end combat louing word may returne greater honour seeke spoile one anothers life sir sayd tristfull knight first might haue remedied mishappe seeing would esteeme selfe thinkes scorne graunt time talke pandritia came foorth castell accompanied damoselles desirous pacifie daungerous strife wherein perceyued two champion remaine primaleon seeing courtesie pandritia left tristfull knight thus saluted madame trust ere long shall receiue contentation griefe first entrance castle cannot welcome hath alwaies bin desired sir answerered pandrita pardon haue knowledge good wil giue harty thaks vrged great distresse see make entreatance would leaue combate vpon report name may without blemish mine honour shall enter castell doe best relieuing weake estate credite madame sayd primaleon haue earnestly desired doe seruice haue spared trauaile person farre countrey bring tydings hope shall agree good nature shall remaine suspition giue vnderstand called primaleon sonne famous emperor constantinople tristfull knight heard wordes ouercome extreame sorrow heauinesse entred combat father primaleon much adoe sustaine himselfe prince seeing came word florendos let grieuous motion seeme abate courage knowledge fell combat hath passed franke freely forgiue glad haue tryed right reputation tristfull knight kneeling downe great humility kissing father hand hee sustained graciously armes great salutation passed betweene pandritia glad see prince primaleon conducted house sadnesse lodged goodly chamber wound attended lady diligent louing respect chap lii primaleon tristfull knight healed wound receiued combat courteous entertainment sorrowfull lady pandritia staied little space primaleon certifying happy deliuery prince edward departed thence prince toward constantinople tristful knight iourney towards spaine pandritia likewise ioyfull riding left house sadnesse went garden damosel primaleon prince vernar arriued constantinople soldan bellagris sent messenger emperor gaue vnderstand dealing soldan babilon staid army contend certaine lord dominion rebelled entred armes floredos tristfull knight noble father prince primaleon made abode space certaine dayes carefull castle solitary pandritia carefully visited feeble estate louingly tendered short time recouered perfect health time primaleon certified prosperous successe prince fdward verily supposed dead long shee conceiued great delight report request prince left house sadnesse returned mansion named garden damosel vsing pleasant conceit great might suffer thinke primaleon hauing borne company longer willingly hee would declared name knight prisoner edward also manner happy deliuerance accompanied tristful knight tooke leaue loath depart soone perswaded earnest affayres gaue courtesie left twaine thus ryding together tristfull knight desired father hee might leaue company affection lady directed trauaile spaine denying sonnes request himselfe minded ryde alone ende hee might make better proofe valour imbraced one another tristfull knight riding towards whose sweete sake liued great affliction anguish minde time wee leaue returne prince primaleon encountring aduenture time come constantinople whereas full often wished himselfe heard soldanes army force caused whole empire stand great feare primaleon entred citie kept close beuere would knowne intended come suddainly vpon friend wold make better welcome come pallace hauing deliuered horse esquire went vp great hall armour vsed tristfull knight much defaced blowes receiued causing great astonishment present gaue way come emperour kneeling downe desiring haue empresse lady present would discourse highnesse happened lately england emperour desirous heare yet knowing receiued ground saying honour place whence came make great deale better welcome conducted empresse chamber good hap princesse gridonia polinarda bazilia present emperor tooke occasion begin thus faire lady knight commeth court england would declare message vntil time might come presence desireth shewe ambassage wish otherwise thinke tariance sonne primalaon whose absence small cause heauinesse emperour sate downe lady primaleon began behold earnestly perceyued growne great alteration especially emperour father whose countenance much changed saw last prince gridonia greatly offended faire face continuall mourning shee vsed absence lord generally beholding staying speaking indifferent long space great amazing emperor also company courtly lady last vnclasped beuer began order desire gratious father pardon long silence also great time mine absence royall court hauing message present good health noble friend england also sonne primaleon humbleth himselfe gratious presence emperor suddenly wrapt inward ioy great time remained trance like maner empresse gridonia polinarda al lady came running altogether imbraced ioy impossible giue iudgement thereon hee vsed curtesie al princesse bazilia came kissed hand said faire sister feare lord vernas long abset himselfe fro shal haue right soon dare warrant vnarmed emperour could satisfie himselfe till heard ioyfull newes lately chanced england vnderstood palmerin sonne prince edward daughter flerida receiued great contentation nourished company princesse polinarda concealed ioy one dramacian excepted accustomed disclose secret great pleasure returne primaleon noble gentleman cittie came dayly welcome greater content within prince vernar great many prince knight greece arriued court whose company long desired ioyfully hartily embraced middest great triumphing solace messenger sent soldane belagris presented himselfe emperour disclosed message manner illustrious prince soldan bellagris lord master humble duty kisseth hand excellency giuing vnderstand soone arriued court aduertised soldon babilo hauing great puissant armie prepared himselfe ouerrunne country empire make generall spoile people dominion estate weakned losse knight haue left court seek aduentures great brittain taking ship army poynt hoyse sailes word presently brought certaine lord realme leuied number owne subiects enter armes able longer suffer oppressing tyranny vpon occasion stayed armie bring obeysance beene hardie rebell thing hardly without losse pagan shall finish thou intendeth visite might preuent lord thus willed make knowne vnto wishing see houre death imperiall estate way distressed gramercy good friend said emperour instant perceiue great good wil soldane thy lord hath alwaies borne vnto pray thee commend honourable thankes protesting much god forbid stand like neede thinke best take rest hauing endured long trauail cannot else chuse sore laboured yet first desire thee rehearse fareth thy lord since coming home lord answered messenger euer since arriual hath delighted discourse strange aduentures long since brought ende great brittaine rare know highnesse hath heard wherfore need reherse say true quoth emperour assure selfe imprisonment english prince edward cause castle dramusiande remaine perpetuall renowned memory thus concluding talke emperour went empresse chamber presence lady rehearsed message soldan bellagris morrow messenger departed bearing emperours letter lord court citizen replenished great ioy filled heauinesse stood feare armie soldan babylon chap liii history discourseth large tristfull knight hee departed constantinople company prince knight went pursue search prince edward occasion ill weather scas landed vpon coast spaine trauaile came castle giant almarol became enamoured faire miragarda whose loue foyled giant kept passage great honour picture authour hath made mention prince florendos present tearmeth himselfe tristfull knight endeuoured himselfe likewise search edward well excuse owne negligence also fauour hard fortune knight trauayle shall bee perfectly resolued proceeding time departed constantinople company diuers knight pursued prince primaleon euery one taking contrary way course directed hauen sea imbarking himselfe merchant england time occasion serued tooke departure hauing endured long sea knew themselues within ken england suddaine contrarie winde came vpon held danger betweene hope feare last great hazard liues chanced vpon coast spaine tooke landing rocke day called lisbone florendos seeing himselfe farre place whither directed course would haue gladly attained rode ouercharged extreme heauines complaining fortune vnlucky trauaile passed prouince portingall hautie chiualrie obtained generall commendation happened come riuer thesin ryding contemplating amorous thought espied goodly castle scituated vpon rocke gaue great occasion pleasure behold castle vrged aduance course thither lay blocke way great let former pretence vnder greene shade rode perceiued three lady singular beautie life time supposed neuer haue seene like lady continued serious discourse among themselues tooke heede arriuall florendos gaue great good liking especially shee sat middest twaine shewed great reuerence stately beautie also singular erquisite behauiour shall say florendos enamoured faire spectacle hee could well eschew bird fast caught fowler snare liked better honour heartily loue hee changeth mirth mones talke teares whole cogitation louers complexion aiming whole course affection lady whose face power detaine freedom behauiour operation chiefe starre within compasse sphere still stroue himselfe goe backe againe shun blaze set fire sences affection hung clog conceit one looke brought heart labyrinth ariadne thread could good saint giuen glaunce remained mus occasion lady receiued leaue field walke castle gaue vnkind corsey heart florendos mind outrage yea sooner gone fell rigorous accusation himselfe partly timeritie withheld speaking againe necessary cause haue mooued speech betweene one eue man distraught wit began feele seuerall accident loue imprinteth heart delight dally vnder banner little son goddesse citherea pierce deepe aiming shaft hardy enemie enter launce confessed himselfe bee suretie bullet flew eares beautie sent charge warre eies able houre power space yeere well sad walked castell finding gate shut hee fell former agony fortune casting eye aside hee beheld sheeld hanging wall wherin liuely giuen view portrait lady mistresse hart iudged handled perfection wanting nothing resemblance person vnder sheeld golden letter artificially written name miragarda whereby florendos verily supposed belonged iustly deserued beautie merit viewed would likewise inuegle heart stoutest durst conceiue hardinesse themselues come place abode yet letter placed tent purpose aduertise knight took occasion trauaile way carefull themselues feare giant almarol lord castle kept sheeld behalfe faire miragarda knight durst presume take thence florendos stood vsing thousand amorous deuotions singular picture espyed giant come forth castle armed iacke azier lesse faire strong mounted sturdy blacke courser florendos began vse word credit sir knight mystery letter hath gotte maistery feare repent first saw fortune much enemy conduct place trust answered florendos fauour portrait stand feare thy puissance regard sweete face owes respect word thou vsest thy ruffe hardly shew desire giue thee thy dutie since thou wilt haue forbearance ready payment cause sword time seale thee quittance word caused one either side cruell blowes weapon dangerous one doubtfull yet fortune fauouring prince florendos brought giant almoral estate bene made shorter head miragarda presently discended perceiuing almoral brought subiection vsed word prince florendos sir knight desire make acceptation victory beare bloody minde desire losse life sake much fauour much beholding well gentlenesse also gard fortresse florendos seeing gotten good lucke might speake durst requited presently answer madame force gratious speech also good opinion conceiue seemely selfe onely vow heart command also hand mainetaine cause wherefore grant life desiring gentle nature wold afford like beauty claimed conquest none selfe way mitigate miragarda giuing great thanks curtesie departed castle againe accompanyed giant florendos still remaining without complaining wound receiued beautie hurt gained giant whose company enterprised keepe sheeld miragarda entring combat defence knight made iourney way indeed nany singular report beautie yet fortune instant preferring florendos caused still remaine conquerour thus remained prince extreame conflict loue frequencing dayly lady picture amorous pensiue complaint miragarda tooke pleasure behold fained loue onely would scorne fond foolish dealing fame blowne abroade aduentures great brittaine knight continually lost castle giant dramusiande miragarda conceiuing opinion earnestly request would take iourney thither perswading aduenture fortresse reserued finished valour florendos loath disobey commandement tooke vpon crauaile arriued england time heard aduenture finished prince preparing themselues come castle bridge attended comming behaued haue heard gentlewoman whose rare excellencie may perceiue vrgeth gentle minde attempt deepest danger gratious seruice shall resolued faire miragarda chanced castle giant almorol defended haue heard time king recinde prisoner enchanted castle many prince spain betaken themselues search queene remained greeuous sorrowes nothing could moue procure pleasure whereupon countie arlae presented daughter miragarda queene end might receiue pleasure company noble gentleman delighted rare peece beantie enterprised iousts triumphes onely winne affectioned expences great doe pleasure litle regarded many brought great necessitie onely riotous charge beauty set queene seeing lord long absent kingdome noble gentleman court striuing excell one another braue rich deuises brought hard exigent many liuings onely procured loue miragarda aduise countie honourable councell pittied see great inconuenience sent giant almoral giuen certaine knight gentlewoman attend vppon keepe till time appoint mariage instant could dispatch great discord risen amongst prince knight court sent castle giant almoral vntill prince quietnesse againe meane time often vsed walke greene feeldes delight selfe euen time florendos come found liued till one might releeue captiuitie hereafter shall vnderstand euery thing happened time abyding chap liiii palmerin departed realme england trauaile met prince gracian lying fast sleep vnder greene tree gaue vnderstand hard aduenture befaln prince platir floraman riding helpe met damosell brought place fighting combate palmerin slew dramaco lord castle redeemed three ladyes tirannicall seruitude long remained palmerin court king england noble father freends reioyced company euery one supposed would trauaile could hardly keepe himselfe earnest intreaty king prince flerida mother vrged stay longer gladly would last perceiued al mean could serue hinder determination laboured night day pursuing pretence gaue consent depart whither pleased taking leaue aged king father mother freends little sorrowfull enioy absence gaue euery one gentle conge left great heauinesse within florian seeing brother palmerin gone honour imbaced staying long trauaile hee began fresh sadnesse throughout court especially king frederick whose affection inclined prince palmerin hee nourished court therefore loue great deale surelie grounded first discourse happened prince palmerin riding encumbred thousand conceites durst take way constantinople fearing displease lady polinarda remembring neere affinitie good hope wold make estimatio seruice contenting himselfe thought hee rode till arriued vnfertile valley whose scarcitie tree thing delightfull eye vrged dispence thought sudden sadnesse till last hee ridden good came faire mightie bigge tree whose compasse boughes contained fine coole shadowe vnder espied knight lie fast asleepe hauing neither horse esquire beare company made somwhat amazed loath leaue dangerous estate moued lance speech sir knight place one repose wearie limmes vncertaine safetie may assure self feared knight suddenly awaked setting hand sword presently started vp palmerin knowledge bee prince gracian whose company little welcome solitary vnfrequented place passage wherefore hee began tearmes following sir gracian let presumption admitted offence rather esteemed sort way command seruice gracia glad see prince palmerin knowing puissance might remedy part misfortune willing disclose imbraced prince armes order began vtter tale vnknowne worthy sir knightly chiualry hath brought end adueture tearmed beyond possibility knowe affection inclined ayde whose misaduenture requiret helpe good knight happie arriuall time let spectacle shall shortly see remaine vndoubted infallible witnesse delay word may turne danger thus follow way see right long shall come place prince platir floraman abide great danger may yeelde maruailous friendly succour make hast would gladly happy haue sight meane time siluian doe fauour may mount vp behinde come vnto desire except v forgetfull stone haue doubt meete together palmerin sory heare newes highly commending fortune came luckely aide two prince promising fulfill requst gracian set spurres horse rode fast possible might towards rode long came place two pathes seruing two seueral wayes made stand muse way best take driue doubt espied damosell come riding towards vsing heauy clamour one pursued depriue life palmerin abashed vnlooked aduenture stayed horse question perceiuing intent great feare gaue speech good sir offer discourtesie hinderance happy trauaile may endamage greater harme stay discourse misfortune yeelde content heare afraide disclose doubt valour giue comfort great mishappe trust lady answered palmerin valour hardly make warrant great desire instant must request shewe cause grieuous lamentation well syr quoth shee since desirous vnderstand exextremitie case come shall certified hereof much possible craue riding length espyed goodly castle heard great slashing bruit weapon noyse damosell brought shewed ten knight setled themselues fight twaine defended great pollicy charged enemy courage minde little space laid fine dead ground knight stood certaine men holding two faire comely lady would haue entred castle two knight kept themselues still gate possible way enter palmerin beholding combate fierce side blood cruelly wasted strength altogether brought great weakenesse stayed long perceyued mighey bigge knight come forth castle strongly armed mounted ten well appointed men garded person diligent aduauncing himselfe remainder left aliue ten knight endured still combate twaine verie maiestically gaue foorth wordes retire varlet let breake bone caitifes haue procured high heauie displeasure palmerin saw two knightes feeble estate fresh resistance vtter losse liues stepped knight replying manner thou haue either regard knighthood honourable condition thou oughtest vse martiall attempt leaue thou seest weake resist prouide thy selfe haue enterprised quarrell knight offended word palmerin couched speare ran ech puissance able resist encounter sent together violently earth falling combate sword armed men came defence lord good fortune prince gracian came ayded couragious helpe foure assayling knight companion end preuailed siue outright caused standing seeing lord knight slaine face run castle betake themselues darke seller vauts onely stood feare losing liues palmerin seeing field body came offer resistance went ladyes pale colour reason great feare stood cruell dramaco tooke seeking dishonour offer villany could wherefore prince word began salute faire ladyes shew pray occasion villanous wretch endeuoured himselfe dishonour ignorant hath happened yet certified misfortune came best seruice might platir floraman knowledge prince palmerin stayed ladyes answer comming imbracing great courtesie gaue harty thanks friendly succour nay trust answered palmerin giue thanks prince gracian come vnto time declared vnto heauinesse estate taking lady hang went castle found body two aged woman sate wringing hand death dramaco seeing coming slain companion dissembled greef remained hart submitted themselues fearing lest tast cup themselues onely requesting liues might saued renowned palmerin england presently grant lady brought goodly chamber esquire bound vp wound made prouision get strength againe palmerin desirous haue knowledge knight slaine questioned one old woman mother presently returned answer knight griefe haue slaine called dramaco hee sonne begotten valiant giant lurcon sometime husband primaleon slew constantinople time enterprised reuenge death famous perrequin dura haue wee long liued owne content vntill froward fortune conducted hither desirous heare pardon mee griefe permit rehearse prince contented himselfe report departing hee went visit lady vnderstand manner mishap chanced chap lv lady declared prince palmerin manner brought castle hardy knight dramaco met prince gracian sent platir floraman rescue lady thence palmerin found castle labouring still aduenturous enterprise dramaco companion thus happily foyled knight remayning castle till wound healed palmerin determined depart fro thence first desired lady tell happened became oppressed cruell dramaco eldest lady perceiuing earnest desire prince palmerin satisfied request manner worthy sir daughter lady inhabiteth farre place castle liued quiet content life well guarded supposed ensuing danger feared mishap well gouerned lady mother none auoide destenies haue ordained must abide doome appointed fortune allowed great vnhappinesse haue felt part rygour cruell tyrant addicted cruell nature noble rewarded bloody murther fayre lady damoselles defaced honour vsed alike villainous furie sent tent knight aforesayde castle mother finding v altogether vnprouided refuge time insomuch woonted safetie gaue v small cause doubt without respect teares complaint brought v away extreame violence way brought v met knight meaning prince gracian dismounted horse perceiued comely knight saued life tooke horse left foote goe whither pleased thinking scorne accept combate sundry meanes offered vnto leauing alone brought v castell two knight swiftly pursuing v stood defence order would suffer v bee lead castell dramaco seeing knight preuailed well seruants came himselfe accomplish could fulfill well stood friend happy effect remaineth substantiall witnesse palmerin well marked discourse lady theyr great misfortune monsterous crueltie cramaco hee reioyced found gracian luckie time whose meanes brought aduenture good happy conclusion gracian rehearsed time hee stayed tree platir floraman came way knight conducted lady taken horse left order haue heard declared mishap lady whereupon rid hastily continued combat haue already heard vntill time one lady escaping away met prince palmerin brought defend oppressed cause sifted euery matter according themselues desired knowe prince palmerin gaue castle lady taking farewell gently mounted horsebacke leauing cure woundes castle lady carefull helpe prince length brought former strength passed away time pleasantly lady recounting strange aduenture happily passed death dramaco comming eare lady mother caused come thither see daughter arriued gaue great thankes prince imployed paine gratified honour shee could deutie expedient time place prince saw euery thing due desent order determined depart thence desiring lady vse courtesie ancient mother dramaco shee innocent culpable mischieeous practises request lady willing shewe liberalitie vertue great commendation gaue castle sonne dramaco rewarded courteous thankes prince going armoury dramaco prouided themselues one notable armour stable likewise tooke three fairest steed might better serue necessitie abide put exercise leauing lady castle readie depart owne abiding vowed stay place till attained citie constantinople sped shall heare hereafter chap lvi palmerin left prince two lady castle rode accompanied siluian esqure til last arriued sea shore finding ship lying anker entred presently sonne ship cable burst middest billowes sea brought ship strange iland palmerin went land encountred strange hardy aduenture fountaine siluian met francian onistalde declared mishap maister cause betooke presently search like manner siluian arriuing castle giant dramusiande vrged vpon report aduance himselfe presently trauaile palmerin departed castle left prince lady mother rode without aduenture space three dayes together till last comming sea side reason distemperature made great raging alighted gaue horse siluian desirous looke surge would driue pensiue matter foorth minde walking along side rocke espied shippe hard lay ancker marriners body else hee could perceiue neare made desirous goe aboard see body hee might resolued whence vessel wherfore strooke land vnfrequented place stayed supposing bin gone land fetch fresh water necessary needfull vse saw body came space neither could perceiue whether bin gone land prepared himselfe enter ship siluian desired change minde fond enterprise aduenture better countenance meer folly hazard person saw word might attaine perswasion attempt suffered enter ship according desire sooner prince fully entred cable rope held ship burst midst siluian presently cried master offred cast himselfe land againe bough tree vaine yt ship lanched forth deepe full gale wind rode merily vpon surge short time palmerin lost sight shore stil thinking fortune intend sodain aduenture dishartning himselfe iudging best reposed mercy god fauour waues expecting good issue vnlooked chance siluian remained auinesse losse maister thought stay place till heard tidings either good bad seeing three dayes news would happen rede sadly fro thence leading maisters horse hand espyed two knight white armour beset pellicans red carnation colour siluian presently knew francian onistalde demanded become master siluian declared manner mishap entred ship cable brake suddaine feared mischance would annoy deare friend whose happinesse wished owne health wherfore concluded siluian go strait london king fredericke would conceiue great greefe know vnlucky chaunce desired shew way thought might soonest find pain death go london reherse losse prince one knew beare maister great affection siluian promised accomplish pleasure departed vowing spare labour sea land vntill might heare noble palmerin siluian fully resolued best tooke way strait great brittaine arriuing castle giant dramusiande entertained kinde louing courtesie discouered losse lord presently dramusiande clapping armor backe promised neuer returne vnto castle without might attaine good recouery famous prince siluian seeing affection giant great master welfare himselfe could wish presented himselfe serue esquire till might happy finde prince againe thus leaue good fortune trauaile returne noble palmerin england enduring sharpe brunt sea long thought last ship staying side rocke sea left iland vnhabited forsooke ship glad gained shore leauing sea side betooke himselfe trauaile little path right little brought faire greene meddow middest whereof placed marble stone height man inscription vppon take heede thou goe way read posey stone placed supposed cause passenger afraide knew minde greatly moued see end accident accompanied continually hauty courage went taking great pleasure behold high rock greene tree spread bough brauely ouer path went palmerin seeing aduenture would happen marble pillar giuing terrifying manner word went still without feare till last nighted laying downe grasse take rest made helmet pillow determined sleepe night motion mind thought take quiet rest farther intent one remembrance fayre polinarda presented selfe best worthy memory hee beene long absent yet durst enterprise come presence losse siluian whose counsell alway serued especial remedy amorous assault wanting company heauy case hee forced vtter diuers sundry complaint thus spent hee night courtly debate betweene reason earnest desire one perswade dangerous kinde trauaile exclude mind fond allarmes giuen fancy continually wrapped intricate endlesse vexation sences often see reason subiect amorous desire prince able resist aspiring drift eger passion resigned wit follow loue amitie begun lady mistresse hee wasted night small order rest cheerefull morning deliuered faire countenance went still musing wordes read vpon pillar esteemed flat mockage could perceiue nothing deserued forewarning trauailed faire plaine field still vsing minde former exercise hee came fountaine singular beautie pillar whereof fine wrought azure water issuing forth mouthes diuers beast artificially made prince standing good muse fountaine much water ascend vp high mountaine faire thing stand vacant place could readily thinke himselfe might iudge thereon lower end aforesaid pillar lay two cruell tygers two fierce lion hee supposed kept passenger drinke fountaine strange sight made somewhat abashed stand feare enchantment practised get present danger beastes behaued themselues order though might easily brought vnder subiectio chaine bignes requisite holde furious beastes yet tyed shortnesse litle scope walking palmerin knew needle aske leaue drinke fountaine reaso make answer albeit strong force offer resistance wherefore attempted try friendlinesse fortune put life hazard vpon aduenture aduancing himselfe taste water vpon one pillar letter gold engraued word behold fountaine wished water going little farther espied thus hath courage drinke fountaine shall bring ende enterprise belongeth aduancement honour fame shall accomplish much may compreheded strength prowesse man ouer written word passe drinke made prince little astonied one gaue encouragement approach fountaine stood way hinder determination yet concluded try aduenture iudged impossible meete occasion hautie enterprise chap lvii palmerin encouraged rare aduenture entred sight beast kept fountaine last albeit great danger vanquished approched drinke water also departed thence arriued castle whereon sawe foure shield placed vrged poesy hee sawe written try ende vnlooked accident hee entred combate foure knight came forth castle whereof slew three saued life fourth discouer ende strange aduenture many doubtes prince conceiued minde concerning might happen gorgeous spectacle poesy placed vncertaine manner verilie supposed trappe secret fetch allure venture owne destruction wherfore hee determined depart thence meddle beast saw faire shew gentlenesse onely haue approch fountaine walked little way thence began accuse blame either seare cause forget duty occasion withdraw mind honourable attempt returning couragiously backe againe aduanced himselfe one tiger corner fountaine like wise gaue himselfe manner prince catching hold vpon shield forceably handle brake detained wise prince could meanes get againe charged sound stroke ouer legges tiger could vse himselfe well would succour feeble estate tiger came three beastes behauing themselues furiously prince thought doubtfull aduenture al life time attempted hauing wounded one lion verie sore constrained fall earth prince stouped downe recouer shield tiger abandoned lion approched neere vnto catching hold vpon helmet drew within reach violently hee enforced fall vpon knee whan tiger crushed pawes cruelly armor stronger torne prince hundred peeces perceiued himselfe attainted extremitie life stood point danger sword saluted deepe heart tiger sprawled earth cleane bereft life breefe courage noble minde animate hardinesse albeit great paine trauaile hee made dispatch liues sate downe take little rest tiger pressed ground extreame violence thought verily bone bene broken red prettie went fountaine desirous quench thirst perceiued another little posey darkly couched could gather meaning wherefore presently drauke water finding pleasantnesse running riuer spring iudged fountaine aduenture placed cunning enchantresse disharten timerous glut eye valiant faire pleasant show saw hazard tried place went still path made fountaine last suddaine espyed goodly well fortified castle finely moated round draw bridge entrance tree shadowing delicate manner minde altogether delighted beholding rare seemely castle gate stood foure faire iasper pillar vpon ech hanged knightly sheeld palmerin taking perfect view beheld first vpon siluer ground posey man dare conceiue courage take downe quoth palmerin leaue bold trye taking downe sheeld feare matter aduenture worthily foyle since protestation hautie enforce humble selfe well serue neede want sheeld also prooue bragges contained word palmerin fastened sheeld arme espyed knight comming forth castle verie great maiestie beeing strongly armed seeing prince without helmet lyon hauing brused sort could weare proudlie began vtter speech presume take downe one shieldes armed according finish enterprise must taste punishment due fault committed hee may learne another time arme head standeth danger word staying heare answer palmerin began charge mightie stroke still aimed hit bare head palmerin preuented determination well closing fast vpon hee brought downe vpon knee making semblance though would haue slaine knight desired mercie yeelded himselfe prince courtesie palmerin sauing life demanded hee deale withall hee answered chiefest danger behind wherupon prince arming head helmet vanquished knight went second pillar whereupon shield campe azure read thus perillous therefore worthie feared consisteth greatest danger trust quoth prince may bee thou saist true yet shalt thou supprise minde cowardly feare leauing first shield took downe second presently came forth another knight spake prince manner trulie sir knight haue done vnwisely hazard selfe place especially take downe shielde requireth rther ransome heart blood sir answered palmerin see dutie knightly behauiour hath failed behold ready deliuer recompence sword leauing word setting themselues stoutlie one ende prince reached sure warrant creast sword pierced deepe head fell earth discharged life pausing little last went third piller wherein middest sheild vpon field sineple azure letter written word mee bee gotten honour aduenture taken downe expected comming third knight soone came forth great haste without vsing word entred dangerous combate twaine passed alemerin hauing cut one armes wounded sore many place body brought long enduring fight weaknesse hee fell downe yeelded vp ghost foot good fortune caused prince aduance himselfe fourth pillar viewing sheild beheld letter gold good encouragement remaineth happy victorie word made desirous end fortunate aduenture taking downe shield came fourth champion speech think fondnesse beene could content selfe sufficient conquest wherefore paiment may witnes iust desert prepare selfe receiue hardy blowes palmerin accustomed make answere place knightly strength ought shew selfe deliuered mind halfe score stroke wellaid notwithstanding force three yet serued selfe sauce ioy whereof kneeled downe hartily gaue thanks god prouidence permitted enter hauty exploit demanded knight stood al seene noble behauiour aduenture castle hazard request made answere credit worthy sir yet thing finished perswade selfe may accomplished worthinesse well perceiue spight thing contrary valor must enter place haue seene neuer thought find present behauiour constraineth confesse vertue gouerneth action shee see conquerour attempt vndertake chap lviii palmerin hauing vanquished three knight entred castle likewise slewe giant offered resistance passed ouer blacke riuer great danger met enchantresse eutropa aunt giant dramusiande threw selfe headlong riuer thinking haue pulled prince failed pretence likewise knight whose life saued reported death three knight emperours court assayed enter castle deliuered bazilliart germaine orleance kept prisoner dungeon certified castle called perillous isle palmerin vanquished foure knight sawe come offer resistance accompanied knight entred castell thing admirable beautie court pillar iasper stone ten cubit length whereon many goodly chamber faire lodging built court paued marble wrought colour red greene euery thing curious ingeniously framed castle prince supposed excellent thing euer seene hee wearied eye beholding sumptuous paralell hee walked thorow faire gallery brought hall singular beautie entrance whereof mighty giant presented himselfe prince holding hand knagged mace yron hee held vp sight resist passage palmerin perceiuing bold intet would seeme dismay remebring fortunately begun without determined ende valiantly within setling giant found play ende payde home made quiet enough speaking hauing thus worthily conquered enemy walked vp downe hall till last thorow little gate entred sumptuous gallerie wherein could finde way first hee must passe ouer abroade place water ouer layde little boord planke small breadth strength supposed able abide least wayght world faine would haue beene side vnhappy place hindered determination mooued many grieuous conceites began greatly blame aduerse fortune boord breake fall water blacke ougly riuer stix whereon acheron carryeth damned soules hell might compared fearefull lake well ouer would though cost life wherefore disarming himselfe heauinesse armor might chiefe occasion breake planke good courage beganne venture vpon hauing nothing defend withall swoord euer might happen attained almost middest olde rotten planke began somewhat cracke palmerin verily supposed remedy must fall hellish gulfe wherefore calling faire polinarda memory began manner desire fauour madame hitherto haue aduenture life martiall exploytes dangerous attempt sake crauing nothing handes ayde fauour ought instant greater reason wish seeing try greatest hazard onely aduance honour whose friendship may happy finde onely meane encourage distresse shall assay renowne behalfe shall faithfully serued selfe euer fully satisfied thus concluding speech little ioy gained side perceiued olde withered creature come forth doore presence face al wrinkled haire ougly blacke dispearsed abroad ouer shoulder staying awhile began manner estimation shall make selfe shall iudge cunning auaile warrant safetie place suffers vanquished one knight often stretching forth hand take hold palmerin verily thinking plucke cast selfe headlong filthy puddle ending life wickedly tretcherous villanous deed deserued prince seeing failed intent ouercome sadnesse wretched sight went diuers chamber get downe found many mayden feruants enquired knigt whose life saued combate found desired shew name castle also desperately drowned selfe worthy sir answered knight proofe noble valour cannot conceale thing may pleasure know wherfore marke shall shew vnto castle called name perillous ile whereof hold opinion sage vrganda first founder lady place hid selfe heath castle remained enchanted person could attaine inhabite order left faire pallace fountaine see little gate may easier beleeue longer agoe sithence time inhabited could giue assurance scituation ile dame drowned named eutropa aunt giant dramusiande vanquished prowes famous knight england coeceiued inward sorrow almost distraught selfe wit reuenge mishap sent speede soldan babylon prepare mightie army wherewith might ruinate citie constantinople whole empire greece diuelish desire could take effect soldane enough doe owne subiects raised themselues mutany open rebellion cause shee seeing drift could accomplish wish came vnto place accompanied three knight haue slaine selfe performed damnable art volantary affection selues isle round hath dispersed enchantment might allure wandring knight vnder power either slay presetly keepe continuall orizon satisfie insatiable bloody desire haue maintained safety long time alwayes fortunate many knight slew tooke captiue chanced long since euening fortune conducted hither fiue noble knight slaine three twaine conquered two fellowes yet last brought subiection fourth knight remaine prisoner castle pray sir said palmerin shew name three knight slaine also prison two may bestow vpon former libertie demand made answere first knight called medrusian fearefull second titubal blacke third foruolant strong sure sometime haue seene emperour palmerins court constantinople indeed quoth palmerin haue seene great ill wil wicked disposition alway bent molest trouble wished good euer honoured wherfore lesse esteeme losse rather reioyce world hath cut enuious practises time talke come place two prisoner lay without company reason smal abode eutropa made place wherein determined execute tyranous cruelty castle ten time feared dramusiande made abiding sage aliart drift practises w discouered willing stop mischiefes enchanttresse striue commit caused palmerin enter ship sent purpose thorow disapoint vile pretence downe went knight prince prison carying torch lighted hand deepe vnder ground man might shoote crossebow length moued palmerin greatly agast thinking paine two knight endured obscure vncomfortable prison made enter th se word certainly castle hardly beleeue erected vrganda report goeth neuer w ont vse cruelty wandring knight last came grate opened saw whereas two knight attending coming villainy supposed rather set liberty least part thought whe presently prince knew one bazilliart germaine orleance great yrons vpon leg yron chaines middle caused presently fall teares able suffer abide longer heauy case co manded knight take chaines iron bazilliart like well feared lead tormets wherefore began speake vnto thus sir knight might doe v pleasure let v rest captiuity lead v place punishmet sir bazilliart said palmerin imprisoned place would hardly consent deliuer soone minding put feare would hide himselfe longer helmet germaine orleance catching armes renued acquaintance order see well sir palmerin hereafter must abandon foolish feare prowesse wholly applyed redeeme captiuity fortune bedeth lowring browes dramusiande amply testifie saluted one another courteously came presently forth noysome prison conducted faire chamber refreshed hungry stomacks discoursed hapned sundry aduentures chap lviiii time palmerin remained castle called perrillous isle accompanied bazilliart germaine orleance sa ransfort knight keepeth castle francian stalde departure siluian tooke vpon trauaile prince search arriued castle palmerin departed ahence sayling sea attained coast spaine desirous see faire miragarda changed armor vnder title dispayring knight trauailed toward castle giant almarol long time knightes spent friendly discourse till drewe towards night knight castle named satransfort prouided two faire bed one prince palmerin another two companion night tooke quietnes since first comming castle morning concluded depart thence first desired see chamber commodity goodly castell found rare excellently ordered could chuse commend highly deserue walked thence fountaine yeelding lesse laud noble conquest palmerin dangerous attempt exployte worthily merite returning vnto castle earnest request satransfort staied space foure dayes comming foorth afternoone sit pleasant shadow vnder greene tree espied farre two knight come hastily ryding presently knowne shield francian onistalde endeuoring themselues seeke prince palmerin time siluian declared vnto losse lord good fortune came place palmerin entred shippe found passenger ready crosse sea intreatie sealed hauing fayre winde tyde length discouered perillous isle place made passenger greatly abashed ignorant soyle knew danger might receiue place yet request two knight somewhat pacified set land place palmerin entred first shore attained top hye rockes came pillar fearefull sentence vpon vsing litle regard affection bare vnto deare friend incited forward came haue told fight knowledge prince knight receyued curteously imbraced another token mutuall inuiolate friendship time abiding visited noble aduenture fountaine also dead body tituball medrusian foruolant came place eutropa drowned selfe way extolling worthy prowesse power atchieue ende singular exploytes occasion fell would needes depart palmerin left castle custody gentle knight satransfort intending make present noble sage aliart friendly departing thence came sea side inbarqued themselues among diuers passenger foure knightes themselues palmerin alone desire enired sea sight land sage aliart conducted ship prince made sayle contrary way knight knewe land althought determined goe constantinople see lady faire polinarda whose sake heart endured diuerse grieuous thought passion length fortune attained coast spaine pleased well would try valour presence faire miragarda intent might know beauty comparable famous actes court recinde king spaine came home last castle giant almarol miragarda soone arriued would needes know successe castle giant dramusiande albeit beene admonished thereof yet would neuer accept tristfull knight done england mind whatsoeuer done made account desirous see deedes might bee agreeable reputation hee deserued commanded keepe passage castle thinking many good knightes would endeu themselues thither aduenture much renowned castle dramusiande tristfull knight loath thing displease faire miragarda caused ther sheelde made image beauty report whereof allured many knight thither defence conquered two hundred tooke shield remembrance victory hanged vp either side faire portraite lady miragarda perceiuing shieldes prowesse florendos tristfull knight receiued
