great delight beheld euery one desirous make himselfe like shield plaine sinople curiously figured image deadly hope singular well ordered liuelinesse face lineament also seemels shadowing attire euery one iudged naturall proportion name likewise presented vnder deuice named euery one despairing knight manner ridde toward castle almarol desirous trie force aduenture esteemed great fame fearing perill fortune vnkindly turne selfe perswaded himselfe vnpossible attaine top honour man doe hazard person place victorie worthily presented minde beareth affection leaue perpetuall renowne posteritie chap lx palmerin vnder title disparing knight came castle giant almarol hee saw shield diuers famous knight friend hanged among number vanquished whereupon entred combat tristfull knight whose strength neither could win victorie miragarda tooke anger thereat shee commanded tristfull knight absent himselfe thence weare armour space twelue moneths certaine aduentures bee mentioned finished prince palmerin time hee trauelled towardes castle giant almarol hee arriued hee greatly abashed see placed hie rocke sore trouble come vnto desparing knight come somewhat neere espied two knight entred combat desirous see hee set spurres horse bee mad end could come thither tristfull knight vanquished aduersarie placed sheild among meanes palmerin certaine knowledge conquered knight called carmelant writing vnder sheild made manifest palmerin beholding manie shield tree esteemed valour tristfull knight great reputation last hee perceiued shelds frisoll estrellant tenebrant friendes great renowne whereat amazed knew say saw picture miragarda represented beauty sens rauished could proceed farther till vsed speech certainly madam see present thing neuer thought doe cannot thinke amisse knight may wel hazard life hare goddesse yet desire approue selfe bearing opinion beautie best fauored beloued neither may equalled whose sake aduenture combat tristfull knight hearing word could withhold himselfe returned prince answere chastisement correction sir knight giuen according proud wordes haue deserued bee repaied extreame crueltie wherefore fearing least fauouring shall deserue rash report selfe try valo may maintaine dishonour haue vngently offered hereupon fetched carire met together great force enforced abandon horse drawing foorth sword deliuered one another rigorous blowes one would haue iudged neither able endure giant almarol abashed noble combate called faire miragarda come see hauing spread faire cloath gold along windowe rich cushion whereon leaned damoselles standing behold knightly chiualry shee presented selfe windowe two champion retired themselues take little pause meanes tristfull knight gained commoditie contemplate faire miragarda tearmes man albeit state oppressed neuer much debilitie would assure himselfe remaine victor maintaining qua rell excellent rare iewell like manner palmerin complained faire polinarda breake cogitation began couragiously againe tristfull knight beholding lady great griefe could vanquish knight hauing fayled many forceable assaultes gaue one another armour cut cruelly mangled blood effused ground fought shieldes broken hundreth piece faine take breath againe vnable endure penitrable grieuous trauaile palmerin standing leaning vpon swoord beholding armour reduced estate aud remembring cause entrance combate sad conceyt beganne say madame either sufficient doe seruice else esteeme litle mine affection vnworthy seruant none grant honor fight hauing onely power maister desire assist friendly fauour since haue made hazard life aduance fame loyaltie suffer knight remaine victor seeing mine eye lady neither may presume aboue tristfull knight walked vp downe debating himselfe ende combat began somewhat feare life time dealt hardy valiant knight wherefore lifting vp eye place mirgarda stood began discouer minde thus sometime deere mistresse sister named polinarda whose beautie others selfe esteemed rare perfect earth beh lde inequall state surpassing beauty perceiued iudgement grosse much neither may ought paragon selfe heauenly perfection wherfore sweete mistresse doe honour fauor may support mine enemy suffer haue beene vanquished beautie brought subiection feeling themselues somewhat refreshed charged one another againe valiantly continued frustrate expectation long ye caught one another middest endeuouring way gette maistrie laboured vaine strengthes equalitie one could hardly iudge greater aduantage miragarda commended combat best euer seene desired victory might returne tristfull knight wish expectation deceiued night approching fast vpon commoditie trie conquest came foorth giant almarol intreatie parted themselues indeede could hardly see one another palmerin returned halfe mile place remained till woundes healed determing gained little strength come againe castle would knightly behaue himselfe would beare shielde miragarda thence honour prize constantinople almarol conducted tristfull knight chamber field alwaies vsed lodge miragarda greatly offended power vanquish prince standing vpon triall betweene beauty lady valiant palmerin sent messenger florendos tidings straightway absent himselfe place weare armour space twelue monethes fortunate vanquish enemy iust cause greeting displeasant tristfull knight became resolute make life sorrow agreeable pensiue name verily supposing fortune determined vtter detriment chap lxi tristfull knight commandement ladie miragarda departed castle almarol accompanied esquire armello brought backe master sheeld armor left tree among conquered knight florendos met shepheard trauell ioyned amitie vowed neuer leaue one another prince palmerin returning ende combat certified armello cause master departure wherefore likewise presently departed thence tristfull knight receiued sharpe message miragarda loth thing disobay minde hee called esquire armello bare great loue affection going little thicket tree brinish teares trilling downe cheekes began esquire heauie discourse armello friend soo guerdon frowning fortune recompence trauailes hath ordained patiently suffer god thy selfe sollitary wood remaine witnesse neither moued mishap storme great discurtesie say philosopher patience noble conquest yet alway opinion trusty trauaile deserued better reward onely respecting faith worthily merit moitie friendship thy ioy thy mirth thy happinesse thy comfort world changed hard lot misfortune onely thou patient preuaile vsing thy continual epithite quid non facit amor yet haue one hope chiefest remedie extreame affliction death speedily finish heauie complaint cut misery wherwith cruelly assaulted wherfore good friend armello thou wilt manifest thy wonted curtesie pleasure mine extreame neede take horse armor depart constantinople giue forth certaine truth death hath claimed due hand haue ended life vnfortunate aduenture wherein know thou shalt amisse griefe doth assure shall ende right soone onely let request thine hand thou conceale late mishap thy selfe let neither friend foe vnderstand say euery one thou art witnes death armello hearing word master strooke heart grieuous extreame passion teares eye began manner trust lord know place content thing like desire oppression beare companie forsake god knowes danger might happen also sorrow conceiue selfe neither doe thinke expedient blaze abroad death number mishappes might arise thereby entring seuerely mind friend much seeme displeasant parent alliance wherefore beare furie miragarda thinke rash dealing ere long moue vnto repentance time shee hath considered faithfull seruice aspyring minde hath beene honourably maintained shee recall vngentle wordes recompence haue deserued worthily therefore expect good sir frame well enough warrant know answered florendos perfection thy trustie zeale carefully bent welfare despaire present haue small occasion thinke know fault shall fauoured ingratitude seuerely bent torment world adioined might deserue comparison great displeasure yet knighit world would haue vanquished seeing defended onely phaenix beautie would haue made hazard last extremitie encouraged combate excellent meane crueltie dwel poorelesse person angry minde harbour vnder faire face well fo san h c lim meminisse iu abit tel esteeme selfe hauing conquerour ouer many could bring obeysance one knight certainely perswade selfe haue vsed lesse prowesse aduenture wherein thou hast seene mee wherfore haue good occasion take heauily lament honour haue lost exiled gracious presence therefore good armello receiue horse armour suffer walke alone heauinesse cause mine owne hurt ended speech forsooke armello wandring along riuer side till last sate downe vnder tree desir u receiue little rest vexation minde would hardly suffer hee awaked hee perceiued great heard sheepe feediug pasture ground vnder tree neere hee saw shepheard playing instrument whereto recorded many sweet ditty florendos tooke great pleasure sit heare perswading himselfe shepheard base condition seemed deuises excellent wel ordered commendation loue also great iniuries receiued thereby tristfull knight well noting complaint fortune conducted place might enioy partner liue heauinesse came vsed friendly meanes short time grew good liking florendos beeing glad hee met friend solitarie life shepheard vttered secret mind tristfull knight bewraied sum griefe vowed amitie remaine betweene misfortune haue power sunder friendship armello hauing stood musing good master gone sight determined trauell without company came backe againe castle almarol foote tree directly vnder shield faire miragarda placed master shield armour among vanquished knight presenc mirag rda hee vttered many rufull grieuous complaintes would haue mooued gentle heart compassion shee entered great disdaine esteemed worthie account triumphed paine tristfull knight time wee leaue shepheards company prince palmerin hauing wound wel cured prouided new armour cruelly defaced returned castle giant almarol intending depart thence conquered tristfull knight arriued castle heard lamentation armello vsed whereby vnderstood tristfull knight renowned prince florendos moued great displeasure entred combat supposed hatred miragarda might worke occasion greater mischance losse valliant prince florendos might cause great griefe emperour palmerin also lord lady royall court thought vrged prince great vnquietnes could determine whether might abide place pursue prince florendos cause abandon tristful kinde life remedie eny misfortune might annoy meanes princesse miragarda supposed fayrest lady euer seene thus musing vpon thousand matter also beauty miragarda compare heauenly hew lady mistresse last remembring effect duty hee set spur htrse galloped thence respecting way went desirous attaine citie consantinople chap lxii giant dramusiande accompanied siluian arriued castle giant almarol amorous picture miragarda hee entred combate almarol foyled miragarda gaue custodie portrait also keeping passage knightes came thither must remember giant dramusiande trauailed many strange country accompanied siluian finde againe prince palmerin arriued castle giant almarol within prince departed thence beheld castle hee desired long see could perceiue neither body neere came tree saw laden shield vanquished knight whose name subscribed vnderneath euery one made haue knowledge diuers bene foyled last soote tree espyed armour sheeld tristfull knight made greatly muse armour conquerour deserue better estimation placed among number vanquished neere armour beheld armello hauing endured teares pittifull complaint long time length chanced fall fast asleepe dramusiande desirous heare tidings vsed meanes awaked vnderstood aduentures fortresse also departure tristfull knight began greatly rebuke himselfe fortune failed encounter good knight whose shield would haue placed highest tree armello desired contrary dramusiande taking good viewe picture miragarda brought suddaine alteration stout hauty stomacke could way resist cutting care ouercharged mind yea brought great quandary could hold launce trembling leafe stirred wind eue stood cleane bereft sences whereupon began vtter speech madame beholding portrait beauty wherwith nature hath plentifully adorned wish desire keep passage might faithfull seruice make renowned thorow whole world since countenance hath courage conquere heart mine yet neuer done desire vnder noble conquest may endeuor strength exalt princely beauty dare presume speake shall receiue punishment due great offence continued amorous thought giant almarol came brauely forth castell miragarda sent offended see giant dramusiande wherefore aduancing himselfe presence almarol deliuered greeting sir knight thinke might auaile set sheild rancke vanquished thus busie selfe beholding portrait thing would rather perswade gentlenesse shew constraint may happen force word dramusiande replied thus perswaded mistresse picture wold pleased small matter rather accomplish thy desire doe thing might return contrarie trauaile little losse lesse heart libertie remaineth captiue would gladly receuer againe entend enter combat thee intent thou maist report thy word could foile mee yet thy workes puissance daunt mee almarol naturally accustomed cruelty courtesie gentle dramusiande receiued speech angrie manner ready prouided encountred speares valiantlie together throwne beside horse charged one another fiercely swordes miragarda standing window behold exploite gaue great commendation behauiour dramusiande feared would ouercome giant almarol sore hurt well wearied themselues retired take little pause dramusiande beholding faire miragarda suddenly stroken amaze remembrance combat cleane minde almarol seeing estate brought beholding face miragarda awaked study sure stroke creast sword cleft wounded sore vpon head dramusiande taking il part returned almarol great fury inforced start way way glad auoide blowes wherewith charged last almarol fell earth dramusiande setting foote vpon vnclasped helmet would haue smitten head miragarda presently sent downe one damosel named lardemia staied dramusiande word noble knight princesse miragarda doth sent intreaty would satisfie selfe honor victorie depriue giant life whose losse might griefe indeuours way recompence madame answered dramusiande onely grant life request gracious princesse vow selfe keepe famous shield bee except loyall seruice fortune conduct knight hether conquere desire setting pittie aside suffer enioy death shall trauailes trouble possesse long wished ende lardemia hauing lead almarol castle window returneth answere sir knight lady mistresse sendeth thousand thankes recompence courtesie committeth safegard shield hand wishing good fortune may alway gouerne enterprise dramusiande word greatly cotented desired aboue thing pleasure faire miragarda whose beauty depriued wonted libertie forcing loue grow somewhat amorous cause remained keeping faire portraite accomplishing hautie deedes chiualrie altogether supposed incredible honour got long time tarriance fortune hauing fauoured last anger forsooke euen accustomed falsifie promise perceiueth haue entrance prosperitie chap lxiii dramusiande keeping shield passage giant almarol entred iust prince gracian rosuel victory ended strife friendly acquaintance next morning dramusiande accomplish promise faire miragarda came foorth sate downe tree portraite knightly shield placed vsing grieuous complaint siluian marueiled see mighty man brought subiection force loue faithfull trusty esquire armello keeping company frequenting still grieuous mones thought none worthy keepe precious treasure shield faire miragarda onely lord maister best deserue wherfore able conceale passion heart conceiued began manner giant dramusiande knowe well sir knight fortune hath greatly fauoured master absent keepe iewell ioy durst hee shewe himselfe place constrained forsake command miragarda well perceiue faire portrait kept none whereto dramusiande replied thus friend faith affection thou bearest thy maister seemeth worthy great commendation deed remaine true confirmation witnesse woryes yet must vse euill suspect altogether vnknowne would also enter combate wich maister present place chauce vanquished would content selfe placed among conquered whose assurance haue beene likely mine peraduenture might profite left shield vnder obeysance whose onely seeke satisfie ending life hautie enterprise againe might fortune chance see combate wish maister would conceiue another opinion th n yet doe iudge either better worse perceiue present make account wherefore perswade selfe well worthy able keepe defend shield faire miragarda knight maister vnknown albeit confesse worthy hath deerly deserued onely sure notable coquests also proofe knightly curtesie way equal selfe might well thought trueth remained shall stay certaine space doubt shall see hauty attempt ended time haue beene maister finished continued speech hee espied farre two knight come riding along riuer side one armour coloured blacke white diuers border gold finely wrought vpon bearing shield deuice murthered body campe sinople armour greene colour thicke beset lyon gold shield two lion rampant twaine sooner arriued castle dramusiande incontiuently knew one rosuel prince gracian sometime beene prisoner whose amitie hee alwayes made great account albeit friendship acceptable yet promise made miragarda commanded contrary confidering also loue gotten maisterie directing minde enterprise made neither spare friend foe vsed alike trauailed thither mounting steed came forth perceiuing prouided himselfe iuste well pleased desired approue strength behalfe faire miragarda casting eye beautifull picture beheld middest shieldes florendos conquered supprised suddaine amazement quite forgotten cause came thither dramusiande seeing addressed himselfe manner salutation sir knight portraite lady placed contemplated great ease hee desireth enioy iewell must first combate denyeth priuiledge till vanquished fortune respect doe fauour yet shall feele double torment remayning victor trust answered prince gracian man life may ataine honour singular personage behold hath courage aduenture first concluding speech met dramusiande valiantly breake speare force hee throwne earth strong violence great voyde feeling mooued rosuel displeasure reuenge friend hee pricked foorth dramusiande ready prouided another speare sent beare prince gracian company rude encounter made maruaile supposed enemy renowned palmerin england whereof desirous resolued gracian hardiest swoord drawne hand entred tearmes sir knight althogh fortune hath beene friend foyle v iuste yet pray discende foote ende may finish combat swoord would trie valour vttermost may depart hence benefite life dramusiande euer accustomed great bounty gentlenesse seeing desire prince gracian gotten honour victory would respect satis ie mind made answere maner sir gracian make small estimation life would man sh uld bring danger beseeching take part haue already boldly ventured selfe bound duty doe thing may honourable welfare gracian hearing himselfe named knight knowledge greatly abashed replyed thus worthy sir since fortune hath beene good obtaine friendship hardy knight esteeme selfe happiest vnder sun desiring haue knowledge shall finde expedient wordes dramusiande tooke helmet presently ranne imbraced conceiuing vnspeakeable ioy company mischance put cleane memorie iudged shame foyled handes dramusiande requested cause remained place satisfie desire recited whole occasion iourney made promise miragarda conquered giant almarol keepe shield place vntill knight prowesse could bring vnder obeysan certainly said rosuel perceiue intended keepe life time knowe nothing death ouercome trust quoth prince gracian haue time past extolled verily belieued faire claritia might equall beautie hauing beh ld admirable miragarda exempt minde desiring accomplish meane might doe seruice credite said rosuel haue forgotten loue bare lady depart sooner hence shall fall contempt lady giuing onely laud peerelesse miragarda mounting horsebacke ridde away fast possible could like maner prince gracian possed presently neither vsing friendly departing giant dramusiande could refrain laughter think weake stomacks two prince chap lxiiii palmerin england trauailing toward constantinople laid downe sleepe hard faire castle whence came foure lady carried castle one lady bearing louing affection disdaining great good vrged keepe prisoner palmerin england left castle giant almarol happened frontier nauarre dominion france perceiued altogether inhabited gouerned mighty giant whose vnciuility life wrought many cruel spoiles villanous deed part among palmerin behaued himselfe worthily effect deed returned due commendation co tinuing trauaile along coast last faire green valley espied goodly well fortified castle neere vnto faire largs poole well stored choice fish prince alighted horse let feede pasture meane time looking could see body suddaine might come endanger sat downe water side beholding wherof droue many solemne fancy remembrance take little nap mistres polinarda approached thoughtes also remembrance manifold courtesy receiued remained constantinople motion prouoked good opinion ioy number heauie lamentation especially sharp command mistres loath breake mad absent himselfe constantinople longer otherwise hee would gladly haue done thought hee fell sound sleepe foure damosel came walking foorth castell beholding prince cheekes dewed teares eye lid redde ouermuch weeping constrained great compassion one damosel rare excellent beautie called certaine seruants helpe caried prince faire chamber castel causing armes fastened together chaine ende might vse resistance awaked found himselfe great alteration ouercome griefe knew say ladie bearing great affection euery instant changed colour witnessed ardent loue shee conceiued minde last made manifest sum desire whereto palmerin meanes would giue consent desirous shunne occasion whereby hee might bee thought disloyal lady determined depart thence without horse armour onely auoide importunate sute moued lady extreame griefe violated bondes reason whose limit duty alwaies warned keep within seeing neither tear intreatis might mollifie heart commanded brought chamber iron made fast leg great speech giuen forth terrifie would vse pittie outragious passion palmerin esteeming either selfe word bare greater affection clogging iron amorous speech lady could vse last turned hee hot loue extreame hatred absenting selfe companie caused bee vsed rigorous manner crueltie long time lasting woonted affectio caused repent hasty fury mind thought discharge prince seeking meanes possible banish memorie cause inclosed selfe chamber labouring example present proofe extinguish furious flame continuall passion saw nothing would serue griefe driuen impossible cure concluded keepe prince prison long length shee would glut selfe remembrance else last prine would wearie able longer endure cruell practises vsed would repent long deniall bee enforced accomplish amorous dessre palmerin hauing already made faithful vowe loue torment cruelty would perswaded violate promise small griefe lady frequented himselfe still woonted sute also obstinacy encreased seuerall deuises cruelty chap lxv florian remaining court england made entreatie behalfe orianda sister daughter marquesse beltamor remaining castle giant calfurnien restored king fauour married three noble gentleman court florian whome mention hath beene made since prince palmerin departed england stayed certaine time court king vncle intreate fauour orianda sister daughter marquesse beltamor remembring great seruice done time giant calfurnien wounded sore willing discharge promise made departure might manifest honour redeeme misery wherin remained approached presence king manner haue alwayes heard soueraigne lord vncle laudable deedes ought recompenced like ingratitude vnkinde dealing euer banished heartes prince wherefore fearing least selfe found faulty hainous crime shall desire gratious furtherance cause shall present duty owne honour good lord time imbarqued selfe greece tempest ouerreacht violent meane ship attained coast ireland would needes goe land albeit master ship perswaded contrary land fortune met giant calfurnien whose strength although redoubted indeede yet good hap gaue honour death bloody fight receiued many grieuous dangerous woundes could way haue escaped death selfe three lady daughter marquesse beltamor whome cruell giant kept perforce vsed honourable goodly prouision small labour trauaile recouered sound perfect estate assuring lord onely maste high estimation friendly courtesie hope expect wonted noble forgiuenesse behalfe king perceiuing desire florian great friendship receiued lady returned presently auswere indeede confesse marquesse father intended accomplished profite damosel recompence friendly fauour haue receiued hand honour eldest married rosiran cousin great friend argolant shal refuse marry second third restore marquisate father ioyne marriage beltamor brother forenamed rosiran florian kissing highnesse hand token vnspeakable pleasure hee receiued king wordes meanes edward noble father sent poast al speede bring lady court wel see king accomplished effect make proofe good habare lady lady come end euery thing due decent order finished florian tooke leaue king vncle also edward princesse flerida would try aduentures castle miragarda pompides made florian somewhat abashed ignorant gentle dramusiande wherefore desirous hazard himselfe combate prepared speare encounter dramusiande seeing knowing florian desart son deare louing friend edward would haue entred fight case satisfie lady miragarda met strongly dismounted earth vp againe rose fell violently swordes much dramusiande would beast bargaine florian bragge choise made combate dangerous iudged likest victory miragarda leaning window extolled maruelously hautie valure excepting combate tristfull knight palmerin gaue onely commendation singular fight continued outrage betweene constrained retire take little breathing dramusiande feeling prowesse aduersary supposed florian desart therefore concluded many time discouer himselfe without bringing combat ende fearing least reported gaue ouer want courage maintain quarrell changed opinion hee desirous finish intent faire miragarda secretly began manner deere mistresse know merite trauailes shall bee burie commendation pi te obliuion little regard yet great insupportable griefe vnkindly requited neuerthelesse great conquest haue gained whole endeuours lincked fulfil good liking way contrary haue ordained remaine affectioned doe honour al action merite fauour regard knight maintaine cause fore deliuerer attempt witnesse neede stand friendly furtherance beseech denie presence faith loyaltie owne lest enemie winning victorie cast teeth hath brought vnder beholding beautie florian desirous finish enterprise came charged dramusiande second time almarol debating miragarda lardemia esteemed maruellously valour giant keeping shield also knight offered resistance siluian standing doubt dramusiande would slaine would great griefe lord master came esquire florian hee presently knew made ioyfull beleeuing verily saue liues wherefore came florian wordes desire sir passe doubtfull fight labour dramusiande trustie loyall friend siluian sooner spoken wordes presentlie threw downe sword embracing one another gentle salutation though greatest f iends world florian greatly amazed see siluian without master wherefore hee demaunded thing hapned vnderstood losse brother hee remained griefe beyond perswasion determined goe straight constantinople failed would seeke world ouer would find againe taking leaue dramusiande accompanied siluian departed thence desiring see faire miragarda least brought like opinion gentle giant dramusiande farre thence hee met pompides lamenting heauily hee vanquished presenting himselfe beare prince company imbraced courteously ridde shipping next hauen fortune fauouring honourable intent dayes brought castle wherein noble palmerin england remained prisoner staying rest themselues beheld damosell mounted white palfray accompanied two esquire come foorth castle knight presently tooke way friendly greeting requested goodly castle belonged demand might hindrance hasty affaire whereto damosell made answere albeit gentleman busines wherin must presently imploy selfe matter waight great importance yet gentle demaunds speech outward behauiour hath commanded stay til haue satisfied desire castle first founded commandement noble couragious prince bazelie sometime king nauer ed deceased princesse arnalte faire daughter come unhabite ancient famous mansion vnwilling gouerne people reason yong yeeres also vnmarried committed finished castle giant almarol maintenance beauty faire miragarda whose stately magnificence highly comended cause supposeth shee beloued knight remaineth castle heareth great loue affection beliefe hath comanded goe see princesse miragarda whereby may certified beauty highly extolled may surmount wherewith nature hath plentifully adorned selfe fall princesse miragarda carry credit minded deliuer knight shall remaine longer prisoner lady prooue superiour canonized spectacle know put knight death considering iniury hath offred hath much abased selfe beare vngrateful person affection gather knowledge acquaiatance florian well pondering damoselles wordes somewhat pleasantly disposed withall demanded beauty mistresse might compare indifferent condition shee owne mrust sir quoth finde thing deserued beare title beautie shall chance haue sight lady say haue made simple comparison fayre damosell saide florian would followe counsell make stay hasty iourney credite miragarda much beautiful lady quoth pompides let word seeme stay mistresse commaund proceede enterprise shall see neither v worthy vse talke shal saue life knight loueth certifie lady certaine report hath pleased knight say wordes iesting neuer sawe faire miragarda seemes sir knight answered damosell haue beene affectioned faire view princesse readily stand witnesse behalf beautie desire therefore returne princesse lady large informe concerning beauty faire miragarda princesse arnalte glad newes caused fayre chamber prouided two knight disarmed themselues taking little ease wearie trauaile shee came courteously welcommed castell shewing commodity might vrge pleasure walking forth pondes side sitting downe vnder cipresse tree pleasant shadow began manner gentleman albeit ignorant accept wordes manner shall please shape mee answere yet timerous without ill suspect may craue leaue cut doubt hath long time concealed time king father gouerned countrey finished course terrestriall time betooke selfe liue solitarie habitation till gouernors kingdome chosen pheere might respect satisfie late deceased lord father fortune enemy al mine action permitted vnknown knight happen castell made choise onelie man loued neuer liked according affection concluded lord mee princely possession hee neither regarding bountie beauty applieth himselfe disdainful gentle desire rather taketh pleasure iron wherewith haue charged princely offer whereto haue chasen although great despising insupportable torment yet haue dissembled disquietnes supposing affection hath ouercharged wittes could perceiue honour wherewith presented yet opinion vsed fondly selfe lady beauty sufficient win princesse miragarda onely excepted whose report filleth euery climate extolling benefit yet doubt commanded one damosel take iourney thither see beautie might stand equall onely perfect without compariso determined set knight libertie found deserue high title shee would reward punishment according disdainfull nature worthily deserue horian well noting proud minde arnalte determined cause abide vaine opinion thus truly madam would vse torment knight let persist obstinate p ruerse minde ende punishment owne follie himselfe pelmerin memory though neuer seene life wherefore euery part replenished vnspeakeable ioy tooke knight hand returned castell comming table ready couered sat downe florian desired see knight whose castle wel downe sat feasted honour great reuerence supper ended palmerin pompides l dged one chamber together faire chaber prouided prince florian gaue friendlie entertainement staied space eight day florian knight would needes depart ieauing princesse pensiue sorrowfull depart company desired faine made promise soone could would returne hereon departed merrily away princesse arnalte greatly r de siluian aside hee expressed great perpleritie wherein remained loue hee bare faire lady mistresse polinarda feared approach comandement gaue time departed constantinople whereto siluian vsed kind reioycing finde company solitarie place betooke themselues presently toward tentes suddaine came foorth one tent knight attyred faire armour thicke beset golden glass hauing put helmet mounted steede declined much hath seene perfect appearance knightly worthy behauiour desireth fauour request much would breake fewe lance certaine knight fulfilling whereof cause reward honourable thankes trust said palmerin desire fulfill occasion may found pleasant princesse florenda seeing pleasure see v iuste certifie remaine gratious comand sooner esquire deliuered answere princesse florendos knight came foorth tentes florian hauing obtained leaue first iuste encountred first knight hautie courage sent measure length earth manner serued fiue without breaking lance sixt sheuered piece wherefore pompides deliuered launce glad see speede luckily princesse somewhat mooued see knight foyled fast one exhorted make better proofe chiualrie meane damosell came crossing valley blacke palfray yeelding selfe foote renowned palmerin began vtter speech desire sir knight honour haue receiued knightly deedes armes instant conceiue courage followe shall receiue greatest praise giuing ayde life time neuer gained like palmerin bare armes succor weake estate distressed desired pompides keepe brother florian company fayling ayde finishing noble enterprise would long returned againe giuing conge lady rede away hast damosell one lady belonged princesse florenda seeing palmerin depart suddaine came pompides wordes truely sir seemeth deserue beare armour afraide much bruised suffer companion depart alone knowing mishap damosell hard fortune may hap attach knight lady answered pompides gentlewoman gouernmet good knight dare awarrant shall haue little cause feare shall net account cowardise presently direct course rather behold hardy pr wesse thinke stand neede helpe wherevpon tooke leaue lady endeuoured himselfe way prince gone far outreacht pompides could ouertake good florian hauing dismounted eight kuights could deale laace broken one lady came presented another desiring breake one lance sake florian thanked lady courteously promising employ lance present come hand would aduenture life seruice witnesse prepared ninth knight hauing good opinion himselfe began order speake prince haue great desire sir knight try valour estimation hope shall manifest haue yet seene thus concluding affectionate loyal friend bare shield tyger bearing white lyon piece knowing prince florian reuenge dishonour companion receiued encountred prince courage third attempt enforced keepe friendes company pardon offered humilitie kisse hand would suffer germaine orleance knowledge presently came imbrac c urteous manner turning princesse florenda vttered speech wise faire mistres account dishonour passe thorow kingdome father may seruice hart desireth lady whose word procured pompides depart palmerin came prince florian speech sir would faine haue knowledge knight hath betaken himselfe trauaile lord brother desiring certifie sorow conceiue word gaue faire lady answered florian knight sure bee ready time employ himselfe seruice named pompides brother euer approoued good friend humbly pray said lady would excuse greatest offence haue vngently offred florian promised would accomplish taking leaue princesse florenda noble company posted apace way prince palmerin tooke standing great feare lest mischance happen vnto chap lxviii damosell hauing brought palmerin faire florenda conducted castle duke ronsillion enterprised combat redeeme three lady duke kept prisoner put death great hast made lady conducted palmerin way vsing word till came litle village dukedom ronsillion desired prince stay would go village shee would stay returne presently meane palmerin tooke helmet sat downe rest somewhat weary trauaile damosell returning beholding young beautifull despaired herselfe able fulfill earnest desire cause presently fell teares palmerin knowing cause sorrow desired would expresse whereupon began answere thus alasse sir knight cause haue lament order onely infortunate woman world haue trauelled whole kingdome france thinking find valiant renowned knight perceiue greatly deceiued thought intreat princesse florenda giue one strong hardy knight finding company vnhorsed lord great valiancie good opinion intreated follow rehearsing perillous danger bring place put deedes proofe finde young small force voyde hope haue good successe faire lady answered palmerin shall faile doe much power permitte perhappes cause haue better opinion see yet willing vse therefore desire tell intent haue caused trauaile doubt aduenture life doe seruice thing soeuer sir quoth happy effect deedes would agree wordes village remaineth three lady prisoner daughter one noble lordes countrey father would giue mariage duke ronsilion two brother found meanes murther three lady kept castle haue graunted commodity finde knight preuaile combat shall restored former libertie prefixed appointed day combat must first tried bramerin chiefe gentleman belonging duke one renowned knight countrey chance vanquished must hazard self cliaster alfarin two kinsman yet conquere returne victorie must deale duke two brother knowen stoute noble knightes one conceiue courage deale yet must lady day finde knight auenge quarrell else duke hath sworne shall loose heades put lady hope went told brought knight would vndertake deale cause duke sooner hearing hee began greatly offended surely saide palmerin must needes venture selfe take vpon vse cruelty faire lady alwaies disallow king prince suffer iniury vsed lady within dominion token deed shall agree word goe presently abiding duke inuay much owne wicked shall worke ouerthrow damosell perceiuing noble minde palmerin little doubt deale enemy vsed better affectition whereupon broght castle duke made abode see ende noble enterprise chap lxix palmerin come castle entred fight behalfe three lady wherein hee vanquished bramerin slew cliastar alfarin fought duke two brother hee preuailed restored lady prince gentlewoman come castle assembled great multitude people see combate drawebride let downe duke commaundement palmerin prepared enter castle bramarin prouided seeing enemy face came vnto wordes abide sir knight approach farther must deale belieue haue made ill bargaine see ware bragge peny worthes trust sir answered palmerin euer happen must hold content opinion right belongeth returne best aduantage therefore fully determined fight feare shall lacke daylight finish mine enterprise syr sayde knight shall neede complaine lacke time warrant wee shall ende right soone least wise chance faile shall deale fellowes castle loth prolong time giuing scope horse met speares nobly together bramerin throwne ground void feeling palmerin perceiuing alighted horse set sword throate word yeeld varlet sweare henceforth neuer iniury oppressed lady sword thou shalt die death bramerin seeing life stand ieopardy deferred fulfill desire palmerin mounting horseback entred castle court espied chaster alfarin faire greene armour thicke beset azure flower beheld palmeria ran fiercely sword hee saluted one soundlie head made sure enough harme fellow perceiuing came behaued himselfe great courage prince ende palmerin brought vnder obeysance demaunding would yeeld made answer thought would come reskew palmerin seeing obstinate failed send head shoulder al happy escape without hurt whereupon came gentlewoman asked thing el wherin would haue imploy seruice certainly sir quoth see danger withdraw coruage must hazard selfe duke brother vse combat aboue castell pray god send fortunate successe hitherto haue iii knight hope wherof leaue company partner al combat shall try deliuer three distressed lady gentlewoman thus concluded talk shewed staires ought ascend might find duke brother palmerin commanding siluian stay comming without tooke sword went vp till last came faire hall beheld three lady sitting attyred blacke endued singular beauty greatly lamented vngentle oppression long stood beholding perceiued three knightes well armed come lady one began manner faire lady procure great misfortune selues also labour worke ruine destruction cause three knight haue cruelly abused whose deathes entend reuenge sharpely liues shall satisfie part losse wherat champion shall little pleased fully satisfied duke spake word came lady accompanied brother bearing one manner deuise shield cupid chased away leauing bow arrowes bloody broken peeces duke aduanced himselfe palmerin wise sir knight suffise selfe slaughter knight yeelde selfe friendly hand surely would bee great griefe bee death good knight whereto palmerin shaped answer sir thing abuse albeit place suppose may command come ende rather constraine vse recompence lady haue highly offended fauour seeke hand duke brother strooke freely palmerin side charged couragiously lady weeping destred god force prince shew fauour louing regard vnto well perceiued dangerous fight especially side contend three yet end valor high good fortune one one ouercame duke seeing brother vanquished himselfe left alone abide hazard tooke occasion pause word pray sir knight thinke good tell name whence may know shall vanquish least shall remaine victor ouer mee sir said palmerin knowledge needelesse stand satisfie desire first let v make end combat perhaps let vnderstand belike quoth duke make account victory admit leisure parley well since bent yet conceiue weaknesse selfe make sute fauour began againe great effusion blood witnessing perillous
