accustomed great pittie seeing affectionate towardes lady tooke ground armes promising vse matter sort would make highly esteemed duke receiued prince offer vpon condition scorned mercifull vnto presently bereaue life vnpossible suffer furious sharpe assault hee daile proued sake chap lxx palmerin hauing conquered duke brother procured meanes three lady caused married together florian pompides arriuing palmerin departed towards constantinople great broyle fully finished thinges ordained decent order suddaine entred hall twentie souldiers two knightes well armed spake aloude necessary slaine killed famous noble knight world wherewith came palmerin defended himselfe sword intending butcher first lay hand duke seeing great tumult risen without knowledge put himselfe betweene desiring farther pause matter might taken vp quietly duke canducted chamber palmerin went chamber lady woundes diligently dressed organel duke chirurgion carefull euer hee duke lord time palmerin staied lady reported great estimation duke brother made also cause sharpe dealing onely denied loue diuers report lady esteemed laudable honest granted themselues onely bee ruled gouerned aduise p lmerin stood much friend therefore promised graunt thinke well seeing determined nothing might stand owne honesty maintenance honour palmerin ioyfull see lady conformable appointment made account conquest honour receiued combate wherefore walked duke chamber hee imbraced declared good agreement conuersio lady whereat duke receiued content great remained sound come himselfe againe began manner vtter spee sir knight hand haue receiued damage must need confesse recompence double bee deed agree word blame sir somewhat hard beleefe haue brought onely comfort life worthy sir said palmerin haue spoken grace shall find effect according doubt brother shall last purchase delight neither long study compulsion could bring passe continued talke two knight souldiers came duke chamber helmet palmerin seeing two brother florian pompides ran imbraced great ioy desirous know sped iousting princesse florenda florian rehearsed point point also manner happened thither duke seeing three knight brother supposed person great birth wherefore commanded organeli drew towards night conduct chamber palmerin certified done castle also marriage appointed betweene duke brother three lady thus discoursed till sleepe commanded leaue morning duke brother married lady dragonell second brother chose armisia second sister darofant espoused arismena yongest feast solemnized marueilous great royaltie palmerin discouered himselfe brother made duke conceiue better opinion himselfe beene foyled worthy knight sheweth great honour time staying longer would haue doue pleasure duke lady length taking leaue honourable company departed thence intending goe strait constantinople chance come turne againe chap lxxi targiana turkes daughter commanded knight albayzar goe castle giant almarol maintnine beautie princesse miragarda arriued entred combate dramusiande able vanquish wherefore night tooke downe shield miragarda brought thence away new must wee leaue prince palmerin brother hauing left duke lady trauailing iourney towards constantinople let v see hath happened castle almarol maintaining beautie faire miragarda haue already certified olori que alchediane soldane babilon left sonne behind great enemy christendome seeing himselfe brought despising fortune determined follow course knightly aduentures make valour knowne among number famous knight happened first went great turk co rt stored couragious knight better meane try hardinesse proued effectuall aboue fame attributed patterne chiuallry named albayzar became amorous seruant targiana turkes daughter onely name beautie giuen thorow turkes dominion loue vsually augmenter mindes endeauour themselues vnder obeysance hauing en lamed hart albayzar maketh forsake wonted liberty wander solemne conceit inucigled fancy made brooke passion meekely hauing receiued originall griefe excellent occasion pargiana likewise bearing good affection would loue soueraigntie uer protestation sweete pa ley often confessed hauing platforme order inuention ready coined calleth chamber winde woont began solemne deuise sir llible foundation haue often said sworne shall bee easie driue doubt prouide selfe encroching danger haue often told requisite vnderstand depth deed wel lead away amorous fabulous word haue often told fairest princesse liuing earth would venture life maintenance thereof bring triall giue care aduenture shall giue charge finish hath bin blazed abroad spaine castle giant almarol remaineth prince named miragarda reported onely goddesse beauty god neuer frame one beautifull yea iudgement haue seene picture truly iustly figured perfect proportion shield placed castle desireth must first adueture strength report tell affirmeth lesse faire aduenture selfe hath tried famous place haue depart presently trauaile fauour defence beauty shew hauty courage giant champion fortune suffer vanquish neuer greater pleasure bring hither sheeld faire miragarda returne pray iourney constantinople court emperour palmerin may witnesse self dare denie faithful seruant fairest princesse aliue fulfilling hereof maketh lord mine gracious lady answered albaizer see present perfect loue beare vouchsafe employ honorable seruice whereto presently betake selfe promising bring sheeld miragarda place foot lady world ought humble selues thus breaking speech took leaue wearing fine greene armour wheron wrought many golden spheares sheeld vpon field siluer hee bare deuise phaenix vnder written golden letter name targiana trauailing thus diuers kingdomes last arriued castle giant almarol soone combat dramusiande finished prince florian albayzar perceiuing number shield tree esteemed greatly valure power accomplish rare exploit hee beheld picture miragarda could chuse confesse aduantage aboue lady targiana neuerthelesse hee would put due execution albeit night could time farre spent morning presented castle dramusiande aduertised arriuall armed himselfe came foorth horseback litle friendly greeting passed couched speares third encounter sent one ground couragiously drew forth sword deliuering cruell assault one another miragarda lady highly commend yet shee stood feare lest albayzar vanquish dramusiande albayzar life time felt hardy blowes thought promise certain departed fro princesse targiana dramusiande found enemy strong could hardly assure himselfe victory cruelly deale one another wounded one another grieuous maner one would haue thought possible life could remaine whereupon dramusiande began thus faire miragarda good lady doe refuse seruant great neede hath neuer done seruice shall cause dramusiande lose recompence thinketh trauels haue worthily deserued side alybazar coplaints princesse targiana desirign remember fauor sufficient ouercom enemy commending selfe god mahound began afresh dramusiande long fought yet neither could preuaile thought themselues indifferently matched night approaching made leaue combat finish next day could dramusiand entred lodging meaning morrow ende strife one way albayzar retired minde knowing rest night hee might better deale dramusinde morrow returned tree shield remembring promise made lady euery one fast asleepe tooke downe shield prinesse miragarda hee purposed beare turkie first would passe court emperonr palmerin according lady targiana commanded fearing least pursued stayed place till twenty mile thence bearing shield couered body know lodged stayed vntill wound healed sorrowfull could vanquish dramusiande bring perfect prize lady targiana chap lxxii albayzar departed shield miragarda dramusiande left castle almarol followe armello brought word prince florendos shield made presently leaue shepheards kinde life fellowe shepheard tooke themselues trauaile dramusiande hauing dressed wound well might short space morning returned tree intending ende combate leaue life field began greete picture miragarda according hee woo found himselfe dispossest thereof hee taken sorrow could abide place sought tree could finde began suspect knight maintained combat caried away wherefore secretly might concluded persue presently staying till princesse miragarda certified thereof hee could yeelde account shee faithfully committed keeping determined seeke world ouer would reuenged discourteous knight whose treason rehearsed giant almarol tooke leaue staying til wound healed yet thinking danger wherein tooke himselfe trauell dramusiande gone miragarda vnderstood shield stollen knight dramusiande determined trauaile made take somwhat heauily thinking though dramusiande gone recouer againe yet mishap knowne tristfull knight would take weapon followe offered great discortesie reposed better confidence dramusiande armello seeing shield stollen dramusiande gone order good hope maisters good fortune made trudge hast fromthe castell way went riuer thesin till last found keeping sheepe fountaine staying himselfe heard sound flute often stayed vtter complaint euercharged minde armello greatly mooued heare lamentation came hee litle neere behold face much offended essuse teares armello could iusily say whether feete fate another shepheard simply apparelled playing many delightfull deuises vpon flute armello verily thought place wildernesse woe sight made case kn w way beginne tale well knew lord minded life left castell giant almarol yet hardly knowe wherefore encouraging himselfe approched vnto speech pray friend report tidings young knight loue hath caused vndertake solitary kinde life estate doeth rather command vse knightly armes trust friend answered shepheard selfe cruelly vrged outrage loue hardly endure make answere loue hath allowed misfortune neuer day houre minute quietnesse prince florendos began order oh sir doe seeme blame loue much haue sustained losse impute feeblenesse fortune loue let alone complaine loue armello cast good view vpon knew lord albeit changed remembrance wherefore falling feete desired execute himselfe extreame griefe would fauour himselfe pittie would greatly displease power command otherwise florendos somewhat offended himselfe done thing might displease best beloued armello seeing stayed thus sir haue taken paine come hither might vnderstand matter greatly profite dramusiande hath long time kept shield miragarda many knight hath brought vnder obeysance misfortune shielde stollen thence knight hath hope recouer meanes florendos whose heart already stroken suddaine ioy began manner armello wish goe succour seeing scant able helpe selfe may weaknes presume one chiefest strength could conquer one onely knight neuertheles wil still remaine sorrow hitherto hath daily vsually borne mee company followe knight hath borne away shield lady make yeelde againe fortune send victory shall trouble sorrowes world thus rising vp desired fellow shepheard delight accompany heauinesse beare company leaue sad silent kind life follow noble exercise wherin beene alwaies trained albeit simple yet beene tried good knight armes knight though content sorrowful life yet power refuse request gentle p florendos whose amitie left sheepe went towne hard remained till strong enough endure trauaile time stay made fine new blacke armor alike without deuise prince would knowne made send armor castle almerol departed thence trauailed seeke shield faire miragarda trauailed log togither misaduenture vnhappily parted shall certified hereafter chap lxxiii knight bare florendos company shepheard occasion parted company albayzar proceeded shield miragarda shall vnderstand knight kept florendos company historie declareth knight prisoner edward departed realme england florama prince sardignia tooke trauailes coast spaine purposing trye aduentures princesse miragarda arriued castle almarol florendos gone england try aduenture castle dramusiand leisure sufficient behold muse faire portrait miragarda seemed apparant eye entred prayses surpraises beautifull image made desire som knight would take way thither intent might shew seruice gratious princesse seemelinesse whose picture caused verily beleeue none world might compare beauty remained opinion old remembrance altea claimed one title cogitation vrged motion strife arise became lesse affectionate miragarda knight behalfe many shield wherevpon hee began order floraman wilt thou vndertake exercise armes seeing thou hast power appease thy tedious trauailes labouring get thou enrollest thy selfe farther thou wast content vanquished constantinople wherby thou mightst shun follow deceitfull loue art thou desirous enter armour fortune fly thee thou able way endure oh blinded affection must roue euery stranger knowest strange loue made thee late seeing late come knowledge mine errour haue gone far cannot returne without foot wet purpose pursue fortune hath allowed mee laboursome life resigning ioy wont familiar contenting heauines since way eschew happe seeing graue meetest dead man solitarie wildernesse comfortlesse wretch meane beare company mournfull heart long shall die see twise dead time seeke shall mishappes haue ful conclusion dispaire strike dead thus breaking lamentation walked along riuer thesin forsaking horse armour al knightly behauior entring little shade tree determined liue solitarie greatest contentation sat keeping sheepe play mournfull deuises vpon flute write graue barke tree certaine amorous sonnet passion louer tree grew seuerall sonnet flourished vpon albeit resolute liue al company yet florendos came vnto found neere agreeing complexion manner motion coyned like stampe glad receiue partner heauinesse liued together hearbes root pang griefe sobbes sighes salt teares daily foode sustenance louer sollace sorrow till armello caused depart thence haue heard discoursed already fortuned two careful prince rode along sea side espied little galley comming towards wherein sat lady endued singular beauty attyred blacke accompanied modest behauiour euery one might iudge bee person nobilitie lady feete sat two aged woman espying two prince commanded marriners row shoare beholding prince rufully lady saluted sort sir knight desire one doe great fauour come abord galley aide cause desireth helpe one onely knight faire lady answered florendos beare armes purpose imploy selues aide distressed person entring galley commanded armello esquire take horse expect comming castell giant almerol would faile meete thus leauing prince floraman galley launched forth quickly sight wherefore rid desiring company florendos became maruellous affectionate trauailed three day came strong bridge foure corner whereof foure faire strong tower erected desirous approch vnto espied knight willing passe denied saying would leaue shielde behind giue vp name signed writing custome fortresse permitted passe quietly ill custome answered knight ordained hinder selfe rather could make part good enemie sayde gaue shield bare esquire receiued another encountred knight bridge able withstand force speare dismounted horse throwen water horaman somewhat abashed hardy encounter approached neere bride behold esquire hand portrait faire princesse miragarda made desirous stay see enterprise would take conclusion knight bridge sooner giuen turne ouer one tower one sounded horne vehemently sound wherof knight came forth bearing hand mighty axe wherwith approching knight charged many sharpe dangerous stroke ende valour knight hee laide flate vpon ground giuing place another leisure arise came foorth tall ougly giant bringing hand mace iron knight deliuered taunt thou destroyer blood doe thy duty defend thy selfe reuenge horrible iniury thou hast offered intend cutte thy body many piece fowles ayre shall glutted thy carkasse knight refusing giue answere couered himselfe shield betweene giant began terrible dangerous combate ende knight named valiant albayzar coniured giant left life albayzar sore wounded seeing resistance come entred foretresse stayed till able deale floraman desired haue sling get shield faire miragarda low estate esteeme great dishonour assaile couragious mindes rather desire encounter haue might resist deale haue power defend themselues wherfore past bridge knowing whither best take way desire absent himselfe farre thence would loose commoditie sight albayzar meane time wasted away idle houres woonted silent amourous passion chap xlxiiii declared fortresse vpon bridge belonged albayzar behaued worthily custome ordained happened florendos sailing galley lady circumstance history mentioned duke artilio spaine daughter liuing enioy possession nourished company faire belizarda daughter king recinda loue hauing gained power aforesaid lady caused fancied prince onistalde continuance betweene end desire happened take effect prince receiued order knighthood court emperor palmerin hee changed minde became affectionate towards princesse emperor court forgat duchesse sort neuer since departure fortune see duchesse perceiuing vnkind dealing shee able er lude memorie ordained custome bridge castle caused passage kept giant lamortan two knighes linage suffered knight passe bridge without leauing shield name writing perswading selfe deuise length recouer beloued onistalde sake many knight great danger assailed themselues strange aduenture till valiant albayzar came ended custome great griefe vexation duchesse neuerthelesse bountie valure perceuied commanded hee bee honourably vsed till recouered hurt wound albayzar stayed fortresse dutchesse good till last departed tooke iourney toward constantinople concerning prince florendos saled al night lady till morning discouered castle middest sea artificiall founded vpon rocke taking occasion strike shore began florendos manner sir knight declare cause haue brought place letting passe boldnesse vnder knightly courtesie within castell abideth damosell little vertue beauty vnderstanding espoused one fairest lord countrey deuised meane acquaint selfe reporting knight depriued one castels intreaty stay champion distressed cause time gotten castle fell vnlawfull liking vowed neuer suffer depart thence vnlesse knight came could preuaile fiue knightes maruellous strength one knight shee suffer champion enter combat stand doubt neuer recouer louing lord husband againe faire lady saith florendos send summon fiue knight sight meane prouide selfe stand defence shortly aduanced himselfe toward castel gate espied fiue knight com forth false doore strongly armed prince one began order sir knight wee esteeme best yeeld selfe seeing fortune hath much enemie conduct hither shall find v friendly otherwise may incurre selfe double despite trust said florendos first intend trie crueltie vse regard gentlenes afterward make answere intent vpon came assailed prince likewise behaued himselfe great agility confessed neuer found valour remaine one knight neuer haue assayed perillous aduenture often staied fell againe prince hauing slaine two lady vsing reprochfull wordes vnto fiue power preuaile one set chafe began charge vnmercifull blowes seeing way escape one side sea hindered castell could retyre lady within commanded gate made fast wherefore two fell downe dead last knight seeing danger stood tooke point sword hand humbled himselfe prince thus worthy knight since fortune hath allowed honour victorie haue preuailed companion let pitty enter heart saue life humbly submitteth himselfe mercy grant thee thy life said florendos bee thought bloody mind kill able resist sat downe rest himselfe lady vsing great care bind vp wound lady within castle standing feare lest stubbornnes might procure greater iniury sent one damsel opened gate florendos seeing tooke lady hand entred castel met lord prisoner long imbraced lady great thankes bringing knight liberty began order worthy sir knightly deedes haue gained honour cannot make estimation according haue worthily deserued shall please rest yeeld courtesie depart together florendos gaue great thankes stayed see lady kept castle could attaine desire made selfe fast chamber one might come haue sight went see place lady vsed imprison knight amongst found prince guerin reioyced maruelously see florendos knowing finished hard aduenture accounted himselfe happy company eight day expired departed galley thence house knight lady guerin hee found themselues gratiously vsed court constantinople within tooke leaue knight lady gaue good horse trauelling together parted one another florendos desired iourney alone might better approoue aduenture fortune reserued chap lxxv palmerin florian pompides trauaile met damosell brought castle dramorant cruell found albayzar shield miragarda vanquished twelue knight slew dramorant lord castle palmerin brother continuing trauaile towardes constantinople riding thorow forrest saw lady come riding towards great feare come somewhat neare florian staied palfray saying faire lady pray shewe v cause feare ala sir quoth stay report thing seeing dare scant assure selfe company enterprised iourney court french queene two knight came resisted endeuouring selues abuse mine honour fortune fauourable cry knight came defended cause behaued himselfe worthily open fight slew passing castle end stone wal assailed twelue knight feare death speedily holpen good rescue trust gentleman losse would great one hardy knight al world pray lady said florian bring v castle knight remaineth danger seeme report great pittie suffer knight die lacke helpe although quoth otherwise determined yet bring place well try worthinesse also shew good knight owne danger hath pleasured much said rode together short time heard clattering weapon found knight haue slaine fiue sixe knightes behauing himselfe also manfully whereat prince fell great admiration lady seeing sate still looked began enter wordes gentleman determined doe nothing came beene honour haue kept iourney rather suffer good knight slaine presence stand refusing aid maketh iudge weapon ill bestowed faire lady answered palmerin knight doeth well discharge dutie offer great wrong presumed aid might cut praise worthily beare obtaining victory cause stay mary perceiue knight haue dangerous aduantage ouer would shewe ayde resistance recall word haue better opinion v continued parle knight famous albayzar twelue knight left foure aliue vrged florian opinion word belieue knight ordained darke deed knight onely accepted deere brother palmerin wherevnto know neither may approch neuerthelesse know one professeth knightly armes would striue exalt deed seeing behauiour noble champion fine perceiued knight slaine except two constrained yeelde themselues noble conquerour presently came forth dramorant himselfe brauely mounted strongly armed albayzar seeeing mounted horse came prince palmerin brother manner pray gentleman bestow one speares vpon receiue knight prepareth himselfe assuring forget remeber courtesie sir said palmerin dutie fauour knight content giue mine mee thinkes seeing selfe sore hurt rest awhile referre iust one v albayzar taking speare palmerin said fortune bee much mine enemy suffer brought knight subiection shall haue better leisure loue manifest prowesse remaineth esquire seeing master want shield came presented portrait faire miragarda albayzar refusing said rather made looke employ vse fight preparing himselfe run dramorant seeing destitute sheeld cast owne ground word albayzar sory see thee poore estate victory might obtaine vanquishing thee cannot returne great honour thou shalt thinke haue aduantage thee giue thee priuiledge neuer yet ending talke fetched course met pusisance forced fall ground sore hurt rising taking swordes beganne fierce combat palmerin highly commend valour albayzar would gladly haue knowledge made begin manner truly make account detaineth puissance shield miragarda verily beleeue dramusiande keeping hath bin vanquishing brought subiection doth vrge great maruell seeing could obtaine little hand knight well disposed would hazard selfe bring shield place whence hath brought credite said florian hardly beleeue dramusiande yet vanquished albeit deed knight may mooue v thinke wherefore let first finish combat may resolued doubt albayzar dramorant stroue long together palmerin would haue parted labour vaine albayzar would meanes giue ouer till hee discharged dramorant vitall breath himselfe point ready faint long trauaile also losse blood palmerin horian lady came sustained leading castle better receiued looked good leisure attend wound albayzar many also verie dangerous chap lxxvi florian albazar made defiance appointed end strife court emperour palmerin shall vnderstand dramorant cruel historie declareth eutropa aunt giant dramusiande brother named dramorant one stoutest giant time liued flourishing yeeres became amorous faire damosell daughter wise discreete gentlewoman would giue consent marriage wherefore tooke away perforce son named dramorant whose hauty valiant deed time obtained name cruell chanced mother died trauell strooke deepe hart giant seeing dead whose loue life maintained extreame griefe dyed shortly wherfore child kept grandmother vntill time grew yeares strength decent vertuous manner whole endeuour kill innocent rauish spoile fayre lady continuall inclination desperate cruell attempt feared countrey round vntil time albayzar came preuailed haue heard palmerin florian pompides keeping company castle vntill attained better disposition florian desired report gotten shield miragarda quoth know wel thinke kept well knowne one best knight euer professed armes sir said albayzar haue woon shield prowesse worthinesse haue vanquished vndertooke keepe moreouer haue vowed onely present lady targiana whose knight obedient seruant till death also shew prince court world manifest knight dare auouch contrary lady targiana faire noble princesse liuing opinion first goe court af emperour palmerin make proofe haue professed florian hearing speech proude arrogant greatly enuied thereat returned answere opinion sir enterprise returne small aduantage shall finde court lady whose beautie targiana seeme altogether counterfeyte shall finde many knight enter challenge doubt shall receiue shame ridiculous intent either fame praise way beare company albayzar great anger staied florian termes sir knight see wel estate present dare take paine come emperous court whither intend goe soone may possible cause know farre beautie targiana doeth surmount lady name dare enter combate hereon giue hand wil faile soone may possible wher deedes shall witnesse worthinesse cause maintaine three prince vpon departed presently leauing albayzar returne occasion shall serue endeauoured themselues well trauaile arriued kingdom hungaria glad attained neere constantinople palmerin remained former doubt concerning commaund lady mistresse siluian onely phisition extreame passion gouerned maisters cogitation exceeding well neuerthelesse two brother perceiued somewhat yet durst intrude themselues matter rid till came place would take shipping passe greece mariner prouiding departure prince delighted walke along faire plaine long staied espied coach couered blacke three esquire droue making dolefull grieuous lamentation vpon mourneful spectacle florian approached coach lifting vp cloath beheld knight lying greene armor imbrued blood one could hardly iudge colour mooued florian great heauines desirous know cause misfortune came one esquire willing report mischance knight slaine esquire hauing small leisure stay made shortly answere sort desire vnderstand ye infortunate hap knight follow shall bring aduenture may atchieue rare renowne neither death time able extinguish memorie surely quoth florian haue alwayes desired imploy selfe supposed greatest danger yet could neither feare dismay doubt hinder thus concluding speech followed coach desirous see ende esquire told palmerin pompides seeing gone soone walked softly along valley damosel presented selfe mounted blacke palfray saluted manner desire gentleman one would much fauour goe succour lady three knight endeuour abuse put herto death cruel maner pompides hearing coplait damosell began thus prince palmerin seeing present enterprse doth require force showne therein pray giue leaue accompany damosell may try fortune wil assist cause palmerin desired alone company siluian glad pompides assist damosell taking leaue pompide departed enterprise palmerin accustomed remembrance lady polinarda wherein wasted much time could repaire place lodging glad night take rest little thicket tree sooner laid downe heard one complaine doleful maner drawing neare better heare night darke could descrie one another heard heauy waight begin thus fond florendos doest thou thus complaine thy griefe seeing thy lady miragarda doeth take delight therein forceth vtter ruine submitteth himselfe chiefely vnder gratious regard knewe right well trauaile may ended desire one doe seruice shall doe vse entertainment may permit leasure doeth honour suffer forgotten depriued life whereby hee might haue lesse occasion complaine crueltie ending mo e grieous sigh sate fel asleepe palmerin perceiuing prince florendos determined oftentimes make himselfe knowne fearing hinder enterprise changed minde bewailing much heauines florendos extreame case owne misfortune day appeared hee departed secretly could thence away desiring attaine emperours court might conclude seuerall motion doubt feare loue presented oppressed minde chap lxxvii florian accompanying coatch dead knight met sea arduramet bastard brother valiant albayzar defied combate haphened pompides following lady florian desart keeping company coach three esquire great way sight brother one began thus conferre syr seeing desire much knowe knight slaine seeme affectionate reuenge wrog neede giue eare wil discourse thereof large shall vnderstand knight named sortibran eldest brother famous king frisol whose worthinesse hath beene hee euer bare name kingdome fortune little yesterday conducted esquire weeping teares desired bran doubtful cause wherto courteously gaue consent thinking trecherous intent esquire brought place wherefoure enemy awaighted comming setling himselfe ende sortibran cruelly slaine aduertised great mishappe came fetch castle might see wounded body honourably interred meane one young sonnes gone court sooke knight reuenge father death therefore desire dsisist succour case shall onely enlarge eternall renowne also shall worke occasion none may dare presume commit treason florian promising esquire accomplish request rid till came sea coast entred galley attended comming hauing sh ed body sortibran sailed away pleasant gale winde long sea discouered foure turkish galleyes presently borded moore vessell beholding florian iudging noble knight entertained courteously commanding esquire cast dead body lord sea next morning heysed sailes goe iourney arduramet bastard brother prince albayzar trauailing seeke giue vnderstand soldane babylon father dead right succeede place arduramet talking florian demanded time heard prince albayzar reported mark token knew well vanquished dramorant cruell bethinking combat assigned albayzar performed emperours court businesse chanced could meete appointed time bega greatly offeded much arduramet desired shew cause heauinesse vnderstood seuerall clause great anger hee began rage thinkest thou knight world may dare attempt lord brother albayzar certainely thou art much beholding fortune deliuering thee great danger neuerthelesse thou hast great desire shew thy prowesse thou dost seeme vse protestation let v goe court great turke make thee confesse princesse targiana albayzar honorable knight liuing earth onely perfect goddesse beauty beside thou thinkest hath offred thee wrong thy stomacke serue thee thereto reuenge thy selfe die cause proofe wherof receiue gloue thou dare florian desired manifest valour strange country receiued gladly challenge arduramet thinking honour brother conquest florian went court great turke determination time leaue let v remember pompides trauailed damosel till came thicket tree heard one make great clamour looking aside beheld knight offering monstrous dishonour lady two knight sitting horsebacke laughing simple shift made defend selfe villainous intent knight pompides able suffer great shame sight couched launce abused lady ran cleane thorow head laid dead ground dealing roughly twaine serued sauce iust desert would abuse themselues vile sort came lady submitted selfe feete pompides feare sustained crueltie would hardly suffer vse speech wherefore pompides taking armes seing heauy estate great perplexitie comforted manner faire lady let feare seeme dismay mind body imploy themselues defence lord quoth shee bloodie minded men haue brought feare albeit see dead face yet remembrance crueltie doeth still make afraide wherefore desire depart leaue mourne great mishap else shall still fearefull bird branch danger fowler pompides began smile see little trust lady reposed company neuerthelesse minding satisfie desire beautifull also vertuous honest disposition departed accompanied damosel brought thither reported knight would haue rauished lady met trauailed toward court king frisol newly come slaughter sortibran meeting endeuoured faire speech allure lust sawe would consent would vrge perforce pompides departing followed palmerin desired trauell still company chap lxxviii happned palmerin england departed prince florendos hee fighting giant bracandor albayzar arriued holpe ouercome enemy palmerin left florendos sleeping tree came forrest halfe mile citie buda king hungaria lay perceiued company knight lady fountaine wherefore fearing least company might bee hinderance trauaile turned horse ride way intent abandon place resort hee might better commune dispute loue ryding turned head espied pleasant company fountaine fiercely fighting together wherfore turned againe goe thither sawe great conflict came done quiet enemy take gladly stroue resistance duthesses pontus duraca trauailing court noble father company prince ditree vnfortunate skirmish slain vrged palmerin great heauinesse saw also heauy cry lady made hold bracandor mightie giant inhabiting rocke ten knight daily waiting palmerin pitying lady mishap couched speare ran giant force laid along earth manner though starke dead ten knight standing seeing came altogether running vpon defended himselfe wel power vnhorse hardy blowes made quickly coole courage bracandor risen vp againe commanded knight retire would reuengo iniury himselfe wherevpon gaue ouer giant palmerin sternly dealing one another bracandor ende began greatly faint knight seeing danger forced maisters commaund came beset prince palmerin albeit receiued many dangerous hurt paide due little profit lady continued prayer good assistance esteeming best knight euer seene bracandor seeing maruellous force one onely knight beganne blaspheme god ran violent manner prince god indued great pollicie force least blowes sufficient haue slaine bracandor beholding six knight slaine dangerous woundes dispaire himselfe fell ground palmerin well pleased rid enemy short time sent foure beare maister company came offering take helmet hee might haue presently cut head astapardo came foorth accompanied ten knight charged sudainly leisure commend himselfe mistreffe palmerin reduced great perplexitie yea death appointed furious skirmish puissant albayzar presently arriued seeing great iniury offered one knight gaue speare fought dramorant cruell ran astapardo manner speare went quite thorow body armor behaued themselues well part slaine rest saued liues flight palmerin seeing himselfe deliuered great perill came offered great thanks prince albayzar suffering vse courtesie without making knowne set spurres horse rid away great haste palmerin returned bracandor finding yet aliue commanded esquire leade rode city buda accompanied duchess lady sorie death ditree knight well pleased againe noble hautie deed palmerin chap lxxix shal declared vnto giant bracandor wherfore came remaine place svch report history deliuereth vnto v perilous isle remained giant named bucarquant ruled isle cruel maner subiects stand doubt death put beside gouernement isle concluded conspire death poyson sonne bracandor innocent wicked diuillish deedes father yet fearing gouernement would prick like cruelty chased isle giuing company nephew astapardo twaine went kingdome hungaria purposed people little mountaine giuen name inhabited rock place might suffered liue quiet reuenge would sought cruell deed bucarquant gotten company bloody minded dishonest knight liuing robbery deflowring faire virgin lady villainous deed might deuised till last heard duchess went see king frisol father law accompanied prince ditree knight suddenly came set vpon prince knightes slaine also fiue belonging bracandor till rescue came prince palmerin behaued himselfe haue heard come citie buda king frisol vnderstanding death sonne tooke heauily great losse forceable constraine yet hee dissembled griefe came duchesse prince palmerin giuing great thankes courtesie commanded vsed maruellous good respect till wound healed strength somewhat better increased citizen tooke giant bracandor without king leaue put death burning bone nothing might left seene cruell villaine soone king frisol able withstand extremitie griefe meekely yeelded day stroke death smal griefe noble linage well loiall obedient subiects greatly lamented losse gratious prince obsequies funerales magnifically finished estrellant son prince ditree receiued name rightfull renowned king committed gouernment scepter one noble lord hungaria time ease yet come would follow exercise valiant knight armes palmerin staied citie buda till strength would permit beare armour hee followed intent alwaies see place greatest aduenture chap lxxx florian court great turke entred fight bastard arduramet vanquished heere must remember arduramet prince florian landed came turkes court arduramet receiued great thankes turke himselfe prisoner taken fortunate voyage comming prince targiana whose gentle nature afforded gracious welcome arduramet deliuered speech manner gracious lady since time departed excellencie haue endured along tedious trauell recouer lord brother albayzar albeit fortune meete yet haue heard report deed heart contented labour finished assuring hath woone renown christian haue knowledge doe daily desire see make proofe puissant behauiour beside haue heard hath conquered shield faire miragarda wherewith gone court emperor palmerin maintaine knight dare auouch contrarie seemely selfe onely goddesse beautie earth time search happened tooke certaine prisoner among found knight told mee newes lord albayzar hee assigned fight emperours court wherupon word arose v haue appointed combat tried ended court florian seeing great pride arduramet stricken coller hee began vtter mind speech arduramet arriued place must entend meane accomplish promise albeit albayzar valiant knight armes effect deed manifest lesse yet maintaine prooue hath shield manner conquest prince targiana beautie esteeme confesse authoritie ventureth field fauour cannot chuse speed happily deedes shall please licence mee field defend albayzar knight law rather deserue receiued seruice esteeme arduramet could suffer braue word especially one prisoner rage cast helmet ground began raile tearmes follow oh mahomet doest thou suffer presence christian presume vile presumptuous brag gratious lady desire assure miscreant field vow leaue til haue reuenged rare monstrous iniury targiana commanded florian take helmet whose gentle manner presently obeyed offended word arduramet beauty farre otherwise alwayes accustomed cause princesse commanded arduramet depart make himselfe ready enter combate prince florian affection greatly placed tooke prisoner vnder protection better assure safe danger commaunded fiftie knight presently armed see none might come neare hurt time combate arduramet florian kissing hand departed place appointed fight vp chamber see euery thing happened came f e knight field aduice targiana arduramet prauncing like noble champion great turke himselfe stood window daughter desirous see ende noble enterprise ardumaret bowing himselfe princesse targiana couched speare prince florian word lady cause knight knowe seruants bring subiection florian brake speare valiantly vpon hee sent ground maruellous violence wherat great turke somewhat displeased targiana greatly triumphed arduramet sorrowfull mishap came prince sword hand thus sir knight sword shall make amends fault thou offer sooner resist trench blade bellie thy horse perceiue well said florian needlesse vse aduantage knight descending horse betweene began dangerous combate wherein florian cruelly martired armour arduramet great turke would gladly haue parted fearing death arduramet targiana desired let trie minde assure victory strange knight arduramet seeing himselfe ill intreated thought many time haue yeelded himselfe thinking shame hee might get concluded fight till latter gaspe short time fell downe dead feete florian departed field came princesse targiana whose presence fell knee vttering speech faire lady vnknowne mischance vnhappie aduenture haue bene brought land strange knowne seeing bountie hath allowed victory desire recompence great honor haue done may hencefoorth imploy selfe seruice wherein shall manifest greatly bound gentle curteous nature targiana somewhat changing colour looked earnestly father came receiued florian gratiously allowing onely knight whereat great turke well pleased stayed seruice targiana lesse affectionate towards willing doe pleased chap lxxxi dramusiande florendos sought together hurt dangerously palmerin arriued wrought meanes relieue feeble estate giant dramusiand mention hath made since departure castle almarol trauailed many country find knight taken shield miragarda thence tranaile proued famous fortunate last arriued castle dramorant cruel kinsman vnderstood slaine dramorant knight carried away shield miragarda made affectionate desirous seeke rode dominion hungar met knight riding sad full heauines attired blacke armour vsed courteous greeting knight made answere whereupon tooke hand saying sir knight make answer offer courtesie knight sad conceit word reuiuing himselfe cast eye dramusiande grieuously answere trust sir knight heart mine afflicted eye ouerwatched eares silent opinion much dulled ignorant whether saluted thinke heard refused answere like credit much deceiue selfe perceiue well quoth dramusiande haue spoken truth wherewith hold selfe well contented could report might finde knight beareth shield wherein pictured fairest face euer nature framed hauing letter name peerelesse inequall miragarda word knight gaue grieuous sigh saying surely sir doe greatly desire meete selfe trauels end seeke onely combate bring backe shield head castell almaroll whence bold take away enterprise toucheth one aliue wherefore desire giue euery trauell betake selfe rest life mine hath preserued danger aduenture maketh desirous follow dramusiande ignorant knight seeing vse intent order endeuoured know labour spent ende profit wherefore incensed anger gaue scope steedes met together nobly dismounted ground fell fresh sword armour expence blood witnessed dangerous estate person dramusiande thought two knight world could handle without noble palmerin florian brother made great think knight one till last euer beene bring last extremity vitall course yet highly one way contented knowing die honourable seruice wherwith haue continually endeuoured gratifie desire breaking speech fel egerly combate last brought vnto feeblenesse forced fall ground fortune preserued greater conquest honor caused instant noble palmerin england arriue place knowing dramusiande supposed verily slain wherefore came knight almarol force haue obtained shield faire miragarda force beare onely honour saint homage heart enforce knight yeeld vassailes highnesse licence field compell knight court also dare auouch contrary lady mistresse targiana onely daughter great turke lord soueraigne shall beare prize beautie condition doe require mine attempt defendant shield shall bring liuely portayt lady name verified foote thereof shall onely recompence conquerour shall gaine manifest themselues indifferently fauoured lady shall sworne giue writing name mistresse hath good hap vanquish shall onely lord shield lady targiana shall haue likewise deliuered shieldes fortune shall allow prowesse furthermore granted knight dismounted iust shall haue licence fight sword vanquished deliuer shield depart expect answere redoubted emperour concerning ye request hath trauailed many strange countrey commeth make triall valure puissance knight conceiue courage aduenture combat behalfe lady hadde ended speech great tumult knight sent earth heeles vpward albayzar greatly terrified stroke lost stirrops constrained hold mane horse else himselfe borne company perceiued knight ready charge swoord hee leaped horse aduancing shield beare hardy blowes knight betweene beganne dangerous combate regardants hardly knewe whome impute aduantage albayzar fortune beene alwayes friendly suffered charge knight mightie blowes litle litle perceiued faint wherefore last scant able hold longer retired himselfe entring discourse know right wel weapon inuented maintain honour also discharge perillous aduenture wherefore beed much better haue past life without frequenting abide mischance wherein remaine present ala poore wretch thinke vanquish fortune ende finde selfe vanquished knew well enough keepeth himselfe falling snare hath little cause doubte peruerse frowarde chance fonde soole complaine manner author mine euill wilfully seeke mine owne dammage whereupon valiantly assaulted albayzar againe short time subdued laid arose vp anger gaue answere gentleman well follow way haue receiued mischance impute folly occasion proceeding lady lady shee fond goe foolish accomplish vaine request answere brauely sayde one knight fully determined shall goe v seeme dare offer offend shall quickly coole courage disposed suddenly chafe florian mounted horsbacke presently came vnto speech determined try worthines proue according faire fountain forrest seemed true two cause first emperor much affectioned haue dwelling solitary place neere pleasant spring faire costly fountaine second name marcellus many place fountaine neere whereunto two knight suffered steed receiue water targiana seeing singular prospect place conuenient repose desired prince florian pause whereto presently agreed princesse taking maske two knight well regarded affirmed shee albayzar maintained valiant iouste wherefore consented betweene themselues take lady shame might better couered attained receiuing infortunate foile iust putting helmet heades approched neerer princesse one began thus madam ought wish ill chose receiuing sharpe repulse beautie conceiue courage minde seeke remedie shall vnderstand knight hath vanquished v constantinople maintaining excellent state beauty hath woon shield whereon figured lady hath honoured placing foot wherefore let fault passe meeke penance behoueth depart v shall offence lesse esteemed may must command v thinketh sir quoth florian blame innocent little defence selues keepe shieldes without presuming fortune may happen prouide farre worsse inconuenience perceiue said knight againe lady beautie causeth vse tearmes bluntly doubt able maintaine albeit may make good account manhood shall trie sir quoth florian closing helmet charged order thy ashamed dutie knighthoode assaile whose stoutnesse still detained targiana death one seeing fell knee princesse word madame desire appease anger death fellow grieuous woundes ha receiued let mercy pleade cause though vnworthy yet thinke life would little pleasure targiana beholding repentance desired florian hee would forgiue presently granted commanding dead body bo caried away whereto knight daring gainsay willed esquire lay ouerthwart vpon horse departed together knight grieued himselfe seene targiana walking florian said shee thought place assurance countrey trust said florian neuer sawe order yet ought maruailed one one side shield albayzar side beauty causeth aduentures happen haue bin vanquished gaining sight excellent feature cannot chuse threaten themselues greater danger nature framed onely bring extremity dare conceiue hardinesse behold targiana seeing florian deepe praise stayed conge ouer lippes seeing faire tree farre tooke hand saying let v goe walke vnder yonder faire minde assureth thing happen might hauing seemely perso maketh desire fortune would send hazard aboue see forceable magnanimity beauty engraned heart mine hauty disposition death thousand death able withstad preferreth title fro maister might better report amorous coplaints alwayes resident pensiue minde knight one faire blew armour helmet seruing vnder head office pillow lay without receiuing rest gaue forth sighes complaint dolefull manner targiana florian desirous heare loath disturbe seriously busied withdrew themselues litle closely could knight thinking neare began vnfold griefe order lady haue beene offensiue offer great vngentlenesse leauing aliue wish daily death yet obstinate suffer die onely might passe time vnestimable opinion endles torment greater griefe often wish prolong life seruice wherto vse vnfriendly meanes permit imployed therein onely authour mine euill daily occasion mercilesse passion forget extremitie abide loue neuer dying death compell wast course life trust serueth strange neuer saw affliction man meane whereby tollerate mine keepeth one certaine stay commeth best change falleth ague quartaine quotidian mishap onely meant men sustaine griefe hope short ende fortune mine extreames neuer take ende vrgeth beliefe triumph see tormented iudge vnworthy liue seruice vexation content selfe well may think remember rigour showne hath deserued hauing considered ought shall find haue giuen rash recompence hath deserued better reward vngentlenes hath bin either custome bold curtesie beare thus ended complaint grieuous sigh though hee fetchht h latter gaspe florian attached griefe heare heauy tale distressed knight tooke lady targiana hand returne knight hearing noyse silke apparell princesse made bush started vp putting helmet head came prince florian word abide sir knight another time shall learne manner discretion defend selfe trust shall report prowesse take occasion rehearse complaint seeing sir quoth florian minded folly offer excuse therefore proceede determination drawing swordes beganne braue fight charging one another dangerous manner targiana commended exployt aboue seene thus animated one another knight greene white armour chanced arriue shield hee bare deuise speare pierced many place blowes receiued two esquire attending desirous knowe cause two knightes endured combate cruelly wherefore hee came princesse targiana knowe beheld quite forgat demand one knight albayzar vanquished knowledge presently wherfore set vp behind one esquire riding away gaue speech faire lady seeing knight able beare company know none worthy selfe keepe shall recompence dishonour haue gotten targiana seeing neither faire intreaty resistance small strength could pacifie florian maintained combate fiercely could heare cry beganne order perswade know sir knight dare presume make entrace vpon others possession seeing although haue power carrie away yet good affection shall alway estranged seeing remedie pray suffer goe foote yonder fountaine abide mine attendance shall goe assuring haue weapon wherewith assist defend content said knight satisfie desire desireth honor seruice walked downe fountaine time minde leaue florian knight earnest enterprise neuer perceiued targiana carried away seene brought weaknesse could haue rescued dangerous estate fortune friendly vnto dramusiande trauailing toward constantinople recouer shield faire miragarda arriued seeing extremitie two knight knowing armes knight dragon also beholding another knight endure combate well greatly abashed fearing lose man loued gaue horse spur ran betweene word gentleman desire request ende debate weaknesse rather requireth rest continue discord extreame danger least sir palmerin speaking knight dragon refuse grant desire knight hope shall haue occasion thanke florian heard name palmerin conceiued griefe throwing sword fell ground manner beene dead wherefore palmerin seeing great debilitie found vertuous valiant commaunded siluian vnlose helmet might receiue ayre hee knew florian desart brother readie fall ground himselfe dramusiande vsed diligence stay florian rising seeing brother palmerin ill intreated began word might recompence great offence haue committed forgetfulnesse much gouerne sences know hardy blowes noble lord noble brother answered palmerin seeme part take thing amisse hath happened rather let v bethinke selues howto requite courtesie haue found deere triend dramusiande florian contented himselfe brother answere esquire giuen vnderstand knight carried away lady targiana ouercharged grie e beyond measure great heauinesse determined make pursuite palmerin would agree thereto moreouer dramusiande shewed danger wherein present making faithfull promise soone wound brought better estate himselfe would vndertake trauaile earnestly hee shield miragarda yet griefe prince florian great neither counsell friendly intreatie could perswade dramusiande hauing accomplished meane set prince horsebacke departed forrest florian casting eye towards fouutaine thinking lost misfortune teares standing eye began thus thou valley whose ent ance seemed pleasant mee know issue value mishap deare neuer cease trauaile yeeld life among mischance till haue found sweete content haue lost meane know euer forget departed forrest came monastery wound cured great facilitie dramusiande soone hee brought place went backe valley purposing fulfill promised florian hystory leaueth three knightes returned carried targiana away perswading company attaine title immortall praise chap lxxxviii shal rehearsed knight carried targiana away happened company remembrance made history king denmarke three sonnes al prooued bee noble valiant knight especially eldest called albanis freze renowned thorow father kingdom knight durst encounter come age fiue twenty yeeres hearing braue report princesse miragarda became affectionat leauing father court trauailed castle almarol accomplishing many notable deed way arriued time albayzar carried shield thence saw could attaine enter combat staied till fortune would suffer see princesse miragarda whose view hee became seuerely vanquished vowed possible bring sheeld againe fortune stand friend much purposed make greatly beholding strange condition haue told shee reioyced receiue euerie one without making shew welcome albanis preuailing diuers aduentures came cittie constantinople seeing number shield valiant moore woon great renowne held euery valour purposed manifest courage albeit worthinesse great brake three speares valiant albayzar yet fortune much receiued foyle shield placed among conquered knight departed thence opinion euer serue miragarda hee arriued valley florian palmerin fought beholding targiana esteemed fairest creature euer seene knew shee whose behalfe albayzar sped happily wherevpon concluded bring constantinople trie fortune would fauour better albayzar hauing presence faire targiana offered great honour curtesie power altar faithful affection bare prince florian wel rid drawing neere constantinople euening met knight blacke armour riding sad heauily albanis gaue speech friendly salutation blacke knieht rid without making answer whereat albanis somewhat displeased desirous shew courage targiana turned blacke knight manner sir albeit word little esteemed haue made shewe courteous answere yet doe thinke beene dutie offer friendly motion lady wherto blacke knight made reply good sir haue beene obliuious selfe towards lady ready recompence shall commaund seeme discourteous speech haue saluted trust farre reason minde busied affaire neither saw much lesse heare would faine knowe sayde albanis whence ariseth cause doubt see sufficient excuse vnciuill behauiour syr quoth blacke knight would wish keepe iourney tel cause griefe would gladly pleasure little profit albanis desirous know demanded importune blacke knight tooke field pleasure encountred albanis force horse fell downe shoulder broken albanis could recouer himselfe blacke knight alighted forced abide mercy done riding away targiana came stayed thus sir knight desire euen make hazard person many danger magnanimitie doeth accompany aduersity abandon liue affliction beare gentlenes mind keepe c mpany trauaile emperours court suffer partner iourney businesse lyeth place expect knight conducted trauailes hither lady answered blacke knight thought knight vndertook conduct perceiuing contrary minded goe thither force must pleasure small request albeit extremitie li e stood thereon thus departed together leauing albanis sorrowfull euer bin blacke knight way requested wherfore knight enforced goe targiana ript vp whole matter wherefore blacke knight gaue greater honor done knew whose cause albayzar kept shield miragarda made somewhat excuse deede albayzar beauty targiana would haue vrged knight aduenture hardiest exployt arriued constantinople whe albeyzar appointed depart thence carrie shield away none durst aduenture recouer made emperor greatly agrieued esteeming greatest shame euer happened prince court side primaleon chafed father would grant combate albayzar minded stay comming foure mile without citie beare shielde image gridonia secretly caused made see might vanquish albayzar bring backe shield lady lost fortune hindred purpose tooke effect also would suffer albayzar depart thence great glorie chap lxxxix blacke knight entred combat albayzar blacke knight lodged night without city house ancient gentleman would knowne next morning targiana attyred selfe sumptuously gowne turkish fashion crimson sattin adorned braue bi lament gold precious stone mounted palfray white swan damosel esquire likewise braue apparrell atteding seemely order maner came city accompanied black knight arriued iusting place whe albayzar euen conquered english knight placed shield among emperour courtly company behelding braue gesture blacke knight noble company brought good opinion end iust made lady knight throng best place sight looked notable exploit caused greatest amazement beauty princesse tagiana rich sumptuous shew apparrell made people run heapes great murmuring whereat albayzar somewhat abashed cast head aside seeing lady targiana could hardly sustaine himselfe falling ground blacke knight staide good beholding shield albayzar conquered saw portrait faire miragarda teares ran cheekes began manner madame possible thing wherein nature hath showne skill make surpassing faire bee power might glad vanquished selfe would triumph found fortunate present desire die maintaine truth hope discouer deceit albayzar sort recompence shall returne hath iustly deserued albayzar greatly reioyced see lady targiana whose loue attained estimation honour wherby farre ouershot himselfe prodigall pleasure stood maze whether black knight hauing ended complaint seeing albayzar farre distracted put himselfe little neerer awaked wordes albayzar whereon doest thou vse thy mind mutely aduertise thee princesse company called targiana daughter great turke hath taken pain come hither see thy valour much blazed commended world albayzar word alighted horse hauing taken helmet came kissed hand targiana manner salutation madame know may requite selfe hauing honored highly aboue desert targiana receiued gratiously giuing hearty thanks noble seruice whereof made estimation florians deed presently forgotten yea farre bannished memorie though neuer seene life manifesting rightly inconstancie regard seruants according raised authoritie albayzar hauing done duty princesse targiana mounted horsebacke began thus blacke knight sir knight would faine know moued bring lady hither also haue desire enter iust vpon presenting shield shal receiued sir quoth blacke knight strife concluded betweene v shall discourse certaintie thereof selfe concerning shield say must present allowed iouste time vnprouided thereof thou hast disloyally stolne else might haue worne honour lady wherefore haue thus determined puissance cause thee confesse honourable assembly fortune fauoureth thee much suffer vanquiwed thy hand faile reuenge thy self greatest enemy euer thou haddest vanquish thee desire greater victorie recompence trayterous wrong thou hast offered carry backe shielde lady miragarda place hath alway accustomed remaine content answered albayzar fortune permit thee conquerour ouer thou enioy shield hath suffered mee vanquish thou bring castle miragarda shall ordaine life pleaseth like shall lady targiana deale thee mine accustomed good happe returne victorie syr quoth blacke knight thereto ready thine albeit thou shalt finde friendship hand offer greatest enemie emperor company suddenly strooken great maruaile heard wordes blacke knight especially primaleon desired greatly haue knowledge whereupon iudges commanded field targiana entred according albayzar requested trumpet sounded knight mette couragiously albayzar thrown groud heeles vpward black knight dismounted saddle betweene legges girtes horse broken else kept horseback still made emperour iudge albayzar depart honour hee thought drawne swordes laid terrible manner albayzar thought neuer met stroger knight blacke knight well esteemed strength albayzar generall verdict neuer seene hauty combat albayzar encouraged lady targiana blacke knight animated picture miragarda betweene declared deedes incredible prowesse last albayzar seeing armour bedewed blood himselfe brought extremitie hee retyred take breath began thus complaine noble victory haue attained many noble mindes preuaile thing seeing instant must lose glorie haue gotten oh lady targiana haue power vanquish best knight world absence suffer one knight preuaile much presence loose former honor deere life falling contrary doth maketh thinke affectionate onely cause victorie fall side yet princesse world braue bountie beyond beautie better deserueth title aboue title truely may lose victorie combat defect weaknesse fault excellency wherto fairest aliue may seeme aspi e blacke knight side seeing dangerous estate could assure himselfe good successe silently picture miragarda entred speech madame seeing hath pleased vse affaire haue greatly touched desire forsake enterprise wholly wherein though alba zar hath vanquished many knightes honour praise targiana excelleth figured lady beauty yet shew selfe excelling singular gift ouercome hath conquered many perswade selfe wil fauor hath done wrong disloyally beare shield castle let true faithfull seruant giue honour hautie attempt afterward deale cursed carkase mine euen shal stand gratious pleasure fell combate fresh emperor seeing small defence themselues supposed could long continue fight primaleon opinion came nature griefe mind receiued perfectly cruell wound blacke knight though felt vpon owne body supposed linage cruell behauiour vsed ech empres gridonia departed able abide grieuous sight two champion griped one closing arm albayzar weake resist longer fell ground whereat blacke knight reioyced vnclosed helmet haue smiten head emperour called vse mercy yet makking though heard lifted vp sword princesse targiana fell knee speech syr knight first desire strike head afterward proceed shall please loth would see die hath ventured life danger honourable seruice blacke knight seeing modestie princesse moued pittie wherewith granted albayzar li e iudges came field haue blacke knight honoured according became victorious conquerour would depart field portrait faire miragarda placed middest reason princesse targiana supplied roome led honoured according hie estate deserue emperour commaunded albayzar led tent meane while blacke knight kissing highnesse hand vpon knee began manner dread mighty emperour desire prince may regarded aboue court ought shew honor person know whe emperour knew blacke knight daughter conceiued child kept artibell prison till time deliuerance vpon day hee caused beheaded cup sent hart beloued artibell princesse perceiuing cruell reuenge father desirous accompany deere caused al feare tooke occasion behold none knew primaleo presently said giant dramusiand wherfore desired emperor stay aduancing meet dramusiand came imbraced great reuerence opened helmet primaleon faithfullest louer world cup alter againe beleeue assuredly knight shall exceede either knightly deed armes else amorous constancy louer emperour seeing al knight assaied cup desired knight dragon fellow make triall also palmerin busie beholding faire polinarda heard emperor word wherfore florian free louers passion albeit could dissemble lady indifferently aduanced himselfe wordes lady targiana lady defi e assistance passing danger forsake onely let enioy recompence desert thing hold greater estimation reserue greater affection word farre distant loyalty louer holding cup manifest held nothing world iudged blacke griesly cup seemed instant targiana knew yet would known therof griefe conceiued accident retired chamber repenting euer shee bestowed loue esteemed small fidelity damosell thrace receiuing cup againe florian said sir knight fortune speed better deedes armes action manifest faithfulnesse loue would ounsell neuer hereafter pursue aduentures faire lady answered florian recompence seruants according desert would greatly grieue fal hard destiny farre distance reason maketh esteeme lesse passe farther suffer selfe inueigled snare lesse bee pittied seeme bewaile languishing life answer florian albeit seemed acceptable many knight yet lady receiued great contempt naturall quality yeelde according deedes submit themselues abide pleasure contrariwise naturall inclination vse recompence seruice haue receiued neuer deserued damosel thrace came knight dragon desiring try cup according diuers done perswading person knightly hee seemed expected good issue palmerin seeing matter brought extremity cast eye damosell heart whose obstinacy caused die griefe entring speech aduenture truth pray lady henceforth excuse fearfulnesse dare presume think mind receiuing cup contained quallitie hand prince florendos could exceede farther emperour glad tooke cup prooue rest damosel word bottome teares beheld empresse pleasant euer seene made thinke aduenture ended doubting contrary requested damosell cup shuld alway remaine state whereto damosell answered thus must tried wil turne againe former blacknes desire knight meaning prince florian make triall thereof hath little desire keepe loue faithfull lady cup hand stand great danger pretty triump ladyes conceiued good occasion laughter emperour commanded al knight take cup againe labour vaine neuer seemed alter colour wherefore empresse tooke beheld emperour perfectly verily seene face empresse came gridonia bazilia wherin saw chiefly esteemed princesse polinarda took perceiued noble palmerin england heauines able endure extreame grieuous countenance deliuered cup fearing let fall hand shaked maruelously none knew cause thereof except emperour whose amorous youthfull time gaue occasion thinke shee seene one cup greatly desired doe seruice made round eare saying faire daughter make mee iudge want seruant word began sweetely blush rare beauty gaue excellent colour whereat knight dragon became afflicted cup passed hand hand till came againe prince palmeriu beholding sweet face faire polinarda tooke occasion speake maner himselfe gratious lady well perceiue countenance haue forgotten borne seruice yet doth miserie time constraine liue without hope desiring nothing else accomplish pleasure deliuered cup brother florian beheld bottome teares prince araalte nauarre faire targiana also many lady greatly offended twain deceiued wherefore damosell taking cup said doe sir knight behold issue vnfaithfull loue whereto presently shaped answere seemeth sex canno hartily fauour knight oweth affection maketh many force constancy yet thus much dare assure lady haue shall great deale better secured diuers haue tried aduenture cup hath showne fauour damosell making answere turned emperour saying desire highnesse n w proofe may made chiefest beloued wherein credit receiue great pleasure agreed quoth emperour intend selfe mak triall first shal perceiue slenderly fauoured empresse haue lost power end aduenture holding cup remained order still without change apparance heate wherefore damosell said lord must confesse selfe time past therefore deliuer cup
