free louers griefe albayzar tooke loue fauored much held great came turne knight dragon whose hap proued worse rest cup enflamed round seethed euen water doth vpon fire caused great feare beh ld griefe hee patience abide verily thought consumate day vexation life end supportable meane made would let go cup kept constantly euery one thought remedy death trust said damosell vnfained loue true knight deserueth rewarded sharp recopence word offered take cup gaue backe answering thus faire ladie desire suffer abide doome mishap hath alway ordeined wherein may end trouble incident mourning continual dispairing life emperor able abide great crueltie executed presence arose caught cup immediatly quenched though neuer bin violent whereat receiued small cause amazemen prince florendos albeit weake yet desirous partner constancy knight dragon receiued cuppe hand emperour presently rigour prince miragarda vsed towards caused suffer selfe torment noble prince palmerin flame arose cup inuironed body prince seene sighing lamenting midst thereof mooued lady shed aboundance teares vse many extreame word cruelty miragarda florendos though midst flame could hardly suffer hear blamed whose sake ready make sacrifice himselfe emperor seeing many meanes applied quench flame yet none power preuaile put himselfe midst thereof tooke cup florendos thinking would presently bequenched labor effect flame continued empresse gridonia al lad e knight fell rufull complaint maruailous heare noyse made grieuous spectacle polendos king thessalie came damosell thrace word desire faire lady seeing haue found thing sought would vouchsafe courtesie succour dangerous case prince florendos agrieued quoth damosel great tumult made wherein wil vouchsafe heare know say doe giue order appease murmuring wil work meane deliuer prince danger emperours commaundement disturbance quieted damosell presented selfe emperor saying aduertise dread gratious emperor adueture cup already past finished flame doth compasse prince florendos way extinguished vertue consisteth teares hand knight hath ended enchantment cup must sprinckled flame wherein enclosed dare assure prince shall brought former estate fire ingendred cruell woman loueth cannot way quenched onely teares pitiful lady constant faithfull brandisia deliuered cup knight dragon put finger therin sprinckled teares vpon florendos presently fire vanished away leauing florendos men thought verily dead aliue good estate great content emperour company chap xciii another aduenture happened court emperour palmerin followed florendos thus happily deliuered great ioy courtty company wished intreated faithful loue great cruelty beene place might haue seene triall inuiolate faith emperor desirous know knight whose spotlesse loyaltie ended enchantment misdoubting noble palmerin england desired earnestly would make himselfe knowne vnto palmerin putting hand helmet discouer himselfe hindered aduenture hereafter followeth sudden entred hal lady accompanied three mighty ougly giant whose armour colour fashion helmet carried three men swart euill fauoured face caused lady tremble also many knightes change colour proud stately giant thronged middest knightes aduancing themselues emperour without shewing courtesie reuerence stayed damosell charge declare seeing great nobilitie emperour somewhat offended yet notwithstanding seased fury began order perceiue right noble emperour renowne blazed world princely court little respecting honourable company see present vrgeth enter due land therof hath rightly iustly deserueth opinion might subdue gouern whole world would distribute force iudge way able matched yet fortune affaire hath hitherto prospered may vngently enuious long quiet peaceable felicity turne backe towards suddenly fury ouerturne good fortune glory haue gained prime yeeres may defaced aged estate forbiddeth follow trauaile armes long happinesse vnwilling enter warres wherewith come summon soldane persia principal captaine law mahomet also great turk noble gouernours coutrey belonging soldane babilon named albayzar strange aduentures hath put himselfe make triall valour vpon hope long expected good fortune named let vnderstand time certaine heathen prince slaine wall constantinople whose death hath vrged great impatience seeke reuenge great wrong haue offered god protector defendor welfare fauouring beyond expectation haue heretofore hindred determination prince prepared ruine kingdomes vtterly race fame memorie hath quarrel sedition sprung vp amongst haue murthered one another happening many sundrie time hath suffered put pretence execution wherefore auoid mischance also fauour euil may happen haue sent v highnesse certaine condition performing whereof shall end hatred ioyntly ioyne continuall friend first shall send polinarda daughter prince primaleon sonne soldane persia aged xxv yeeres prince much renowned puissant incomparable rich shee shall bee espoused beseemeth noble prince second florandos sonne shall promise marry armenia daughter soldane named princesse singular heauty shee thought excell lady liuing earth dowrie soldane giue title hee hath part empire without desiring recompence behalfe faire polinarda onely might stand pleasure send great turk christian knight remember named florian desart deceit hath brought daughter tragiana thence court whose mariage hath already prouided prince albayzar soldan babylon soldane father lately deceased thus haue reported whole summe ambassage attending highnesse shall answere wil agree heathen prince giant haue charge tell perhappes may enforce greater maruell emperour hauing noted word damosell smiling thereat began say truly lady desire heare giant must report perhappes shall haue better opinion word haue spoken concerning amitie princesse request condition lincked many contrary rather chuse perpetuall warre wherein selfe friendes subiects willingly die hold league order knight request haue altogether ignorant abideth hee present court would suffer receiue iniury perswade selfe princesse targiana rather come hither compulsion hath beene vsed answere haue determined giue wherefore let knight declare haue commission one giant aduanced himselfe emperour vnreuerently entred speech heathen prince whose iust law full request thinke scorne grant doe send defiance thee dare vndertake meane motion offer thee succour yea pronounce open warre thee behalfe call god record onely intend thy death dare presume beare armour v place renowne thine empire shall changed wast desolate wildernesse thou shalt well perceiue thou seest thy men murdered thy woman cruelly spoyled thy virgines violated thy child martired yea infant torne mother breast gored top lance witnesse great grieuous vnspeakeable fury channel thy streetes shall powre foorth blood thy murdered subiects thy citie standeth abounding wealth excessiue pride surpassing prodigality shall fire vtterly consumed thy whole kingdomes signory raced ruinated shall escape bloody tiranny may sit downe sighing say sometime stood citie constantinople th se place sometime faire city braue building incomparable habitation rich prospect equalled ground one stone left another witnes ancient monument bu ned consumed generall defaced spoyled thy selfe onely cause cruell horrible iudgement wherein sufficiently satisfied iniury receiued thy citie thus haue manifested charge receiued soldane persia refusing pi pr ffer say thou shewest duty prince thy knight e dare presume maintaine contrarie companion vndertake enter combate seuen stoutest vrge confesse fault thou hast made seale pledge endeuour deliuering thee theyr heades recompence follie thou hast showen refusing enter leag e soldane persia giant breaking speech one giant named berocant deliuered scrole def ance hand emperour seeing stearne countenance made began smile answered thus see gentleman cholericke humour arise stand doubt grant demand beside iudge grant come league soldane persia neece polinarda would consent goe concerning combate haue enterprised knight would wish vse selues discretion shame selues vtterly thinke shame enter fight emperor continued speech knight dragon incensed anger hee could content himselfe rest place wherefore diuers knight arose fully resolued accept challenge giant dramusiande hinderes turning emperour wise high mightie emperour great benignity courtesie prince often occasion encourage wilful offendor euen lenity noble heart gratious patience gouerneth action hath caused presumptuous pagan conceiue boldnesse neither respect place person rigour prince foll owne rediculous vsage punish according desert one gratious command enter field one shall giue berocant vnderstand pride must haue punishment place iustice none knight enter fight selfe defie coming one one thus desiring highnesse thinke amisse hand ready performe heart hath suffred pronounce knight dragon florain desart approched presently dramusiande desiring would suffer assist defending challenge two giant dramusiande seeing well prouided would refuse knightly offer whereat gracian berolde pompides floraman somewhat offended ther none al would gladly haue taken part giant dramusiande giant named arbusar albaroco berocant refused offer made answering giant deale withal disdained take armes men might elorian hearing speake arrogantly chafe tooke arbusar arme saying thou counterfeit monster excuse thy selfe fondly entring combate recompence thy desert present emperor thy head thy shoulder giue thee better occasion fight thou shall vnderstand knight brought princesse targiana countrey knight thou seest knowe hardinesse su er deale albaroco refuse combat dare giant hearing confesse brought princesse targiana countrey became full choler desired place might assigned presently determined hazard fight emperor commanded place showen whereabout caused good regard placed dangerous affaire woont doe somewhat displeasant orian venture ougly follows iudging knight palmerin england great feare least chance lose time knight entring field damosel thrace taking florian aside secretly vsed word vnto sir knight fortune bend selfe dangerous attempt strength doe faile commend selfe clemency lady doubt escape hazard luckily god forbid said florian trust haue power helpe themselues much lesse way send succour prostrate selfe de ice fauour whose greatest libertie continuall thraldome aduenturous minde word mounted horsebacke rode field emperour lady knight hied themselues windowes see hautie exployt albayzar likewise desirous see came one windowes desiring victory might fall giant good hope beholding valiant noble courage chap xciiii happened fight giant iudges placed discerne fight trumpet sounded encountred one couragiously euery one dealing roughly enemy supposed dangerous combate euer seene emperor still affectionate behold marueilous courage knight dragon dramusiande florian behaued themselues deliuer behauiour primaleon florendos knight gaue great praise hautie valour empresse gridonia departed window greatly pittying danger either part princesse polinarda staied see end accompanied targiana much greeued see boldnes florian pleased beholding courage giant whose helpe thought haue reuenged great inconstancy shee found prince florian gaue damosel thrace vnderstand want strength preuaild better triall cup albeit giant arbusar desended well could resist florian saluted many mighty cruel stroke driuing wearinesse could hardly indure stand feete last faintnesse wearinesse constrained retire berocant seeing fellow dangerously wounded began rage himselfe manner god possible force berocant arbusar albaroco highly esteemd throughout whole world brought subiection one giant two knight grant v accustomed strength greatest need leaue v destitute succour happy might esteeme selfe might vanquish sometime conquered dramusiand deliuered number knight kept prisoner suffer haue aduantage ouer would foure best knight earth losing life might better broke hard fortune knight dragon recourse amorous thought beautiful face lady mist e whose vngentle word departure co stantinople armd greater patience abide death froward hap prouide prince body apply thought vnto co mitted himselfe gouernment fortune kept lady mistresse euery one vsing pretty fancy himselfe time remained breathing assalted one another valiantly knight dragon hauing brought albaroco foote honor mistresse conquest opened helmet part head shoulder glad victory stood doubt obtaine aduanced assist dramusiand berocant fiercely let fly st oke often trauersing ground caused blow vnfortunately fall dramusiande giuing greater wound shoulder receiued hand berocant wherfore dramusiand turned word trust sir knight esteeme succour giue oppression friendship wherefore pray suffer end cause selfe perhaps see vanquished put valour triall kill shall remaine victorious ouer death rather chuse shame may fall vngentle manner ayde knight dragon hauing thus iniuried friend dramusiande retired greatly displeased himselfe busar reduced weakenesse florian quickly gaue paiment sore wounded himselfe iudges would haue carried field would consent thereto seene issue fight displeasant albayzar targiana giant cruelly vsed went thence able suffer greeuous sight emperor primaleon king polendos seeing knight dragon wouded dramusiand sore greatly doubted lest berocant ouercome suddenly dramusiand caused change opinion followed enemy great courage forced fall downe dead feete came iudges great honor conducted three conqueror forth field emperor royall traine met palmerin florian hauing opened helmet came emperour great reuerence kissed hand receyued maruellous princely courtesie empresse gridonia bazilia polinarda attended comming emperour vnderstood brought two english knight came receiued according knightly bounty palmerin came humble himselfe princesse polinarda sudden feare ouercharge could withhold himselfe falling ground emperour supposing caused lesse blood commanded primaleon polendos vernar berolde cary presently chamber respected great diligence health dramusiande florian likewise honoured princely vsage emperor remaining ioyfull good hap albayzar sorrowfull see three giant speed ill chap xcv happened court emperour combate giant certaine dayes cruel combat prince florendos seeing dramnsiande english prince danger determined restore shield miragarda place whence prince albayzar tooke present abide doome iudgement well prouided himselfe armour necessary aduanced himselfe emperour father desire sufferance attempt loath goe least danger happen way treacherous meane deuised albayzar wherfore gained stay yet eight dayes longer meane time emperour concluded aduise councell send princesse targiana home againe father accompanied king polendes diuers prince knight first would content desire loue wherefore great royalty married prince albayzar honour held open court caused many triumph braue deuises accomplished gratifie honourable personage emperour ledde targiana chappell gaue prince albayzar whose heart greatly reioyced receiue sweete content long desired chiefest grief eclipsed ioy prince florendos present faire miragarda thought made pleasant beloued otherwise hee would haue beene time came departure targiana humbly submitted himselfe princesse gridonia lady especially princesse polinarda vsed graciously time abyding emperour knight rode two mile citie committing charge polendos prince could perswade florendos would needes present albayzar castle almarol witnes vnfained faith lady mistresse miragarda emperor taking leaue targiana returned traine cittie endeuouring himselfe change mind florendos vaine two dayes departed constantinople accompanied albayzar would suffer weare armour permitted one esquire belonging targiana himselfe tooke twaine one carrie shield miragarda couered carry owne thus iourney intend leaue damosel thrace seeing prince palmerin good disposition health presence emperour spake thus worthy sir thinke sufficiently certified cannot depart hence without company seeing haue finished many yeares haue beene thought impossible wherefore humbly beseech would imploy selfe ende likewise miserable estate distressed infortunate princesse thrace whose enchantment way expelled whose renown shall speake shal ioyne marriage make selfe king ouer thrace perchance desire haue follow aduentures wil suffer ioyn honourable estate shall stand appointment marry one shall thinke meetest wherfore desire set part excuse enter vpon iourney soone possible may faire lady answered palmerin much vsed trauaile know better continue neuer refuse aide person whose intent might preiudice alwayes bound obey therefore assure selfe soone shall prouided armour albaroco hath disappointed stay accomplish desire damosell well pleased answer palmerin emperor wished good nephew conceiued great greefe leaue company soone wherefore went chamber empresse also sorry heard newes likewise prince polinarda hearing palmerin soone leaue court went chamber amated great griefe many passion minde dramaciana perceiuing knowing well cause heauines caine perswade manner faire mistresse neuer thought misfortune could depriue discretion haue alwaies vsed greefe grounded departure palmerin consider desire euer may behold though truth deserueth enioy excellent prince earth yet dare assure beauty sufficient yeeld heart vnder obeysance onely desireth sweet friend loue without good hope desire know could long enioy life perswadeth enioy gladsom long expected felicity wherfore desire vse courteous fauour towards may vrge sooner returne court folinarda hauing receiued content word dramaciana made answer manner well brooke sudden voyage palmerin aboue loue heart giue honour yet make priuy thought albeit sustained hazard death perhaps beauty leo arna princesse thrace may alter affection hath vowed beleeue quoth dramaciana inconstancy cannot harbour heart proued himselfe loyal aduenture cup preuent worst vouchsafe leaue priuate talke vse meanes shall quickly sound depth intent polinarda esteeming deui e returned presently aunswere thinke well dramiciana pretty inuention well content proceed therein loues pray vse circumstance matter sort perceiue nothing therein done polinarda thus concluding speech went sate princesse gridonia mother mean english prince remembring hasty iourney also small kindnesse perceiued lady passed day many silent thought whe euening came went empres chamber knight lady danced duty came sate downe dramaciana familiar entred speech sweet friend either might could vtter complaint opinion receiue redresse verie glad consent would seeing sorrowes grow greater extreame none dare bewray request much courtesie hand resolue one two question thus cause lady polinarda dealeth hardly driue vtter despaire contempt life thinke deserue greater fauour trust may iudge ouermuch vnkind care meane motion lay heart foote loyall serucice seeth full well griefe couereth selfe close conceit seeme know onely either daintie courtesie else thinketh scorne recompence trauell desire beare witnesse faith neither forceth paine torment miserie would forget knight suffreth al sake cannot expresse would suffer might please esteeme thereof trust sweete friend neuer life entered farre speech hereof person would haue gone farre present proofe fidelitie hath constrained speake haue heard knowing well trustie friend secret buried bottome sea sir palmerin answerd dramaciana long time haue absented selfe hence hath mooued thinke mind addicted purpose iudge rather complaine custom cause al wont hold fish baire greatly whether best take let goe aduertised go end enchantment leonarda heire prince thrace whose loue feare cause forget old friend wherefore may greater ease beare small burthen trust answered palmerin beautie leonarda rich proffer preferment world shal haue power alter qualitie might iudged either inconstant faith negligent promise cause haue greater desire speake princesse polinarda may assured loyaltie poore heart mine shall wise king polendos noble prisoner set forward voyage turkie winde seruing well short time arriued citie great turke resident witnesse honourable copany vnder sayle discharge ordinance braue peale people accustomed suddaine greeting came running heapes hauen knowe cause braue warning great turke himselfe desirous likewise vnderstand newes came ryding courtly attendant toward hauen polendos espying tooke faire targiana hand accompanied noble train prince knight armed rich sumptuous order presented father falling knee bedewing face fewe teares humbled selfe kisse feete great turke mooued naturall remorse pitie embraced louingly armes came king polendos company vsing marueilous princely gratious fauour lodging pallace feasting noble wise emperor court thought themselues time better vsed thus continued possible pleasure till day came departure turke vsed intreaty perswaded stay one day longer prepared priuely feast time neuer like passing dinner time talke emperor palmerin also honorable vsage daughter constantinople table sooner withdrawne entred fiftie armed well appointed knight one hauing swoord drawen hand comanding one offer resistance except would presently loose life great turke entred false secret doore giuing speech yeeld polendos grant thy selfe thy company prisoner otherwise shall presently loose heades polendos knight tooke one corner hall keeping sword hand himselfe spake turke order would gladly knowe cause offer v great discourtesie considering well daughter hath beene vsed constantinople also honour haue done conduct safely court polendos answered turke emperor thy lord thy selfe thy friend meane harme offended knight tooke daughter hence greece promise shall depart hence till emperour deliuer knight hand trust quoth polendos hope would stand hard suspence stay condition wherefore esteeme honour end liues face enemy thy vassailes continuall prison hereupon assure thy selfe emperour would gladly leaue knight court satisfie thy desire one hardy noblest knight earth likewise wish much good mine owne soule well sayd turke must resolue selues either presently abide death submit selues remaine prisoner word princesse targiana cast selfe knee father desiring vse cruelty done much honor emperor court also deliuered peril life dangerously assaulted came voyage turke seeing imporunate daughter great anger conuayed forth againe would see slaughter many good knight targiana seeing father gone intreated king polendos company would suffer themselues remaine prisoner abide danger offer resistance naked hauing nothing defend withal time prison would either deuise accomplish meanes doubt purchase liberty vpon good perswasion yeelded themselues presently carryed deepe dungeon strong tower laded many iron could possible beare whereat targiana receiued great griefe cloathing selfe mourning apparell would neuer shew merry countenance time knight prison remained long time shall reade second part booke turke commanded christian galley kept safe sure protection presently sent word soldane persia prince diuers emperours knight prisoner determined sharp reuenge great iniury florian desart done newes esteemed strange neuerthelesse fearefull way displease made resemblance good opinion matter giuing counsell keepe vntill prince albayzar returned else emperour might cause slaine great turke trusted much deuise suffering captiue prince might send esquire emperour palmerin aduertise miserie wherein remained esquire meanes would forsake maisters desiring accompanied prosperity leaue great mischance belcar perceiued commanded esquire go certerfie emperour great mishap befollen vnto esquire come constantinople newes nothing welcome emperor nether primaleon entred word gratious lord father mischance onely procured meanes dealt courteously neither quality motion desert would gladly see thing accomplish way pleasure iudge power sufficient deliuer bondage wherein wherfore thinke best send speed seeke prince albayzar may recouer king polendos knight way cannot perceiue may pleasure profite sonne answered emperour imprisonment polendos knight perpetuall would seeke set liberty meane rather enioy death accomplish might continuall reproach difference alway craue betweene world good may perfectly discerned euill albayzer guilty iniury turke doeth seeme offer knightes therefore honour suffer anothers offence whereat amazed targiana suffer great discourtesie considering honour receiued court deare soueraigne quoth esquire cause complaine intreaty could way preuaile er father whereupon hee rehearsed whole discourse nd manner imprisonment emperour ha ing heard departed empresse chamber rie must forsake returne prince lorendos trauailed long accompanied noble albayzar dominion spaine came faire astell albayzar knowing well began thus open intent sir florendos haue heretofore passed place greatest danger euer fror giuing aide damosell bloody minded wretch sought dishonest slewe ten also lord named dramorant cruell kept castell exployte noble palmerin england florian pompides brother present testifie haue spoken therefore pray let v goe castell assure selfe lady gaue time deliuered danger receiue v courteous friendly welcome content quoth florendos seeing haue place lodge night see neere thus breaking talke rid two stone cast beheld foure armed knight come towards esquire came vttering word prince florendos sir knight great astribor sendeth strait commandement companious presentle yeeld armour vnder obeysance deniall wherof shall cause vse cruelty toward would willingly offer good knight thing doth request except report tydings knight hath aine dramorant brother sometime lord rightfull possessor castle giuen knight damosell keepeth prison till fortune send knight hither sacrifice god reuenge brother death albayzar aduanced himselfe make answere vnarmed florendos thus replied esquire goe tell lord astribor knight would gladly finde well acquainted sure hee hath slaine knightes deseruedly mine armour cannot well spare c ntent shall goe without time except knowledge haue shall returne well said esquire since yeelde gentle meanes must prepare selfe knight appointed sufficient authoritie take armor away perforce refused yeeld according custome florendos seeing knight prouided ioust encountred sent two couragiously measure length ground one slaine outright sore wounded able rec uer himselfe came foorth astribor himselfe brauely mounted seeing florendos destitute launce gaue horse spur ran force florendos constrained fall ground recouering himselfe dealt astribor couragious manner bringing vnder obeysance cut head recompence disloyall actes certaine knight castell seene lord master conquered lett armour coming toward prince florendos reuerent manner yeelded themselues would enter castell lady might come soorth prison whereupon albayzar entred found dungeon cruelly vsed great could remember last shee fell knee reward gentlenesse submitted selfe kisse hand would suffer sustained courteously armes willing thanke prince florendos suffered beare armour lady word fell great rage though distraight wit began thus say cursed hath dishonoured yon credit knightly armes better bestowed linage wherefore thus perswaded lady shall haue losse good knight whose heart aud hand euer ready aide albayzar suffering runne farre praise framed talke another purpose desirous knowe maner astribor happened thither syr quoth shal vnderstand astribor brother dramorant cruell man malicious nature euer giant brother sooner aduertised death ten knight came vnto fortresse finding small force resist entred cau ing found put sword reseruing prison till might chance haue knowledge intended burne v together till might come ordained custome worthily finished albayzar certified euery thing pleasure caused prince florendos vnarmed woundes carefully respected lady good knowledge art chirugery stayed longer prince florendos willingly would place neuer pleasant could satisfie fancy onely place remained best beloued chap xcvii happened palmrin england company damosell thrace svch speede noble palmerin england made company damosel trauailed without aduenture hinder quietly entred kingdome thrace whereat damosell ioyfull seeing euery thing fell fit desired labour spent many yeeres began happily prosper damosell well knowne highly honoured kingdome great resort people came many city townes receiue ioyfully beene long time absent people beholding prince palmerin gaue foorth speech one another behold gratious lord soueraigne happy shall subiects vnder gouernment noble prince remaineth courage clemency shall finish enchanted estate princesse enioy onely queene lady gouerne scepter ouer v according deceased prince appoint palmerin applied whole cogitation might manifest loyaltie princesse polinarda respected honour done vnto though hee good hope ende enterprise intent presently returne lady mistresse opinion rode togither til came city limorsana principall lord ruler came receiue triumphes possible conducting royall pallace respect vsing king emperour came chamber queene carmelia aunt princesse leonarda duty vnto receiued nobly bene owne sonne verily thought marry princesse farre intent english priuce seeing verily beleeue gouernour thrace somewhat offended remembring promise lady polinarda wherefore tooke leaue courteously bowing himselfe queene carmelia went chamber vnarmed siluian damosell came way company supper accompanyed queene carmelia many lord noble gentleman country shewed great courtesie english prince till houre rest came euery one departed chamber palmerin lodging could take rest desired much deliuery princesse leonarda morning siluian armed early lord came chamber found ready depart thence wherfore accompanied chappel seruice solemnized royally archbishop cittie rode neare place princesse enchanted reporting danger feare aduenture chance vnto chap xcviii palmerin tooke way enchaunted princesse happened short time lord brought prince place leonarda remained enchanted beheld pleasant valley company braue stauely tower among greene tree building seeming excellent eye nature could haue inuented gallant thought framed celestiall power rather earthly creature palmerin glad see thing pleasant though sorrowfull absent lady polinarda comparing great felicitie enioy princesse leonarda mournfull thought frequented mind could make choyse nothing onely hope hee fauoured lady whose remembrance caused aduenture promise pleasure hazard doubt could moue feare thing truly great grace discreete man diuers tune see doubtfullest thing haue pleasantest issue seemeth pleasant beginning doth proue sharpest danger ending euen noble prince palmerin contained courage magnanimity mind feare dismaying power supplant thought good fortune suffered returne euery attempt honour one cheefe knight kept company presented himselfe manner worthy sir fortune hath alway beene great friend danger distresse could offer dismay seeme discourage selfe aduenture accustomed prosperity forsake present yet sometime raw proceeding returneth vnexpected vndeserued punishment case standeth noble selfe accompanied great aduised care cannot moue foote vertue shall warrant safety pardon good sir haue beene ouer lauish speech intended issue onely aduertise aduenture perillous therefore craueth heed friendly admonishment better late repentance sir answered palmerin counsaile shewing great grauity foresight esteeme great deale time vtter fortune speede enterprise vnmindfull friendly good promise presented great humanitie enflamed suddaine enuy heart present hope see king began enter dissembling prayses true faithfull subiect would seeme offer began perswade aduenture dangerous soeuer proued might attaine power astonish person declining vainglorious prayses dayly gift workes flatterer courteoussy tooke leaue set spur horse riding towards determination example surely worthy great praise prince ruler liuing earth incline leane onely study sweete word flattering tale false report rest bring asleepe vile exercise painted face would suppresse subiects friend seruants bee equally regarded renowne plentifully encreased accordingly honoured yea vertuous richly rewarded vicious rightfully euer reproched would plaine dealer gouerned haue beene noted good openly discerned euill enioy one hope continuall quiet matter palmerin come somewhat neare place light beganne darken ayre maruellously troubled mistie lord thrace ouercome feare fell beside horse hurt themselues sore made hast citie fast could tho darkenesse likewise terrible siluian palmerin willed stay behind seeing suddaine feare tooke courage would follow maister enchantment would suffer enter saue onely knight power ende siluian forced returne citie hee found people great astonishment happened since departure palmerin remembring wordes ancient knight beganne dislike enstance sharpe euill thought easily finde way aduenture greatly deceiued hee felt paine supposed would haue rent asunder likewise thought finde place power torment beyond loue bare lady found expectation altered inuisible motion dismounted horse wherevpon anger hee drewe swoord thinking preuaile ouerthrew seeing blowes smitten winde thought mount horsebacke againe ride forward labour vaine possible finde horse disaduantage onely swoord taken likewise armour caught away suddaine darkenesse violent hee commoditie goe forward yet goe backe againe place commaunded siluian tarrie chap xcix pwhat happened prince palmerin daungerous aduenture palmerin hauing lost horse armor haue heard already became full heauinesse respect naked hard aduenture required better prouision strength suddaine beganne faile armes legges denied wonted nimblenesse suddaine heard mighty terrible thundering still expected earth would haue opened vnder vpon heard fearefull hollowe voyce looking could perceiue body snatcht vp mighty height still looked violently throwen downe againe feare power hurt greater comfort light excluded darkenesse away found himselfe middest little iland enclosed rounde lake blacke ouglie thought one flood hell neere espyed olde withered tree vnderneath stoode knight armed armour palmerin swoorde like wise hand whereupon began prince order desire syr knight see present meanes thou canst defend thy selfe swoorde mangle thy flesh bone whereon wilde beastes countrey shall feed thy renowne famed ouer whole earth shall take full end none approach beare witnesse thy death prince neuer accustomed feate nowe surprised maruaylous manner whereat maruaile ought bee vsed hee destitute thing defence striue armes enemie hee founde altogether insufficient yet notwithstanding extremitie fortune allotted hee approched knight offering aduenture vppon thought close together darke cloude suddainly ouershadowed palmerin could way discerne knight thinking gripe sword suddainly put hand armour hee perceyued vnder tree knight gone knew way palmerin heereat somewhat abashed seeing aduenture replenished fearefull assault end would changed rigour armed himselfe againe courage strength encreased also minde nobly addicted accomplish mucgh desired light beganne cheerefull againe palmerin discerned faire castell whereto could attaine without crossing ougly lake passe hee coulde deuise meanes woulde stand hazarde life beside banke side steepe approching downe water could iudge himselfe howe get vp w ight armour would great hinderaunce side hee would yet hinder determination hee espyed companie mo ous mishapen beast suddaine fought furiously together end vtterly spoyld killed one another greeuous fight thus ended hee went iland see might haue passage side last espied boate hauing foure ore handled gouerned foure ape eche one tyed mighty chayne one ende boate sate mighty lyon embrued blood though maister conducter passage fed himselfe nothing else flesh passenger palmerin tooke occasion beholde sight espied man farder side cry beastes carry ouer whereat became much amazed thought man foolish hazard himselfe vnder pilote man sooner entred boate lyon straight way rent peeces giuing part companion sustaine life prince stood behold knew determine himselfe sawe way passe terror death behind wherefore seeing remedy hee concluded put himselfe rigour beast shift strength armes sawe himselfe wholly destitute hope heereupon looked hee might discende downe rocke slipperie steepe hee thought way breake necke extremitie hee committed himselfe god afterward mistresse beganne manner madame losse life appaleth hope fauour sustaineth doubte well consider selfe ending life aduenture greatest good euer may happen insupportable paine shall attaine perfect full conclusion yet knowing greefe mollesteth proceedeth none onely fixe ioy comfort ende helpe extreames onely aduancement good fortune heere taking occasion stay hee suffered himselfe slyde softly downe rocke attained riuer side without harme whereupon lyon fellowes came receiue boate hee perceiuing enchauntment drew sword offered resistance presently beast vanished knew way palmerin leaped boate diligence rowed himselfe farther side landed hee cause maruaile hee sawe way get vp vpon rocke walking litle aside hee beheld rope reached ground top slender rotten hee thought able abide waight armour wherefore make lighter determined leaue armor yet knowing occasion haue vse come top rocke bound himselfe middle rope presently hee pulde vp maruailous speede toppe could perceiue drawne vp knew field beast slaine euery thing enchauntment presented cause abate courage fore addicted himselfe aduenturous feare world power dismay chap c palmerin ended enchantment princesse leonarda night palmerin rested himselfe vnder tree morning beheld tower brauely wherefore walked last espied horse tyed tree worse case left mounting vpon rode little hee met two knight without word couched speares first receiued vpon shield knight presently vanished away second burst lance vpon whervpon palmerin followed requite blow sword lost sight like maner knight palmerin looking espied man readie draw bridge passage ouer water made gallop thither apace entred gate power locke hesawe himselfe faire castle aduanced himselfe see brauerie chamber two giant came laid mace enforced fall ground recouering himselfe thinking fasten halfe good blowes gone nothing remaining great smoake caused make lesse estimation thing chaunced whatsoeuer resisted hee would little force comming court castell perceiued little gate high wall whereto must ascend paire staires narrow dangerous man would haue hardly trusted himselfe palmerin desirous see ende labour aduentured goe vp vpon middle steppe walles beganne shake vehemently palmerin doubted whole castell would fall vpon till came top staires enchantment lasted sooner come general terror shew enchantment fully ended palmerin entring little doore came darke entrie great gate made fast great locke boltes iron hard gate lay mightie serpent whose horrible bignesse oughly forme made prince greatly amazed whose necke vpon chaine hanged keyes open gate prince knewe passe gate except might winns keyes terrible porter hee charged many noble stroke serpent breathed horrible veneme smoke hauing prince swoord one nostrilles terrible ore hee slewe one windowes people seeing flye ouer cittie made iudge palmerin painefull trauaile whose good successe prayed often saw serpent gone found keyes ground wherewith vnlocked opened gate entring faire hall perilous isle eutropa cast selfe lake sumptuous castle sage aliart obscure valley might compare rare excellent monument engeniously deuised king thrace walked found thing new bee perfect estate enchantment fully finished last came chamber perceiued certaine damosel talking stood armed man likewise tooke pleasure conferre damosel prince loth trouble entred verie faire garden greene banke faire fountaine beheld diuers lady excellent beautie especially faire young princesse leonarda sooner espied came courteously manner credite sir knight finde selfe largely beholding cannot recompence nobly haue deserued time shall endeuour selfe requite honourable bounty receiued hand meane shall request accept good satisfaction noble deedes imprinted deepe heart shall faile accomplish prowesse hath bound gratious lady answered palmerin beauty nature hath aboundantly adorned withall sufficient content greatest trauailes attempted hardyest knight world fortune allowed lybertie receiue great benefite gratious lady seeing aduenture wonderfull present put past darke obliuion shall intreate tell haue greater danger passe pleaseth present trust shall dispaire accomplish knowing right well hope rich treasure beautie ought reserued knight indewed greater prewesse selfe word procured sweete blushing princesse face whereof resoued replyed thus know sir knight danger sustaine present danger hazard castle tooke end tune came garden breake talke came lord gouernours citty seeing serpent fly ouer citty knew well end enchantment came great maiesty riding castle comming garden humbled themselues knee princesse leonarda offering likewise kisse hand noble palmerin would suffer receiued courteously friend companion queene carmelia sent coach castle wherein princesse leonarda brought pallace vnckle receiued became high estate dignity prince palmerin likewise vsed great honour princely obeysance came camber found siluian little glad see lord sauely returned chap ci palmerin remaineded court thrace request queen carmelia palmerin granted stay court thrace eight dayes time lord fulfill commandement deceassed king went camber queene carmelia whose presence charged duke rialdo giue english prince vnderstand king sardamant commanded fulfilled came prince chamber found talking siluian concerning speedy departure thence knewe appointed next day following making themselues ignorant therof last duke rialdo entred speech lord thinke haue forgotten commandement deceassed king sardamant left performed marriage princesse leonarda neece willing accomplish straight heauie charge also suffer noble prince hath merited graciously ingratefully recompenced likewise part cannot esteeme ourselues happy felicity king rule v whose deed rightly deserue monarch whole world cause considered nominated humbly desire accept owne right dutie see faithfully accomplished gratious king seueraigne happy tranquill estate remaine feared stranger beloued friend neighbour except increase wealth doe alter noble mind alwaies hitherto continued vpright happeneth falling great mishap estimation would lesse accounted honourable pain haue bestowed restore v princesse leonarda queene blotted obliuous report though beene neuer seene done assure sir answered palmerin refuse make accept reward happie fortunate onely verily iudge princesse leonarda ought kept one may better estate wealth worthinesse damosel thrace brought thither standing hearing answere made came vnto manner sir palmerin know right well loue hindreth enioy deed hath deserued causeth muse one peradueture thinketh well onely cause refuse recompence honorable famous labour word damosell seemed reason able duke company seeing could obtaine answere palmerin returned againe queene carmelia concluding giue noble lord enioy princesse leonarda according king sardamant ordained whereto palmerin gladly agreed saying account honour worthy gentleman greatest euer fortune could sent suffering princesse ioyne marriage according minde therefore thus assure yourselues shall bestew prince vpon shall contented receiue lord thrace gaue harty thankes reporting answere queene carmelia made acceptation thereof worthily deserued leonarda somewhat offended would haue fallen anger damosell thrace vsed word vnto faire princesse thinkes thinke ill constant faith loyaltie prince palmerin wil keepe vowe hath made perhaps nothing inferior beauty wealth assure palmerin hath brother prince saire vertuous deedes ioyne marriage know gladly held selfe content damosell vsed perswasions well princesse leonarda well pleased palmerin tooke leaue night would gone somewhat early morning queene carmelia seeing tooke aside thus charged pray sir remember couzin leonarda send lord birth worthinesse hath continually deserued thinke good might cause brought court emperour palmerin esteeme greatest honour life time might happen vnto perswade would wel entertaine faire polinarda neece would likewise greatly delight selfe furthermore chiefe knight world court constantinople would gladly kingdome ruled prince hath bin trained vp famous emperour madame saide palmerin assure emperour esteeme honour highly entertaine according doeth deserue faire princesse polinarda soueraigntie whose beautie power made refuse crowne thrace presented vnto according sage aliart made rehearsall famous aduentures principall noble gentleman throughout realme thrace hartily desired might possible noble palmerin england whose honestie valour knightly courtesie agreeable together fulfill commandement king sardament would haue beene loth contrary thereto consented palmerin made knowne minde secret intent well vnto also princesse intended hee would see especially performed wheron honor stand warrant end gratefully accepting humbled themselues take farewell framing like toward queene princesse departed princely conge rode thousand thought toward constantinople bearing aforenamed deuise tiger shield prosperous iourney leaue returne prince florendos son noble primaleon hauing slaine astribor giuen liberty lady prisoner castell departed iourney albayzar whose company passed realme france without desire approach court doubted king queene melicia knewe would stay longer willingly would therefore continuing way entred kingdome nauarre wherein two worthy knight trauailed two dayes length entred faire goodly valley middest whereof ran pleasant riuer diuerse sort tree planted pleasant beholder sight hereof greatly reuiued pensiue minde prince florendos could bridle thought remembrance castell giant almaroll wherein iewell happinesse remained whose walles spent part youthful time knightly tryall long trauailed pleasant valley within greater delight espied ryuer side strong well fortified castell whereto aduance themselues beheld damosell accompanied two esquiers foote preparing herselfe towards meete florendos perceiuing knowing himselfe armed worst happen gaue forth himselfe nobly meet damosell spake sort sir knight faire arnalte princesse nauarre ladie mistresse commaundeth respect daunger may happen vnto aduenture faile accomplish one three condition wherewith shall present first must returne vnto place whence came shal sweare onely princesse beautie whole world secondly must enter combat way ryde dare maintaine contrarie accept two condition shall make promise neuer beare armes cause wherein knighthood may witnessed merite renowne enterprise neither behalfe distressed lady triall knightly loyaltie thus gentleman cannot put mind satisfie lady must hazard selues endure manifold peril contained within valley wherein either cunning faile sufficiencie noble demaund foile must content selues abide perpetuall imprisonment wherin nothing bitter vnto life nothing better vnto present death heere prouided dare endue themselues hardinesse refuse obey condition haue tolde wherfore gentleman follow aduise would counsel take oath maintenance beauty way impeach dishonour diminish iote knightly valour considering shall iustifie nothing truth wherin neuer faile rid selues great deale trouble surely knight infamous blot assure fall daunger owne folly may well sit repent extreme mishap et power remedy great misfortune faire damosell aunswered florendos take verie great disdaine mistresse commaundeth respect vaine glorious request knighthood standeth vppon better regarde assure take lesse pleasure counsell dread perill confounding lady claime alwaies considered condition may neither demande defend yet aduantage would request would doe much fauour declare ende stately enterprise lady tendeth seemeth immodest wil much shew selfe vnmannerly thrust selfe vnreuerent seruice promise sir knight aunswered damosell enterprise full doubt vnto hardiest knightes conuenient first receiue oathes wee discouer princesse arnalte whereof acquainted hand would aduance themselues promise thing chance lady compell yeelde meere constraint shall beare bad estate depart hand gentle quest daintie making promise damosell quoth florendos well perceiue scope meaning threatning word ensuing danger would bring like yong nouice lady would haue gladly performe surely childish satisfie minde promising one coditions haue rehearsed rather desire acquainted ye difficult danger wherewith seem much menace whereto willingly giue consent rather base minded accomplish commandement may depart tell damosel aunswere returned castell ladie whence short space came forth six knight gallantly mounted armed bearing launce downward approched ye prince florendos deliuered forth speech sir knight thought good lady mistres vnderstad present danger ancient custome vsed place doth bring knight dare seeme denie lady hath courteous demand thou impudent thou wilt needes deny thou shalt well know may compel thee word sweet answered florendos lady may much command much compell selfe neither command compell bid hartily welcome dare doe wordes gaue spurres horse sixe fetched carire good hardy knight florendos likewise prepared himselfe receiue couragiously sooth knightly prowesse first depriued one life short space left destitute lance began take hart fresh setled himselfe manfully toward fiue endure sharpe charge wherewith assaulted fight hereof mooued albayzar immeasurable griefe wished happie maintaine cause good knight would reuenge iniury vncourteously offered perceiued great wished rather presently voyd life want armour extremity florendos enuironed euery side enemy knew well way shun perril vnhappiest thing one horse one knight gaue cruell stroke hee constrained fall earth long recouered feete againe presently tooke himselfe tree rescew himselfe little mallice knight perceiued deliuered vnto speech syr knight tree neither shall defend power therefore slender helpe trust vnto wherefore wee iudge far better render selfe prison lady mistresse suffer great danger see great effuse blood much rather answered florendos endure death making ample proofe noble minde render selfe hand cruell discourteous person wherfore gentleman ordare conceiue good opinion hardines selues knightly fauour let deale one another honesty request honor grant otherwise faint hearted selues dare fight altogether dismount horse shew much vertue honour good knight esteemed aboue brutish manner cowardly mind whereunto one knight presently thus replied see reason sir much presume selfe one v thinketh himselfe able enough compell submit selfe little account make vanquishing deale altogether rather please humor princesse arnalte dishability selues quite man man neuerthelesse seeing haue desire come foote content giue ouer horse wherupon presently alighted came together assail florendos receiued gladly behaued himselfe toward brauely short time reputed left horse florendos long fought discharged one life quickly continued deuoir gallantly sword toward foure one another sent three keepe company length florendos brought last subiection part head shoulder princesse arnalte suddenly came accompan ed domosels desirous saue life knight wherupon spake florendos manner sir knight end great victory haue atcheeued may call name dishonor murdring hath power defend himselfe beseech would giue life knight discourtesie haue suffred fellow amends may made maner put selfe way duty acomplish thing shall like ordaine prouided alwaies honour authority way impeached therby madam answered florendos life granted whe finger giuen person much forget owne honour imploy themselues vnnatural attempt neuerthelesse vertuous honest iesture hath gained much power ouer refuse graunt thing conditionally much honour tel reason cause maintained bad custome sir knight answered princesse arnalte fearing long staying place wound may turne greater daunger expect pray much fauour go castle hauing prouided redresse wound also knight hath receiued faile answer please florendos hauing need succor reason dangerous fight would refuse agree princesse arnalte caused one damoselles see curing wound sooth greater danger might easily trauell day following princesse caused bee buried slain tooke florendos hand walked cheerfully pleasantly disposed courtesie held great reputation hauing made houre death would see married mine owne pleasure contentment attending time withdrew selfe auoyd popular frequentation castle hauing fortune soiourned chanced arriue comely knight braue gallant honest gentleman worthily accompanied vertue prowesse good liking coupled equall loue desired aboue match holding opinion also iustly satisfie lord father commandement ioyning hereunto greatly grace selfe sooth braue knight come castle grant almorall altered nature neuer made account freendship refusing altogether mine honest offer casting remembrance great good contemptuous vnkind forgetfulnesse resemble whose behauiour gained power ouer onely made set liberty first knight greeued far made forgetfull selfe suffered gather fruit garden honour commanded mee keepe better regard furthermore beside farre delighted flattery purpose permitted depart made mee faithfull promise return speedily possible hee would fayl come marry mee attended long time saw returne according promise conconcluded following enterprise perceiued entred somewhat within realme spaine foote mountaine knight standing sadly two great oakes armed blacke armour bare shield white bull fielde sable mounted gallant courser three knight conceiued good opinion would haue approached suddenly esquier stept hauing saluted courteously deliuered minde order gentleman knight standeth dakes giueth vnderstand hath enterprised guarde passage hath kept log time many knight hath desire offer knight discourtesie onely satisfie lady remaineth affectionate loyal obedient therfore may stand liking grant thing demand passage shall libertie enterprise doe contrary put triall make confesse perforce cannot reasonably deny refuse grant declare vnto v quoth prince florendos first wil thy master soone make thee answere hardly determine matter whereof ignorant reason thou concealest closely hee cause confesse answered esquier arnalce princesse nauarre fayrest creature vnder heauen worthy knightly seruice seemes sayd albayzar shall find knight shunne combate castle hath accorded promised fulfill impecious condition therefore iudge mine opinion good cause know assuredly enterprise dangerous ought longer maintained let happen pleaseth fortune sayd florendos afterward turning esquire answered order friend may goe assure maister iouste esquire busie speech prince florendos floraman sooner perceiued returne maister desired florendos would graunt combate knight kept passage request would denie wherevpon floraman gaue spurres horse ran couragiously knight princesse arnalte encountring together great force dismounted earth heeles vpward recouered themselues promptly like good knight set hand sword wherewith began strike one another daungerously vsing knightly dexteritie florendos albayzar greatly delighted behold floraman reputed good knight abashed greatly aduantage happen knight princesse arnalte loue hee fought brauely displeasant floraman dutie like good vertuous knight least princesse florendos albayzar shoulde take euill opinion side knight passage thought bonde wherein loue princesse arnalte tyed harten encourage two knight continued combate long ouercome extreame trauaile constrained retire take breath straunge knight reioycing thereat began vse language towardes floraman know sir knight might better breake saue life depriued shall come confesse princesse arnalte fayrest lady aliue shall iote spared fauour alwayes considered shall confesse truth consent thy answered floraman maintaine thing farre beyond dutie much arnalte faire worthy bee serued much rather thou makest thinke world enioyeth thing compared diuine beautie hath made singular faire princesse nauarre may wise equalled side haue time past loued lady selfe respect whole world filled report prayse rather die accord presumption thou wouldest haue confesse floraman sooner concluded speech returned fresh combat charging one another suriously done could iudged whether one aduantage likelyest win victory maintained sight brauely end knight kept passage beganne little little feele feeblenesse somewhat assailed stroke stroke word turned hand armour broken many place likewise armour floraman better case enemy followed stroke wisely dealt gallantly second charge againe constrained retire floraman accompanied gratious gift imbraceth heart vertuous prince would proue might possible chaunge paragon know well sir sayd knight passage weakenesse see brought giueth hardinesse vse perswasions reproofe greatly affectionate towards princesse arnalte haue deliberated selfe sustaine death graunt vpon occasion enterprised gard passage worthy gentleman answered albanis defer tell sum desire aduertising fortune guided one day valley princesse arnalte maketh present abode rauished beholding beautie remained vowed seruant good wherevpon put three condition approoue wandering knight maintaine prowesse fairest princesse world assuring came place rather desire doe seruice princesse nauarre feare six knight desteny farre vnfortunate fallen hand sir floraman hath made loose hope till houre entertained make profession armes saide florendos ought abashed misfortune befalles assure arnalte
