person ioyned friendship chap iii damosell princesse thrace arriued court emperour palmerin happened knight tiger historie maketh mention emperour empresse chamber accopanied worthiest lord empire damosell thrace chanced enter court seemed much changed saw knight accustomed bee emperor whose feete failed humble selfe incontinent hee caused taken vp presently entertained gracious behauiour hee desired vnderstand thing happened nephew palmerin england aduenture vndertooke leonarda princesse thrace naming caused princesse polinarda giue sweet delicate blush face whose presence damosell thrace began vse language manner rehearse maiestie knightly prowesse noble nephew find selfe ouerthrowne great perplexity know worthy deedes reserued bee deliuered one prompt discreete memorie selfe neuerthelesse discharge great bond friendship wherein princely courtesie hath straitly bound mee report haue seene time companie hee tooke occasion leaue went place princesse leonarda enchaunted hee witnessed knightly valour render name perpetuall honour hauing finished aduenture straunge admirable whole discourse whereof damosell deliuered circumstance emperour giuing vnderstand hard cause distresse eftsoones offered knight tiger came report manner passing lake wherewith isle compassed daunger boate fashion drawn cord ladyes present remained mightily ouercome griefe sweet delicate colour wherewith diuine face plentifully endued began sadly alter thinking great perills noble palmerin england passed putting life extreame point hazard deliuerie princesse leonarda haue heard reported said emperour many strange aduentures haue knowne worthily atchieued time neuer heard life perillous know well imagination king sardamant farre different king well perceyue prowesse palmerin excelleth farre valour knight assure yet neuer saw knight might equalled without great impeachment could finde meane discharge great daungers damsell sufficiently set sale praise thrise noble palmerin eares many gratious personage changed talke manner hath thus woorthily deserued bestowe vttermost endeuor bring within compasse affection princesse leonarda whose good minde altogether placed entertainement princely fauour knight hautie disposition seemeth either altogether blinded owne conceite else heart affectionately placed person assure made account crowne thrace bnt flatly refuse also espouse princesse leonarda brought presence principall noble gentleman court according ordained testament king sardamant grandfather reason whereof lord requested queene carmelia shee would send highnesse princesse remaine company princesse polinarda neece daughter prince primaleon also noble lady wherwith renowned court plentifully enriched whose gratious conuersation may onely entertaine heart leonarda precious dignitie vnspotted vertue also imitating honourable example may highly esteemed acceptable fauour noble personage preferre renowne lady felicitie owne life prince palmerin well liked intent queene caemelia meanes whereof doth humbly desire might stand highnesse pleasure make deniall request seeing haue hitherto ed entertainement fulfilling whereof shall esteeme herselfe whole kingdome perpetually bound excellency highnes may esteem greater truth haue made report commanded present maiesty letter credite wherein full well shall perceiue residue pleasure may like highnesse pardon blunt discourse vneloquent maiden emperour gratiously receiued letter perused thus framed answer damosell vertuous sage lady onely pittie great paiue haue suffered trauelling thus farre also giue thanks good endeuour forgetting honour bountifull courtesie good newes haue brought nephew palmerin regard princely desert vttermost requitall duty desire god power may stretch farre requite according haue worthily merited lady regard caused nephew hold small estimation princesse leonarda know care beyond iudgement deuising meanes might gaine power requite cause great honour desire would yeeld consent princesse leonarda might come remaine court assure selfe well contented thinke selfe highly honoured request better declare gratefull accept comming hither thankfull would great trauaile giue countie salin reason death county arlae remaineth vacant hauing left heir repossesse damosell presently threw selfe emperor foot offering kisse hand signe thankfull mind sustained armes graciously accustomed stranger yet estimation damosell behaued selfe manner duty empresse also toward prince primaleon gridonia witnesse beneuolent mindes honour wherewith would entertaine freendly guest great intreaty courtesie made stay humble offer whereupon returned emperour deliuered mind word hardly withhold selfe instant gratious lord desirous vnderstand couragious mind prince palmerin dealing escaping tiger hideous fearefull also happy end aduenture gracious fauour agreeable desirous thought plentifull measure beyond poore demerit shall leaue report thereof highnesse memory till time returne princesse leonarda assure maiesty heart vnspeakeably satisfied pleasure shall speede well resolued excellencie thing haue long time wished wherefore humbly desire may depart desire haue enforme princesse leonarda gratious fauour causeth iudge euery day yeare till haue cause fulfilled dutie faire damosell answered emperour like well made abode still court perceiue great desire returne answer thankfull message wish selfe whole course iourney damosell humbly tooke leaue emperour company came chamber princesse polinarda secretly withdrawne selfe reueale dramaciana waiting gentlewoman good opinion hart suddenly conceiued ioyfull tidings damosell kept company presently beganne coniecture beautie princesse caused prince palmerin refuse gouernement thrace princesse polinarda modestly began question damosell euery particular chance happened knight tiger whose sake honoured damosel princely courtesie desired shee would bee messenger vnfayned good princesse leonarda whome shee would willingly stay come vnto court presently damosell made promise performe euery thing vttermost departing princesse went palace ledging locked vp honourable present empresse gridonia since comming sent vnto hauing thing readinesse shee departed farre rich ioyfull damosell wee intend leaue iourney returne noble renowmed knight tiger hee departed kingdome thrace tooke straightest way hee could possibly chuse bring vnto constantinople wherto drew somewhat neare chance one day hee arriued great forrest farre house resort people likewise tree much defaced spoyled seemed wast desolate wildernesse ryding along sad pensiue minde heard trampling great many horse casting eye way heard noyse espied ten twelue knight well armed crossing ouerthwart forrest wherevpon gaue horse spurres desirous doe seruice neede vse aide followed way rode short time ouertooke one company could speedily iourney reason horse receiued attaint one legges knight palmerin desired friendly conferre made vse speech maner desire sir may demand bold request report vnto cause knight iourney speedily whither goe vnfrequented forrest know well sir answeeed strange knight enterprise doeth concerne thing therefore needelesse tell haue small occasion demand purpose see acquaintance cause neither impeach mallice pleasure aide content resolue request shall vnderstand sir three league distance place lady courteous creature remaining strong well fortefied castle hath daughter exquisite perfection beautie knight countrey named felistor desirous marrie lady mother suffer bestowed hauing already giuen espoused another rich gentleman countrey named radimar wherefore lady daughter haue consented gentleman goe vnto castle owne secretely knit vp determinate purpose deceiue long laboursome expectation felistor aduertised close intent hath determined hazard fortune extreamest danger either hinder helpe himselfe leaue conquest doubtfull estate may better preuaile fortune darken sunshine good hap hath placed secret ambushment little wood lady daughter must necessitie passe hauing giuen strait charge ambush life radimar put swoord soone may lay hand countenance blemish earnest intent marry damosell despight dare say contrary marriage may better accomplished assist company onely good wil vnfainedly beare fortune contrary fauour horse bath taken suddainly attaint whereby shall hazard breach promise would dislike friend grieuous would happen preuent worst therefore pray sir thinke well lend horse content selfe meane time whereon esquire rideth iudge take mine good part courtesie cause place haue power answerable forget fauourable pleasure truely sir answered palmerin see well doe great pleasure bent vse gift deede greater dishonour better standeth credite defend cause distressed lady instrument whereby honour may receiue disgrace therefore found leaue desirous companion cannot time stay make answere poasted ouertake felistor strange knight perceiuing presently entred speech ala fond foole thou makest ouer much hast entertaine thine owne misfortune simplest thee able sufficient teach thee thy fellowe duty wish soone companion haue giuen due chastisement pride wherewith thou art fondly accompanied thy horse may fall share well teach thee thou oughtest haue done courteous request also may discharge promise made freend knight tiger attained length ground vndestood presumptuous language strange knight yet looked back whereby gaue know ye hauty disposition aduenturous mind moued fearefull foreshew supposed danger contrariwise cowardldy wretch esteemeth euery flaw tempest little motion mischance vtter ouerthrow soueraigntie noble palmerin england pursued knight long ouercharged gloomy fogge night could perceiue follow trackes horse reason whereof constrained alight gaue horse esquire entending repose himselfe well could desolate place vntill aurora faluted beautifull countenaunce vaine bestow labour take rest destined houres sleepe earnest desire defend cause iniuryed ladie would suffer much close eye wherefore day began sooner peepe caused siluian bridle horse presently tooke way felistor company passed could set eye beganne greeuously mooued imitating enioy quietnesse mind till haue deliuered innocent cruell oppressor among deed knighthood beareth largest title honour chap iiii happened knight tiger ambush take damosell valiant knight tiger long pursued search knight almost spent one halfe day meane felistor knowledge giuen secret spy lady daughter set forth way company foure good knight felistor met cruell conflict betweene short time foure kuights al slaine hauing taken lady daughter returned way whence came palmerin seeing could haue sight turned againe met knight talked prince deliuered word see well sir knight either haue great desire meet companion else suddaine kindnesse come vpon returne lend horse receiue much beholding whereto knight tiger answered trust sir much mistake ouer fondly deceiue selfe intend much fauour shall indebted much freendship horse better mine would good borrow whether would would follow intent haue entreprised giue aide whose necessity requires helpe cannot chuse laugh said strange knight perceiue haue fayled way spent whole night purpose onely desire haue meete felistor perceiue comming hitherward hauing lady entended espouse sir shall haue leysure enough present time fulfill wish stomacke serue palmerin perceiuing knight told truth caused siluian gird horse well clasped fast helmet fearing danger might happen prepared himselfe salute troupe came first whereof felistor hauing damosell arme made great protestation amorous good rid weeping bitterly good lady mother sixe knight company felistor foure caused stay lady castle palmerin sufficiently viewed came comfort lady manner faire lady teares greeuous behold present danger hath conquered surpassing pittie must aduenture life deliuery either purchase former quietnesse leaue life content enemy yet haue often heard small force serue chastise person haue regard owne honour confounded enuious stomacke owne disloyall action containe little manhood report knightly dignitie laide brauer conquest owne manifest disgrace felistor hearing knight tiger vse braue language became offended himselfe power make answere middest choller without remembring arme head began fiercely assaile knight tiger saluted felistor friendly blowe head hee cleft downe shoulder valiantly addressing himselfe knight behaued elfe maruellous prowesse damosell seeing prince great danger fearing hee would hardly escape hand gaue palfrey bridle rode solitarily musing along forrest knight tiger perceiuing began much greeue neuerthelesse valiantly dealt knight slaine three rest tooke themselues presently flight whereupon knight whose horse attainted trauell pleasantly iybed prince came humbly yeelded himselfe desiring would remember discourteous word passed whereupon knight tiger according courteous nature gently entertaine lady seeing enemy happily vanquished receiued heart vnspeakeable ioy looked could see daughter ioy presently amated sorrow wherefore might better recouer againe came fell downe knight tiger giuing humble thankes noble succour desiring might please lend assistance till found daughter whose absence remained oppressed greefe danger cruell enemy madame quoth knight tiger attribute honour victory misfortune vnkinde aduersaries alwaies receiue recompence according wickednesse liues deserueth diuine iustice suffer escape vnpunished carelesse comitting heinous offence daughter iudge within forrest therfore good trifle time vaine hastily besturre selues present search promise leaue till haue safely deliuered owne security whereto lady replied see well sir knight vertue magnanimitie shineth brauely noble heart would poore power sufficiencie requite princely bountie neuerthelesse trust god repay good desert farre vnable present yet remaine life time dutifull good shewe acceptable thankes noble commaundement thus lady concluding speech knight tiger siluian lady rode way iudged damosell taken iourneyed day part night yet neuer nearer purpose maruailed stray far feare least honour impeached caused take occasion vpon iudgement might best preserue hauing thus trauailed late constrained alight ease horse siluian presently vnbridle might refresh themselues pasture gaue lord sorrowfull lady prouision sustenance carried wherewith sufficed themselues well could knewe desolate place strange looke courtly dainty faire auba sooner deliuered faire morning sight presently mounted horsbacke rode whole forrest yet finding gladly looked made lady conceiue great griefe knight tiger perswasion could appease wherefore desired goe castle vnfit take vnaccustomed paine wherewith much adoe last consented rode castle arriued euening entrance thereof garded foure knight felistor giuen charge remaine began fresh vexe lady first see daughter vnhappily lost forbidden entrance house two extreames mouing many passion caused repute selfe vnhappiest vnder sunne knight tiger seeing lady great affliction beganne flatter eye knightes showes gratious behauiour custome among aduenturous mindes dissemble intent deuises amiable conceit sometime preuaileth pollicie deedes manifest knightly power fortuned knight felistor came receiue many made venturous chiefest intent haue murthered knight tiger cary backe lady herein found themselues greatly deceiued knight tiger perceiued sooner bride bee let downe entred thereon beganne valiantly charge foure knight setled themselues altogether one began vse word perceiue well sir knight great folly occasion present ending life seeing wilfully come seeke deliuer answerable paiment bold enterprise word knight tiger nothing regarded dealt roughly two quickly dispatched liues fellow fearing least brought like estate cast downe weapon yeelded themselues lady seeing happy successe alighted entred castle greatly abashed noble bountie knight tiger sorrowfull beside knewe recompence great courtesie stood considering small danger sustained deliuer hand felistor company beheld daughter comming conducted fiue knight certaine tent wherto straying happened come damosell gone castle mother knight beheld blood slaine knightes face attached sudden feare would gladly haue beene thence lady perceiued cause dismaying went incontinent hauing imbraced desired would suffer cause doubt arise would shewe thankefull mindes knight tiger deliuered great danger herevpon humbly went saluted prince kept company space eight day end whereof departed thence taking iourny toward place heart desired chap v happened knight sauage man departed court emperour vernar long time since history hath made mentio noble knight florian desart leaue tiger way costantinople returne prince florian departed court emperour vernar greene guilt armour bearing shield sauage man leading two lion siluer field euen according ore knowne sonne prince edward pursued intent hauty desire time carried strange deuise atchieued honourable exploit euer euen first part history hath largely made mention braue knight seeing place famous aduentures fortune conducted realme ireland euen place nobly woon castle three sister daughter marquesse beltamor castle custody others vtterly vnknowne knight sauage man reason whereof constrained lodge cell ancient hermit discoursed vnto two brother giant calsurnien within castle one named brocalon baleato long time beene nourished profound isle mother collambra giuen vnderstand great misfortune happened giant calfurnien camboldam murcela brother losse contrary mother armed themselues like good hardy knight vewing take vengeance much defaced noble stocke might sooner execute bloody enterprise embarqued themselues galley hauing company knight linage length landed coast ireland long known lord castle three sister also belonged brother giant putting sword found within castle fortified theselues great strength lest chance meanes assayled knight sauage man could suffer hermit proceed tale must needes demand question pray good father much resolue one thing giauts vse come forth castle walke delight along forrest certainly sir answered hermit would loth resolue demand question seemeth manifest earnest desire offer combate giant would sorry meanest abilite resist three best knight realme therefore desire affection bent way request would bridle within limit regard remember dishonour noble mind adenture life wilfully wisely yet couer intent vnder title seeking renowne must iudge altogether voyde knightly regard see danger beyond compasse yet desperately throw himselfe hazard trust pittie one well corrected wherefore good sir auoide worst may happen desire let minde remaine would witnesse valour occasion may represent hope victory seeme better equalitie knightly force otherwise shal cause good minde thinke desperate hope hath rather conducted hither carefull aduise way returne victor giant woont walke abroade morning murther one villeinously mangle another hauing sworne continue crueltie vntill meete two sonnes prince edward intent famously reuenged brother slaine hand perceiue father said knight sauage man make conscience condemning aduenture liues redeeme wretch estate poore soules suppressed cruell tyranny remember selfe armour ought borne onely imploy pain succor way able shield themselues order knighthood giuen v end faint shadow conquered wordes see deedes wherefore father perswade selfe fortune shal sooner present occasion put hap aduenture word aged hermit began shed teares see could remooue determination neuerthelesse laboured still perswasion paine bestowen small purpose full intreatie resolutely bent passed away night friendly communication morning florian preparing himselfe depart time heard great noyse without cell going doore espied damosel came hastely riding seeing knight sauage man came vnto succour egerly pursued giant brocalon white armour well mounted lustie courser alighted speaking thus damosell see well damosell haue taken place small assurance selfe knight deliuer hand doe presently perceiue estate displeasure whereto knight sauage man thus answered trust syr deceiued farre perceiue none oweth dutie much lesse stand feare doubt disloyall tyrannie thou vsest shall well enough tempered ere thou part wordes caused sore combate betweene brauery whereof much delighted aged hermit still prayed good successe happen knight sauage man gallantly hee continue fight giant enforced take breathing acceptable prince shielde greatly defaced himselfe surcharged much trauaile yet farre better state giant seeing blood trickle downe armour fast began vse speech come passe one knight hath power preuaile much certainly feare hope haue alwayes vanquish knight slew brother one knight brought doubt yet must needes end life rather might one handes valour carrieth large commendation knight vtterly vnknown thus concluding began charge knight sauage man rough forcible stroke notwithstanding duly awaited oportunitie length brought enemie vnder subiection taking helmet presently parted head shoulder sight hereof small ioy aged hermit also damosell came humbled selfe prince manner vnpossible sir knight render thanks according worthy desert neuerthelesse report laudable language knightly deedes court vernar emperor allameigne whither present direct course fame shall remaine continuall memory gladly would bee acquainted name earnestly desire two cause one might exactly discourse noble valour amazement cannot deserue well might know noble gentleman whose gratious bountie might repay contiuuall prayer faire damosell quoth prince desire knowe name may doe seruice vttermost power declare vnto rather cause assure deedes small estimation credite may worthily cast discountenance giue praise hath pleased vtter let seeme eares vnaduised speech present necessitie must disclose mine eye heart haue tasted fierie plannet rather let obtaine acceptable opinio beliefe modest thought remaining captiue mercy may finde ready pittie beauty wound vpon speech hermit tooke occasion begin thus sir knight deepe point wisedome flee subtill temptatio beautie glorious eye grieuous heart sweete conceite sower triall reason iealouzie frenzie beggerie murder many mischief always waiting yokfellowes haue already escaped one extreame danger like fall greater one could haue beene hnrtfull body hangeth waity soule remember son thy fall grieuous thy selfe father said prince beautie familiarly welcome eye men see haue power escape delight agreeable heart likewise flint would mooue affection euen contemplate heauenly grace beautifull damosell could otherwise chuse offer selfe humble seruant refuse doe perswade selfe good nature altogether forsaken also might iudge colde kindnesse could moued forcible motion see well quoth hermit pleasure flesh make thee forgetfull health thy soule wherefore pray thou maiest conuerted time least thou feele punishment thy follie late thee helpe thy selfe whereto prince answered thus pray father tell conquere earthly delight sit wresting many matter study wil looking booke abate secret inflamations heart haue heard many calling profession haue laboured kill learning hath quickned themselues seeking draw throne anothers heele haue prickt themselues therwith heart tush father religious reason haue seen olde billet burne fresher young bauen holinesse inueigh secret delight loue would take heretique good argue shew folly allow declare wisedome well quoth hermit betake selfe oratorie youthfull worldly pleasure desert whereof doubt end reward went cel making speed til shut doore giant brocalon beene aliue againe followed wherat knight sauageman laughed heartily comming vnto damosell began salute tearmes could wish faire lady seruant kiude mistresse might shall like allowe seruice sooth iudge would like behauiour doe content auoide pleasure worthy sir answered damosell cannot much ingratefull great good defending greatest distresse power must witnesse shew thankfull minde mean time desire haue company two three dayes till place great danger shall account selfe highly beholding lady quoth receiue great pleasure courteous answer thinke selfe happiest man liue attaine bountie wherewith presently tooke horse causing esquire mount damosell way recounted prince florian tempest sea cast coast ireland comming denmarke carrying letter e edise basilia empresse allemaigne perceiued quoth countrey couzins daughter marque baltamor remained intended bestow little labour seeing ortune hard met giant brocalon contented murdering two esquire bare company pursued haue fulfild villanous wil good hap reskew thinke selfe beholding expresse prince taking hand returned answer promise faire lady reioyce fortune seruice doubt shall finde gentle companion guard person danger may happen would either happie courteous giue liberty prisoner singular beautie hath secretly fettered continuing pleasant purpose speech last came goodly riuer pleasant sight whereof inuited alight horse ease themselues little sitting louingly together prince began amor usly dispose himselfe toward sober chasle damosell meane esquire went castle neere hand prouide viand maister fasted since came hermit cell refused haue damosel sweete company many affable speech prince spent damosell might better entertaine fauour length bold giue greene gowne feare lost flower chastity whether know mine authour saith esquire departing left maiden comming againe found woman chap vi happened knight sauage man taken farewell damosell svch great pleasure knight sauage man conceiued presence damosell night passed time away riuers side till length prince began waxe heauy sleepe like vnto entertaine loue present time rather suffise appetite thing else made small account louers passion humour satisfied presently forgotten damosell seeing prince vse regard vnto fell extreame conceite greefe lightly bestowne honourable chastitie knight feared would commit courtesie vtter obliuion shuld happen vnkindly quoth vnworthy shew face among person credite wish present losse life might falue vp staine blemish former rich heauy pittifull discourse continued time knight sauage man slept soundly last looked espied two esquire attending knight huge stature seemed exeede giant brocalon walked many time would stand still muse himselfe pull rent haire one would haue iudged depriued wit last extreame passion called esquiers commanded wait ther neare vnto would repose himselfe vnder tree hereat damosell greatly abashed standing feare awaked knight sauageman wordes good knight forsake drow sine danger nearer thee thou art beware another brocalon come iniure v therefore helpe neuer defend v word prince suddenly started vp put himselfe good regard enemie hee aduanced himselfe neerer vnto seeing esquire walking horse maister lying vnder tree great griefe minde stayed himselfe secret heard breake foorth speech see great folly repose credite god either want power else wilfully bent euerthrow hath trusted good cause haue thinke brother vanquished one onely knight make small estimation fauour suffer meete might either beare brother company take reuenge griefe nature compelleth chuse blaspheme name deny giue honour haue done suffer knight much dishonour v haue altogither cast obliuion wil honor altar testimony affection trust repose selfe euer henceforth despise heauy complaintes caused prince iudge baleato brother giant brocalon hauing intelligence brother death sought finde done deede good hap acceptable prince found without knight aid walking aside baleato last espied made arise speech dare imagine himselfe hardy trouble silent purpose assure thee thou art little beholding fortune thy vtter enemy conducting thee hither especially time fury thou wilt find greeuous thou art able endure damosell keep thee company haue good occasion receiuing part g eefe meanes one appeare anger god offering sacrifice deale sexe meete brocalon best knight world slaine following another baleato answered prince reserue threatnings affraide thee prepare thy selfe deale neither word weapon terrifie damosell assure thy selfe onely defend also humble proud min e make thee thinke none good thy selfe shalt thou learne vse thy better deale courteously people countrey mooue mallice greater thou shalt vnderstand hath slaine dalfurnien brocalon thy brother haue good hope send thee wherefore put thy selfe readinesse entertaine much disdaine haue aduantage thee thou proudly thinkest vnable deale thee giant extreamely moued heare braue language prince began rage manner thou cruel destroyer blood thou maist assure thy selfe haue thy presence greatest enemy vnto thee world therefore shew vttermost thy manhood carry hope bathe hand mine thy blood beside rent thy cursed heart peeces throw foode fowles aire began fierce cruell combat wherein prince nobly behaue himselfe forcible stroakes giant deliuered te small purpose length perceiuing subtilty prince vsed beganne strike vere roughly swoord broken three piece body wounded diuerse place whereat damosell much displeased doubting least see ende valiantly defended prince seeing himselfe danger cast shield receiue mightie stroke giant gaue blowe lighting shield entred farre could pull againe prince perceiuing closed driuing still backward till came riuers side strooke leg fell ouer bancke water waightinesse fall head going forward brake necke small ioy damosell also prince reioyced rid enemy mounting horsebacke rid againe cell olde hermit prince woundes somewhat dangerous meane esquire baleato returned knight castle giue vnderstanding master death hee slaine brother brocalon likewise dispatched come cell good olde hermit albeit somewhat offended prince yet receiued louingly poore bed caused lie vsing good regard vnto within fewe dayes dangerous estate well recouered desire prince would suffer damosell depart iourney giuing vnderstand might trauaile without danger knowe selfe giant slaine also said stood honest report keepe company knight armes whose affaire lay many sundry place decent honour seene effeminate order prince well content depart albeit damosell found selfe greatly agreeued vse estimation hauing sealed fort maidenly honour none power obtain neuerthelesse saw remedy forced make vertue necessity teares tooke leaue prince feigned himselfe amourous speech sad sorrowfull departure chap vii knight belouged giant brocalon baleato surrendred vp castle vnto noble knight sauage man happened prince florendos arriued castle giant almarol remained faire princesse miragarda next day following knight belonged giant intelligence death lord whereupon presently determined themselues go see knight sauage man would entertaine fauour since refuge defence left wherin might repose hope assurance concluded surrender vp castle hand knowing themselues farre vnable withhold determination came hermit cell found knight sauage man lying bed well disposed comparing yong yeeres noblenesse late exploites receiued great cause admiration last iudged himselfe hardiest courage amongst suddenly entred speech deny sir knight fortune hath entertained especiall regard seeme much forgetfull selfe puissance brocalon baleato two giant reputed small courage noble hardinesse brought vtter confusion therefore remaineth chosen argument onely hath called dignity fauour also maintaineth affection towards inestimable bountie let seeme hardie offer checke reproofe valour best fortune vnlike equall let rather imagine themselues happy may deserue good countenance worthy champion due consideration hereof hath constrained v enter hardinesse come present selues noble mercy good opinion guided v hath worthily ouercome remaineth honour famous conquerour staine laudable title offering discourtesie humble themselues obedient seruants signe whereof receiue hand keyes castle lord sometime enioyed withall receiue hearty good affection remaine onely noble comandement courteous word prince returned answer speech honest well repleate shith ciuill courtesie sorry present case suffer let vnderstand thankefully accept great gentlenesse shall beare company court england cause king grandfather satisfie dishablity suffer tooke keyes castle wherewith much contented seeing issue fortunate beginning seemed doubtfull knight still kept prince company respect honourable promise made wherof little glad hoped gaine good fauour court england report noble conquest short time blazed mooued generall consent gladnes much recouery castle woon prowesse prince florian good king fredericke ioy good happe sent court prince florian good estate health newes came vnto english court imprisonment king polendos companie court great turke vnhappy tidings moooed king whole court great greefe considering withall state sorrow wheren emperour constantinople remained extreame take cause respect small hope liberty againe great turke sworne put death except emperour would send knight boldly carryed away daughter princesse targiana newes comming eares prince florian began fall speech far better go render selfe suffer extrame rigour cruell infidell many good knight liue danger seeing occasion cause first arise better meane salue vp againe selfe cannot beleeue sayd prince edward turke forgetfull himselfe seeke death many small matter reason albayzar one owne kindred stand hazard life report goeth emperour ought carefull keeping albayzer end safegard life might redeeme woonted liberty whereto prince florian thus replied perswaded good father turke hardly remooued determination maketh greater misdoubt safety knight absence assure greeuously offendeth good emperour perfectly resolued goe comfort considering part dutie behalf farre time seeing depriued defend aged king fredericke father edward mother priucesse flerida could disswade determination contrary wils departed court taking iourney toward constantinople armed accustomed maner bearing sheeld vsuall deuise thus happy successe may fall vnto time intend leaue returne prince florendos time wel neere castle giant almarol hauing iourney done many noble deed deseruing commendation rehearsed english chronicle would seeme impertinent place rehearse neuerthelesse must need tell yee floraman prince sardignia iourney atchieued great renowne continued till arriuall city rioclaro present called tamar florendos seeing himselfe neare place spent great time languishing affliction entred thousand imagination himselfe first considering beginning loue happy continuance thereof enforced number sad coniectures wherein passed night quietly could morning rid toward castle almaroll albayzar beganne vse doubt entertainement iudged woman slenderly acquainted pittie especially hee looked small fauour princesse miragarda contrariwise cruell towardes stranger shee toward dearest best beloued friendes florendos sooner discouered tree planted riuer thesin walles castle almaroll heart immeasurably touched suddaine feare remembring many stormes endured perilles whereto must render himselfe againe afresh spectacle certainely woonderfull griefe wherein somewhat bare prince albayzar company remembring vanquished knew remedie himselfe abide mercy miragarda come castle found gate fast locked wherevpon went tree shieldes hanging well beholding florendos last espied owne sight whereof secretly sighed imagined might thankfull sufficient esquire armello since departure well garded sooth much beholding esquier esteeme himselfe armello fallen amorous lardemia damosell attendant faire princesse miragarda stayed place contemplate beauty beloued mistresse rather care maisters sheeld armor gone farre ouer shoe loue pleasure remembrance damosell tooke great delight see greeuously attached loue armello shas set fire affection could know lord maister cause hinder disguised blacke armour perceiued prince floraman likewise espyed sheeld princesse miragarda presently coniecture blacke knight lord prince florendos reuerently drew neere vsing speech hope good lord haue occasion hide self hath earnest affection seruice specially hauing recouered rare iewel sheeld faire miragarda whose commandement made departure place well worthy impeached high ingratitude fauourably entertaine hath nobly worthily deserued florendos able conceale himselfe longer opened helmet embraced esquire armello deliuered sheeld miragarda willing set place woont stand prince albayzar discourteously tooke away bad also take sheeld princesse targiana set feete portraiture miragarda little offend prince albayzar behold length came foorth castle giant almarol well armed gallantly mounted white courser supposed three prince came demand ioust beheld sheeld miragarda place wont suddainly abashed knew well say last knew prince florendos reason lifted vp beuere helmet whereupon cast lance ground stretched armes came embraced prince florendos entertaining word alwaies perswade selfe worthy renowned prince florendos would bring end honorable exployte perceiue haue happily atchieued desert laudable knightly princesse miragarda cannot otherwise chuse requite better entertainment done heretofore continue former obstinacy vse gratious acceptation towards noblenesse doth worthily merite duetie commandeth fauour shake honour name speech importance world shalbe acquainted monstrous vnkindnesse hope beare company iustly condemning affoord great disloyaltie good knight thus breaking speech without staying heare answer prince presently ran castle declared princesse miragarda noble knightly returne loyall seruant florendos newes enflamed heart vnspeakeable ioy neuerthelesse dissembled matter sort though made account thereof giant perceiuing slender estimation seemed haue florendos also bringing backe againe sheeld able withhold choller longer began touch highly princely seruice florendos vniuersall praise owne renowne witnessed true testimony inuincible minde countenancing small regard notoriously impeach herselfe ingratitude iniuriously requite deserued well word seeme nothing moue resolute hardy countenance gaue show giant lady mistresse selfewilled conceit albeit within selfe remayned greatly affectionate prince returne modest shamefastnesse discoured giant made matter regard giant little vexed great fury foorth presence much accusing obstinate minde comming prince florendos could hide great discourtesie miragarda prince contented himselfe withall woont haue entertainement would dispatch cause albayzar desired almaroll goe againe lady know pleasure concerning caried away shield brought backe againe giant presently returned princesse giuing vnderstand knight caried away shield brought thither backe againe noble prince florendos desired knowe done miragarda taking little pause last commanded albayzar brought persence florendos abide without albayzar come straitely charged goe yeeld himselfe prisoner vnto king recinde especiall good lord faile goe thither remaine prisoner vntill great turke set liberty king polendos al knight receiuing oath would faile doe commanded willed depart wh giuing humble thanks fauouring much considering offence deserued greater punishment offered gently kisse hand would suffer departed come foorth againe castle take leaue prince florendos cast protraiture princesse targiana without many bleeding sigh heart countenance iesture bewrayed extreamity suddaine pa ion great stood rehearsing himselfe amorous conceit wherewith meruailously charged last desired almaroll doe much fauour goe intreate princesse miragarda might stand pleasure suffer shield best beloued targiana hang rancke among conquered respect deserued dignitie case would shee agree request highly esteeme selfe superioritie aboue lady whereof albayzar certified departed choller extreame melancholly thirteenth day departure castle almaroll arriued court recinde king spaine receiued princely courtesie vnderstood sent cause little pleased thereat king polendos might haue libertie againe also sonne prisoner amongst knight newes presently caused emperour constantinople aduertised set former griefe apart reioyce custody one bring home againe knight prisoner turke emperor greatly commended pollicie princesse miragarda wished might possible haue company court well regard honour equall worthy desert also mittigate affliction nephewe prince florendos desired alwayes fulfill occa n might witnes faithful seruice perceiued lady made account trauailes neither regarded torment endured sake determined guard shield againe vntill knight purchase office triall valour misfortune happened great receiue folie new attempt vowed neuer beare armes euen commit whole course cruelty fortune seeing would allow one fauourable looke chap viii combat prince florendos fought second day enterprised guarde shield princesse miragarda prince florendos passed one day castle almaroll without friendly countenance lady comming presence began commune himselfe hard fortune little hope gaine desired ioy frowardnes cast contempt faithfull seruice second day expell heauie thought wherewith grieuously charged came place shield faire mistresse aduisedly behold vttered complaines manner knowe certainely sweete lady bestoweth time seruice receiueth grea compence hauing meanes behold faire image portraiture power sufficent bring subiection heart hard adamant goddesse would affoord fauourable word vnto sometime image made pigmaleon highly might manifest courtesie precious iuell enriched withall gained great honour see well haue preuented happy cause remaineth net entangle mindes liue free thraldome extreamitie party inueigles desireth well comforted gratious speech gratiously tormented silent counterfeit depriueth former felicity seeing remedie must feede mine eye entising shadowe satisfie fancy midst shadow behold thing mine eye dagger stabbeth heart leaueth depriued mean might adde ease misfortue albeit portraite dumbe sencelesse cannot would could perceiue heauy aflictions yet fond conceit maketh weary wretched life hauing played mistresse thereof deuoutly thought stead th person reuerence picture thinke dutifull would selfe forward esteeming shadow foresaid content welcome perswaded tooke delight therein hardly beleeue long absence seruice presence offer dutie worthy looked maketh thinke haue committed forgetfulnesse therefore account vaine mourne longer seeing affection haue alwayes faithfully borne rewarded vnkinde recompence prince florendos continued sad discourse princesse miragarda secretely behelde hinke windowe woont arise earely morning heare pleasant noates pretty chirping bird would come sing tree planted riuers side shee perceiued grieuous lamentation proceeded depth heart somewhat abashed thereat yet sort neuer pittie dollorous estate proud opinion held selfe greatest desartes world sufficient answere beautie neither florendos could endure much griefe mercilesse iudgement passion loue carefull prince abiding woonted mones sudden heard great noyse farre among tree caused breake amorous lamentation aduanced see matter espyed three knight come riding attired rich costly armour first greene armour shadowed siluer beautifully shield bare deuice word writen greeke letter normandie armour second white azure mingled together artificially streames greene enterchangeably figured thereon sheeld field sinople liuely pictured god apollo ancient habit armor third carnation colour beset crossets gold gallantly sheeld field g ules bare deuise orpheus wrapped flame hall ingeniously made wanted nothing life grace picture two foremost knight came singing pleasantly prince florendos tooke great delight heare accorded good musicke together prince floraman well seene art commended aboue euery heard life sweetly voyces consent together beside eccho riuer tree mountaines answer note familiarly almost commendable instrument princesse miragarda standing window tooke great pleasure heare much comfort sad mind prince florendos prince sardignia somewhat acquainted song tooke knife engraued barke tree worthinesse thereof might remaine till time consumed tree tree grew bignesse letter might seene leageable maner finished well owne content marke perfectnesse song rehearsed himselfe forme following song two knight sing came riding castle giant almarol engrauen tree floraman prince sardignia faire madame vouchsafe see liuely picture carefull minde lorne griefe looke iudge fortune vnkinde sue serueth faithfully repaide extreame cruelty wh greater torment gentle minde scorned liketh state refuge hope finde thing doth misfortune boast condemnd confounded rebuke blame yet ignorant whence cause came heauy waighty yoake loue queintest lookes affoord discourtesie wise doth passion proue yet keepe himselfe libertie whose wit rauished stealth need physick greatest health men loue commend happinesse quiet sweete delicate delight boast fortune frowardnesse extreame rigour seuere despight sweetnesse men haue felt came late part else dealt yet say man hath beene iust serud lady due regard gouerned owne mistrust denies seruant desirde reward misfortune waxeth yet suffer though die therefore finis three knight sooner espied prince florendos walking castle almaroll prese tly left singing pulled downe beuers helmet doubted known came tree shield hanged began greatly commend valour whose noblenesse gained braue prize length knight greene armour stedfastly beholding portrait faire miragarda began brauely vse language thus beautie heauenly face picture represents authoritie sufficient bring obeysance heart neuer thought loue yea worthiest knight whole world albeit minde farre otherwise sawe mine eye hath beene daily comended much mine eare neuertheles knight hath enterprised defend rich treasure dare hardy breake couple lance doe endeuour becometh good knight condition prouoke doe iniury willingly would feare lady oweth faire picture would seuerely punish offering offence knight contrariwise shee entertaine especiall fauour take vpon enter combat prince florendos thus replied pitie sir put foorth good minde seeing stomacke serueth wel purpose ready prouided ioust force greatly bestow breaking launce two therefore take field pleasure sanctifie request word parted fetch course met together force launce slewe vp ayre piece passed brauely thing shaken first encounter giant almaroll seeing destitute launce caused brought forth castle deliuered esquiers went serued lordes withall valiantly met againe breake launce second time encounter forcible prince florendos lost one stirroppes side danger haue fallen besides horse neuerthelesse knight greene armour measured length ground recouered himselfe againe quickly measure displeased fall drew sword word syr knight made meanes summon ioust albeit foyle hath happened yet offended thereat much honour let v trie one another sword ende good hap vanquish valour shall haue larger estimation knowe answered prince florendos gentleman company esteeme request see preparing themselues offer ioust therefore let intreatie time perswade desire shall haue time enough trie manhood together shall thinke selfe greatly aduantaged finde selfe ouermuch iniured thus concluding gaue horse spurres ranne couragiously knight white armour mingled azure sooth receiued brau ly breaking launce great force prince florendos lost stirrops yet recouered himselfe well enough fall knight stroke prince horse sell together horse tumbling vpon somwhat hurt one leg florendos prouided himselfe another lance gaue signe third knight encounter knight perceiuing somewhat moued misfortune companion failed put himselfe vpon aduenture courteous regard fellowes first offer missed meeting whereupon tooke second careere worthily ech brake lance brauely passed third encounter prince floraman almorall made great estimation noble behauiour e three knight vsed likewise princesse miragarda much commend noble exploites florendos knight shewed presence knight desirous try end fortune began aduance himselfe forward like prince florendos met together couragiously knight dismounted earth prince florendos litte better case caught hold themane horse bene forced beare knight company escaped fall well well mounted againe knight first iousted came vnto word earnest desire sir knight try fortune find selfe much agreeued till haue felt much sword haue done lance therfore gentleman one hath worthily de erued knighthood let gaine much fauour hand presently would satisfie request prince florendos shaped answer language accompanied great honesty cou te e beside esteeme thereof well would great blemish mine honour deny knighly desire alighting horse drew sword enter combate knight bare shield deuice apollo stepped betweene sort noble florendos haue good occasion content selfe victory much haue woone especiall friend would haue know offended mischance vanquiwed prince great singuler prowesse may better perswaded word shall vnderstand earnest prouoking combat deere friend prince berold brother prince platir great paine thanke haue honoured trauaile worthy company selfe humble seruant sage aliart obscure valley knowledge soone see yet would make shew thereof desirous selfe vnknowne end faire princesse miragarda might yet behold knightly valour esteeme according noble desert prince florendos come open window looke forth priuy secret place greatest felicitie might see fiield died blood came contend singularity beauty triall whereof little proud victory returned alwaies made take greater deilght perceiued liues tried combat stand danger oftentimes behold sundry combat fought castle three knight continued still talke last told entertainment princesse miragarda afforded prince albayzar better content thing else greatly desirad liberty great turke hold prisoner whose cruelty knew would seuere mittigated meane spent day hope see princesse could way accomplish desire knowing beside floraman concluded still guard sheeld faire mistresse miragarda durst come vse controuersie therewith stil bemoned hard fortune true faithfull seruice could better esteemed chap ix strange aduenture chanced castle giant almarol happened prince florendos history report three knight iousted prince florendos linger loyter place til came greece farre cittie constantinople chance trauailed met leonarda princesse thrace worthily guided many noble gentleman imployed themselues knightly seruice gaine good opinion princesse others vttered many amorous conceit inueigle fancy towards marriage passed away time till arriued con stantinople princesse entertained maruailous great honour history doth make mention hereafter royall receiuing citty speake thereof returne againe prince florendos walking along riuers side take fresh aire next day three knight departed espyed two boat well furnished oares foremost wherof sate foure damosel attired sumptuous apparell sitting poope end boate sounding tuning lute whereto voyces deliuered pleasant ditty might well haue bene compared three knight taken way constantinople stayed still castle almaroll haue made triall drew neare castle men besturred oar merily lady continued pleasant song often making signes courtesie towards boate couered tilt surpassing rich vnder pauilion inestimable value sate lady pillow cushion veluet imbrodered gold whose countenance sooth maruellous beautifull shewd gouernes ouer light robe carnation taffata cut layd beautifull silk seemed great costlines value beholder reason wanted gold pearle precious stone set forth vttermost might better discerned heate day past sunne declining neather region gaue commandement mantle pauilion lifted vp prince florendos floraman might behold exquisite perfection beautie feete might see sitting cloath blacke veluet two aged gentlewoman betweene sat faire damosell side lay seemely knight greene armour bearing shield deuice field sinople cupid fast lincked chaines gold bowe arrowes lying broken piece knight himselfe seemed man altogether vanquished ouercome damosell aduanced selfe aboue marriners brauely decked colour ladie whereof may say little proude behauiour seemed pleasant accident soeuer could haue power change great shewes delight brought boates side castle continuing sweete harmonie eccho water gaue acceptable noyse eares windowes castle stoode behold two prince florendos floraman thought time long till might haue knowledge lady especially prince florendos earnest desire knowe knight boate casting armes together thus communed himselfe mind e treamest rigour misfortune reserued adioyned lament others reioyce daily hourely tossed surge vncertaine chanches one else haue harbour hauen happinesse speake amisse let world enter iudgement first whole course life knightly seruice reuerent dutie haue alwayes borne mistresse yet haue gained one haue lost speciall argument altogether vnfortunate hee would haue proceeded furder secret complaint floraman stayed friendly imbrasing walking together behelde come boate lady sate modest ciuill damosel boate came two esquire vailed bonnet lady mistresse went orderly together damosell came two prince esquire reuerently dutie damosell gaue gracious salutation passed last came tree shieldes placed damosell beholding portraite faire miragarda turned esquire word diuine motion vnequall beautie causeth enter hard opinion lady mistresse returne greatly displeased arriued suppose pleasure base stone saint vincents rocke may presume paragon selfe pure perfect diamond shee proceeded towards castle windowe reason suddaine aduenture princesse miragarda stately placed haue deliuered message maruailously damped glimpse singular beutie occasion pausing thing strange woman quickly abashed simple cause therefore worthy fanourable conceite damosel attained hardinesse yet without maidenly ciuil bashfulnesse saluted princesse miragarda speech let seeme faire princesse offensiue gracious eye thrust selfe presence bold maner countrey maiden sildome acquainted courtly quality beside messenger pardonable audacitie must vsed declaring message therefore presuming noble fauour omit needelesse prolixious phrase incident matter haue disclose neither necessarie offend care long tedious protestation shall therefore vnderstand gratious princesse arnalte princesse nauarre especiall good lady mistresse kisseth hand excellencie desire hath doe seruice spend sometime farre famed commended company hath beene bold trauaile thus farre arriued small traine attendeth daring enter land presume castle first resolued stand good liking affoord entertainement otherwise loth offend returne whence came word princesse thus replyed faire damosall request honest commendable part esteeme well thereof yet lyeth grant lady request small greefe vnto assure comming princesse nauarre acceptable greatest good fortune world beside might happen concerning friendly desire trust custome castle flatly entrance well defended woman whose company strange men daily imploy themselnes deed honour good affection bare lady mistresse presume selfe breake custome giant almaroll whose authority stretcheth mine sure would wise agree thereto therefore desire imagine ill grant lady request great trust committed knight without perill none must enter castle pray returne acceptable thankes lady excusing allowable answer may assure griefe greater iudge imagine destitute power accomplish courteous madame answered damosell shall faile declare large princesse arnalte gratious pleasure doubt well accept friendly aunswer rather daunger greater presume vnaduisedly owne peri l highly bound courteous nature sending forewarning humbly tooke leaue princesse miragarda whose answer thorowly deliuered lady mistresse whereat receiued great vnkindnesse would hardly suffer damosell report allowable sufficient excuse princesse grew great melancholly neither one might speake vnto knight greene armour perceiued arose began thus pacifie madame ought take euill part princesse miragarda maketh refusall entry castle perchance fraide least beauty staine blemish know doubt standeth way seeme vnwise committing hee case great hazard wherefore pray let perswasion imagine cause deniall quietly content choller remaine vpon stomacke word knight vsed force eares princesse arnalte contented selfe answer damosell brought would presently depart thence without seeing occasion commanded knight go place shield hanged thence bring shield wherein princesse miragarda pictured shee would carry away knight esteemed commandement highly princesse would imploy cause seruice wherfore without fu der delay went land accompanyed damosell carried message princesse made knowne intent presently went two prince florendos floraman summoned word gentleman knight see come company lady mistresse desireth send princesse miragardaes sheeld lady would vse occasion iudgement esteemeth well thought seeme bold denie demand carry opinion selues may speed purpose faire meanes know shall constrained fetch away wils yea despight thing dare doe contrary trust would loth doe great gentle nature would willingly offer iniury knight countrey vpon wordes prince florendos thus answered gentle damosell knight seemeth ignorant daungers shielde doeth promise cannot content himselfe feede eye beholding contemplating thing rare beautie excellency hee must needes enter proude imagination owne pleasure lady must carry shield away belongeth matter trust faire damosell lord hath neede himselfe hath neede shield haue hee may chance goe without time vnlesse bring larger commission get good deliuer commonly accustomed send shield woman thing knoweth vse therefore haue bid good fetch himselfe shall carry sound message vnto pray doe mee much fauour let vnderstand time take matter hardily vpon mee defende shielde vttermost hee doe fortune serue well conquere shield shall without trouble deliue ed prooue happie carry away shield prowesse shall esteeme selfe fortunate man aliue loose shall loose life wonderfull vnfortunate race haue final ende neuerthelesse must let vnderstand seeing doth esteeme well lady sake intrude desperate aduentures necessary bring witnesse testimonie gratious fauour may bee placed feete faire portraite least perchance want thereof victorie chance fortune doe turne backe expectation may vtterly deceiued knowe minde may depart tell damosell returned place knight attended told answere prince florendos tooke leaue lady accompanied two esquire came brauely marching toward prince drew somewhat neare began proudly vtter speech see well sir knight good counsell vsed towards small discretion cannot take offered meete therefore taught discipline principle duty friendly perswasion yrkesome care willed friendly message send shield wherein image miragarda would loth constraint come fetch perceiue rather l se great detrimeut shame giue friendly whereby might haue gained commendation lady fauour demand wherewith would honour feete picture promise vpon knighthood ill hap conquered shall made acquainted pledge lady fauour therefore doe vttermost endeuour bring vnder subiection shall see giue lecture feare hardly construe trust syr quoth florendos language braue bountifull replenished large circumstance wo d manhood prooue answerable thereto deedes whereof knowe man might better resolued draw sword doe commit cause present triall herevpon two knight prepared themselues combate offering one towards heard casement winde castle suddenly open caused prince florendos looke vp espied princesse miragarda seene since comming castle reason whereof remained inwardly rauished delight gazing delicate spectacle combate quite cleane minde strange knight perceiuing tooke arme thus awaked sir knight presumeth enter combate ought forgetfull himselfe seemes therefore either prouide defend promise goe away lady shield prince florendos seeing strange knight arme remembred himselfe presently doe whervpon withdrew eye place greatly affectioned hauing heart aboundantly charged griefe began thus frame answere doeth greatly displease mee sir enter combat take mee time esteeme conquering returne uantage sir answered strange knight end may perceiue small succour present imagination doth promise defend selfe well ere shall perswaded owne folly word strooke florendos terri blow crest helmet waightines thereof constrained bow head slacke requitall thereof worthily handled knight shield broken two piece whereat knight offended without measure beheld image mistresse cruelly martired extreamely rage himselfe fought like voyde reason iudgement prince perceiued neuer left following knightly intent til brought knight almost breath yet hee ouercharge himselfe extreame labour euen owne pleasure continued fight fresh ending beginning worthily behaue himselfe knight desire rest breath endurr hot combat brought feeble estate constrained fall earth verie greatly trauelled sore wounded princesse arnalte whose inconstancy haue sufficiently heard heretofore sore displeased shee saw knight conquered shee commaunded seruaunts presently rowe away forsaking knight making account estimation neuer knowne seene prince florendos hauing thus brought enemy vnder obeysance opened helmet see hee knewe knight humbly yeelde himselfe desiring hee taken sharpe reuengement hee pleased deale minde bent rigour hand hee might take latest breathing hee hadde fondly thrust himselfe place committed great dishonour prince returned answer suffiseth sir knight haue conquest thee thou goe present thy selfe princesse miragarda suffer iudgement shall please assigne hee spea giant almaroll hee cause thee know princesse minde giant intreatie knight went knowe pleasure princesse returned answere princesse sent commandment vnto florendos take oath vanquished knight hee neuer serue lady princesse arnalte hee beare deuise shield ner respect thinke farre vnr able loue helde captiue vnder power vassall wherefore hee cause cupid painted shield holding knight bathed blood downe feefe albeit iudgement princesse miragarda somwhat sharp rigorous yet knight would gainsay determination causing regard vsed wound next day departed thence sadde sorrowfull thinke displeasure princesse arnalte suddainly went away prince florendos remained curing wound meane time prince floraman maintained custome accomplishing many hauty noble deedes mooue affection princesse miragarda amiable gentle maner good hardy knight florendos would vse estimation great paine prince daylie suffer sake chap x phere shalbe declared knight came company princesse arnalte cause hee trauelled castle almarol great entertainment made court emperor palmerin arriuall leonarda princesse thrace shall much amisse let vnderstad knight came company arnalte princesse nauarre occasion serue may haue better knowledge hereafter reported first part hystorie darpos duke normandie sonne frisoll king hungaria issue two sonnes whereof one named frisoll grandfather mention made many time historie called dragolant long time since reported knight armes farther remembrance gallant young gentleman meetly endued strength beare armour beside great fame noble exploytes father grandfather imbolden couragious desire loathed spend life ease slothfull idlenesse wheruppon left place bene nourished brought vp addicting mind search knightly aduentures forgetting court emperour palmerin first renowne deed might haue giuen greater grace person hautie desire accompanied one esquire beare sheild helmet tooke voyage towards realme spaine earnest affection castle giant almaroll might approou valour knight kept princesse miragardaes shield iournied thitherward constrained passe realme nauarre chaunce happened passage guarded princesse arnaltaes knight whereof two vanquished noble valour princesse arnalte well noting worthy behauiour also braue lustie young gallant vsed friendly perswasion went castle entertained honour accustomed vse towards resembled dragonalt bounty prowesse young prince beholding arnalte intiched great beauty vnderstanding dowry queene nauarre began waxe maruailous amorous farre inueigled loue iudged owne opinion consisted detriment life dignity honour length fel lady mistresse dutifull thought maruailous desirous go see faire princesse miragarda meane vtter earnest affection made reuerent offer beare company iourney well knew entertaine himselfe company might familiar manner proceed loue princesse arnalte curious accepting gentlenesse presence rather adde estimation honour impeach vndecent cause wherefore thing readinesse much conuenient speede might set forward towards castle almaroll accompanied lady damosel six esquiers haue heard also noble aduenturous prince dargonalte witnesse intire loue bare princesse many time way assayed knightly occasion wherein fortune still affoord victory princesse receiued small pleasure happy chance shee esteemed well thereof thought worthy possesse loue dragonalt aduisedly pondering frequented princesse amiable condition short time came citie standing bankes riuer thesin made two league castle giant almaroll stayed till prouided two boates passe along riuer wherein came castle almaroll dragonalte entertainement haue heard noble valiant prince florendos whose valour mooue hatred prince arnalte towards affectionate loyall friend dragonalt angerly departed castle almaroll towards owne place abode nauarre entending neuer see againe doubted suddaine choller would take suddaine cooling could easily intreated anger little offended euen could easily woon forget desire wreakefull vengeance vnstayednesse good loue great manner chaunced dragonalt continuing affection princesse arnalte ende fortunate obtaind good mariage making lord selfe king nauar e wherefore ought despaire hand fortune giue v may perceiue course history leaueth dragonalt queene togither returning leonarda princesse thrace ready depart realm thrace desire court emperour palmerin queene carmelia grandmother sent away worthily accompanied lady gentlewoman better gouernement iourney beside gaue charge lord gentleman went case depart vntill presented emperour order set forward towards constantinople met diuerse time way many braue gallant vnderstanding setting forth honour dutifull attendance vntill shee came emperours court assembled togither many braue knight richly armed carrying fine deuises one would haue iudged rather prepare incampe themselues warre shew knightly disports delight emperor many came thither behold brauery others doe princesse leonarda seruice beside good hope winne marriage ech one striue behaue himselfe gallant might witnesse greatest title knighthood wel please eye yong princesse deserue estimation whole court honourable estate seruing well doe prince gracian berolde sage aliart platir diuerse knight emperor court going company aged emperor himselfe went meet princesse two league citie aduertised comming reason prince primaleon prince rid somewhat rest presently leaue coach mounted goodly white palfray whose harnesse rich costly beholde princesse selfe brauely attired greekish fashion might better delight eye behold robe carnation veluet fairely imbrodered pasement lace gold clocke scarlet closed sumptuous diamond placed thicke maner button compasse cloke likewise garnished diamond hauing betweene euery diamond ranke glorious orient pearle shined sunne gallantly maruailously decke set forth costly vesture beside glimpse sweetly dazeled face youthfull knight whose thought free assault loue suddenly entrapped singular beautie emperor albeit farre yeeres yet attire himselfe youthfully giue greater grace yong prince bare company comming princesse leonarda entertained stately accustomed honour afterward gaue place prince primaleon sonne kissed hand gentle manner prince came emperonr whose presence witnessing great estate much content mind young princesse small deale abashed great honour emperor nobly affoord grant licence remaine court remembrance courtesie would haue stouped downe kisse emperor hand remembring court gratiously honored presence would suffer humble selfe much giuing vnderstand friendly speech comming abide court accept thing small contentation setting forward way might sooner enter cittie emperour sudden espied occasion withdrew mind thinking beautie princesse leonarda saw prettie space cittie constantinople vnder ake standing neere hermitage lois little common way knight armed carnation coloured armour thicke beset little gold whole armour gallantly set forth erewith helmit likewise maner sheeld bare deuice field azure cipresse tree thicke hung nut gold knight mounted lustie bay courser hauing attending two esquiers one carying shield couered ouer cloath deuice thereof could discerned knight hauing espied emperour sent presently one esquiers vnto come emperour rained palfrey began salute order gratious lord knight behold vnder yonder oake supprised maruellous earnest desire trie knightes court renowned valour hath beene much reported whole world willed certifie long time since bare armour followed knightly aduenture therefore would gladly make proofe good opinion holdeth himselfe might better speede purpose denied honest request determined day guard passage doubting shall defend himselfe sufficiently dare iudge great hardinesse themselues passe without asking licence wherefore humbly desireth maiestie would command knight ioust hath promised refuse none except prince primaleon sonne neuer consent beare armes emperour ioyfull tydings might rather would consent knight request meane whereby princesse leonarda might receiue pleasure considered also well like perceiue noble valour prowesse knight remained court hauing opinion knight enterprised guard passage one well seene hautie exercise returned esquier answere friend say vnto knight thy maister freely giue leaue proceede honest request partly sorte aged yeeres suffer one number sure hazard honour get libertie thy maister princesse leonardaes passage company promise thee abide till either haue woonne valiantly lost vnfortunately came againe princesse leonarda esquire departed answer maister began speech madame thinke reasonable one denie way within mine owne dominion especially time company certainely knight hath enterprised thus hinder v ought one small courage except doth imbolden himselfe meanes beauty hoping moue towards doth offer person endure doubtfull antly emperour concluded intent reccamon court esteemed good hardy knight gaue spurres courser strange knight fortune farre contrary presently dismounted horse hauing nothing moued knight kept passage whereupon frisoll coutched lance strange knight caused bea reccamon company galloped horse fetch lance broken vppon frisoll grecian somewhat offended aduanced himselfe knight meeting middest way gaue forcible stroke constrained fall earth mean wherof berolde put foorth himselfe knight caused speede gracian done emperour hereat greatly abashed beholding shame knight receiued whereupon dramian went trie fortune sooth aduerse horse fell downe together perceiuing said enemie ought refuse ioust strange knight hearing word gaue signe dramian giue ouer run would warned friendly motion putting himselfe vpon second triall againe throwne earth verie sore dangerously wounded moued emperour much agreeued doubting lest issue enterprise would returne dishonour knight court rosuell seeking reuenge iniurie companion receiued gaue himselfe forth brauely meete strange knight entertainment fellowes receiueed hardy prince platir saw ill hap prince ranne couragiously strange knight broken lance met together verie forcibly body horse fought together likewise cruelly ende platir horse compelled fall downe ground strange knight sate still gallan thing hurt rough encounter emperour ouercome extreame griefe knight beaten downe fast valour one knight knew well say prince primaleon greatly moued emperour father suspected knight vnknowne noble valiant prince palmerin england whose prowesse worthely esteemed prince court christendome neuer remembred iudged strange knight redoubted prince florian est giuen abroade remained king court briefe famous behauiour vnknowne knight made stand dump kn w well thinke neuerthelesse knight continued ioust wit estrellant bellizart francian one another placed among vanquished remained knight ioust sudden euen francian cast foorth saddle pompides blandidon happened arriue emperour seeing knowing merited fauour afforded gratious welcome desiring would endeuour make free passage end princesse leonarda might enter constantinople contented mightie emperour answered pompides make proofe good fortune well witnesse regard haue excellency trie may attaine purchase many good knightes haue sailed sooner pompides thus vttred minde gaue spur horse strange knight sooth compelled blandidon speed knight done saw knight emperours court vanquished listed vp helmet came vnto emperour fell knee kisse maiesties hand emperour perceiued knight hardly kept passage nephew prince florian forrest ioyfull happy victory hee agrieued see knight vanquished yea themselues thinke dishonor ouercome noble prince florian hauing kissed hand emperour primaleon offered doe like princesse leonarda shee seeing prince young yeares accompanied singular prowesse could much account eof eye imagine worthy great good suddainly instant gaue secrete hardy prince florian vertuous deseruings conceit well beseeme fauourable acceptation prince florian whereas vntill present heart could neuer faithfully make certaine estimation loue euen present humour haue heard singular courtesie princesse leonarda also sufficency equiualent beautie caused hot skirmish betweene loue liberty must needes yeeld himselfe subiect affection conquered brought vnder extreame charge nothing agreed well labouring thoughtes supposed princesse commaund seruice good applied dutifull attendance emperour palmerin seeing libertie passage graunted minde gaze faire princesse remember happines obtained victory came maner princesse thrace madame knight imployed himselfe hinder passage onely contented grant v libertie also friendly beare v company wherefore perswaded shall againe hindred iourney knight dare attempt much hath done hauing noble nephew florian company imagine hard aduenture presence seeme impeach v chap xi emperour noble company entered citie constantinople gratious entertainement made leonarda princesse thrace arriuall iousts ended noble valiant prince florian enterprised guarding passage emperour desirous make knowne princesse leonarda magnificent entertainment could affoord court set forward way towards constantinople prince primaleon florian forrest leading way brauely hardy champion resist dangerous aduenture forbid entrance citie come citie receiued people maruellous triumphantly prepared scaffoldes theater presented many strange history rare inuentions entertainment young princesse thrace also delight aged emperour albeit indifferently contented withall yet remained especiall cause griefe stomacke wit imprisonment king polendos noble prince company belcar diuerse approoued knightes armes rid hastily pallace aduertise empresse princess gridonia polinarda comming leonarda princesse thrace came feete prettie way pallace met princesse failed entertaine gratious courtesie whereat princesse receiued great contentation thinking receiued great estimation first arriuall would continue fauourable iudgement stayed empresse gridonia ended l uing salutation princesse polinarda next aduance selfe shewing princely amiable gesture courtesie towards princesse leonarda whose beauty iudged worthy great commentation assure whosoeuer indifferently beholde two lady together could hardly iudge surmounted beautie princesse polinarda aduisedly marking diuine face faire leonarda beganne growe great opinion fauour towards prince palmerin commending maruelloussy sta nesse iustnesse fidelitie would forget loyalty hauing offered especiall treasure princesse leonerda sufe ed great paine trauaile yet could perswaded accept choyce two faire beautifull lady holding one another familiarly hand followed empresse chamber selfe gridonia lady sate downe contemplate sweet delicate face two princess florian sooner entred chamber hee humbled himselfe kisse gmpresse hand embraced louingly great many time shee bene alwayes affectionate mother princesse flerida rest child respect shee receyued maruellous contentment behold sonne prince florian forrest hauing done dutia empresse came saluted princesse gridonia offering manner honour done vnto empresse would suffer regard much wherefore cast armes neck giuing worthy entertainement noble prince deserued haue went place princesse polinarda sate kneeled vpon one knee offering maner courtesie vsed empresse princesse gridonia shee maidenly modestly interrupt taking hand began thus parley see syr florian present come make satisfaction offence haue day giuen princesse leonarda hindering libertie way wherefore selfe would adiudge first punished offering discourtesie perswade selfe able make recompence diuerse wayes knightly seruice vnsufferable faulte haue day committed wordes prince thus replyed would fortune would make good account mee princesse thrace would abase selfe much take good parte simple seruice might attaine great happinesse deede might deserue good lyking gratious princesse thinke selfe fortunate vnder heauen hazard could daungerous sake easily ouercome wherefore fayre madame heartily desire perswade princesse leonarda accept knightly seruaunt honour doo affoord estimation account selfe would heart encouraged laudable cause worthily finish aduenture might like imploy mee princesse polinarda returned answer woorthy syr princesse leonarda shall purchase selfe great honour noble knightly behauiour entertaining vowed seruant champyon perswade selfe long circumstance neede vsed shee gladly accept honest offer wherefore doubt shee much ab e selfe receyue friendly motion dare take hazard vpon selfe imagine cause deceyued therefore signe permanent loyaltie shall bee none else thinke scorne goe kisse princely hand shall bee seale perpetuall bond shall bestow knightly seruice likewise shall admit continuall fauour princesse leonarda sweetly blushing beare polinarda pleasaunt discourse turned affable aunswere madame cannot wish commaund mee thing would forgetfull selfe make refusall thereof esteeme honoured receyue prince florian champyon vnderstand brother palmerin england towards whome highly bound indebted comparing regard good opinion conceiue knowing florian beloued kinsman report summe thought desire may able requite kindenesse polynarda contented herselfe well gentle aunswere fayre princesse leonarda well resolued speciall entertainment shee gaue noble couzin florian also remooue suspition shee singular beautie fearing least fauoured friende prince palmerin england fall lyking matche reserued altogether seemely selfe prince florian little prowd good fortune emperor would haue called saw familiar two princess talk whervpon determined good hap would permit make marriage betweene princesse thrace gaue bed fellow nee e polinarda assuring two vertuous lady liued loued intirely together one could neuer without others company occasion secrete sorrow euer hapned one would reuealing close conceit minde could called firme faithful friendship kind cause passe common betweene length emperor accompanied prince florian withdrew himselfe chamber quistioned prosperous estate king england grandfather father prince edward forgetting deare daughter faire princesse flerida desired might possible see dyed communed many matter hee caused prince brought chamber good knight could sse night quietly accustomed princesse leonarda earnest thought tumbled could enioy wished rest next day morning emperour beene chappell heare diuine seruice table couered princesse fleridaes chamber dined company empresse gridonia polinarda faire princesse thrace table withdrawne tten prettie talking together entered damosell attired blacke two seemely esquiers attending humbled herselfe emperour kissing hand like empresse gridonia polinarda gently imbraced damosell knewe one wayting gentlewoman vpon princesse targiana time abiding emperours court empresse shee stayed still emperor hauing knowledge came demanded concerning welfare lady mistresse wordes answered manner dread prince gratious lord desire receiue displeasure see rather inclined empresse excellencie princesie targiana
