commaunded addresse selfe vnto highnesse one vnfainedly regardeth grace desireth vnderstand princesse good lady eth neuer came foorth chamber since day prince polendos sonne prince knight committed prison time hath ceassed gratiously weepe lament insomuch faire beautie maruellously altered chaunged yet hath turke father laboured much may dis wade mournefull kinde life vaine wasteth endeuor tooke oath presence would neuer giue euer vexing selfe continuall waiting vntill knight enioyed free libertie came constantinople turke father fearing lest extreame griefe would cause shortning youthfull time hath promised restore libertie prince albayzar babilon haue request may enioy among againe cause great turke hath sent hither ambassadour either day tomorrow morning highnesse shall vnderstand summe matter princesse targiana feareth least denie graunt requireth may mooue inconuenience maiestie would repent great honour bestowed court put faithfully trust bring tydings vnto empresse whose presence haue made acquainted charge te cheth doeth person moreouer shee carefully pondering euery car e selfe doubting least mallice father beareth princesse court seeke secrete reuenge way treason intended betweene ambassadour towards highnesse preuent worst may happen desireth returne father good word forgoe prince albayzar know lawfull husband first knight foorth father power haue attained place assurance al deuises notwithstanding harme may come vnto libertie misfortune happen would loath maiestie may see cause finde selfe agrieued offender faire damosell answered emperour accept gratefully good aduice princesse targiana see well honour receiued court albeit small double double rewarded perswade selfe determined follow counsell emperour concluding minde damosell came againe princesse polinarda present gratious commendation faire targiana behelde rare singular beautie princesse thrace set damosell tooke hardinesse demaund lady princesse miragarda prince albayzar vanquished sooth faire damosell answered polinarda princesse miragarda leonarda princesse thrace noble palmerin england deliuered enchantment wherein remained long tedious time wordes damosell tooke occasion beginne thus fauour madame knowe lady haue forgotten straunge aduenture cuppe brought damosel court assure palmerin england strange nature could make small account faire princesse also refusing stately gouernment kingdome thrace polinarda desirous mooue damosell talking matter willed would report welfare princesse targiana friendly giuen vnderstand tidings brought thither ambassadour beiug arriued constantinople emperour sent chiefest prince knight court receiue friendly courteous entertainment damosell heard ambassadour come presently departed thence towards spaine go find prince albayzar promising princesse polinarda returne constantinople made returne turkie emperour dessred damosell present message good king recinde also prince albayzar bestowed diuers rich costly giftes betooke selfe trauaile verie glad espyed none came ambassadour haue already declared receiued princely order enemie became best estate sent sooth noble vertuous minde deale roughly extreamely enemy hee would entertaine vowed professed friend courtesie ambassadour emperours pallace conducted worthlie riding among chiefest prince knight court emperour himselfe doe greater honour came receiued gate pallace proud turke would one vouchsafe vaile bonnet offer honourable signe emperour malicious stomacke towards case offended turke lord emperour perceiued well small regard word princesse targiana sent damosell yet suffred thought best vsing still great courtesie vnto last constrained shew decent iesture presented emperour letter lord turke seale thereof pure gold fastened sumptuous chaine emperor receiued hand gratiously hauing viewed tenour thereof desired turke go take rest chamber next day would satisfie occasion ambassage desire grace answered turk may stand pleasure make presently answer without deser ing furder time haue receiued goe est selfe mine owne tent haue commanded prouided without walles citie otherwise great turk gratious lord would find himselfe much offended emperour replyed fashion shall doe imagine conuenient owne conceit neuerthelesse whit agreeued ambassadour lodge pallace great turke might better fulfill dutie charge committed beseech grace said turk let needlesse speech goe remember selfe hundred knight court held prisoner lord turke see make prouision lord hauing power reuenge diuers iniuries hath receiued subiects determined put death witnesse gratious noble nature content earnest intreatis daughter faire princesse targiana giue liues restore change prince albayzar kept prisoner court king spaine commandement princesse miragarda trust thinke selfe small fauour princesse targiana whose teares power ue liues knight lord turke determined neuer see againe vntill highnesse sent knight sauage man might reuenge iniurie forgetfull himselfe committed carrying away sea daughter targiana deed truly worthy sharpe punishment turke pausing emperour tooke occasion beginne thus certainly confesse selfe greatly bound princesse targiana farre faire princesse miragarda wise foresight beene greater knight suffered extreame rigour death assure since cruell fortune throwne dyce mee rather would haue loste twice many send lord turke knight sauadge man presence whome faithfully promise deliuer prince albayzar prouided alwayes make sufficient assurance whome turke holdeth vnkinde seruitude whereof may certainly perswaded pray vouchsafe knowledge manner case must ordered course must take matter answered turke thus maiestie must send vnto soueraigne lorde prince albayzar vppon inuiolable oath mee voweth may account great sufficient truth faile great bond send prince polendos sonne prince knightes companie may bolde lorde willingly would loose life falsifie faith towards excellencie emperour leaning vpon arme noting well word embassador paused good space without making answere prince florian perceiuing better acquainted infidelitie turkes emperour fearing least hee would haue giuen credite subtill assurance presently started vp began thus worthy emperour consider cause great turke detayneth knight prison shall well perceiue smal trust ought repose occasion little assurance troth much lesse againe suffer prince albayzar escape vpon worde may chaunce sooner would repent selfe remember vnfaithfull dealing giant dramusiande time hee kept shield princesse miragarda contrary vowed promise brought castle almaroll night comming court brauely giue foorth speech woon knightly endeuour dishonourable dealing found end costly therefore necessarie king recinde regard carefully hitherto hath done libe tle person cause sending home againe knight ambassador take vpon maintaine message presenteth turke soueraigne onely regard royall clemency defend contrary yea enforce confesse proceedeth earnest instance made subiects prince alb yzar importune sute haue lord gouernour libertie fall turke doe satisfie continuall request shall constrained guard himselfe wont defend especiall aide knight answered ambassadour thou shalt assuredly vnderstand promise thee authoritie ambassage alloweth enter armes thee faile make thee know reuerence thou oughtest entertaine vnreproueable word lord soueraigne doubt beside giue due recompence thy disloyall vnseemely dealing whereto prince florian thus replyed acceptable thing make account thee enter combatte respect good encouragement haue thereto small honor fall thy share emperour perceiuing nephew great chollere touched scepter held hand ende proceed somewhat inwardly offended giue hard rough speech neuerthelesse hee esteemed well good counsell maintaine hee came embassadour manner ought offended knight assist good carefull aduise especially prince florian nephew ignorant long since custome maners vsed turkes court great turke himselfe haue opinion faith promise hath himselfe beleeuing well would honour professeth violate breake word thing yet dare build assure selfe thereon lest prisoner take occasion complaine fond dealing remembring hard vsage haue suffered moreouer presume venture rashly king recinde know would willingly consent whose sonne amongst prince prisoner til haue owne assurance grant libertie prince albayzar wherefore may thus giue lord vnderstand send home prisoned knight faile send prince albayzar request lawfull promise honor performe chance doubt faithfull dealing herein giue pledge assurance owne daughter princesse targiana sure make answere well perfect knowledge hath fidelitie also desire hath recouer home husband ambassadour standing musing last replyed thus emperour see well knowledge ill men attaine follow good lawfull take leaue excellency assuring princesse targiana wil aduenture life onely vpon word promise withhold onely felicitie hath done noble seruice lord father said emperour shall highly please good beare pray behalfe heartie commendation kisse princely hand estimation haue hath power dispose anything taketh pleasure imploy ambassadour made promise fulfill commandement courteous obeysance tooke leaue departed emperor departure sate conferred knight commending greatly wisdome princesse miragarda sending prince albayzar king recinde whome would come passe yet againe recouer sonne polendos knight chap xii pof aduenture happened courr emperour palmerin followed afterward next day embassadour great turke departed emperours court day afternoon emperour sate accompanyed diuerse sundrie prince lord knight perceiued enter great hall bigge goodly aged man much weakened ouerspent yeeres seemed hee ready fall earth emperour iudged person authoritie reason goodly graylocks faire longmilkwhite beard thought seemely fatherlike man would deceiue world falshood dissembling prince others kept emperour company desired earnestly vnderstand would say oftentimes beholding aduisedly come emperour offered stoupe downe kisse highnesse hand taking pittie would suffer doo make humble salutation could emperour demaunded occasion come gratious lord said aged man voyce fainte lowe hardly could vnderstood court alwayes fortunate entertaine noble aduenturous knightes euer ready succour destitute aide assistance good hope would refuse affoorde mee theyr fauourable refuge deliuering great daunger whereinto misfortune suddenly brought heauy sadde speech accompanyed aboundance teares hee mooued heart emperour great compassion pawsing prettie space deepe dolourous sigh hee began thus againe humbly beseeche maiestie would time comfort gratious aide reuenge iniurie extreamly offered mee sooth great grieuous commenced personage cannot reporte summe thereof without exceeding sorrowe might much offend highnesse wherefore pray bestow mee knight whose good fortune may liue hope ease bring place hee may atchieue rare renowne life time neuer attaine like wordes emperour replyed thus albeit perillous affaire necessarie sende knight without first acquainted cause yet great exceeding pittie take see grieuous sighes manifold teares must need consent request great discredite man ancient goodly time shuld found forgerie deceytfull dealing good opinion suffer mee iudge knight see standing called prince florian forrest albeit name hardie knight sauadgeman nephew one whome put greatest trust giue ayde succour matter importance see hee prepareth himselfe forsake court assist noble approoued valour cause shall haue neede vse aged man seeing maruellous courtesie emperour fel knee kissed hand spake followeth vaine see well famous emperour young olde thunder surpassing bountie occasion selfe receyueth time giueth good cause thinke vttermost haue hearde noble commendation hath rather beene sparing speech sufficient comprehend hero call desertes shall thinke selfe happiest aliue hauing seene mine eye hath bene often bruted mine eare knight sauadgeman aduanced himselfe kisse emperours hand satis action honourable speeche vsed aged man still earnest suite prince florian constrained arme himselfe presently departed court great haste hee leisure take leaue empresse friend emperour fell questioning knight court knowe auncient man whose company nephew florian suddenly gon one could report whence primaleon much offended emperour father would command nephew florian depart soone aged man knowing first place aduenture would conduct wherevpon day berolde prince spaine platir blandidon pompides gratian polinard reccamon albanis resuel renowmed knight emperor court departed folow prince florian feared least euill happen vnder guilefull dealing aged man emperour saw court left desolate manner noble knight woont keep company found himselfe grieuously perturbed minde fearing least finister chaunce happen nephewe florian rode still company aged guide without resting place til next day morning necessity must stay giue refreshing horse suffered feede indifferently mounted againe horsebacke rested day likewise till come within sight fayre castle stood top fayre rocke fortresse del ctable eye behold foote whereof goodly riuer course deepe dangerous went vnto castle constrained passe ouer small boate wherein two men could hardly passe one time aged man wearie ryding desirous haue little ease alighted horse vsing language manner prince florian danger sir knight wherin must hazard liues bold venture selues together little boate therefore pray alight securitie shall passe ouer alone esquyre come one another bring ouer v horse reason wel answerd prince florian respect aged vnweldy peeres also wishing best auaile therfore intend follow counsell see necessitie compelleth v doo say word dismounted horse entred little boate commanding charge thereof passe ouer scantly attained middle water suddenly blacke ougly clowde ouershadowed aged man esquyre land lost sight esquire perceiued hee leape water followe lord desperate intent espyed great hill suddenly would suffer passe vpon turned goe place left aged man quickly rapt away gone esquire could possiby imagine way taken esquire began iudge teares aged man shed presence emperour end shadow treason wretchedly wet stood musing great canuased thousand imagination concluded search maister part fortune find would return emperor court make known vnfortunate losse lorde maister ende prince friend might take vpon enquyre opinion loyall esquyre diligent search great many knightes might happily recouer lorde againe noble prince florian forrest sooner gotten side riuer clowde conueyed away boate wherein passed sort hee could meanes haue sight wherevpon hee began aduance himselfe towardes castle stood vppon rocke fearing daungers might happen rocke high troublesome climbe armor hee weightie withall hee constrained rest himselfe three foure time way night chased away gladsome day hee could arriue castle hee came vnto castle gate came foure verie gallant damozells receyue caused many torch alighted shewed themselues dutifull entertaine castle courteous offer prince would seeme denye beautie much blinde minde daungers might suddenly happen hee fedde eye beholding altogether one free bondes hee would neuer greatly hurt himselfe affecting ladyes damosells prince entered castle court whereof paued fayre goodly marble stone passed courte came great hall builded maruellous artificiall antique worke entraunes wherof prince receiued damosell three attending great huge stature gyant albeeit shee indeede woman past sixteene yeeres age gentle milde natured person tooke prince florian hand lead fayre hall hanged tapistry inestimable value prince come place pleased damosell bring tooke helmet beautie seemed acceptable eye damosell instant shee gaue whole affection vnto yet somewhat abashed esteeme well whose dealing vnknowne neither whence consideration whereof turned suddaine good liking suddaine hatred disdaine would gladly haue dissembled therefore thus beganne parly sir knight heart time greatly supprised sorow grieuous iniury offred wherof haue good hope reuenged yt courteously vouchsafed come castle succ ur mee wherefore pray goe rest selfe night trauaile doth require ease morrow morning recite cause wherein may doe much pleasure madame answered knight sauage man imagine selfe deeply indebted exceeding fauour much bound conducted place reioyce good fortune doe seruice account great honour life greater value would hazard extreame perill excellency thinke well commaund damosell accustomed entertained courtly language presently returned reply thanke sir friendly offer pray would make good supper night may better quietnesse minde take rest tomorrow morning wil discourse haue occasion vse aide time hartily good night tooke leaue sweete gratious manner secrete intent treason could way discerned knight sauage man remained greatly onten ed hoping speede well fauour damosell furder cause friendship arise betweene may thought speed well damosell hermit rebuked haue doe secret intent prince chamber set supper worthily serued damosel gaue entertainment gate castle among thought best waited cup sooth well adorned perfect beautie made forget former affection lady castle may perceiue constancie loue well briefe began queintly deuise damosell likewise mooued conceit companion prince glanced amorous toying iybed double construing supper ended brought damosel bed chamber bed bene famialiar supper time came amiable speech sir knight time place commodious vnto well perceiue good account make seeing fortune aduerse determination burning lamp affection must quenched deepe sorrowfull sigh pray accept king whereof make small estimation earnest penny good concluding left king hand attending prince answer departed damosells remained well pleased could friendly language damosell giuen loue put king one finger left hand incontinent prince depriued power brought farre course himselfe could moue stirre part stone king vertue sooner put finger presently naturall feeling taken damoselles sooner returned vnto lady named arlencea presently bringing copany came chamber prince florian lay maruailously enchanted power discerne spake vnto damosel manner see friend iourney imployed altogether vaine iudge mother colambia liue great contentment hauing power reuenge death son brocalon baleato calfurnien camboldam brother shee pronounced wordes cast eye vpon prince seeing young sweet countenance entred termes greatly abashed thinking noble valiant force consist knight young yeares power ouercome one man surely must need thinke good fortune side matter doth mooue doubtfull opinion seemeth visage somwhat comfortable vnto fortune fauourites make repute neare allied supernaturall affinitie assure could willingly remit offence hee hath done death brother prouoke mee seeke sharpe reuengement death many good hardy knightes thus regard enuie amiable personage mooue secret contention within willingly would haue saued knightly proportion losse brother grieuous vnto fauourable pittie quite cleane forsake presently minded cutte head instant doe deede aged man sent seeke florian brought thither arriued knowing fit fancie preuailed much changed angry moode wherevpon began thus haue accasion madame feare knight wil escape hauing brought extreame alteration wherefore pray change sharpe seuere humor reserue life till haue brought vnto mother take pleasure seeing die hath cut flowres honourable linage may deliuer sooner thinke best wee doe imbarque selues goe seeke island remaineth albeit minde otherwise bent answered arlencea yet refuse followe counsell wherefore desire goe morrowe morning earely port see prouided proper ship cannot enioy quietnesse feare loose knight againe breaking minde arlencea damosel left prince florian chamber brought vnhappy subiection suffer endure sharpe sentence enemy chap xiii shall discouered damosell thus gotten prince florian happened time voyage remembrance made history collambra sooner intelligence death giant brocalon baleato sonnes prince florian forrest slaine concluded couer griefe practise meanes could deuise fortune would present onto whereby might reuenged done e mu ders earnestnesse damnable wicked minde compassed thousand horrible inuentions immeasurable rage wherein continually would suffer determine certainely thing herevpon came island somewhat nearer good hope finde succour aide pre ent purpose meanes auncient knight named alfarnao beene nourished long time husband made aboade within island hauing great knowledge acte nigromancy man altogether brought vp subtill craftie deuises hee hearing continuall complaint collambra made mooued take compassion promised helpe thing hee could possible take reuengement knight sauage man whome hee knewe arte court constantinople wherevpon came collambra vsing speech madame shall like follow counsell dare promise make forgoe extreame griefe wherewith accompanied wherto collambra thus replied would haue come farre perswaded selfe assured friendship good opinion conceiued cause addresse voyage hither altogether minded follow friendly counsell since perceiue good madame said alfernao repose great assurance fidelity shall perceiue platforme haue laid knight sauage man present court emperour greece grandfather growne amorous loue intendeth depart long time constantinople hath made himselfe aduenturous promise onely loue sweete saint forsake greatest danger wherein one shall haue occasion vse vpon determined goe court hee remaineth prostrating selfe emperour speech sad pittifully couched beside teares shall want grace matter earnestly request maiesty may pleasure succour affaire great importance whereout impossibly escape also helpe selfe whereout aide one best knight euen esteemed hardiest amongst wil desire may haue onely request know hee denie shaddowing intent behauiour vertue well enough present mee nephew florian esteemed noble valiant amongst hauing gotten conduct castle vpon frontier greeece hungarie abydeth ladie arlencea onely daughter vnto w make knowne horrible shame knight hath doone shee ought take sharpe vengeance hath offered great famous iniurie without aide shall easily execute summe enterprise must forget deliuer mee king hath power depriue sences man put ame vpon finger king cause one damosel attendant daughter put hand knight presently put finger faile bring receyue due reward shall thinke selfe sufficiently contented withall collambra ioyfvlly returned answere deare friend alfernao know well remedy passed trauells vengeance child lyeth altogether accomplish know shall thinke selfe euer beholding well may perswade selfe doe bestow paine shew selfe ingratefull towards intend follow aduise compasse meane may declare thankfulnesse collambra presently prepare ship wherein daughter embarqued accompanyed foure damosells many knightes winde sea seruing well fewe dayes tooke landing plaine farre castle ancient knight alfernao named damosell arlencea wherein hee left companie tooke way court emperour greece whence subtill meanes haue hearde hee brought prince florian forrest whome hee deliuered castle arlencea damosell giant made abode hee vsed haue hearde declared alreadie nowe come wee place wee left giuing vnderstand auncient knight next morning prouided coatch wherein much speede could poasted porte sea fearing least way knight sauadgeman would knowne arlencea imbarqued good knight marryners hoysed theyr sayles hauing pleasant gale winde committed themselues mercie sea whereon intend leaue returne esquyre knight sauadgeman fearing least ancient knight would offer iniurie lord maister failed take way hee iudged would bring constantinople hee trauelled first day fortune vngentle hee could meete person demaund way next day passed ouerthwart forrest perceiued vnder tree knight richly armed hauing shielde borne esquire golden tyger field sinople wherevpon hee presently rode esquyre whome behelde knew syluian knight noble palmerin england whose presence gaue esquire assurance neuertheles teares trickling downe cheekes hee beganne prince manner lord albeit newes haue declare vnto brother maister prince florian bee agreeable would yet must need report perswaded remedy misfortune chaunced discoursed whole circumstance matter prince palmerin commaunded esquyre bring presently place lorde passed riuer goe castle stoode high rocke hee grieuously passionate well misfortune happened brother also breaking voyage constantinople place earnest affection called hee complained greatly fortune applye herselfe hee thought ende onely breake determined purpose dayly presenting continuall peril wherewith could meanes escape without great losse blood danger life greeuous agony fellowed esquire vsing speedy diligence might least offer brother discourtesie arriued castle next day euening tide esquire shewed prince riuer could passe speaking sort may lord behold dangerous passage lost knight sauage man noble maister word prince made answer cursed may first inuenters cruell enchauntments extremitie whereof hath bene ouerthrow many good hardy knight hath made wretch owards triumph misfortune came downe riuer prince palmerin esquire could finde beate prssage yet man conuyed prince ouer reason whereof went along riuers side till came place water parted twaine entrance little isle whereto prince prepared himselfe goe sounded depth foord knight couered armour skinne wilde beast slaine cryed aloud prince manner noble palmerin hardy desire passe ouer water farre deepe seemeth may suddenly fall vnrecouerable danger preuent counsell goe downe little along riuer side faile shew place may goouer securitie palmerin well noting word knight spake presently stayed horse maruailing knight last knew brother sage aliart whereupon came brother florians esquire commanded goe constantinople stay presence hinder disposed conferre siluian faire polinarda tolde sooner heare tydings maister court place esquier would haue gladly kept prince palmerin company would wise suffer commaunded goe place might soonest haue vnderstanding lord prince departed small time came place riuer broade lesse deepe knight ried againe vnto might venture hardly surest place passage prince staied assurance knight word entred riuer deepe passed ouer easily rigor water hauing power hurt prince recouered side safe soundly knight perceiuing came offered himselfe take princesse horse would suffer alighting came embraced knight word thinke lord brother friendly come succour greatest neede certainely may assure selfe florian brother shall deliuered present danger meanes great authoritie furnished high singular knowledge gratious lord answered sage aliart custome make account mischance may happen imagine knightly prowesse able aduantage euery attempt pray time forsake opinion selfe perswaded florian brother great danger loosing life hartily sory fortune would suffer finde place haue gained knowledge perusing bookes knight cause forsake emperor court bring hither castle rendring handes damosell giant daughter collambra mother giant calfurnien camboldam brocalon baleato brother florian haue slaine seemes said prince palmerin forsake castle prepare selues towards profound isle embarque selues trie fortune much fauour v permit v recouery feare misfortune come already feare whereof confoundeth extreame griefe whereto sage aliart thus replyed lord necessary goe trifle time profound isle florian lost greatest hazard come vnto v wherefore thinke conuenient doe endeuour seeke foorth sparing day night trauaile take course another way wherein vse diligence aduenture life beleeue wel answered prince spare aduice may thing profite brother therefore determined follow counsell wherevpon rid away speedily vntill came two sundry wayes caused part one another ceased trauell earnestly losse prince florian grieuous chap xiii happened knight tiger following search prince florian forrest brother palmerin sage aliart hauing taken farewell one another rode way fortune conducted prince himselfe trauailed night desire helpe brother would suffer take rest horse began waxt strackt feeble reason exceeding great labour prince constrained vse speech siluian thou seest well trusty friend seruant fortune hath set selfe directly yet giue ouer present enterprise blemish credite perpetuall infamie therefore intend take horse whereon thou ridest send thee away mine able hold long vnto neerest port sea thou canst finde thou maist take shipping profound isle time past belonged giant brauorant father giant calfurnien faile send aduertise thee whole estate iourney time afford contrary successe trauaile fall vnfortunate newes shall seeme greeuous irkesome thee desire thee goe constantinople giue lady mistresse polinarda vnderstand cannot make account selfe loosing lampe loadstone life depriued must need knit vp conclude trauailes moreouer thou shalt assure sum felicitie consisteth thing remembraunce gatious selfe contentment alwaies receiue thinking long haue liued languishing loue deepely imprinted soule able put flight feares earnestnes desire compasse time present vnto death hath depriued meane whereby life alwayes sustained haue remedie whereby comfort afflicted heart onely contentment receiue passion hauing remembrance sweete whose sake liue suffer come passe hurtfull plannets displaced remembred acceptable opinion lady shall commit forgetfulnesse angry stormes hitherto hath euen weather beaten fainting spirit giuen course thousand calamity fall vpon assure thee accident whatsoeuer haue power endamage long souleis set worke contemplate rare singularity wherewith diuine spirit associated spirit resecued ioyne together familiaritie mine shall little triumph thought wr thy offer seruice taketh occasion behold shall finde wit superficially metamorphised attending long expected honour felicitie know possible liue absent heauenly presence remember time past haue often vsed behold delicate face fo farre happy meane griefe encreaseth aboundantly thinkes death good pleasuce would bring forth laborinth restlesse desire therefore desire thee siluian present vnspotted faith assure firme stedfast loyaltie considered truth moone pittie ceaselesse trauailes none aliue onely endure yea endure extreamitie beyond iudgement perceiue danger doubtful haue enterprised neither haue assurance trust vnto hope returne troublesome aduenture desire thee faithfull seruant lady thou hast bene loued deerely thou mayst happen vpon honourable recompence either vttermost power giue thee comming passe little content hath proued loyall iust faith ought respected vncertaine reward left inheritour tea e torment satisfaction honest trustie seruice cannot thinke lady polinarda shall consider honorable obeysance wherewith haue dayly hourely regarded thy vnfained seruice hath thought well shew selfe gratious respectiue thee well witnesse owne princely nature also remembring thy vertuous loyall desert thy angry starres much repine thy happy welfare seemeth daintie knowledge thee good siluian let seeme strange thee thou bearest part thy maister misfortune neuer fauouring must necessitie frowne thee vnkind dealing may mooue thee thus iudge wedded affection must ioyne happy content deserued haue vnhappy trauailes thus breaking dolorous complaint remained greeuously afflicted spirit teares aboundantly trickled downe cheekes rendered certaine testimony troubled heart willing dissemble lest siluian perceiue gaue horse spur without word departed thence leauing siluian mightily ouercome heauinesse constrained earth somewhat pacified himselfe mounted maisters horse doubted would bring profound isle bene sore trauailed already lord maister good esquire riding sad pensiuely last spyed two knight knew deuices sheelds armor prince berold platir called desired might please stay little whereupon knight knew presently staied abashed see badly horsed perceiued teares run downe cheekes began doubt harme made demand maister also happened case lord answered siluian know well resolue demand though report agreeable could wish discouered misfortune prince florian lord ridden giue succour aduenture dangerdus said siluian wherein lord must assist brother life stand extreame hazard helpe according would beside doubtfull shall come late horse hardly hold word platir thus replyed siluian lord fortunate hath finished rare incredible aduentures perswaded deliuer danger brother hardy florian forrest therefore content thy selfe power end noble exploit hath done sure cannot faile present occasion departure prince florian trust little offend aduertised without present aide danger lost companion faile follow reason loose good knight go place tell v prince palmerin hath commanded shall likewise heare tidings v soone shall possibly haue commoditie send prince platir vpon word tooke leaue siluian companion rid away hastily successe iourney leaue remembring forget knight tiger departed siluian made dispatch way length came little village seacoast entred venetian gally passe sea island collambra much famed abroad reason giant possessed assuring vessell whatsoeuer might take landing time giant liued crueltie insupportable durst arriue isle galley came neare vnto island constrained rowe close shoare winde sore vpon two dayes greatly hindered third day likewise wind arose extreame violent mariner iudged middest winter could rigorous driuen certaine place diuerse ship glad auoide troublesome tempest taken anker one ship sage aliart sore passionate least misfortune happen florian forrest brother neuerthelesse hee receiued comfort beholding vessel hoping fortune might fauourable albeit winde contrarie nauigation might yet happen vpon coast might happily bring together island collambra knight tiger vnderstanding sage aliart also acquainted aduise receiued great contentation minde tempest endured day left galley contenting maister thereof paine came one ship hauen would goe vessell sage aliart doubted least together would hinderance seuerall determination hee considering farre different prince berolde platir likewise arriued entending beare palmerin sage aliart company voyage vnderstood prince palmerin desired trauaile without company embarqued themselues sage aliart setting forth hauen together kept company sight one another vntill darke night separate asunder winde rising againe kept short time farre aloofe one cleane lost fight land yet sailed couragiously dreading furie winde rough billowes water mercy whereof intend commit course history willeth v returne redoubted knight sauage man conducted collambra order haue told commaundement ailencea damosell giant sayled speedy pace sea pleasure greater speake shee custodie knight sauage man whome shee bare company foure dayes soure night fauoured winde weather came within sight island proude giantesse colambra made residence whose handes fortune would suffer fall knight sauage man raised suddenly mightie tempest doubt cast away little houre cast farre island pilot could iudge countrey winde driuen reason whereof marriners remained far quietnesse could tell saint commend themselues present succour arleneea perceiued sudden alteration shee likewise inwardly vexed wished neuer seene prince florian none company could promise ayde except alfernao hee worne age could lesse helpe beganne encourage pilot defend causing marriners make expedition al vaine heart faint stomackes failed seeing great danger trouble towards ayde haue giuen remedy doubtfull trouble account vnderstanding forsake amazedly knew way helpe peril extant eye alfernao seeing mariner heart came arlencea word madame desire abash selfe assurance excellency consisteth liues misfortune hath come vpon v hapneth customably frequent sea though see water rough impatient moment shall see calme enough againe wherefore pray come forth chamber end pilot mariner may behold perswaded seeing receiue fresh encouragement order tell ye alfernao endeuour himselfe friendly counsell much lay cause forget fearefull motion arlencea request alfernao came presently chamber beheld furiousnesse water sometime listing ship vp heauen throwing downe againe depth hell water likewise beating aboundantly heart would serue keepe mariner longer company went againe chamber full dispaire fearefull frightings able sustaine selfe laid downe vpon pillow betweene two damosel weeping bitterly entred speech see well alfernao small recompence shall receiue enterprise deed dishonourable far dutie beleeue certainely diuine power determined punish v great iniury disloyaltie offer seeking death good hardy knight slue brother one another plaine fight offering taking aduantage hautie derds albeit cannot let passe without great maruell yet make verily thinke fought good lawfull cause despised exceeding crueltie tyranny wherein proud presumptuous brother liued disorder life rightly chastised prowesse knight set selues reasonable regard iudgement practise death well forgetfull sift iustnesse cause goe depriue good knight life reuenge whose innocencie wrathfull anger heauens fallen vpon v wherefore auoyde flie extremitie betime least wee fall woorse inconuenience resolued chaunge angrie moode thinking better take ring caused sleepe soundly thus abide sharpe countenance wreakefull power whome whether must obey arlencea hauing spoken pleased commanded chamber doore opened knight sauadgeman lay taken ring hee good estate hee yet without great maruell himselfe perceiued ship sea compassed faire damosells wept verie grieuously see themselues great daunger prince amazement came foorth chamber saw furious waues water tosse turmoyle barke pilot marriners euery one ship theyr hart dead hey knew way helpe themselues wherupon beganne noble word cheere encourage extream feare generally conceyued caused make small estimation word abashed especially see himselfe place least parte thought haue come came embarqued castle damosells came entertained exceeding friendly gate thereof strange aduenturs made oftentimes desirous demund sort chanced thither danger hee saw imminent eye would affoord much leisure compelled settle thoughtes necessarie marriners often int eaty friendly behauiour prince began somewhat comfort themselues beheld hee went chamber arlencea sitting downe hee beganne speech order madame would might intreate forsake fearfull passion regarde esteemeth maruellous well diuine beautie tempest beginneth little little loose force therefore let perswasion somewhat appease teares wherewith offend gratious countenance grieuous beholde bootlesse much hurt selfe arlencea hearing courteous language prince noting withall seemely countenance reioyced shee spared life intreatie alfernao malicious reuenge sought changed againe good opinion loue whereat knight sauadgeman well pleased alfernao remained grieuously passionate knowing well enterprise could come good ende night spent breake day tempest calmed pilote gaue vnderstand arriued coast spaine word displeased alfernao hearing sate vttering silent complaint himselfe pilote discouered cittie malaga helde kept turkes prince tooke arlencea hand led foorth hatch shew land causing sit downe desired would report vnto manner brought shippe wherein slept long without knowledge himselfe worthie syr aunswered arlencea shall please let former angrie occasion passe pardon say knightly courtesie shall resolued earnest desire therewith assuring loue hath brought mee estate hath mooued forcible affection mee towardes conceale iote trueth shee recounted large whole enterprise collambra aged knight alfernao whose treason astonish prince hee brake foorth speech madame desire wherewith came doe seruice deserue vnkinde dealing wherewith haue vsed since trauaile hath beene imployed vaine desire affoord much fauour report guile whereby alfarnao brought hither knowe perswaded commit cruelty mother great towardes nothing would content death let offend goe chamber arme selfe compell company vnder obeysance may perswade selfe forget gentlenesse trauaile whatsoeuer maintaine excellency bound good desertes whereto arlencea thus replyed lord desire consider singular courtesie ioyned vnfained good beare caused mee discouer damnable treason intended thought vnkind could find hart submit selfe recompence whereof desire would remember shall onely loose presence collambra mother likewise patrimony also shall receiue common bruite ill report euery one wound malicious speech yeelding selfe hand haue cruelly slaine brother madame answered florian pray forget remembrance loosing mother fauour opinion regard good may happen fortune fauour worse hath done wil faile make double requit kindnesse may repose better assurance word protest selfe commandement meane time florian spent time talke vnderstood shippe went enterprise meanes whereof left arlencea followed chamber helpe arme ere girded himselfe mayle coate alfernao foure company came chamber doore lay hand missed purpose florian comming maine strength thrust foorth chamber wordes time come alfernao wherein thy traiterous dealing shall worthily recompenced lifting vp sword haue smitten fiue stepped defended wherewith prince much mooued besturd himselfe among two quickly tumbled feete two seeing knowing small pittie florian would shewe tooke heart afresh came prince assailing couragiously laying treason olde alfernao gaue cruell terrible stroke cut arme one hard shoulder fourth feare glad leape sea alfernao seeing life brought great danger came humbled himselfe arlencea manner madame vnfained loue haue alwayes vsed seruice mother selfe deserueth gratious respect necessary affoord loyaltie ought recompenced hath worthily merited desire intreate fauour knight word knowe may preuaile much anger pacified life saued damosell giant amazed noble prowesse prince knew addresse selfe mooue intreatance quandarie power answere alfernao yet fulfill requested neither would florian deale extreamely wish seeing knee arlencea whose sake thus began trust madame alfernao good fortune render himselfe haue power preserue life contrary desert goe vttermost arlencea maruellously esteem great humanitie prince vsed alfernao commaundement put sure guard fearing least practise treason prince beganne esteeme well arlencea according honest vertuous nature deserued well laudable bountie gentle minde also vsing kindly done albeit subiect voluptuous pleasure yet beholding chast regard damosell selfe bridled affection determined bestow wife great friend giant ant dramusiande iudged part friend wish one friend hee knew acquainted vertue chastitie subdue wicked desire himselfe mooue violate faith friend damosell selfe albeit preferred noble behauiour knight sauage man worthy vttermost straine abilitie yet especiall regard honour knowing chiefest ornament make esteemed therefore shee behaued selfe discreetely wisely gayning good commendation knewe historie hereafter declare vnto chap xv happened knight sauage man come land wheu noble prince florian thus vanquished alfernao companion neare shore determined goe land wherevpon commaunded pilote drawe shore presently landing hauen belonging recinde king spaine rested themselues certaine dayes arlencea damosel somewhat sickly trauile alfernao desired knight sauage man would giue leaue returne owne country seeing arriued place assurance little needed feare danger demaund prince shaped answer wel assured alfernao court constantinople greatly troubled meanes therefore intend shall depart whither else haue sworne go emperour againe let vnderstand hath happened time false teares made forsake court euen vntill infrant came hither may well enough without feare punishment emperour lay clemency farre greater thy euill desert sooth shall neuer laid thy charge respect great good beare madame arlencea whose friendly pittie hath deepely bound deliuering perill wherein malice hath craftily caught euen may large declare vnto emperour lord sayd alfernao libertio highly esteemed greatly desired well acquainted sometimes desire recouerit wilfull forgo maketh put life great ieopardie seeing himselfe brought mishappe commeth sort repen thimselfe wisheth rather continuall seruitude haue liberty loose order fareth time desirous liue thraldome content obey noble commandement yet without feare inconuenience hope haue emperours bountie trust pardoned heinous offence wherein haue displeased imperiall maiestie comming arlencea said madame bethinke self shal please co mand mother fall happen place word arlencea replied thus may giue vnderstand thinke necessary become friend knight sauage man desire remaine obedient daughter request would forget death brother seeking reuenge losse cannot otherwise doe cut daughter life may well assure refuse graunt request shall henceforth neuer see haue yeelded selfe obey commandement knight sauage man doth honor esteeme greatest good fortune euer could come conducting emperours court shall acquainted gratious behauiour diuers noble vertuous prince likewise shal learne amend vnciuil condition seeing rare quality vsed renowmed court madame answered knight sauage man see good vertuous minde cannot chuse conceiue great contentment shall fortune come court shall perceiue well thinke meane time render assurance say pray thee alfarnao report emperour good mind thru diddest leaue lady arlencea humbly request maiesty may lawfully receiue baptisme end empresse may bestow lordly care vertuous qurlities doth well deserue alfernao promised fulfill whole commandement tooke leaue able endure sight amiable courtesie arlencea vsed knight sauage man soiourned pretty space prouided necessary thing trauaile intented ride countrey shew estate thereon arlencea damosel thing readinesse set forward faire company first day somewhat towards euening arriued within faire goodly valley well furnished tree comming neare pleasant fountaine espied two seuerall tent pitched farre beheld foure damoselles walking recreation vnder greene tree shroud themselues parching heate sunne vpon occasion arlencea thus spake prince iudge amisse good sir damosel coniecture receine farre greater pleasure free contentation haue put libertie hand maketh small account thereof prince made shew though vnderstood arlencea said wherefore change present fantasie proceeded intire loue bare familiar talke passed away time vntill came somewhat neare tent rich faire could deuised florian stood still taking pleasure behold damosell came vsed conference thinkes thing strange sir knight one man take vpon conduct fiue damoselles cannot chuse great charge whereof something ease shall like follow counsell shall disaduantage wherto prince thus answered albeit cannot thinke ill courteous speech wherewith kindly come salute yet shall perswade thing except accompanied vertue honestie therefore desire satissfie mee opinion standing reason shall faile follow one would willingly disobey good counsell content saide damosell demaund wherefore shall vnderstand foure damolles garded foure knight long come hither whome please may try oust shall happe vanquished must necessitie deliuer lady must content doe like fortune denie fauour victorie respect friendly eye allowe happy conquerour foure shall deliuered cannot greater hinderance vnto conducting nine lady fiue side fortune throwe discountenance commit knight vanquished foure lady must taken fift shall suffered enioy still thus see oust cannot way disagreeable way euer happens cannot lacke pleasure profite gentlewoman answered knight sauage man seeme well acquainted gentle behauior gaine ieopard aduenture loose selfe promise thinke time long vntill haue made conquest whereto damosell made answere pray sir doe thinke shall purchase v lightly desire haue defend lady conduct hardly permit speed soone hardy valour shall finde knight haue attempted defend v damosell sooner ended word dwarfe neere hand vnderneath tree began sound trumpet high note brought gallant eccho whole valley prince looking aside espied foure knight come prauncing along valley armed white greene armour helmet richly gilded vpon faire garland flower shield esquire brought portraited siluer swannes field sinoble come place damosell talked prince rehearsed vnto comunication passed whervpon one thus answered madame may pleasure feare aduenture danger would loath vnhappy loose without might expect greater profit happen would willingly depriued life abide hard irksome extremitie forced commit custodie another desirous keepe selfe trust sir answered damosell seeke thus excuse selfe word would wlllingly endure ioust proue false word knight lady beare company greatly beholding seeing aduenture triall worthily himselfe v haue one knight defend madame said knight gentleman esteemeth great trouble burdened many lady therefore would willingly vanquished might discharged seeking shun small occasion harme steppeth maze greater danger whereto prince gaue answer truly sir farre meaning farre giue vnderstand onely entend guard damosel compnny disburden foure lady presume defend carrie away manfully behaue selfe behalfe truely shall much displeased woont make account victory except may atchieue great losse blood well sir answered knight seeing desire make valor seene lady prepare selfe entertaiue word clapt downe beuer helmet hauing couched lance fetcht course knight sauage man welcommed brauely albeit knight brak lance worthily yet rough charge prince gaue constrained measure length earth greatly amazed fall lay good space without mouing himselfe meane knight sauage man came damosell talked speaking manner perceiue madame knight able keepe hath enterprised defend wherefore pray discharge selfe promise said enioy reason custome appointed word damosell framed reply haue done dnty well like approued knight armes might worthily apprehended ingratitude withhold haue well descrusd therefore since lot hath first fallen knight enterprise defend submit selfe desiring would entertaine among ladyes request make requitall misfortune hath thus vnluckily lost prince fauourably respected damosell would haue made answer second knight cryed prepare himselfe whereupon set spurres horse encountred valour trunchions speares flew vp gallantly aire comming againe second triall prince gaue knight forcible stroke threw earth one leg broken two knight seeing great dishonour fellowes receiued doubting speed better themselues ran together knight sauage man dealt discourteously yet power vnhorse soone could gaine opportunitie beeing loath trust much gentlenes alighted horse drawing sword came word indeed gentleman haue gotten aduantage two dishonourably assaile one onely knight yet cannot discourage purchasing lady haue depart shall haue best blood helly word one knight made answer cannot tell thing may fall haue ladyes shall buy hand deerely liue shall know price alighted horse running furiously knight sauage man entertained braue ingenious sleight fight short time one knight able hold longer constrained fall princesse feete knight perceiued saw life brought extremitie put foorth nobly defend stroke wherwith knight sauage man charged deuoire bring vnder obeysance knight began ioust sitten great anger seeing fellowes maistred prowesse hardy knight sauage man great danger wherein endured combate came sword drawne assist prince seeing ready yeeld tooke heart fresh fellowes company redoubled stroke vpon sayd would gladly succor would come helpe knight end victory shall obtaine might yeeld larger estimation renowne might likewise make knowne ladyes beantie ought reserued knight vertuous better defend briefe prewesse prince towards one knight sore wounned fell downe earth sight whereof grieued ranne fell downe lady desiring shield surie prince smiling see behauiour knight entred speech sir knight haue taken vp hostage place good assurance otherwise would giue thee recompence thy malicious difloyall stomacke deserueth comming lady began order faire lady desire would mount selues vpon palfrays would willingly place lest remembrance ill hap knight cause forgetfull honest promise made began ioust sooth worthy sir answered one damosel hard put memory slender vnhappy fortune could withstand force one knight haue deserued well submit selues willingly worthy selfe dispose v shall seeme best iudgement humbly desiring vertue blemished inordinate meane oftentimes happeneth lady great dishonour late recouer againe especiall iewell lost lady answered knight sauage man accustomed vse discourtesie sexe especially make account misfortune haue well deserued due recompence farre enough taking one horse vanquished knight rid away lady leauing knight tent remember great losse sustained thus depriued gratious lady esquire rid merrily reioycing werein custody noble aduenterous knight sauageman chap xvi aduentures chanced knight sauage man conducting lady king spaines court happened knight tiger voyage profound isle knight sauage man left valley vanquished foure knight determined iourney realme spaine glad worthily accompanied lady intending let vnderstand estimation made singular beauty indeed pleasing eye willingly could haue afforded point courtesie damosell giant arlencea regard promise wherein bound himselfe beside caused qualifie amorous humour friend dramusiande account made hee would leuell pleasant perhaps company shewed himselfe merry iocond last hee tooke helmette gaue esquier damoselles beholding faire vsage youthfull comely withall seuerally fell good opinion dapper boy goddesse citherea hauing somewhat touched repented wordes spake first humbled themselues vnto prince behaued himselfe gratiously would haue malice growe either side damosel brought forth valley proceeded earnest conference wit whence wherefore remained company knight nobly vanquished damosel modest countenance returned prince answere worthy sir witnesse regard haue dutifull affection wherewith honour presume behalfe rest satisfie present demaund shall therefore vnderstand first damosel named armelia second iulianda third sabelia selfe called artisia one citie farre valley called arseda wherein foure knight whereof two brother twaine yet allied together couzins one another made abode desirons doe v seruice might thereby time marry v wee misse great honour mariage licence mother came oftentimes recreate selues fountaine perceiued neere tent found v would knightes vsually take delight feede eye pleasant iestes deedes could daily attempt forrest moreouer might better perswaded loue would offer ioust knight passed valley summoning thereto dwarffe sounded trumpet assuring alwaies conquerours vntil time fortune made vnhappy noble valliant prowesse ladyes answered knight sauage man great shame loose fortune happy victory hath deliuered hand wherefore promise forsake vntill knight bring extremitie shall destitue power sufficient defend beleeue bardly vanquish submitteth himselfe earnestly direction thus much doe beside conduct king spaines court bring likewise see castle giant almaroll afterward shall finde conuenient leaue company content let depart owne pleasure damoselles vpon motion desired earnestly would bring place promised nature woman desire see nouelties arlencea inflamed selfesame desire forward moouing request yet feared least company damoselles would alter prince former determination shee needed cast doubt prince resolute could wish thus iourneyed till night came vpon went castle neere hand friendly entertained prince caused good attendance bee vsed ladyes heare leaue togither history willes v proceed tell knight tiger fifteene day imbarqued came within sight profound isle pilot knew well gaue prince palmerin vnderstand set shoare conuenient place could find committing god good fortune knight tiger rode vifite profound isle seemed plesant fertile night suddenly hindering constrained alight foote mountaine suffered horse refresh himselfe began mourne lacke company approoued friend siluian whose presence agreeable well remembrance nourished also fweete louing counsell would giue extreme grief heauinesse knew best comfort thus want company constrained passe night among greene leaues vsing helmet pillow vnder head tost tumbled vnquietly night vntill cleare morning chased away vncomfortable darkenesse arose mounting horsebacke rode heauy pensiue yet somewhat comforted pleasantnesse isle iudged worthy peopled ly wast desolate euening tide came little island compassed strong wals island entred tooke vp lodging house ancient knight accustomed giue entertainment knight bestowed time seeking aduenturesand saw knight tiger without esquire attending came tooke horse himselfe afterward helped vnarme vsing great humanity possible knight tiger glad friendly entertainment desired informed host customes manner countrey risen supper reposed himselfe little requested host tell ihat island belonged maners customes thereof might report place came demand ancient knight host made answer lord came good time resolued perceiue ignorant beene fortune come hither little sooner sweetest time yeares life would haue beene great danger shall vnderstaud long time since giant named brauorant cruell lord possessor island delighted set spy port informe knight damosel arriue island happened come would vse extreame cruelly knight would depriue liues damosel would villanously force afterward send away starke naked dispoyled rich costly cloathing purpose kept great company vassayles nothing else imploy themselues following wicked humor merchant fortune came cast anker isle vassailes would compell ransome themselues great extremitie would suffer depart hence chanced find fault tyranny refused pay ransome knew laide without right reason would murther put villainous death heauenly power seeing great oppression crueltie bloody minded helhound continually vsed chiefly towards neuer offended diuine prouidence thought good cut tyrant fortuned giant died whose soule thinke carried place vnnaturall deed deserued haue recompence could imploy life better thus dying left behind foure son issue thing compared giant father two eldest son named calfurnien combaldam content liue smal teuenues island yeelded went inhabit another country albeit thus departed hence supreme authoritie would long suffer liue vnsupportable crueltie tyranny made dispatch cursed liues hand one onely knight called report hath blazed knight sauage man named beareth figured shield sauage man may haue better knowledge knight haue one seeme cannot chuse acquainted noble mindes imploy themselues seeking hautie aduentures whereby fame thundered whole world two brother nourished island vnder mother wing whose iudged themselues able endure armor determined depart hence reuenge death brother calfurnien camboldam earnest desire gone would suffer tary longer taking shipping away went spent great time bloody horrible life predecessours spent seeking aforenamed knight sauage man fell good hardy knight himselfe chanced come entred combate behaued himselfe worthily likewise ended liues two giant whose death deliuered inhabitant countrey dwelled great deale feare trouble iudged knight ordained onely meane defend miserable afflicted people life flauish seruitude wherein remained long time cruel giant mother merciles hellhound named called collambra could long endure sorrow suffered death child wherfore practised compassed deuises could wherby get knight sauage man custody might speede better close intent ioyned magitian friend one loued well named alfernao gone emperor court constantinople hauing ten day allowed accoplish intent worke craftily wel knight sauage man must brought hither occasion shal want may helpe way damosell giant named arlencea daughter collambra accompanied certaine nuber knight damosel ioyned company enchauntor vpon whose promise assurance made knight sauage man shall bee brought hither great hope cruell collambra hath reuenge deuillish good knight gone citie foure league distance hence accompanied great many friend also one brother though young yet maruailous bloody cruell reputed especiall knight armes also giant named esponuautable hath conuerted countrey great cruelty gouerned giant brauorant cruell speake vprightly brauorant altogether terrible hee lately named wherefore hartily pray good knight sauage man fall hand giant neither treason may preuaile laide ancient knight knitting vp tale sigh knight tiger thus began good friend hard escape daunger fortune hath determined fall seeing could wish would suffer brother colambra seeke reuenge death nephew perhappes might fall handes hath good punish wicked life make knowe desert crueltie well kindred hath tasted knight sauage man hee one knowe well hope wil escape hand enemy one reserued bring end many worthy hauty aduentures wherefore respect hee especiall good friend desire know certaintie haue rehearsed speede ill cannot take quietly therefore wil satisfy mind determined morrow morning goe seeke giant doubting fortune fauour repay wicked euill desert recompence meete offender see well syr answered ancient knight ignorant giant force presuming combate ala sir hee make account enterprise ten came waged fight therefore cannot chuse mislike iudgement one repute enterprise rather want discretion vpon good sound aduise knight tiger tooke good part councell host laboured haue follow yet intend ruled host talked indifferent space withdrew himselfe chamber tooke rest better done night reioyced greatly brother florian yet arriued also himselfe ready helpe hee brought cruell collambra morning taken leaue courteous hoste hee departed follow hee intended comming forrest trauaile citie collambra made aboade heard roaring noyse sea made whereto would needes goe see could espy vessell wherein knight sauage man brother might imbarqued rode towards sea coast hee heard great bruit noyse somewhat neere riding forward see might bee espyed shippe lying anker hard tenne knight belonging collambra mother arlencea maintaining firce combate three knightes soone seene knew platir berolde sage aliard obscure valley put liues hazard onely giue succour knight sauage man sight mooued somewhat reioyce till suddenly astonished againe beholding past twentie pace knight fought combate giant maruellous stature armed rich costly armour cried kill murder three knight presumed make resistaunce hacked hewed enemy one tumbled side another side dangerously wounded giant seeing beganne waxe meruailous worth himselfe mounting horsebacke came giue ayde knight knight tiger perceiuing fearing least arriuall would hurtful three deare friend poasted till came saluted giant word art thou ashamed espouuantable offer thy selfe thou seest sore wounded haue scantly power defend themselues let alone addresse thy selfe mortall enemy came seeke thee would deliuer vnfortunate isle thy cruell bloody tiranny giant stayed behold summoned combat braue manner perceiuing bare golden tiger shield hee knewe presently knight world hold great estimation thought durst bold speake proudly neuerthelesse regarding presence knight tiger seeing knight vanquished fell speech see well valour strange knight far different countrey maketh desirous hazard fortune happy conquest yeelde contentment comming knight tiger began againe thus desire syr knight doe much fauour tell mee belong emperours court constantinople sonnes linage noble prince edward might greatly content mee would resolue mee heerein perswaded could thus long maintain fight knight without haue named content answered knight tiger satisfie thee thou desirest wherefore giue thee vnderstand knight brought vp court emperour constantinople company selfe sonne prince edward brother renowned knight sauage man whose behalfe earnestly desire requite treason thou thy kindred haue practised bring vnder subiection island art thou palmerin said giant eldest sonne prince edward vanquished dramusiand camboldam didst win islle man else could thrusting forth kept cause desirest thou know answered knight tiger marry greatly desire said espouuantable enter combat thee presence sister collambra would receiue vnspeakeable contentment seeing thee seuerely tormented dishonour thou hast done kindred word prince replyet thus euen selfesame man thou hast great desire knew glad see thee willing fight combate although place thou thy selfe hast appointed make knowne publikely heauenly power haue sent chastise thy wicked life also crueltie thy sister collambra well said giant end thou maist better folow thy enterprise faile prepare thy selfe morning night cause field prouided wherein entend fight combate thy companion would likewise set worke haue three couzins shall maintaine combat furnish armour armoury brother bravorant see armour greatly order hauing fought long knight vppon word berolde tooke occasion speake th thou shalt v great pleasure lend v armour haue neede refuse combate well accompany seruice prince palmerin destroy abolish memorie haue kept people tirannous seruitude see quoth knight tiger likewise dismounted except prince flatir kept saddle still yet charge rough vpon almost borne fellowes company recouered himselfe gallantly hauing lost stirreps knight tiger seeing giant comming towards cast himselfe beside horse quickly feared giant would haue kiled horse feete spake giant thus content thy selfe thou counterfeit monster let thy cozins proceede haue enterprised deale shall find sufficient abate lofty mind haue tried fortune hinder neither like v thou quickly decide controuersie doubt thou shalt perceiue little regard haue thee vttermost thou canst doe see well answered giant thou hadst good fortune dismount make thee bold speake thus brauely receiue greater contentment thou canst deuise see thee place mine owne pleasure shall giue thee punishment sword repay shame friend company foyle therfore went smyling giant shewed much fauour thrust foorth againe image golde stood doore within cried aloude thus take heede suffer sorcerer enter chamber treasure lye worthy round garnished bookes sage lady alwayes woont contemplate bookes lying vpon sumptuous deskes gold deskes supported beast antique worke selfe mettall couerings bookes cloath gold hauing euery corner liuing creature rare inuention erte bestowed image goddess diuers beautifull lady prince gazing delicate figure attributed maruellous commendation wishing lady present see braue sumptuous monumets iudged sight beautifull picture well content eye though seene best beloued lady bett rupt minde seemely shadowes along one part chamber portrait king queenes liued ye time sage magitian vrganda owne picture likewise middest sitting chaire gold hauing booke lying wheron made semblance though read right side counterfeit placed oriana daughter king lisuart king great brittaine side briolania queene sobradisa leonorina princesse constantinople two faire princess melicia olenda hauing name impozed vnder letter gold rare beauty lady haue named one etalted aboue equall together maketh think raigned comendation beautie time valiant king amadis worthily praise vsed knight gained immortall renowne aduenturing another place seen yseul faire geneuera queene king arthur friend sir launcelot du lake yseul white hand accompanied many beautiful lady somtime florished great brittaine bracando studious leaue worthy report highly esteemed another place stood empresse polinarda agriola empresse allemain gridonia flerida francelina figured neere iust proportion wanted nothing life selfe worthy high praise delicate sweete face flerida supposed exceed another place chamber placed shaddowes court emperor greece caused many knight take aduenturous trauails first polinarda daughter vertuous magnanimous prince primaleon accopanied faire miragarda leonarda ye princesse thrace altea sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemonia arnalte princesse nauarre chiefest placed princesse polinarda seemed beauty aduantaged aboue prince florendos pointed see fortune wold respect place speake indifferently workmanship bestowed like wise miragarda one could hardly iudge whether polinarda excell oriana briolania equalitie together would haue tried sharpe wit say fairest yet portrait faire oriana set forth shew grauity wel beseemed daughter famous king assuring ciuill gratious countenance able haue woone victory precisest eye vpon beautifull motion one knight haue fallen affecting best beloued promise nether oriana briolania polinarda flerida miragarda copared yseul faire yet notwithstanding one could moued opinion deceitfull regard saint beside offend eye thus perswaded themselues true faithfull hope grounded heart firmely fixed eye man could remoued sinister occasion thought setled liking satisfied changed euery countenance euery face liketh none contenteth recreant loue worthy come within court prince commended beauty yseul worthily descrued yet thought owne lady fairer stood maruailing delectable inuentions whereon could gaze sufficient desire coursing endlesse laborinth beyond prince palmerin rauished affection seeing counterfeite much torment attired manner took farewell whereupon fell arrogant conceite though lady polinarda indeed fearing moued offence began manner speake picture madame know onely hath power command profite receiue vsing speech maketh selfe deafe heare yet couet would respect word fauour would strengthen loue lengthen life see wel madam make accout word may preuent vnhappy destinie wherefore much vtter great detriment grief much sooner shall knit vp small lamentation assure onely liues die sake platir vsed like language towards sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemonia shortly espoused berolde prince spaine finding lady mistres place failed praise though bene presence custome true faithfull louer delighteth made choise whether absent present yet commend extoll felicitie prince berolde thinke great iniurie commend lady aboue best beloued onistalda sooth well deserue place among sage vrganda forgot place study occasion place furnished esteemed soueraigne beautie whole world sufficiently contented eye braue showes sage aliart spake vnto manner perceiue lordes image haue depriued naturall vnderstanding cause forget duty commandeth vse honour wherefore pray doe seeme fond praysing figure shape without substance beholding mispend time looking recompece haue power giue therefore shall necessary goe picture represent time sufficiently content heart eye receiue pleasure looking toyes vrganda giueth see prefent enchauntment palmerin hearing word brother sage aliart returned answere doe maruaile syr aliart behold liuely presentation faire beautifull goddess finde good cause busie braines receiue memory credite thinke man would rauished delight see thing rare excellent importance palmerin spake manner would haue friend suspect amorous thought departing thence went againe castle prouision made sate downe dinner ended concluded depart island wherevpon palmerin caused satrafort called presence gentleman came company palmerin speaking brother sage aliart began vse speech thus consider selfe noble friend brother way fortune might aduance estate able recompence manifold courtesy haue receiued handes might repute mee base ignoble minde wherefore witnesse great feare haue least condemned amongst vnthankefull frankely freely giue perillous isle haue conquered great trauaile losse blood desiring would accept thereof ought rather vnder gouernment know wherefore pray refuse gentle gift would estimation could finde heart bestow vpon perswade selfe vrganda reserued satrafort perceiue willing hereto selfe desiring would account noblenesse vertue requireth may discharge duty wherein greatly bound lord answered sage aliart island haue good occasion offended seeing commit handes worthy come within neuerthelesse earnest desire haue doe seruice willeth make refusall gratious offer accept satrafort fubiect louing friend companion well valour person likewise let perfectly vnderstand vowes himselfe alwayes commandement thus concluding speech offered take prince palmerins hande kisse courteous prince would permitte taking sage aliart armes beganne againe followeth louing brother fortune rayse preferment may finde somewhat worthie good desertes shall well peceiue affection beare meane imagiae best mee prince berolde platir commended marueilously liberalitie palmerin whose presence acceptable satrafort sage aliart would gladly haue changed maister neuerthelesse concealed mind closely himselfe doubting least purchase displeasure new lord aduaunced himselfe giue faith dutifull obedience praying knight tiger would continue woonted noble fauour palmerin vsed friendly behauiour towards remained well content withall hauing left sage aliart giue order custom isle imbarqued himselfe ship argentao desirous goe firme land soone could possible considered also hee would haue arganto returne gouernment would commodiously rip vp secret griefe siluian tooke leaue prince berolde platir giuing vnderstand must necessitie goe alone himselfe hee aduenture assigned promised day ensuing three thus parting platir berolde glad please prince palmerin thing thought meete entred foyst wherein brought thither humbly taking farewell palmerin sayled towards constantinople wind weather seruing commodious dayes attained firme land like manner prince palmerin another countrey taken leaue argentao likewise returned profound isle subiects receiued atiously accounting highly bound prince palmerin ordaining gouernour would case suffer people island cruelly dealt withall beene bloody giant chap xx alfernao arriued emperours court constantinople happened many dayes knight sauage man departed citie constantinople emperor aduertised losse prince florians esquire caused small griefe thorow whole court came passe alfernao arriued vpon sudden euen emperour sate leauing table lamenting want nephew florian caused come alfernao fell downe feete word illustrious gratious emperour humbly desire maiesty would thinke woonted fauour clemency remembring passed transgression grace looke depth shall found worthy grieuous punishment royall clemency hath power moderate accustomed vse mercy whose offence deserue rigorous intreating dread prince ancient man came requested highnesse assistance dissembling teares faint speech nothing else meere deceite great neede ayde one knightes wherevpon granted licence noble nephew leaue court goe company intending deceit deceiued selfe could execute determined began alfernao discourse emperor whole successe nephewe florian forrest sent informe maiestie hapned report esquire might better belieued whereto emperour thus answered certainly alfernao haue brought deere friend nephew greatest danger euer could happe albeit haue good reason contrarie yet thine owne desert pardon thee bringing good tydings whome heauens would suffer fall hand cruell collambra trust mee alfernao dealing shall remaine sufficient example giue credit hereafter either teares faire speech especially comming one seeme arlencea esteeme maruellous well courteous dealing towards nephew fortune come court witnesse good requite honest vertuous desert meane time may goe chamber rest selfe please stay comming nephew arlencea shall beare record entertainment hope remit past would gladly answered alfernao go empresse feare shee hath conceyued knight sauadgemas esquire may perswaded hearing truth thus speaking empresse accompanied ladyes came emperours presence whereof glad made beginne thus madame perceiue desire haue vnderstand become nephew florian hath caused come suddenly hither hath saued man labour comming empresse ladyes accustomed place commanded nigromancer alfernao expresse againe vnto empresse former discourse shee might likewise acquainted deceytfull treason report displeased much also ladyes gentlewoman raysing hatred themselues alfernao desired emperour might departe place prince primaleon seeing great choller lady began pleasantly smile prince hall likewise bearing company meanetime laughter lasted heard great noyse without pallace diuers running know occasion beheld albanis esquire prince berolde spain come leading hand giantesse collambra sight made people flocke heap exceedingly wondring pallace sounded eccho noyse albanis entred great hall holding collambra hand face fearefull moued emperour start suddenly alfarnao sooner espyed heart came manner dead neuerthelesse couered greefe cunningly could hauing embraced began manner madame appeare misfortune hath brought hither hath like authority ouer wherefore desire take patiently commit vnhappines fortune vnstedinesse cruell collambra eyed emperor heard word alfernao began cry aloud suspecting betrayed though voyce would haue shaken hall peeces wept bitterly pretty space spake followeth alfernao see instant thy monstrous disloyall dealing thou hast forgotten good kind affection husband brauorant life time alwaies beare thee thou hast deliuered hand thou hast also betrayed daughter thou hauing vsed matter shall neuer see againe madame said alfernao know well doubt make loyalty see must constrained satisfie rehearsing manifold extreame mifortunes well qualifie anger towardes cause see equall vnhappinesse one vnhappy planet hath stroken v began rip vp whole circumstance happened since departure end discourse gaue vnderstand arlencea daughter willed forget death child enuie shee bare killed agree vnto daunger neuer see againe collambra returned answere credite alfernao much offended present misfortune thy wordes wherefore knitte vp matter giue thee assurance die thinking arlencea daughter forgetfull selfe endure courtesie hath murthered brother death yrkesome vnto honoreth hath much dishonored word cast selfe downe ground furiously good whi would vse talke time rage albanis prince beroldes esquire aduanced himselfe make knowne emperour message forgetting declare whole circumstance happened perillous isle palmerin slaine giant espouuantable three couzins depriued liues prowesse lord berolde platir sage aliart newes greatly satisfie prince primaleon gridonia proeeding rehearsing danger mooued great admiration vpon alfernao declared people profound isle chosen knight sauage man head gouernour absent palmerin placed argentao rule isle quoth hee knightes haue left island gone perillous isle determined soiourne afterward come hither vnto highnesse court emperour answered thus perceiue noble knightly aduentures reserued nephew palmerin whose welfare doubt depriued company sage aliart therefore would prince florian together promise doe euen long company breaking ter desired alfernao tell prince florian intend tarry long realme spaine gratious lord answered alfernao determined yet returne vnto court hee haue first showne lencea castell almaroll word welcome leonarda prince thrace shee hauing already giuen entertainment prince florian chiefest place heart doubted least sight princesse miragarda would quite extinguish remembrance shee thought knight sauage man would enter combate kept shield miragarda quite cleane forsooke former opinion lauded fortune sending good seruant polinarda perceiuing troublesome thought especiall friend softly gaue comfort madame sweete friend suffer knight frequent place affection serueth dare assure beautie neuer princesse world attaine power change fancy therefore pray discouraged beauty princesse miragarda owne sufficient perswaded hired contend madame answered leonarda able iudge much indebted gratious fauour seeing loyall friendship commandeth nothing concealed betweene v let vnderstand thus much present comfortable word hath brought tedious coceit wherein spirit grieuously passioned emperor commanded magitian alfernao comfort collambra assure daughter arlenceas sake hee affoord fauourable welcome court shee would consent baptised euery one would greatly honour quickely forget death child collambra seeing alfernao comming could suffer declare emperor assigned woman mad desperate spake vnto order dost thou alfernao recompence good deed thou hast receiued husband hand render thy selfe willingly enemy side perswasion thou commest forsake law wherein haue bene nourished brought vp life time promise thee finish life thy treason together end may example enterprise thing dutie specially dealing rested hope
