fidelity whereof thou madest assurance promise word ran one great open windowes hall one could get succor threw selfe headlong downe court alfernao comming though would haue hindered threw himselfe likewise downe collambra sell waightily stone sharpe brused peeces hauing remembrance speake one word afterward alfernao liued vntill next morning emperor primaleon sorry see desperate murder emperor princess reioyced well deliuered cruell collambra yet greeue see bloody stratagem able endure pittifull sight withdrew themselues chamber two yong princess leonarda polinarda passed away time discoursing seuerally valiant prowesse knight vntill time called supper chap xxi prince knight prisoner great turk arriued court constantinople wherupon king recinde deliuered prison prince albayzar next day body collambra alfernao buried emperour sitting conferring albanis prince beroldes esquire many matter profound isle ancient knight maiestie giuen charge guard port constantinople entred great hall come emperor presence kneeled downe spake followeth inuincible emperour newes hath beene rehearsed noble nephewes moue content amid manifold discontent tidings bring present lesse welcome former aduertise highnes within hauen entred foure gallies great turke wherein polendos belcar prince knight court haue bene kept thus long prison princesse targianaes father came let maiestie vnderstand hereof landed ete acquainted therewith emperour remained ioyfull tidings possible might without making answer departed forth hall rauished inwardly ioy gladnesse could tell prettie whither goe like manner happened oftentimes haue newes brought thing desir u haue length came downe staires open court sate downe chaire vntill might see come gate meane many knight court came tell arriuall sonne polendos make answer minde busied remembring many misfortune come one another necke yet notwithstanding haue come prosperous end whereupon humbly desired heauenly power continue still woonted fauourable protection nature men good iudgement doubt danger haue receiued good successe hath bene euermore seene felicitie miserie doe equally happen dram pleasure hath commonly pound paine maner good emperour discoursed secretly himselfe comparing euery cause ioyntly together teares plentifully run downe white beard thinking fortune fauoured age hee worst able witnesse dutie neuerthelesse feared long enioy company knight imprisonment gone neere heart hee feared betweene two extreames suddenly rapt away emperor thus winding vp endlesse bottom vncertain thought prince primaleon sone came kneeled giuing vnderstand galley whre arriued wherevpon commanded horse shuld brought presently tooke way port accompanied sonne prince court chiefest inhabitant citie one greatly desiring see prisoner emperor came port saw land polendos belcar onistalde diuers others might better welcom alighted fro horse much abashed see knight order theyr face pale black strength weakened board haire growne long sawe departed fro constantinople company princesse targiana began scantly know come shoare emperour contained selfe courtesie mild nature dayly afford towards especiall friend prince belcar presented himselfe emperour offering kisse highnesse hand receiued armes imbracing louingly vsed gratious courtesie towards vnto prince primaleon son well bin brought vp court also sonne owne sister hardy frisoll king hungaria brother especiall good friend continued fauorable vsage belcar onistalde son king recinde owne sonne polendos came kneeled downe leauing belcar returned gratiously declaring sight euery one incomparable beauty departing port walked foote towards pallace refusing mount horsebacke mind busied exceeding ioy well recouery princely commendation targiana sent proued speciall friend prince primaleon went middest betweene belcar onistalde prince knight came louingly comuning friend order followed emperour sooner come pallace found empresse accompanied lady attending comming outtermost gate hauing giuen knight amiable welcome emperour commanded brought chamber great trauaile sea required rest prince conducted emperor chamber according custome esteemed arriuall scant great hall perceiued enter turkish esquire coming emperor began salute word gratious lord almaneor ambassador great turk commanded let maiestie vnderstand loth yet take landing fearing lest hinder pleasure highnesse conceiueth seeing knight safely returned come hath sent vnto maiestie wherefore desireth would iudge amisse hath done haue ought mooued offence highnesse morrow morning come sorie wil make acquainted summe ambassage cause loose part contentment present knight hath animated withall certainely friend answered emperour sorry make remembrance let commit fault knight enioyne making amends againe morrow shall see day willing rest himselfe night galley esquire departed courteous answere emperor taking empresse hand withdrew themselues chamber passed night greater contentment done many day faire phoebus morning displayed golden face earth empresse walked chappell heare seruice emperour knight farre behind seruice ended dined empresse chamber determined feast polendos belcar onistalde prince serued dinner maruellous great state table withdrawne emperor commanded principall knight court goe welcome land great turkes ambassadour would shew himselfe honourable well would thought vngreatefull hauing recouered home againe knight also vnderstand great turke polendos belcar rest beene prisoner went foremost receiue shoare would haue thinke forgotten kindnesse shewed sea primaleon somewhat displeased nature could suffer vse kindnesse towards knewe professed enemy polendos company come port hee thought good tooke barge went aboord galley ambassador brought shore nobly noise drum phifes trumpet clarians turkes wondred royall entertainment ambassador nothing great courtesie polendos diligent shewing greatest honour might knew well exceeding humanitie came lord gouernor wherevpon considered prince wel beloued emperour palmerin finde friend aid necessity enemy molest emperor attended ambassador comming empresse chamber accompanied sonne primaleon many prince knight court ambassador man came request great turk name freedome albayzar change prince prisoner turkie presence emperour made humble reuerence maiestie well deserued vsing proude behauiour first comming constantinople emperor welcommed gratiously desiring offended accept day according willingly would haue done worthy emperour sayd ambassadour small discretion knew well busie yesterstay receiuing home haue long looked letting needlesse matter passe must request know highnes minde concerning libertie prince albayzar would sende great turke lord doubted would sende home kept prisoner touching deliuerance lord hath bin hardy trust gentlenes onely intreatie daughter targiana hee hauing assurance prince albayzar daughter husband onely word great friend desireth would send home beloued lord albayzar great turke himselfe willed vse speech hauing ioyned speake thing little please hearing emperour returned answer know great turke lord hath determined make acquainted withal accustomed doubtfull occasion let mallice stretch neuer far deuises purchase scope yet haue power make feare princesse targiana thinke selfe highly debt earnest intreatie wonne libertie knight surely greeueth father would enuious towards would heart haue daughter againe court might recompence part gentlenesse hath vsed would kindly pledge selfe vpon assurance reposeth fidelitie moreouer promise sir haue written king recinde faile send prince albayzar beleeue certainly belong come hither wherefore pray stay till come meane time vse matter turke lord shall rid doubt princesse targian satisfied owne contentment opinion said ambassadour prince albayzar quickly damosel sometime sent secret mistresse dispatched message twenty dayes setting forth let king recinde prince albayzar vnderstand coming certifie likewise liberty knight meanes whereof faile come hither court vntill time determined licence soiourne declare lord turkes minde see prince albayzar neuerthelesse present gratious letter haue well vnderstood content thereof declare haue charge pausing tooke forth bosom letter written p rchment sealed armes great turke humbly presented vnto emperour presently caused opened perceyuing thereby turke willed giue faithfull credit ambassador said desired report cause arriuall whereto ambassador thus replyed gracious lorde knowe haue forgotten day princesse targiana came vnto court neyther subtiltie wherewith entised brought forth father courte guilefull dealing nephew knight sauadgeman hindered sort iourney could bring princesse targiana vnto court entertained excellencie empresse princesse polinarda gratious manner esteemeth selfe life bound manifolde courtesy lorde turke regard noble fauour toward daughter would gladly thing hee could witnesse beneuolent minde forgetting iniuryes past faire daughter targianaes sake condition way maiestie offer nothing right reason hee shall constrained forcible strength reuenge shame iniurie hath receyued knight sauadgeman substance minde thus briefe desireth send vnto knight nephew would chastise haynous offence refuse satisfie request commaundeth let vnderstand enemie reuenge knight abuse world shall take example cannot belieue said emperor turke lord seem threaten whose hand requireth nothing iustice willing doo cannot thinke well present proceeding sooth demaund iustice besides reasonable graunt lorde requireth florian accused bringing away daughter answer earnest intreatie desire selfe lorde perceyue trauelleth vain nephew knight sauadgeman send vnto wist welcome selfe seeme content lord cannot send nephew except please himselfe perswaded consent vnto much lesse father prince great authoritie reason haue made content lorde turke willing receyue whatsoeuer please eyther bring send sorie farre spent yeeres cannot shewe haue beene sometime neuerthelesse sufficient witnesse selfe sende knight whome hee demaundeth hee may tell would doo selfe let bolde knight doo errand vttermost aunswere wish looke handes wherefore thinke good goe rest selfe prince albayzar commeth inde time conuenient may departe please meane time honor courteous entertainment shall thinke well assured answered ambassadour answere would make wherefore hauing fulfilled charge neede matter henceforward vse word ambassadour thus concluded p lendos desired emperour would suffer entertaine turkish infidell stayed wherevnto emperour gladly consented polendos bringing lodging failed let see enimies better welcommed emperours court friendes lorde great turke primaleon remained well contented hauing heard answer emperor father also def ded cause knight sauage man loue princesse leonarda diuersely mooued fearing least fal great turkes hand would appease anger stomacke sacrificing good hardy knight god sudden dump yong princesse well perceiued sweete friend polinarda hid knowledge thereof present time vntill brought empresse chamber two walking together lodging polinarda demanded cause griefe wherevpon princesse leonarda ignorant targiana beene brought canstantinople noble florian forrest else matter stood desired polinarda pleasure declare occasion happened princesse herein satisfied minde shee remained sorrow without measure well occasion suspecting beautie targiana also thinke ingratitude knight sauage man instant reputed man without faith loue regard loyaltie would gladly haue deuised meane whereby banish remembrance forth heart princesse polinarda perceiuing willing preuent mischance happen couzin began vse talke manner madame thinke prince florian man princesse targiana must thinke loue allowed among person honour made ready thinke well occasion might finde meanes get hand great turke father court could neuer haue escaped beene aide princesse targiana satisfie helpe necessity made himselfe hardy bring greece arriued left knowing honorable signe christian knight make loue infidell moore therfore ground iudgement done past beauty farre excelleth blacke hew princesse targiana accounted one renowned lady whole world must iudge thus selfe little boast good fortune entertained gratious seruice word may assuredly build knight sauage man onely would follow aduentures hath enterprised onely hope gaine fauourable acceptation wherefore pray let consideration haue spoken cause forsake conceit haue couzin madame answered leonarda haue woon power ouer friendly word forced forget former imagination yet doubted couzin inueigled seeing hath conducting many lady realme spaine good sweete lady saide polinarda pray let spirit troubled suspitious passion knight weake iudgement make forget aduentures happen commonly trauelling knight meet many place lady damoselles company maketh haue better remembrance ruleth thought soueraigntie loue couzin dare giue faith none thereof word may assure selfe speech polinarda vsed perswade yong princesse thrace quite forsooke iealous thought caried many contrary hardly place reason harbour often happeneth play wanton little blind boy goddesse cytherea chap xxii knight sauage man accompanied damosel arriued king spaines court happened prince albayzar ambassador great turke staied certaine dayes court emperour company prince polendos made better account entertainement turkie deserued many along looke made ambassador waighting coming prince albayzar emperour primaleon could sufficiently commend courtesie princesse targiana teares ransommed christian prisoner foorth trouble wee must come againe knight sauage man iournied speedily vanquished foure knight valley gotten damosel arriued citie brusia time called tolledo king recinde made aboad little glad tydings came libertie sonne knight held captiuitie great turke seene florian come king pallace called esquire desiring goe let queene lady vnderstand strange knight come thither enterprised maiestie thought conuenient approue himselfe king recindes knight esquire acquainted lord presently went pallace brought queenes chamber king himselfe dyned company queene lady esquire beholding iudged faire beautifull marry found great difference betweene lady seene court emperour palmerin esquire aduancing himselfe presence went first humbled himselfe king recinde comming queene kneeled downe spake followeth madame strange knight whose company came vnto court hauing passed thorow realme desirous try himselfe armes knight royall court great desire doe seruice king husband intent proceedeth request certaine lady hath brought company preuaileth much good knight maiestie accept would venture ioust knight court wil maintaine beauty lady excell hath brought might proceede enterprise rather intended aske leaue king knowes shall way offend excellency king queene verie glad newes fortune sent tryall matter desired manner dainty emperours court greece carryed braue report noble knight world went thither try valour beside aduenture approued realme spaine altogether done castle almaroll two aforenamed place generall triall famous knight king spaine seeing queen returned esquire answer spake manner trust madame ought refuse gentle offer knight wel satisfie mind haue desired see hauty exployts also auoyd secret hard iudgment lady sure would gladly see courage fauoured knight queene mildly returned answer since liketh wel gratious lord request alowed thou mayst esquire say vnto knight king thinke well comming court permit libertie ioust enter fielde whether ioust combate occasion shall happen howsoeuer king alloweth freedome fielde knight desire resist himselfe hee shall hartely welcome morrow morning may put intent execution greatest rest quiet answered esquier knight maister desireth haue may finde knight may bestow breaking lance since maiesty hath freely granted ioust faile let vnderstand gracious pleasure meane hope knight put themselues readinesse esquier sooner departed king went looked foorth one window seeing knight fielde among many lady hee saide queene madame come hither shal see strangest aduenture euer life certainely said queene shee well beheld knight damoselles seeme haue good opinion knight behaue themselues amiably company one lady appeareth stature giantesse indeede said king strangenesse make eye knight iudge either foolish else compelled commandement great princesse leade damosel king queene stood thus ieasting knight damosel prince albayzar giuen vnderstand aduenture came foorth chamber came pallace gate mounted horsebacke came window king queene looked foorth hauing giuen salutation day questioned somewhat enterprise knight determined trie combate hasty intent staied time knight well armed came fielde monnted lusty coursar bearing deuise shielde white hart field sable knight place ioust determined esquire beene sent message queene spake vnto order sir damosel knight saith accustomed ioust without shall recompence hee remaine victor wherefore pray let vnderstand shall bee desert chance conquer victory fall side yeeld damosell vnto shall thinke best company spanish knight replyed thus knight friend seemes farre beyond scope minde would trouble folkes would gladly rid himselfe wherefore may say vnto lady seruant towards haue dot yet well deserued vanquished yeeld vp custodie come cause place let well truely vnderstand beauty damosel may compare heauenly face lady fortune proue good triall preuaile shall content selfe without expecting recompence knight hand therefore till would gladly know presumeth hazard ioust esquire hauing brought spanish knight answere lord hee content himselfe well therewith marry tell quoth haue leisure name lady whose cause fight hee happie conquer withall heart satisfie request esquire went againe maisters minde spaniard heard hee presently entred word perceiue thy maisters proud hauty stomack made bold enter fielde causeth braue speech wherefore must take paine asswage courage helpe away one damosel king recinde albayzar marked well large language desired see deedes would counteruaile wordes especially damosel knight one made himselfe last broached horse spur ran together great force spanish knight seruant policia daughter duke ladislart receiued pleasant stroke damosell knight hauing broken staffe iust vpon shield rared thorow midst himselfe throwne ground heeles vpward hee recouered himselfe quickly like good knight drawing sword came reuenge foyle hee sustained ioust damoselles knight beholding stayed speech sir knight came craue licence combat sword wherefore pray pacifie selfe let ioust fiue knight see attend happy escape hand disaduantaged shall content pleasure owne desire spanish knight offended mishap cared dyed presently king commanded auoyd place one fiue knight entred field welcommed like first briefe beare one another company albayzar seeing said damoseles might woon without good paine bestowne hauing good hardy knight defend damosel knight hauing broken foure launce withdrewe himselfe attending esquire bring another albayzar seeing knight necessitie sent one owne launce blacke head pure gold damoselles knight would receiue speaking brought manner thou mayest say vnto albayzar little loue good beare maketh mee disdaine receyue thing hee sendeth aduauncing himselfe towards hee tooke launce sent king wherewith charged another knight came sort cast saddle boisterously good remained senslesse meane damosells knight gallopped end course could hardly stay horse vanquished knight arose departed field prince returned backe againe place albayzar sate behold ioust came tooke arme vsing speech sir knight iudge little knowledge haue hath made despise contemne lance sent yet parden folly desire said damosel knight beleeue word sent esquire perswade selfe know albayzar souldan babylon would willingly enter combat albayzar hearing word answered thus content know well shall take surfeit loosing desire stay till brought hither breake lance presumed refuse afterwards entertaine combate doubt giue seuere chasticement proud mallapart stomacke would heart aunswered damoselles knight thou armed mallice thee cannot tell thou shalt feele albayzar presently sent armour king seeing fury noting high wordes passed betweene came field end would albayzar fall misfortune bene first perours court place turke sent imprisoned knight would recouer home albayzar cause king recinde would permit trie combate scantly would suffer ioust together greatly feared lest damoselles knight would endaunger person prince albayzar queene verie well pleased meanes damosel knight perceiued valor knight spanish court damosel albeit reioyced ill fortune vnhorsed yet greatly commended prowesse knight defended well still looked comming spanish lady delighting better seruants venter lady themselues greeued see good friend vnfortunately foyled chap xxiii damosel knight albayzar iousted together long prince albayzars esquire returned maisters armour blacke streamed ouer little stroakes gold prince babylon armed taken lance florian refused came king speaking manner desire gracious lord would disswade enterprise know selfe able reproue knight shewed himselfe disdainfull towards sure would haue receiue shame court word king thus replyed albayzar earnest regard well would sorry thing happen well wherfore grant combate strange knight trust neither dare consent well care haue person giue occasion emperour palmerin whereby may thinke ill well quoth albayzar hope lance shall much would haue may well complain highnesse suffer punish pride knight good sir said damosel knight doe thus waste time needelesse word good prepared selfe ioust prouder would haue punish see occasion yet doe dare fortune friend remaine victor ouer let paiment shal please end pray quoth albayzar much fauour tell assure would gladly know two cause first might ignorant knight shall vanquish second speed according desire may better enquire trauaile abroade answer damosel knight wil satisfie thy honor much perswade thy selfe greatest enemy euer thou hadst thy life greeue may haue libertie combate thee long haue wished haue fill thee since pleasure king shall presume exceede highest neuerthelesse awaite time may deale thee according desire deceiued answered albayzar think know know thinke haue seene sometime castle dramorant cruell made selfe bold vse language haue yet forgotten wherefore assure selfe speech thou diddest vse brauery thou seemest haue present shall destruction dare afford ayde iniury haue receiued may little ease stomacke taking reuenge quailing thy vsurping boldnesse cannot deale would till fitter time serue purpose desire thou wouldest breake one staffe vnder name word lady may see whether deserue better praise lady run aire princesse targiana take said damosel knight mplest beautie company fauourite time seruice determined ioust would wish quoth albayzar lady haue named gratious mistresse fight knowne great high authoritie would name fauoured one may thought worthy equall presse ouermuch answered damosel knight would haue reueale aduertise fortune hath made seruant lady whose gratious fauour let soueraigntie name sh wen onely great importance yet since see af ect much content breake one lance sake thought may better satisfied assure tarre excellent beautie princesse targiana singular aboue name worthy talked respect royall incomparable mistresse desire would request know name haue vowed keepe secret may better make others maruaile cannot suffer said albayzar thy reproachfull speech especially thou seemest dispraise whose beautie lady liuing way equall two knight departed fetch car ire ranne together singular courage albayzar hauing eye loue lady targiana mi ie enemie offered damoselles knight accompanyed secret good princesse leonarda briefe two knight greatly affectionate towards lady encountred together force launce flew vp aire piece passed shaken thing come end race failed take newe staues broken againe like first yet aduantage either side king spaine made great estimation noble valor perceiued damosel knight deuised might accomplish meanes knowe doubted albayzar would discharge dutie wel enough shield princesse miragarda made valiancy well knowne court emperor palmerin two prince much amazed seeing could haue aduantage ouer one another wherevpon tried third launce wherewith mette together forcibly damolles knight lost one stirroppes cast vppon croupper horse like manner albayzar forsooke stirropes constrained catch holde necke horse greatly offended hauing iousted many time yet could speede seuearely desired wherefore determined depart one bee cast beside saddle two redoubted knight went prooue fourth launce hauing hand albayzar spake damosel knight thus pray sir fauour mee dooing must demand damosel knight would passe returned answere trueth sir thus intended depart hence see ground therefore pray trauaile selfe desirig thing mee certainely sir said albayzar would haue thought beene vncourteous neuerthelesse yet intreate would goe present selfe giant almaroll prooue fortunate foyle say meanes haue acquited bond wherein princesse miragarda straitely tied may see knight iousted beauty lady targiana happen fortune fauour victory doe thing shall command offer faire play said damosel knight cannot otherwise choose consent request thus pointed fetch course met together directly launce broken buckled together mightily body hauing giuen rough greeting damosel knight compelled forgoe stirrops greatly amazed albayzar measured length ground sore shaken lay study prety damosel knight seeing astonished said vnto may know aduantage haue gotten haue leaue trie combate caused helmet opened might receiue aire sitten good space grieuing misfortune especially presence king recinde hee arose holpen vp gentleman king commanded honour much wherevpon damosel knight beganne thus againe albayzar may perceiue little fortune fauours aduantage haue woon maintaining beauty gratious mistres princesse thrace pray present selfe shall arriue emperour palmerins court shall say thus strange knight calleth himselfe damosel knight hoth vanquished commanded submit felfe excellency thou hast seene let thine eies iudge whether beauty targiana may presume compare thou deepely drowned thine owne conceit thou wilt recant thy former blasphemous error thou maist assure greatly grieued present seruice importance first hath receiued yet albayzar rage made answere faile keeping promise thee god vouchsafe liue long present thy head lady princesse targiana reuenge shame haue day receiued thy hand would sory said damosel knight thou shouldest die minde returning face king recinde said desire grace would suffer depart would offended declare may perswade selfe one knight world doth wish good readier doe seruice selfe word king thus replyed since sir knight would knowne shall moue contrary time passe way desire visit sooth shall welcome thanke grace humbly answered damosel knight great honour courtesie haue found hand shall forgotten long liue taking one launce left gaue reuerent shewe obeysance king queene lady tooke great delight beholding knightly behauiour departed company king returned castle accompanied prince albayzar whose heart intruailously ouercome griefe would speake suffer speake queene lady sorrie knowledge damosel knight beside offended prince albayzars foile well gentle behauiour reputation gained carried away prince miragardaes shield damosel knight farre citie darke night drew forrest neere faire fountaine concluded rest themselues night refreshed themselues laid among greene leaues prince himselfe went lay pretty space damosel laying head roote tree beautie leonarda princesse thrace presented self amorous thought charging many contrary passion night could lay eye lid together yet loue irresolute lest thing world could haue made forget quite prince florian lay thus busied thousand imagination arlencea marnailously affected towards seeing companion fast asleepe went place prince florian laid sitting downe side began fall speech seems worthie knight sauage man iniury heretofore haue done doth yet remain fresh memory make account liueth dieth onely loue speake truth may perfectly resolued without regard mine owne honour come seeke cause intreatie might moue pittie preferreth loue none aliue courtesie shall seeme refuse conceite griefe extreame must need giue entertainment latest enemy set soule body quietnesse might haue comfort remaine dease make account breaking laid head prince breast fetching many grieuous sighes groanes though life would haue forsaken body whereupon prince tooke armes amiable speech though gladly looked began comfort thus madame arlencea little esteeme would willingly consent doe thing seeme displeasant offensiue honour desiring thinke much bound inte ded accomplish sel e desireth since time great fauour deliuered daunger whereinto alfernao brought forsooke altogether folly vaine humor loath reward vngently whose courtesie neither time death make forget thus perswade selfe haue prouided husband according noble bountie doth well deserue yea good knight refuse make choyse knight sauage man may time vse friend seruant pausing kissed hand brought place lady sleyt departing againe owne lodging began ashamed folly noting well wittie word knight sauage man whose loue extreamely passioned co strained discouer flame torment one damoselles gaue fatall ring prince ripped vp whole discourse word passed night desiring earnestly teares trickling cheekes would giue assistance might enioy loue knight sauage man damosell answered lady thus trust madame haue occasion finde selfe agreeued good reason knight ought satisfie prince ought trauell himselfe damoselles receiue shame dishonour yet content minde thinke willing doe pleasure goe knight vse friendly perswasions vnderstand depth intent arlencea imbraced damosell genile answere spake againe manner know well sweete wench shall haue remedie case must enioy thy meanes wherefore pray thee goe fortune thee come passe neither perswasion thing else mooue loue pray thee intreate would pardon fault committed disturbing quiet ease madame said damosell repose yourselfe altogether went knight sauage man found slumber sitting downe began manner thinkes enforceth lady liue sorrow wil vse regard vnto ought easily take rest knight sauage man hearing voyce woman opened eye seeing arlencea damosell loued best amongst beganne friendly embrace giuing better word giantesse lady whervpon damosell beganne thus againe syr knight desire would vouchsafe tell cause make account lady loue seeing hath sake forsaken mother forgotten cruell murdering brother likewise hath lost libertie selfe madame answered prince feare shall haue time enough discourse whole matter vpon point day wherefore intend set madame arlencea part demaund occasion haue forgotte seeing remaine affection since day alfernao deliuered power lady arlencea pray syr said damosel would offended nicenesse onely auoid malice lady abscence pray thinke wel may pleased displeasing haue better come mooue lady sute againe knight sauage man hearing courteous answer might breake launce face venus tooke armes day came apace vnwilling see secret pleasure durst see feare shent labour chap xxiiii happened damosel knight going castle almaroll vpon point day breaking damosell gaue ladie arlencea vnderstand answere k sauage man prince seeing lady walking came gaue morning courtesie afterward mounted horseback beganne set forward iourney arlencea somewhat mooued euill fortune night past p perceiued well came vnto vsed kinde gentle language forgot care troubled much prince began deuise pleasantly foure damosel woonne forrest iested merry conceites iourney seemed nothing troublesome vnto pleased polyphemia damosell arlencea sent mooue sute prince thought shee deserued better countenance hand knight sauage man knewe well countenance polyphemia grieued see vse pastime damosel wherevpon began smile himselfe would vexe would embrace one damosel come another kisse one another would familiar withall much pleasure poliphemia seeing dealing knight sauage man went side behind damosel dissembling much could possible extreame affliction amorous thought regard honour commaunded keepe secret passed betweene prince hee making though saw continued pleasure damosel recreation sake tooke delight walke foote would giue one another greene gowne iest iybe pleasantly poore polyphemia knewe well take yet hoping haue partner misfortune indeede came castle almaroll chanced fiue dayes departure spanish court came faire greene field gallantly decked nature tapistry lady tooke delight stay would make nosegayes garland flower disported themselues long thought meete put garland head mounted horse againe merry pleasantly disposed change iocund humor beheld come ranke tree bigge tall knight manner giant mounted horse meete carry mightie person armour azure colour spotted thicke little siluer flower shield caried deuise hidra serpent seuen head fielde sinople big knight two esquiers attending one carried lance battelaxe knife gold come place knight sauage man damosel stayd began language manner aduertise thee knight long time since desired goe castle almarol heart became affectionate faire princesse miragarda good lyking growe determined try fortune knight keepes shielde good hope vanquish might afterward take office place hapned farre contrary desire perswaded fauour make victorious owne force able consideration hereof doth little offend determined reuenge selfe mean wherfore aduise thee wel two condition shall put thee thou shalt best like either enter combat surrender damosel beare thee company friend answered knight sauage man assure thee man thou thinkest neither shalt thou find one wont vanquished thy hauty word thou shalt deceiued giue thee vnderstand accustomed feare fellowes speake glorious pride themselues neither huge stature giant dismay thou durst presume take worst garland lady head would sel thee life would make thee restore againe affection said knight thou bearest maketh thee esteeme danger wherein thou maist fall seeing thou wilt lustie content courtesy sake offer thee condition shall dismounted v swaine may haue paine foure damoselles foure shall still attend vppon lady see likewise thy company wordes knight sauage man thus replyed could wish thou hadst many damosel thy power thou seest name end either thou mightst win conduct might maister thine except thou intendest take lady force otherwise thou shalt haue pray thee get thee going thy businesse see well said knight contention cannot ended without laying hand weapon try conclusion called esquire brought lance couched ranne couragiously damosel knight met brauely mid way encountred worthily pe ce lance flew whistling ayre encounter knight lost stirrops meeting together body horse began fiercely fight one another strange knight cast ground damosel knight almost borne company horse slaine knight horse arlencea lady greatly feare least knight would ouercome prince florian leaping horse tumbled ground drew sword stood still heare knight would say seeing damosel knight ready combate began somwhat offended rough stroke lance made feare knight stood pretty space buckled shield drew sword sheath comming prince word thou art knight much friend thine owne life agree condition made shee iousted thou shalt see keepe promise thee pray thee said damosel knight vse friuolous speech thus determined make thee beare copany foote thou seest horse slaine without wasting time word began charge knight fiercely knight saw felt likewise laid huge waighty stroke till end receiued many wound losse blood faintnesse body constrained fall downe ground damosel knight set foote taking helmet made show though would haue smitten head knight yeelded himselfe mercy desiring might please saue dis life whereto damosel knight thus answered content giue thee thy life condition thou wilt fulfill command thee know aduenture sayd knight perillous would make account sauegard life thou shalt first quoth damosel knight tell thou art afterward thou shalt take one horse whereon thy esquire ride take thy way presently court king recinde queene thou shalt say behalfe damosel knight iousted presence prince albayzar saluteth humble duty desireth fauour king hand thinke ill made selfe knowne thou maist assure highnesse faile make selfe knowne returne castle giant almarol may get thither sooner take thy horse recompence mine haue lost iousting thee knight arose made answere worthy sir since fortune great vnkindes hath brought iato extremitie shall faile obey whatsoeuer commaund name called trofolant feareful haue heard sometime remember true quoth damosel knight pray make knowne case declare haue said may depart way accomplish promise prince mounted trofolants horse tooke leaue setting forward iourney damosel till came end pleasant valley leaned himselfe stump tree espied three knight richly armed one cryed aloude stay till came damosel knight hearing word would goe staied heare say come neerer knight spake againe manner sir knight would gladly haue one lady company wherefore pray bestowe beare affection selfe trust sir answered damosel knight doe like well dare bolde take one iudge put life great daunger fancy saide second knight doth best esteeme exceedeth stature meaning arlencea content selfe quoth third knight rideth next tall lady meaning polyphemia thinkes beautie exceedeth wherefore pray sir knight content selfe lady sticke v three well behaue selues shall haue occasion complaine v perceiue answered damosel knight would gladly haue lady determined defend therefore haue minde little riuer betweene v may easily passe fortune good shall carry go backe againe good answered first knight seeing stomacke serues wel shewe small aduantage shall get dealing v vpon wordes passed riuer hauing placed launce rest ran valiantly damoselles knight entertained puissant stroake compeld fetch errant dust greatly amazed fall power stir himselfe great two knight saw fellowe foyled came ouer riuer together abashed valour damosel knight durst venter try one another ranne together though offered wrong would refuse breaking staffe nobly vpon one ent keepe first knight company hauing arme broken force fall drew foorth swoord welcommed third friendly little tumble downe damosel knight victorie commaunded esquier alight tooke knight helmet might take aire commaunded shew obeysance three damoselles whome would need haue knew price willed sware loose liues knight perceiuing reckoned wrong hoste promised would doe thing contrary whereuppon one came arlencea word madame make account beseech command thing poore power seruice haue little neede saide arlencea seruice would greeue vse assistance thing whatsoeuer neuerthelesse may example following quality commit many outragious fact damosel encrease renowne hath nobly vanquished deliuered company command go king spaines court behalfe let lady vnderstand desert come wretched dealing say aduertise one presume trauaile abroad without company knight able defend vnlawfull action madame said second knight polyphemia shall like command marie quoth take course commpanion doth forgetting tell lady pray may liue safetie without hauing affiance knight whatsoeuer enterprise conduct trauails put trust honourable loue euen bow soules loyall affection yet haue neede shunne company rather let doubt proue shall find word true damosel knight vnderstood well enough couert speech polyphemia yet dissembled though knew meant lady said third knight cruell commit greater taske two lady haue done companion quoth cruell would haue thee banished company thy dearest friend damoselles knight himselfe began thus againe since three lady shall carry message king spaines court pray tell lady desire repose trust shall imagine themselues danger let well assured aduenture hazard soeuer helpe may yeeld assistance notwithstanding one three lady desirous haue thinke contrary counsell desire humbly make account thereof may know pray tell name depart may demand another day whether haue fulfilled promise lord quoth first knight three court whereto send v meanes whereof grieue go shew misfortune court whatsoeuer might like send v name shall vnderstand called grouanell knight brother named brabosan twaine sonnes countie loban third knight couzin called claribard knight greatly renowmed court spaine truely gentleman said damosel knight ought thrust selues dishonourable action neuerthelesse must excuse beautie woman hath sometime inueigled wisest head would wish better aduised albeit selfe often feele heat fire ending rode charge lady glad sped well knight presence likewise commended high good fortune chap xxv trofolant three knight yeelded themselues spanish court damosel knight arriued castle giant almaroll long damoseis knight could reach castle giant almaroll hindered way many knight ventured themselues take damosel taken charge conducting chanced king recinde stood pleasantly talking window queene many knight chamber beside beheld enter goodly tall knight face couered helmet armour broken many place besprent blood fine deuises thereon could hardly discerned sheeld carryed esquire shiuered selfe manner deuise therein could well seene euery one great admiration went proud iestures made estimation neuer knight came entertaine pallace gate passed till came chamber king made obeysance returned queene word madame haue combatted knight long since court iousted prince albayzar hath company nine damosel desired bestow one halfe whereto would meanes consent made answer could wish many lady conduct would take mine beare ladyes company trauaile vpon proude answer intended take perforce would suffer made resistance end onely conquer great danger loose life valiant redoubted knight granted mercy vpon condition performe command great humanitie would adioyne punishment come present selfe maiestie craue pardon behalfe would let himselfe knowne court returne faile come better acquaintance highnesse meane craueth would pardon offence past know said king remit iniury hid desired know earnest seeing armour much defaced good lord answered queene desire would offended past cannot thinke knight would desire passe vnknowne grace without compelled earnest occasion said king knight pray sir tell know said knight call trofalont fearefull haue answered king oftentimes heard much talke knightly deedes haue atchieued cause would gladly haue knowledge damoselles knight wherefore pray tell know iudge whence hee lord said trofolant promise neuer saw life till iudge one sonnes prince edward perswaded one knight else could haue conquered whereof little ashamed yea much greeued thereat take leaue highnesse haue discharged commandement quoth queene giue licence depart leisure would thing saide king would take better armour handes case doe seruice beside would knight serue emperour depart court destitute horse armour lord answered trofolant thinke selfe highly bound maiestie princely offer haue made determined goe euen see deride fortune face departed king gaue queene vnderstand trofolant reputed good knight would beleeue sonnes prince edward would come court depart againe without knowledge king commending valour damoselles knight grouanell brabosan claribard entred chamber hauing made reuerence king queene came presented themselues lady rehearsed great misfortune damoselles knight poliphemia commanded lady knew well poliphemia receiued iniury knight whose noblenes made king speake thus gentleman promise greatly desire know knight hath thus vanquished intend send knight may bring hither shall like highnesse answered one knight whose good fortune serued ouercome v grace must well thinke hard bring hither except list himselfe trust said king make maruell much accompanied many damosel one knight cannot long endure patient conuersation one woman wordes king departed knightes withdrew themselues chamber offended damosel knight vanquished showne incredible prowesse court prince albayzar returne damoselles knight made expedition iourney came neere castle giant almaroll wherefore stayed riuer thesin speaking damoselles manner arriued place faire lady conuenient display force beautie fauouring enterprise combatte behalfe assure picture princesse miragarda castle excellency knight hath keeping thereof cannot yet vanquished cause iudge rather singularitie faire princesse force valour knight intend try selfe wherefore pray faire lady seperate selues asunder bethinke selues vnder whose name shall enter combate present know shall purchase aduantage company poliphemia greatest opinion beauty selfe amongst spake prince order know wel sir knight victory gaine enter combate princesse miragarda proceedeth force loyall friendship truely far wherfore fortune chance forsake combate doth deserue seeing great inconstancy towards whose behalfe seeme enter combate damoselles somewhat abashed hearing poliphemia spake plainely wherevpon prince florian returned answere perceiue lady iniurious towards without great occasion offer truly great discourtesie conceiue bad opinion wherefore put ill suspition determined enter combate vnder fauor beautie shall well perceiue contrary iudgement riding came last castle time miragarda lady came forth recreate selfe vpon water accompanied giant almoral damosel knight sooner beheld beautie th faire princesse heart presently depriued libertie yet good qualitie passion tormented beautie lady longer continuance miragarda gone pretty distance said damosel say beautie gallant princesse say answered poliphemia dismay selfe iote v conceiueth opinion selues may equall beautie miragarda sooner returned againe shee sate downe castle gate greatly delighting selfe behold faire company florendos farre armed assailes somewhat moued seeing made liue continuall langout giant almorall beholding beside knowing well miragarda greatly delight see combat strange knight called word sir florendos doe dutie commandeth princesse miragarda stayes onely behold florendos taking good view damosel seeing knight prepare himselfe ioust presently mounted horse backe comming knight began manner salute pray sir knight tell vpon occasion come hither compelled bring damosel place pennance would gladly deliuered peraduenture may fortune pleasure promise sir florendos answered damoselles knight came hither enterprise take guard whereof make great estimation onely see lady repose trust prowesse hath conducted thorow many country cannot tell said florendos answer make hath good knowledge neuerthelesse would desire breake couple lance may giue little pleasure princesse miragarda fall ioust hindrance one shall lawfull enter combat damosel knight answered thus sir florendos would loth combat although dare bold iust little well satisfie desire princesse miragarda delight damosel beare company whose sake likewise breake two lance sir almaroll himselfe force greatly enter combate afterward know well said florendos assurance haue owne deed make vse hardy language therefore agree whatsoeuer iudge reasonable may assure self almaroll faile accomplish desire chap xxvi iousts enterprised betweene damosel knight kept shield princesse miragarda combate damoselles knight giant almaroll knight preparing themselues ioust almaroll steppee betweene desiting stay little till princesse miragarda beneath ground might goe vp castle take place window knight readie ioust set staues ground staied till princesse miragarda come window florendos contemplated face hauing taken leaue gaue horse spurres damosel knight met middest carrire great force trunchions lance flew vp aire passed nothing shaken esquiers brought new lance wherewith ran together againe couragiously burst staues nobly wherevpon prepared third triall florendos somewhat agrieued hauing felt prowesse aduersarie feared least misfortune happen presence lady damoselles knight great doubt whether florendos beside somwhat offended begun ioust perceiuing well minde prince couzin fortune discountenance presence beautifull mistres preuent came wordes thinkes necessary sir florendos content selues seeing neither v boast aduantage ioust beside canot purchase great renowne conquering one affectionate seruants verily would sorie receiue misfortune hand might hinder place hope wherefore pray giue leaue breake two three launce sir almaroll yeelde contentment lady beare company florendos returned answere perceiue sir knight haue little desire deal feare nothing may happen witnes well knightly behauiour wherefore pray forsake order tell whence tell name saide damosel knight afterward ioust much cannot resolue selfe vpon two point rest neuerthelesse would gladly content well pleased venture againe two prince ranne together force burst staues hand wherevpon horse hurt cruelly maisters fell ground damosel knight hauing shoulder horse broken florendos horse slaine outright greatly vexe drew foorth sword willing enter combate damosel knight perceiuing hee stayed friendly language sir knight would gladly intreate forbeare much resistance friend desireth thing may doe seruice beare much good vnto loath enter combate feare haue valor duty frienship forbiddeth mee vngentlenesse perswade selfe lesse courage selfe could make good assurance victorie would grieue see iniured wherefore discourtesie may happen either side pray sheath swoord againe reserue triall therewith till one come shall seeke mallicious intent doe princesse miragarda heard whole discourse passed damosel knight could haue beene content boldnesse saw see combate tried betweene florendos spake againe manner hardly content selfe sir knight without might see one v dismounted else would tell yoe word artesia one damosel made answere tell ye sir knight order woont vse knight knewe lesse gouerned discretion himselfe would neuer ende fight making excuse v selfe may behold time seeing princesse miragarda doth fauour content knit vp thus without passing triall thinking v vnworthy good truly friend answered poliphemia haue saide certaine belieue knight opinion himselfe florian smiling made answere see well faire lady paine haue taken conducting made account neuerthelesse haue aduantage entising word want power deceiue maister selfe wordes albeit spake somewhat softly yet princesse miragarda well vnderstande reason whereof tooke presently one slender fidelitie iudged florendos one libertie loue power ouer himselfe desired liue libertie could haue compassed remedy great torment beautie faire mistresse enforced endure returne florendos could wel perswaded damosel knight desired enter combate giant almaroll perceiuing caused brought foorth goodly bay courser sent damosel knight request would put himselfe readinesse ende two might trie themselues together would giue delight princesse miragarda haue better combate content reward ordained requitall paine remained conquerour vppon motion damosel knight made reply looke sir almaroll shall please appoint shall finde contrary thereto quoth almaroll victory happen side pray giue reward lady named arlence faile esteeme chiefe mistresse affection come passe fortune make choyse shall receiue recompence horse wheron mounted warrant good world trust said damosel knight haue already determined selfe bestow vpon knight make good account yet accept horse victorie fall side come passe vanquished lady selfe finde heart satisfie request shall finde hinder thing content answered almaroll hearing speake reasonably presume refuse knight willing doe seruice without word placed lance restes couered shieldes gaue horse spur encountred together brauely damosel knight forsooke stirrops almaroll cast ground sable betweene leg little offended haue disgrace especially presence new chosen friend damoselles commended greatly gallant beginning chiefely florian woon knightes kept valley almaroll hauing recouered feete drew foorth sword came marching towards damosel knight presently alighted left giant offer harme horse charged one another cruell stroke moued great admiration present couragious prince florian well delight damosel declare noblenesse fight prince florendos forgetting withall miragarda well perceiue stood feare knight refusing combate side almarol behaued himselfe gallantly desire gaine arlencea regard loue life neuer fought brauely two champion continued notable courage short time armour broken many place body grieuously wounded blood ranne pitifully almaroll nimble quicke aduersarie brought greatest danger meanes whereof glad breake square little take breathing damosel knight would suffer followed intent fast vpon constrained fall earth seeming rather dead aliue sight whereof greeue prince florendos measure much offensiue princesse miragarda departed window commanding almaroll brought castle presently done florendos went chamber see prouision might made wound sooth dangerous damosel knight brought somewhat aside damosel vnarmed dresse wound great danger whereupon caused himselfe armed againe mounted horsebacke intending depart thence set forward way two knight strange countrey arriued castle came desirous try aduenture one knight carnation colloured armour thicke beset griffin siluer sheeld figured white hart field sinople knight blacke armour bearing shield deuise fellow two knight sooner beheld damosel knight carnation armour spake thus companion seemeth sir come vnto place shall haue accasion vse armor keepeth shield miragarda case endure combate knight seeme wherfore shall sayd came hither vaine goe disburden one ladyes meete company certainely answered knight cannot content selfe thing base estimation hauing mine eye shield wherein pictured beautie faire princesse regard whereof maketh account nothing worthy word companion cast eye image miragarda hung seemeliest place pillar whereuppon entred speech see good friend haue aduentured place haue bestowed labour vaine willingly would loose life whose heauenly visage shield represents content selfe hope glory assure sayd first knight intend depart place without carry shield yet would possible first make tryall worthinesse durst deny take hence aduancing tree shield placed offered take downe shield damosel knight perceiuing intent knowing florendos busie hurt giant almaroll would suffer presence one offer great wrong prince florendos wherefore regard good bare broched horse spur came place shield miragarda hanged looke knight arme puld backward great strength ell beside horse headlong ground withall spake manner may well perswade selfe sir knight desire trie fortune aduenture forgetfull honour proceede cowardly attending presence hath authoritie defend shield absence therefore trie gentle companion dare presume carry hence manhood miragarda come againe window take better aduise damosel knight vnderstanding braue word giuen knight greatly content selfe presenc tooke vpon worthily defend sheeld knight offered take away gotten himselfe foote againe dr w forth sword phrenzie madnesse came assault damosel knight companion perceiuing came betweene word pray sir amount vpon horse mean time trie valour knight may answer proude attempt made vpon adua ted himselfe damoselles knight great desire witnesse courage princesse miragarda prepared himselfe brauely meete aduersarie hee discharged nobly hauing full desire neither shielde armour mailecoat could defend push lance passed cleane thorow body strange knight tumbled beside horse ground altogether depriued life damosel knight gotten launce knight body praunced till came vnder window princesse miragarda stood expecting comming knight meeting middest course brake launce prince came together damoselles knight caught hold enemy shielde hee pulde great force brought head necke horse permitting leisure recouer himselfe gaue owne shield cruell stroke crest helmet knight giddy therewith could hardly tell recouer himselfe meane knight thus amazed prince tooke helmet gaue another heauie stroke hee fell beside horse foming forth blood mouth aboundantly florendos chamber giant almaroll greatly abashed seeing combate fought lady shield absence wherefore fearing least displeasure come thereby forsooke occasion went presently thither hauing well viewed two knight receiued small admiration aduenture damosel knight perceiued spake order sir florendos see deedes wherein haue imployed selfe onely would doe seruice yet ignorant answered florendos wherein shall thinke selfe beholding see two knight brought badde estate yet knowe vpon occasion shall sir florendos saide damoselles knight resolued hereof knight see slaine wold haue caried away shield princesse miragarda yet liuing slender abilitie fauourer aider others attempt haue giuen vnderstand thing high estimation might woonne without labour thus regard offence offer witnesse good vnfeinedly beare tooke vpon hinder disloyall enterprise proofe word may behold whether true pray sir quoth florendos tell desire know name whose prowesse hath deeply indebted sir florendos answered damosel knight satisfie see desirous wherefore aduertise florian forrest couzin obedient seruice suffer receiue iniurie place shall present florendos great ioy replied thus minde hath beene troubled good well eased knowing seeing prowesse wherefore humbly desire thinke well would spend litle time may commune matter importance beside shall cause wound giant almaroll sooner healed grieue much hauing receiued foile noble knight hand doe thinke answered damosel knight would wish tarrie haue promised visit place faile doe gaine ill report number wherefore desire suffer depart hence would take oath last knight conquered shall make faithfull promise haue knowledge name trauell court king recinde shall declare queene occasion combate fellow himselfe desire againe receiue ill opinion sudden departure florendos laboured disswade iourney would meanes mooued determination wherefore friendly embracing set forward way accompanyed damosel held greater reputation done began waxe contrary esteemed euery day worse chap xxvii happened damosel knight returned court recinde king spaine early next morning damosel knight set forward iourney court king recinde intending came thither discharge himselfe damosel would haue none company arlencea gentlewoman attended seruice loath forsake tiil brought place might marryed according honest behauiour deserued end thinke vnmindfull rode thus musing himselfe heard voyce woman cry pittifully wood hard way cry lamentable gaue horse spurres ridde till came heard noyse looking side beheld banke goodly riuer knight whose armour azure colour richly wrought ouer little fillet gold shield pictured golden lion siluer field feete held damosell haire head whose beautie deserued despightfull vsage knight shewed held sword drawne hand made show cut head refused obey lust farre espyed another knight tumbling among greene leaues laughed pittifull sight heartily ready fall sowne beholding hard shift damosell made helpe selfe laughed good spake word doth good see fortune enforceth take great pain meanes shall eased busie labour come take pleasure damosell damosel knight perceiuing shame knight endeuoured offer damosell cryed aloude forbeare villany else would cause buy pleasure dearely knight damosell haire head seeing knight spake boldly returned presently answer offended sir see vse damosell manner trust water broad betweene would quickly make know price boldnesse nouerthelesse thou darest tary long faile come thee thou shalt well vnderstand thou meetest knight soone allay thy brauery pray companion sayd knight lay doe offend selfe fretting raging iudge best go knight hath many damosel company may take choyce without trouble desire friend answered damosel knight would tell ford passage end may make triall valour haue great desire come v said first knight must swim ouer know way began againe pull hale damosell cruelly would mooue damosel knight anger earnest reuenging great shame villany making account danger passage alighted horse lept riuer passed well recouering furder side knight lay among greene leaues said companion doe trouble selfe determination quickly quaile lustinesse knight whereto prince thus answered hard say thing may come passe intend hinder pleasure make account without word setled himselfe close knight gaue friendly entertainment tumbled ground left arme broken shiuers knight seeing misfortune fellow left damosell defend himselfe waightie stroke damosel knight handled sort constrained craue aid hand sought haue abused word beseech faire damosell forget iniury haue done intreate knight saue life damosel knight held hand would strike expected damosell would say beholding amiable countenance would haue forced supprised exceeding greefe pittied see neare death required reuenge dishonest enterprise whereupon spake damosel knight manner let intreate lord saue life wicked man may hereafter warned falling like offence promise faire damosell sayd florian cannot command thing would willingly consent vnto knight hath deserued greater punishment yet hath suffered giue life vpon condition shall take companion best manner deuise shall trauaile king spaines court shall declare lady shame would haue offered shall promise neuer weare armour againe without pleasure suffer knight promised respect accomplish whereupon esquire prouided knighly beere whereon knight layd arme broken carryed companion court king recinde damosel knight walked along riuers side holding damosell hand reason exreeding seare forgotten esquire knight would haue rauished bound fast tree put gagge wood mouth would bee preuented purpose cry long damosell embraced desired prince would returne againe deliuer esquire miserable vexation came found two palfrayes vpon prince caused esquire mount commaunding ride along riuers side till could finde place get ouer side bring horse meane esquire went comanded prince vnarmed himselfe drie garment full water questioned damosell happened place vppon occasion knight sought distdnest word made answer shall vnderstand sir knight borne countrey belong princesse miragarda know whether haue heard yes indeede haue said prince name ladie much renowmed whole world many knight meanes beautie haue wrought themselues much dishonour said damosell tooke occasion trauaile little countrey fortune vnhappie chaunced meete two knight demaunded place iourney lay misdoubting harme behauiour seemed honest declared vnto whole state iourney whereupon one knight spake thus vnto companion thinke good reuenge shame haue receiued castle giant almaroll ease ou anger damosell one attendant princesse miragarda respect beautie render v sufficient pleasure forget foyle tooke push launce knight equall fellow vngracious intent presently allow others iudgement cast lot abuse first fortuned fall saw pulling cruelly haire head esquire grieuing see ill intreated cryed aldude might come succour dealt discourteously haue seene beene gratious assistaunce god knowes sorrow poore soule haue endured truely madame answered prince reioyce chanc reskewe yet beene better haue come hither secret wound haue receiued singular beautie consider good desert withall readinesse shall finde mee welfare iudge may bestow gentlenesse vncourteous knight would haue taken perforce damosell noting word regarding sweet countenance remembring noble behauiour princely courtesie made aunswere knewe incident purpose hee best able answere harme newe willeth let alone hearken damoselles esquire returned cried prince presently mount horse giue assistance damosel knight blacke armour sought leade away perforce prince hearing word esquire incensed sudden fury tarrying till armed ranne riuer swimme ouer great hast willing damosell come passe ouer foord esquire could shew bring likewise company damosel soone florian passed riuer perceiued poliphemia come riding towards cry tearing haire pittifully make hast succour mistresse desirous doe glad follow foote knight carried away grieuously wounded legges horse fortune much fauoured arlencea spied damosel knight comming ouertooke gotten halfe mile distance riuer hee perceiued knight set vp arlencea behinde esquire could hardly cause sit still horse stroue often get ground wherfore rid hold horse damosel knight seeing knight blacke armour clapt helmet head would haue dismounted defend himselfe aduanced himselfe towards arlencea held fast horse till damoselles knight stroken blow betweene necke shoulder fell ground like dead man taking helmet would haue parted head shoulder yet pacified furie would send likewise lady spanish court caused esquire vnarmed held arlencea horse behinde maister wept bitterly desiring prince haue compassion comming againe knight knee commanded declare name called rocamor sayd knight friend two knight lately vanquish reuengement iniurie intended carry away lady well quoth damosel knight faile accomplish charge shall commit sweare shall presently loose life knight answered thus good sir end may escape great danger vow selfe obedient whatsouer command sayd damosel knight presently take way king spaines court present selfe lady attendant queene reporting hath passed betweene beside shall neuer liue beare armes againe without shall please licence like charge haue giuen thy two companion haue promised fulfill beseech sir answered knight tell end may declare name command thus submit selfe king spaines court shall say quoth prince damosel knight enioyned pennance bold borrow horse haue dealt discourteously mine causing arlencea mount horsebacke left knight returned place damosell stayd comming way conferred arlencea dishonourably knight countrey behaued themselues wandring damosel come rest company saw amongst siluiana name knight would haue rauished af oorded gentle welcome damosel little glad returne lady arlencea feared neuer haue seene againe night drew pace thiy concluded passe night knew prouision neare hand euery one tooke modicum small refection afterward layde downe rest siluiana could suffer sleepe enter eye good opinion prince farre loue rather tooke delight discourse al night thereon entertaine quiet rest fellowes chap xxviii prince florendos vanquished knight knight prince florian co quered arriued king spain court damosel knight departed castle giant almaroll prince florendos desirous execute charge left came vanquished knight desiring would satisfie whence end cam thither whereto knight thus answered shall vnderstand worthy sir borne realme spaine haue beene held good account king recindes court name shal know called brandamor companion name sigerall two desirous seeke knightly aduentures among many passed honour concluded make triall conquest sheeld wherein figured heauenly face princesse miragarda fortune minding former regard shee v caused v conquered damoselles knight could accomplish meane enter combate whose charge onely defende shielde assure friend answered prince florendos bold discourteous enterprise tooke hand deserued greater chastisement haue yet receiued one cannot deale seuerely enough put foorth themselues action doeth reproach high dishonour wherefore may purge selfe notorious crime shall faithfully protest vnto goe submit selfe king recindes court presume contrary haue adioyned shall enforce grieuous affliction wound doe haue body knight yet thorowly receiued feare damosel knight frighted withall vowed faithfully florendos would execute vttermost commanded wherefore hauing wound dressed presently betooke himselfe iourney leauing buriall companion prince day arriued king spaines court loth enter well knowne king chiefe noble men court notwithstanding great vnwillingnesse regard oath much preuailed entred pallace lady beheld repute amongst number vanquished damosel knight armour faire vnbroken blemished place beside shield whit impayred deuise thereof seene pleasure lady delighted greatly behold brandamor come chamber presence king queene together opened helmet kneeling downe queene rehearsed whole circumstance charge concerning behauiour damosel knight reporting great misfortune seeing many friendes present colour arose redde face neither king queene knew beene daily conuersant company generally reputed straunge knight queene demanded occasion enterprised combate damosel knight brandamor gaue vnderstand damoselles knight slaine companion sigerall vanquished iousted knight garded princesse miragardaes shield likewise combatted giant almaroll brought great daunger life wherevpon king entred speech certainely cannot chuse wonder hearing noble prowesse vnknown knight promise thee knight thou deseruest haue punishment hath happened thy companion assure thee would see executed thee selfe perswade selfe beautie princesse miragarda hath rauished mind knight might boast better assurance themselues could wordes brandamor came kissed kinges hand occasion king knew made iudge worthily damoselles knight commaunded chirurgions vse good respect vnto brandamor well deserued valour time past scantly departed presence two knight would haue rauished siluian arriued court feeble weake constrained leane esquiers shoulder till came king presence least hurt began vse language manner gracious lord damosel knight whose renowne highly commended court hauing vanquished v open fielde commaunded v come submitte selues excellency iudged according deedes haue deserued respect whereof come present selues lady court intreate worke behalfe maiestie offence may pardoned fleshly willes procured v commit two knight discoursed large euery thing happened vppon occasion king thus spake surely doth little content god hath suffered receiue punishment misdeedes hand renowned damosel knight whose behalfe loue beare proceede according hainous offence haue worthily deserued assure heare noble valour knight desirous haue knowledge lord said knight haue great occasion esteeme opinion worthines ought knight sake therefore humbly intreat maiestie vse perswasion lady suffer companion beare armes forbidden damosel knight vntill lady court haue pardoned iniurie offered damosell knight hardinesse tooke v promise friendes saide king good slender case shall receiue fauor ayde knight noting king answere desired queene might stand pleasure command lady entertaine fauorable iudgements would witnesse good affection towardes long liued would ready spend liues queene leisure make answere knight would haue carried away arlencea came humbled himselfe knee lady declaring damoselles knight commaunded come render himselfe mercy without would permit weare armour conceit thereof grieuous tooke hardinesse intreate queene assist sute whereto returned answere seemeth lady court remaine greatly indebted damosel knight whose sake wil seeme hinder commit three discretion sent knight last deliuered message sooner beheld two presently knewe one called ferrobreque gentafort discended giant race sight caused take misfortune heauily lady vnderstanding pleasure queene concluded giue leaue weare armor warning perill liues vse place lady damosel iniured passe let alone whether cause iust vniust intermeddle withall charge seemed vnfriendly knight durst seeme dislike thereof wherevpon constrained allow sentence afterward tooke leaue departed court good space tydings came spanish court damoselles knight length three knight armed brauely arriued pallace euening tide king queene lady walking faire gallerie prospect whereof court might beholde three knight sent esquire declare willes king recinde arriuall esquire caused many assemble gallery esquire come king humbled himselfe knee word renowned prince three straunge knight commaunded mee let highnesse vnderstand haue trauailed long time seruice three daughter galiaster duke arragon iudged faire eye three knightes albeit found verie false loue long time entertayned knightes chiefe affection married vnto three gentleman brought vppe father court receiued great contentment considering offence haue committed beiug forgetfull owne honour marrie beseemed degree three knight highly offended hereat haue concluded neuer espouse damosel onely wearie owne seruants vouchsaf admit entertainment foresaken lady shall alledge change equall three knight iustifie triall thereof combate ladyes may fauour demand without preiudice renowme declare estate knight first named lustramar eldest sonne marquesse inuincible stomackes abide day manner see make proofe armes amourous seruants fall find lady court desirous keepe old seruants entertaine newly come content depart hence euen came hither gone hence visite prince court christendome trie fortune fauourable knit vp earnest desire contentment king recinde greatly abashed sudden newes knight moued much aduenture especially regarding estate would combate ladyes thus much say many among would gladly haue forsaken old fauoured seruants condition might marrie three noble prince king queene allowing well worthy enterprise stayed great looking one knight court would venterous deale seeing none would come prepared themselues depart instant damosel knight arriued valiant renowmed knight sooner espyed knew came met letting vnderstand enterprise three strange knight rehearsed damosel receiued much ioy thereat wearie hope depart three knight prince vnderstanding intens said vnto shall selues imagine expedient recempence selfe meanes three knight great trauaile haue taken dayly seruice haue beene greatly deceiued loue sayd artesia content change company minde said woone knight forrest vpon sent three knight preparing themsel e ioust willed come deliuer handes would compell stay company quoth king knight wil attaine cheefe enterprise hardy damo sels knight artesia companion forsooke company arlencea put themselues apart lady court perceiuing could chuse maruell thereat knowing wel prowesse knight conducted iudged occasion damosel desire themselues might owne libertie others reputed cause vnfaithfulnes found knight gradian seeing day wast apace tooke hardinesse aduance himselfe foorth first making show ioust damosel knight beholding gaue horse spur encountred gradian great force made fetch errand ground hee came artesia word necessarie againe come obey shall command receiued another launce one king page brought vnhorsed arpian learned sit fast sadle lustramar angry misfortune friend wherfore encountred damosel knight nobly caused forsake one stirrops himselfe sent keepe fellowes company three knight seeing dishonour receiued ioust offered trie combate sword chiefly lustramar seeme desirous damosel knight excused himselfe seeing day departing speedily darke night ready ouercharge yet would lustramar content answere poliphemia perceiued came vnto word pray sir knight content selfe seeke urther occasion time assure guide litle woont conquered deale well contented hauing felt indeede put vp soyle fall haue found small assurance answered lustramar woman word counsell forbeare follow enterprise promise said artesia boast bargaine end two knight prepared themselues combate king recinde desirous know damoselles knight came himselfe place two knight offering charge one another hee ca sed parted oure honourably brought pallace damoselles knight humbly saluted queene hauing taken helmet hee kneeled downe kisse hand king knew presently imbraced louingly speaking thus queene madame pray make good
