taking courteous farewell side charging doe commendation emperor child emperours court king returned againe citie prince rode iourney chap xxix happened knight sauage man came castle arnalte princesse nauarre made abode florian forrest forgetting take new armour departed king spaines court yet keeping deuise shield sauage man still greater delight therein manner trauelled atchieuing many rare singular aduentures breuities sake let passe importance placed among knightly deed coasted along diuers country fortune length arriue pleasant valley euen castle princesse arnalte stood rid abroad hunting also see combate fought betweene dragonlat sonne drapos another knight would confesse princesse arnalte fairest lady earth assure presence arnalte gaue encouragement dragonalt vanquished aduersary without great endamagement person armour azure colour bearing shield deuise miragarda enioyned came princesse castle almaroll left honour day vppon occasion arnalte greatly stomacke knight beautifull gratious often fortunate triall aduentures continued earnest affection seruice end began fauour courteous deed regard done returning knight sauage man princesse company damosel espyed comming far whereupon came draganolt graciously saluted said behold come onely man world cruell enemy desire seuerely reuenged wherefore especiall good friend desire see vttermost redoubted behauiour fortune regard happinesse enioy danger fight wil faile recompence sort shall thorowly satisfied contented promise make answered dragonalt estimation thought word onely able assure victorie albeit fortune seene set selfe perswade yourselfe vnpossible vanquished continue acceptable fauour hope whereof onely enter combate knight desire haue reuenge wrong likewise depriue ladyes yea life shall like command dragonalt spent amorous speech ladie mistresse conquered thought knight sauage man company came place stayed dragonalt content honor princesse aduanced himselfe forward word sir knight let know arre arriued place thought meete make triall valour shall finde authoritie enforce obey commandement princesse cause confesse fairest lady liuing earth best worthy knightly seruice haue dispoyled armour shall goe submit yourselfe lady mistresse arnalte princesse nauarre shall accept seruice damosel company pittie see ouercharged whereto prince florian thus replyed princesse nauarre friend desirous serued damoselles great shame haue sought present might haue found better acquainted damoselles princesse arnalte might haue receiued far honoour thinke shall defend well enough comming seruice moreouer impudent confesse large title haue made imagine selfe depriued wittes selfe seruant gratious ladie princesse arnalte may way equall beautie shall make confesse depart dragonalt offended heare word knight sanage men tooke strong launce esquire bowing himselfe princesse assist fauour broched horse prince likewise prepared himselfe ioust encountred together valiantly dragonalt breaking launce knight sauage man sheelde lifted vppon croupher horse dragonalt himselfe cast forth saddle vpon prince florian cast himselfe horse dragonalt hauing recouered feete beganne charge one another furiously dragonalt intended accomplish promise would fight till knight sauage man depriued life found himselfe greatly deceiued noble florian handled sort prindesse arnalte well perceiued strength knight began faile maruaile greeuously wounded many place whereat knight sauage man greatly offended fearing kill outright paused awhile would suffer take breath desired giue ouer combat returne passage enterprised guard dragonalt gaue answer counsell r knight necessarie followed made account life honour fight therefore let vnderstand intend giue ouer combat began combat fresh wounding one another cruelly arnalte damosel greatly pittie see knight cruelly bent blood altered colour grasse fought end dragonalt able endure longer fell downe knight sauage man feete princesse presently fearing would cut head friend spake manner pray sir knight take life considering victorie sufficient honorable mind promise madame answered knight sauage man wil hold hand without recant former word promise gift intend demand pray said arnalte let rise content grant euer request prouided alwayes seeme impeach mine honor knight sauage man gaue dragonalt hand princesse arnaltaes damoselles presently vnarmed conueied castle haue woundes drest daunger whereof grieuous conceyt minde againe conquered presence ladie knight sauage man lodged without castle arnalte thinking neuer reuenged soiourned three dayes end whereof came take farewell finding prince dragonalts chamber fell conference reprouing small account seemed haue whereupon made answer madame firme constant kinde beautifull thing necessarie durst awarrant knight could conuicted manner beside knight would willingly ioyne seruice assure offred compell would willingly haue granted owne desire desirous doe faire lady seruice remembring alwayes ought well esteemed forgotten shall vnderstand haue beene court england spaine little renowned beauty faire lady nourished likewise haue seene florenda daughter arnedes king fraunce whose beautie honoured great many shee champion named haue rehearsed selfe may compare lady emperour palmerins court haue seene gridonia polinarda leonarda princesse thrace sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemonia haue seene also princesse targiana daughter great turke whose loue albayzar soldane babilon hath suffered dangerous trauailes iudgement highly aduanced beauty beyond granted wedded affection towards let offend speake plainely crueltie pride together doeth much deface title beautie cannot deny selfe making light account doe sir dragonalt remembring worthy knight sonne one valiant prince earth triall sufficient cause loue faithfully trust must needes say hath put himselfe danger vnfaithfull person neither knightly bountie regard owne duty hath power mooue respect therefore made promise grant requested desire recompence noble desert would accept lord husband shall fulfill promise accomplish commandement king father charged fulfill respect answere see man build assurance word sir knight answered arnalte fauour tel first afterward doe good satisfie request knowledge faire lady saide knight sauage man shall hinderance matter wherefore aduertise called florian forrest sonne edward english prince flerida daughter emperor palmerin agonalt hearing word spake thus victory haue obtained sir knight loose nothing else reputation good knight could iote offended vanquished handes alwayes returneth combat conquerour seeing frustrate hope yeeld content cannot chuse complaine fortune hath caused fall great perplexitie arnalte vnderstanding knight sauage man sonne noble prince edward began blush remembring passed betweene desirous match mariage seeing might doe would contented selfe request declaring minde manner thinke sir knight could nobly vanquish enterprise knight would study practise deceiue poore simple woman neuerthelesse behauiour prince dragonalt enforceth obey desire vpon condition within one yeere hee shall bring mee court emperour palmerin well vnfained reuerence beare maiestie also acquainted gratious lady haue named god forbid madame saide knight sauage man agree lawfull request rather knowe presence greatly honour emper ur court florian offered kisse princesse arnaltes hand imbraced courteously dragonalt would haue humbled himselfe feete would suffer rise bed made estimation hee sent chiefe gouernours realme hauing knowledge knight sauage man iudged mariage dragonalt princesse according ought greater honour prince florian caused marriage solemnized presently castle next morning came take leaue prince dragonalt queene arnalte hauing made promise would faile accompany emperours court tooke way iourney forsake speake somewhat prince albayzar chap xxx prince albayzar embarqued himselfe saile turkie presented himselfe prince thrace albayzar soldane babylon desirous leaue king spaines court three dayes tried ioust noble prince florian forrest taking farewell king queene lady knight court friend set forward way accompanied two esquire making speedy haste long attained cittie constantinople comming pallace proude stately iesture entred chamber presence found emperour empresse lady beside cheefe prince knight court making reuerence stood viewing among lady seene might repute princesse thrace last iudging prince sate next vnto faire polinarda came kneeling saluted speech madame instant depart king spaines court knight arriued accompanied nine damosel trying iousts redoubted knight court vnhorsed brauely one another sight hereof made desirous hazard fortune ill hap serued done knight hauing thus conquered enforced make faithfull promise would come submit self declare message would command condition made either part began ioust knight charged say vnto small griefe vnto since fortune would present especial occasion whereby might declare good bare neuerthelesse desired humbly would make acceptance first seruice though great estimation singularitie deserues remaine know cause shall like imploy may doe seruice albayzar well knowne emperor court great ioy made side arriual emperor himselfe well pleased see come good disposition good regard princesse targiana lady whose vertuous desert bound carefull albayzars health prosperity safe deliuerance princesse thrace arose taking albayzar hand spake thus vnto pray sir albayzar doe shall please emperour command iudge nothing hurtfull vnto seeing great desire hath reioyce princesse targiana presence albayzar tooke good part gentlenesse princesse thrace vsed towards hauing giuen hearty thankes courtesie came saluted empresse princesse gridonia afterward came emperour taking armes entred speech assured sir albayzar soldane olorique father receiued great contentment imbraced doe yet desirous doe honour well friendship beare father recompence part great courtesie haue receiued princesse targiana espoused lady may commaund thing shall thinke good court sory cannot perswade selfe may doe much gracious lord answered albayzar simple vnderstanding well perceiue great honour haue alwayes offoorded yet cannot forget shame receiued court vanquished likewise haue done iustice prince florian iniury offered princesse targiana albeit great turke father requested hand right iustice daily permit euery one kindred preuaileth towardes heare iustice calleth see well said emperour reason cannot preuaile certifie yet princesse targiana came hither owne good compelled enforced therto florian forrest nephew referring talke vsed among friend pray imagine selfe welcome goe rest selfe chamber gallies prouided haue expected comming since sonne polendos knight arriued constantinople lord said albayzar take time commodious mee saile vse good opportunitie therefore intend stay longer countrey eeuen please answered emperor meet disswade resolute ambassador staied came reuerently prince albayzar hold gallies ready sea good case winde well voyage prince albayzar tooke leaue emperor empresse lady accompanied prince primaleon polendos belcar giant dramusiande others came port galley lay giant dramusiande seeing small account albayzar made prince bare company spake vnto manner see well albayzar emperor worthy blamed shewing honour vnthankefull person seemes regard prince primaleon father request coming grace company albeit needed abase himselfe much tush sir answered albayzar long since knew small good thou couldest allow tell thee noble mind disdaineth familiarity accouteth better enemy thus thou maist perswade thy selfe enemy emperor court thou maist tell wherefore vse courtesie prince primaleon shewe worst wherefore sir dramusiande grieue see behaue selfe doe among mine enemy promise returne much expedition witnesse walles citie haue houre minde could wish saide dramusiande thou hast beene thou wouldst wert returned hither againe might reuenge iniurie thou didst thou wast bold cary away shield princesse miragarda albayzar make answere prince primaleon tooke dramusiade hant knight returned pallace gaue emperor vnderstand good prince albayzar bare gallies launced deepe marriners hoy ed sayles hauing wind short time reached great caire great turke made abode iudged emperour palmerin would offended entertainement gaue knight knowledge arriuall galley ioyfull came himselfe receiue prince hauen desirous question emperor honest vsage towards feared least owne intent treason would reprooue albayzar remained certaine time great turkes court attending comming principall estate babilon would haue preseted second solemnizing marriage honoured presence soldane persia king bythinia king gasplia king terbifonde beside many prince knight concluded together passe sea lay siege citie constantinople would suddainely execute intent seuerely returned dominion make preparation traiterous enterprise chap xxxi happened knight tiger departed perillous isle taking iourney towards citie constantinople knight tiger history hath beene silent along time entred foyst argentao gouernour profoud isle time wind contrary faine take landing isle soiourned certaine day earnest importunitie inhabitant could thinke themselues neuer enough satisfied company yet long desire see citie constantinople made imagine time tedious till came thither length much doe hee departed thence galley accompanied friend siluian uew armour caused bee made profound isle keeping deuise golden tiger renowned thorow country christendome hauing sayled long time hee came last coast scotland minde serued well goe shoare trauelled three dayes countrey came goodly valley along middest thereof great riuer far beheld faire house standing riuer side hauing bride passage kept knight greene armour bare shield white bull deuise made suspect brother pompides side bridge crossed ouer another part riuer espied another knight seemed hardy man knight bull rich armour might passe bride without hee first combate defended would endure fight hee must yeeld himselfe armisia king scot daughter house belonged strange knight attending got horsebacke put fortune triall set libertie passage failed intent shall heare hereafter rendred himselfe mercy armisia ordained custome ende might haue house furnished kinges good courage whereof knew get number passage one chiefest scotland none could get side riuer without passed bridge large foure knight might easily combate thereon well fenced either side could bee daunger riuer fought combate knight tiger stayed see ende combate betweene knight viewing well knight bull lifted vp feuere helmet speake damosell stood looking foorth window perfectly perswaded brother pompides hauing concluded familiar talke damosell tooke lance came forth vpon bridge whereupon strange knight spake manner feare sir knight shall hindered night draweth fast vpon v make end combate whereto see prepare selfe onely witnesse seruice damosell window materiall sir answered knight bull sake enterprise fight doubt good promise without word ranne together couragiously broken lance met fiercely body fell beside horse ground recouered themselues drew swordes wherewith fought doubtfull daungerous combate aduantage whereof fell knight bull yet easily glad rest himselfe enemie perceiued leaned himselfe wall giuing speech strange knight say sir doe perswade selfe haue power sufficiently accomplish haue promised wherefore would counsell reserue manhood occasion better lose life therefore bee ruled aduise goe submitte selfe princesse armisia deale discourteously render seruice vnto willingly straunge knight returned aunswer sir knight know well profite danger come doe perswade mee therefore pray let talke passe let v end haue begun without attending answer began charge knight bull againe entertained sort short time felt himselfe feeble resist hardy stroke enemy gaue end vnable continue longer lost much blood yt fell downe knight bull taking helmet spake vnto manner shall vnderstand sir knight cause scorned follow counsell shall whether goe submit selfe princesse armisia refuse doe fayle part head shoulder know sir answered straunge knight two condition chuse wherewith present dangerous seeme would willingly receiue death hand goe submit selfe pleased nothing else adioyning shamefull death knight bull ignorant reason feared much goe render himselfe princesse armisia desired would tell name truely sir said strange knight intend much satisfie yet contentment vanquished conquerour hath knowledge knight bull seeing obstinate sent esquire princesse armisia desiring pleasure grant knight life armisia alwaies courteous preferment fauour commanded one damoselles goe knight bull tell giue knight life knowledge damosell sooner come bridge presently knew vanquished knight adraspe sonne duke sizana slaine prince doriell brother lady mistresse armisia reuenge whose death guarding passage first ordained vpon damosell began crie aloude teare haire pittifully saying come slaine prince doriell lady hearing came downe immediatly damosel waiting shee weeping bitterly spake knight bull manner pray sir knight let haue assistance deliuered grieuous passion wherein haue long time remained shall vnderstand knight haue conquered flew brother doriell whose death king father liueth extreame heauinesse knight tiger marking word spake order friend siluian see wel dangerous fall hand woman desirous vengeance deale hundred good hardy knight wherefore pray thee take horse goe see entreatance life may saued came bridge desired knight bull would offer knight cruelty turning princesse armisia saluted speech madame anciant enmitie causeth desire death knight pray admit memorie lady great calling ought void lenitie pittie chiefely time haue power execute extremitie reason sufficient appease anger pray yet consider selfe person vse crueltie may shew pittie repent themselues afterward collericke moode ouerblowne past honest vertuous language knight tiger power mooue pittie princesse armisia commanded knight bull cut head enemie prince gaue wordes promise madame neither pittie perswasion may preuaile stand eyesore way selfe shall execute malicious humour would heart said knight bull might please princesse grant knight life since presume boldly defend refuse albeit sore wounded let vnderstand neither shall hinder fulfilling lady hath commanded knight tiger vse wordes end hee would enter combate pompides onely change rigorous humour armisia saw knight danger cruell minde princesse shee continued still one song calling head vanquished knight adraspe great expence blood griefe see wreakefull armisia ended life knight tiger pompides preparing themselues combat armisia seeing adraspes dead could yet contented therewith head smitten commanded wherefore pompides accomplish willed shee flang away furie went chamber pompides brought great extremitie loue grieue departure constrained set downe vpon bridge knight tiger perceiuing heauines tooke pitty came comfort pompides seemed disdaine iudged presence procured misfortune siluian seeing maister returne came walking horse bridge pompides hauing espied knew presently knight tiger renowed palmerin england perswasion great ioy hee conceiued came word well assured gratious lord comfort receiued present instant deface extinguish former mishap palmerin tooke helmet hauing imbraced pompides beganne perswade good hope lady sooner forgotten anger shee reprooued selfe great vnkindnesse shee sent intreate pompides would pardon pleasure bring knight house whoo saw familiar pompides vnderstanding princesse took brother hand walked chamber vnarmed princesse came selfe visit entring speech knight tiger beseech sir knight excuse made account honest courteous word assure great danger wherein instant would suffer regard perswasion whatsoeuer onely reuenge selfe cruell enemy shal conceiue ill opinion tell cause enuied knight much shall vnderstand sir daughter meliadus king scot whose court adraspe eldest son duke sizana pompides hath slaine beganne waxe amourous knew bee one bad condition made regard earnest suite neuerthelesse importunate voyde reason would answered wherupon constrained complaine prince doriell brother adraspe perceiued himselfe bee hated despised practised way might best reuenged following secret trayterous intent long opportunitie execute mallicious stomacke chanced one day brother appointed walke abroade together adraspe priuily armed hauing hand prouided purpose slew brother whose death king father could accomplish reuenge hee deale one cheefest prince realme best assured friend yet heart free continuall vexation respect nature could otherwise chuse pittying willing assist father vttermost could left court caused house erected place chiefest passage realme enterprised haue valiant knight defend birdge promising marry could happie kill adraspe alwayes accustomed bearing proude loftie minde would oftentimes come show himselfe onely vexe remembrance brother death still hee would combatte knight euermore fortunate vanquish kill knight bull tooke charge vpon adraspe heard noble prowesse remained two moneths could come hither againe yet last came trie fortune knight bull hath depriued life see satisfied wil made ordaine custome madamy answered knight tiger haue helpe taking life told first great wrong done earth open swallow intend practise treason prince yea prince himselfe cannot free secret conspirator fauour shall stand steede iustice wicked offendors wherefore sharpely punished rest better warned tran gression assure madame haue done well beseemed vertuous princesse cutting branch fortune made instrument vnhappinesse beside duetie wherein bound knight father command see good deede executed therefore let humbly intreate would keepe promise sir pompides brother nephew king frederick england sonne prince edward father friend see well sayde armisia haue wrought contentment knight father taken vengeance death prince doriel brother prowesse whose presence small honour neuerthelesse may thinke selfe little beholding hath concealed himselfe long would haue allowed honourable entertainment pray sir let offed desire know whether yon prince king princesse armisia accompanied brother pompides embarqued gaue vnderstand charge wherein prince bound receiued royall dignitie desiring earnestly since fortune brought great felicitie would vse himselfe modestly wisely fortune vncertaine selfe sometime put person greatest feare placed assurance whereby letteth vnderstand quickly dispossesse happinesse time little looke alteration end may enioy dignitie assurance counsell entertaine subiects amitie administring iustice rightly vnto let bee done good zeale conuerted rigour cruelty whereby shall cause say gouernor become tyrannous vnmercifull lord answered pompides wordes sauouring good iudgement worthy high commendation cannot thinke selfe much bound noble friendly counsell assuring lodge faithfully heart accomplish according gracious commaundement otherwise shall iudge selfe vnworthy named brother many like speech past betweene imbraced one another pompides returning citie palmerin entring shippe caused sayles hoysed winde seruing well spent time meete great iourney prince tooke landing hungaria past diuerse place countrey chaunce arriue goodly forrest length came faire fountaine couered arke maruellous ingenious workemanship weather exceeding hot alighted refresh himselfe fountaine meane siluian suffered horse grase pasture prince washed hand face espyed little downe forrest damosel running speedily haire hanging shoulder tearing faire visage nailes cry weeping measure last espyed knight tiger came running great pace casting selfe feete remained fearefully looking good hauing power speake one word knight tiger seeing perplexed case began pittie much doubted lest feared would make pursuite called helmet sooner clasped head beheld comming way damosell came giant strongly armed carying hand huge mace seeing damosell demaunded succour knight tiger spake vnto manner trust damosell betake selfe simple assurance knight wanteth strength defend without word strooke prince mace put shield resist stroke rigorous shield flewe two piece prince somewhat offended hereat wherefore drawing sword gaue giant blowe arme afterward could hardly strike great purpose damosell remaining still extreame feare cruell intreatance gigant vsed would haue departed hide selfe forrest iudged knight tiger vnable subdue enemy siluian perceiuing came vnto counselled see end combat wherevpon gaue word pray gentle esquier friend would seeme hinder giant nay rather deuill whose force none found able resist assuredly put death hath slaine maister would yet said siluian would stay see ende fight peraduenture may happen otherwise expect knight tiger destitute shield auoid cruell stroke strong enemy behaued himselfe politiquely nimbly hee lent giant many sore blowes costrained could lift mace right hand vse left thinking yet deale well enough knight tiger prince fierce vpon hauing giuen many grieuous mortall wound heart began faile retired able resist many waighty stroke neuertheles prince seeing almost brought buy let flie still fiercely could haue meane charge againe giant perceiuing himselfe extremitie leaned backe tree defended himselfe great well prince could hardly reach hurt hee waged fight euery way precisely mace hee held hand watching time might giue prince stroke willingly would knight tiger might preuaile giant without hazarding person great danger went rested himselfe tree like wise giant beheld spake vnto order pray thee sir knight let find much friendship thy hand let vnderstand thy name haue euermore thought ten best knight earth could much thou hast done neither could haue bene able resist halfe content answered knight tiger satisfie thy much condition thou wilt promise tell thy name cause thou doest pursue damosell much quoth giant thou shalt commaund handes wherefore thou shalt vnderstand called vascalion ocrance sonne giant lucran slaine constantinople hand primaleon hardy enter combate reuenge death perrequin duas haue marriage gridonia duchesse ormeda afterward espoused primaleon time father slaine left keeping one brother named dramoque likewise slaine one sonnes prince edward england knight yet search knightly aduentures assure little agreeued see selfe case becanse almost depriued hope reuenge death father brother dye damosell fortune caused meet day vnderstood going court emperor palmerin visite leonarda princesse thrace desirous iniurie may emperours court endeuored selfe rauish damosell time fulfill pleasure esquire escaped hand came hindered ayd fiue knight haue left hold combat ten knight would follow damosel tooke selfe flight soone fiue knight began charge thus haue told whole circumstance minde remaineth reueale selfe according first promised beleeue vascalion answered knight tiger necessary thou shouldest receiue sharpe chastisement vsing thy life wicked action proofe hereof thou mayst behold thy selfe thou content death thy father brother seekest reuenge thy villainous innocent damosell let thee know therefore kinseman primaleon man slew thy father brother made called palmeran england sonne prince edward faire flerida sister primaleon whose sake intend take thy life thee depart vascalion word began greatly dismay knew well strength sufficient hold long yet presently aduanced himselfe shew desire reuenged slaine vuckle palmerin glad perceiued gianc forsaken tree serued rampire defence assayled furious stroke giant would gladly haue rested himselfe againe prince followed still earnestly length tumbled ground content see conquered set foote vpon taken helmet presently parted head shoulder sight hereof made damosell glad forgotten feare wherein giant pursued came knight tiger word faire damosell iudge fiue knight combate occasion cannot otherwise chuse great daunger wherefore goe seeke foorth succour meane may come faire softly esquire better ease shall take vp behinde horse tooke way saw giant come pursued damosell long heard clanching swordes wherevpon gaue horse spur neuer left gallopping till came sawe slaine foure giant knight sixe two could defend themselues purpose knight tiger knew dramian king recind sonne armour deuise bare shield alighting horse put himselfe among friendes charging one fought stoutly tumbled reeling ground fiue perceiuing greatly dismayed short time knight tiger companion made ende wretched liues damosell arriued soone sight siluian made knight answered arnolfe without wordes entred field iousted three knightes two vnhorsed third vanquished combat sword day declining gaue ouer time next morning entred field againe blacke armour hauing painted shield little flame fire field sable knight tiger stayed long hee came shewed himselfe field armed woont much disguised shadowes least hee knowne deuise tiger defaced one could iudge proportion passed along empresse chamber windowe chanced see lady polinarda whereat somewhat abashed seeing arnolfe ready ioust let passe fond conceit praunced list know state enterprise presently declared one iudges feeld whereupon prince aduanced himselfe giant arnolfe speaking vnto manner thou shalt vnderstand arnolfe thou art deale kinseman knight sauage man wherefore thou hast thing say vnto reuenge one linage arnolfe iocound heard word presently gaue horse spur knight tiger encountred together great force prince forsooke one stirrup arnolfe sent earth heeles vpward braue beginning caused emperor primaleon reioyce iudging strength arnolfe vnequall compared knight tiger alighting horse came receiued arnolfe point sword little mooued sore fall especially hauing receiued foyle hand allied knight sauage man combate beganne continued great fury moued emperour wordes perceiue arnolfe might haue vsed lesse boasting prowes seemeth far vnable make resistance knight fighteth reason good father aunswered primaleon euill person punished example may remaine others beware meddle vnduttfull attempt arnolfe knight tiger hacked one another armour witnessed cruell rage furie especially gyant whose flesh cut mangled many place blood tricked apace downe armour great losse whereof caused giue ouer take breath awhile desired knight tiger tell name whereto returned answer tell thee alnofe said prince neere kinsman knight sauage man hauing lesse desire end thy cursed life haue like thou art arnolfe replyed thus place long desired assure thee receiue small c ntentment dealing thee happie depriue thee life shal perswade self reuenged greatest enemy fortune giue thee power vanquish shall likewise well content shall sooner visite brauorant sonnes reuenge whose death either end thy dayes sword offer vp spirit thy feete knight tiger perceiuing obstinate began charge roughly yet done following intent gallantly neuer left till tumbled ground starke dead taking helmet seeing life left kneeled downe thanked god victory came primaleon prince conducted knight tiger empresse chamber taking helmet kneeled downe emperour weeping ioy see imbraced armes gratiously afterward came humbled himselfe empresse kissing hand like gridonia lady came ady mistresse speech behauiour caused suspition loue present chap xxxiiii talke prince palmerin princesse polinarda lady greatly bus ed prince palmerin certaine dayes visiting friend could attaine felicitie heart desired tormented secretly though bare foorth good countenance neither could find meanes speake lady dramuciana gentlewoman might discouer griefe end therfore might somewhat remedy affection made case knowne siluian entring empresse chamber desired dramaciana speake word two well siluian handle matter dramaciana came speake prince palmerin chamber window vnderneath lady chamber shadowed arch stone towards garden one might hardly perceiue palmerin receiued lesse contentment speaking dramaciana would beene owne lady made gentlewoman acquainted secrete passion wherevpon iudging houre good fortune could neuer come passe without assistance damosell opened whole minde vnto whereon sufficiently scanned modestly gaue answere may well think famous renowned prince willing perceiue doe seruice would loth hide thing might returne benefite may perswade selfe dutifull good beare maketh hardy time knowing whether shal deceiued intend otherwise make account meete friend dramaciana answered palmerin neither doth time permit shamelesse person render inturie courtesie neither would wish iudge one wherefore setting doubt aside desire certefie end thinke long seruice come vnto hope haue receiued meanes hath euermore sustained vntill present cruell extremity else beene sufficient kill knowes well said dramaciana declare griefe shall neuer make beleeue depriued good hape considered also noble behauiour cannot blemished fogetfulnesse may build vpon princesse polinarda hath beene grieuously passioned time long absence haue beene daily tormented fearefull displeasant thought say haue suffered newes answered palmerin ought sufficient content pray wast time acquite selfe promise hath pleased oftentimes make conuenient word whereby doe highly please changed flattery deceite might growe seuere cause might losse lady well quoth dramaciana haue already prouided place may speake minde princesse ladd shalbe close secret window whereto may come enter chamber princesse fleridaes garden pray behaue selfe order shall neede speake together againe secretly place honor princesse cannot agree together without occasion great danger may perfectly behold answered palmorin account good hath beene alwaies call remebrance causeth abandon ye vnhappy occasion wherwith haue bin long acquainted enuious despite molest hauing fauorable furtherance side consider ye sweet contentation shall receiue hauing meanes speak gracious mistresse find selfe thrown many doubtfull perplexity respect vnworthines honorable dignity shall abashed feare yt displeasure withhold discoursing long tedous trauailes sake certainly sir palmerin aunswered dramaciana fond conceale princely deed wherwith many renowmed potentate haue bin acquainted haue bene valiant hardy spend time hitherto trauailes exceeding danger yet haue finished worthily needlesse shold dismay self presenting person place free hazard misfortune wil tel amorous affliction ye knight drawing pace talk prince maner endles brake conference time shewing place appointing houre speake lady palmerin taking leaue dramaciana went chaber spent night thinking talk passed ye gentlewoman good hope mean made hart sorrowfull wont somwhat behaued himselfe pleasantly remembring heure felicitie drew neere time come dramaciana charged respect took way appointed place passing couertly could garden entered princesse fleridaes chamber leauing siluian without giue knowledge came trouble palmerin walking vp downe chamber alone admitting many cogitation present attempt began thinke greatest detriment might happen knew well came combate amorously power depriue wonted courage could driue straite point refuge might haue flie vnto princely fauourable bountie afford could make account conquest offering approach window espyed princesse coming whose sight abashed sudden feare found voyce faint speake iudgement wherewith beene alwayes acquainted weake simple one would haue taken rather ghost liuing man perceiuing greatly pittying withdrew selfe little window remembring good counsell dramaciana giuen last stepped window princesse seeing aduanced selfe little pausing entred speech madame houre good fortune would allow recompence end long laborsome trauailes haue occasion find selfe agreeued well assure selfe presence hath power make forget paine haue suffered time haue borne yoake loue haue alwayes remained faithfull ab dient regard fauour brought place receiue vnspeakeable content requitall passed affliction trauaile esteeme importance comparison dignity present mine eye high honourable authoritie esteeme fortune exceede others could wish golden face beautie splendant drouping thought might neuer shadowed cloud misfortune ioy honour felicitie hath euermore bene making especiall account excellencie iudge pitte see liue continuall seruitude since extremitie greefe hath compelled take boldenesse would desire thinke come yet regard well auoyde impeachment might happen blemish renowme desire haue gratious fauor might end carefull continuall verations must iudge great consider thing past aduisedly hath bene dutifull remembraunce conceite imagine thing honour neither forsooke griefe danger trouble misfortune whatsoeuer hauing bene alwaies familiar life might eternize name time memory reposing good hope noble selfe eud trauailes shall agree gentle acceptation enforced earnestly request albeit labour haue bene great greeuons seruice yet forgetfull selfe repute present gratious fauour excellencie farre beyond haue done rather know sweete amiable nature seeme altogether left vnrewarded come passe make friendly account shall finde selfe dutifull towards desire comformable looke liketh content dispose caunot accept gratefully great content receiue trauailes haue done sake winde blast mee bounty shaddowe feare foyle fauour stand wordes princesse thus answered thinke sir palmerin would cause come place hold friuolous needelesse word promise reason thinke selfe deceiued could hardly withhold selfe leauing company first nourished brought vp court likewise kinseman friend hath made willing regard trauailes satisfie earnest intreatie dramaciana perceiue greater friend seeing fault mee rather blame mine owne timeritie though seeke satisfie desire without consideration honour whereby let sufficiently vnderstand smal regard haue danger wherein may fall sooner thinke vnaduisednesse cannot deny greatly indebted yet deepe summe easily come forth without preiudice renowme esteeme reasonable recompence noble seruice mine owne disaduantage good fame commendation haue gotten may content haue reward good great towards speech seeme make meet make known emperor grandfather mine also prince primaleon father doubting willing match v together shall esteeme greatest good fortune may happen hauing gained loue liking whose prowesse princely desertes worthy gratious estimation thus consent knit vp long desire v may ioyne one agreement gladnesse prgy accept answer without good wils neither may accord vnto promise madame aunswered palmerin hard receiue contentment commending deedes cannot regard make account seeme refuse go emperour prince primaleon might thought vnwise first would perswaded thorowly good principall action fall consent vpon word shall vse yet resolued acceptation shall take boldnesse seeing time place seruing let vnderstand sure inui lable consent loyalty together albeit fond timeritie vsed towardes may cause iudge farre vnable speake dacitie cause would haue yet thinke faithfull affection wherewith haue continually serued compell enter boldnesse tell doe oi seeme leane contented laudable recompence may receiue others handes regard haue trauailes aduentures daily vsed honour name maketh thinke deserue great fauour nature cannot agree would loth otherwise rewarded must content selfe obey pleasure yet shall finde selfe deceiued opinion haue hitherto conceiued depriued presence lady chiefest misfortune happen faithfull louer left comfort carefull minde none absent friend hath commoditie fit rip vp many sad sorrowfull discourse wherewith may chase away remembrace deceytes whose presence dearer life selfe yet custome loue mingle among sharpest conflict hope onely sweeten mouthes little delightfull taste waste time ieast dalliance vnder amorous ensigne gay foyle graceth copper curant gold meane shaddow deceitfull dealing yet number spend liues seruice gaine knowledge trumperie end glad forsake dare take hardinesse doe surely bound shall leaue desire loued none regard whose good haue thrust selfe danger whatsoeuer returning victor rather aide incomparable beautie force valour remain selfe pausing replied manner thinke syr palmerin receiue answere word gaue wherefore make iudge estimation since perceiue loue hath fondly blinded suffer see modest readinesse pleasure content giue yet greater assurance would noble renowned prince depart offended iniured perswading selfe seeme enterprise thing whereby motion impeachment may come mine honour thinke hardly diligent seruice haue done therefore againe humbly intreate speake emperour primaleon father knowe estate good willes whereof faile giue perfect assurance mine answere truely dutie accounteth bad obedience superiours wil suffice verily perswade selfe loue seeme beare rather disgrace preserue honour sweete madame answered palmerin refuse doe aduise reason thrust foorth seruice knowing doe ouerthrow blisse erecting happinesse consisteth duely gratious mistresse thus concluding tooke hand kissed number time together without expence many salt teare reking sighes made princesse blush grieue inwardly pittying see great humilitie prince palmerin betrothed selfe presence princesse thrace dramaciana gaue counsell vse matter order whose meanes polinarda soone contented altogether windowe matter knit fast assurance palmerin keepe company day must part night till pittying see lady stand long compelled take leaue time chap xxxv certaine knight arriued court emperour palmerin aduertised turk prouided great armie come besiege constantinople dvring time great ioy manner shee deuise word prince floraman thus answered faire damosell haue bin thing forgetfull towards lady humbly desire pardon may perswade selfe seeing passed without vsing courtesie rather occasion turning horse ridde damosell lady entred castle floraman power ouertake whereat greatly agreeued comming damosell brought thither presently entred speech pray faire gentlewoman tell mee name maintaine shall constrained enter combate sir answered floraman may lawfully refuse combate haue seene foure lady one three knight replied againe thus sir yet haue seene lady shall suffered enter castle may contemplate beauty latrania chaunce remaine affectionate many haue done desire enter seruice may shun danger combate knight laying hand vpon one companion spake thus floraman hold honour haue sight foure would chuse lady mansia mistresse another saide selfe knight wee altogither addicted seruice telansia cause abide place see knight holdeth part dare bold come place wee may try fortune gaining recompence lady haue ordained shall happy remaine victor floraman greatly enflamed towards lady remembring still losse fuire altea entred castle latrania receiued gratiously excusing himselfe towards dutie passed forrest assure floraman iudged lady castle faire hee could willingly haue offered himselfe sustaine quarrell feared least reputed vnfaithfull vnto best beloued altea stayed castle till morning hee would haue departed thence lady vnwilling see much offended offered maintaine beautie vpon floraman went foorth three knight one came vnto demanded beauty madame latrania onne power ouer answered certainly said knight greatly desire deale thee may giue due correction thy proud ingratitude gentleman answere floraman pray put selues readines reuenge shame say haue done madame latrania may well serue haue better knowledge desert haue neuerthelesse humor present dare aduenture selfe behalfe entend saide knight make knowe offence haue done vnto gaue horse spurres floraman albeit ioust lost one stirroppes encountred knight valiantly hee sent ground headlong astonished could tell two perceiuing desired likewise runne since lance yet whole sound answered floraman content doe much fauour ran second knight seruing like done first third came keepe company first knight offended hee vnhorsed desired floraman strike halfe dozen blowes end might amend foile receiued ioust prince sardignia seeing excuse would perswade knight alighted horse hauing drawn sword dealt nobly short time perceiued great dishonr gained prouing valour continued roughly fight knight compelled step aside take breathing made floraman giue word beleeue sir knight iudge sufficient serue latrania selfe truely saide knight force beautie may way equall selfe hath brought daungerous estate well content answered floraman heare say much greater aduantage haue lady present heare assure hath good occasion accept well haue spoken became man greatly affected beginning afresh againe knight though faintly defended himselfe well could latrania leaning one windowes castle seeing great daunger whereinto knight brought came downe place fought combate come prince floraman desired saue knightes life whereto request willingly consented speaking manner would gladly honour end combate thinke conuenient knight may thinke himselfe highly beholding haue saued life thorowly intended hee loose seeing small regard made selfe heare let rest himselfe latrania gaue honourable thanks returning castle grieued exceedingly good hardy knight could thinke well champion cause pleasant neuer knight would esteeme prowesse brician rochfort prepared himselfe first encounter blandidon regarding mansia iudged worthy chiefest victorie spake somewhat anangrily himselfe thus faire thus doe demand madome fauour hand receiuing benefit shall purchase glory conquering enemy ran couragiously brician rochfort encounted brauely launce flew vp piece yet neither danger vnhorsed brician perceiuig reputed good knight armes hee desired blandidon breake request made refusall ran second time met brician force constrained forsake stirrops cast armes necke horse saue himselfe falling ground blandidon cast croupper horse two knight taken seates againe prepared themselues third staffe discharged brician strongly horse himselfe tumbled ground blandidon danger haue borne company vanquished beauty caused hazard great danger redoubled stroke fiercely vpon one another length brician sore weakened fight depriued beauty lady fell downe ground blandidon presently tooke helet made offer part head shoulder except would confesse torsia excell three beauty brician lay extremity one maiden honour cried blandidon lady adiudged victory euer brician rochfort caried lodging blandidon disposition beginne combate afresh three knight subdue might haue praise victorie pompides sorry see blandidon wounded neuerthelesse glad honour day happened side vpon perswaded himselfe lady seruice would fall share next day following fayled present himselfe field long stayed rupert rasselin entered blacke armour crosse strickt little fillet gold shield indian colour god figured brought vnder obeysance knight mounted goodly roane courser soone heheld telansia faire greatly affectionate spake himselfe manner hee either may iniurie mee hauing seemely selfe therefore pray good madame would vouchsafe accept loyal heart wil neuer reefuse doo seruice especially may know pleasure perswade selfe soone discountenance knight maintained beautie torsia excell pompides knowing well behauiour rupert rosselin little content poore louer receyued beholding beautie telansia somewhat offended torsia yet come place combate fought passioned cause spake rosselin order thou must remember knight thou art come hither waste time conteplating beautie transformeth thee sense reason perceiue well answered rosselin torsia reposeth little hope valour disdaineth honour presence full word said pompides spend time giuing eare day would soone gone without trying either ioust combate without word ran rosselin encountring middest carrire worthily hardly recouered himselfe falling pompides nothing mooued rosselin tooke new staffe wherewith tryed fortune second time pompides meeting directly brake staffe nobly comming together horse fought one another pompides horse strength fel vnder master rosselin perceiuing aduanced himselfe recouered himselfe stood ready receiue point sword buckled together combat cruell short time flesh seene rosselins armour made semblance though nothing moued would haue lady make doubt prowesse earnestly followed intent pompides small aduantage himselfe neuerthelesse heart liuely himselfe nimble quicke rossolin suffered many sharpe stroke weake wearie enforced intreate pompides let take little rest content answered pompides let pause end may better trauaile selfe beholding beautie telansia considered also small fauour torsia bestowes cannot hinder vanquishing moreouer seene said rosselin great danger fight men depriued hope whe one remaineth conqueror ouer person honour victory giueth larger contentment spoken pleased pompides beganne combate againe hacking hewing one another cruelly within rosselin sore laboured altogether vnable harme enemy pompides seeing himselfe little better estate rosselin doubting least combate would endure long caught armes threw violently ground hardly able sustaine himselfe falling remembrance victory made take courage wherevpon made proffer cut head rosselin lady would agree vnto rosselin caried foorth fielde dangerously wounded pompides greater honour conducted chamber blandidon lay chirugions looked dillingently wound great friendes euer hauing one good assurance torsiaes fauour king himselfe came louingly visite knowledge greatly offended beene knowne court knight excused themselues lady whose beauty caused trauaile thither alwayes desiring vnknowne queene carefull haue well vnder greene tree whereon hanged many shieldes defended certaine knightes neere hand reposing themselues within tent seemeth said knight sauage man arlencea wee shall passe easily make account said discrete prince knowing enterprise dangerous laboured haue performe promise made lady knight sauage man made humble reuerence king afterward mounted horsebacke speaking thus againe damosell brought thither foure lady contented shall serue let see willingly venture life sake since haue tolde recompence shall happy ende aduenture passe declare condition enter combate seruants shall grant one gift victory happen side end shall bee ignorant intent take paine discourse shall vnderstand determined guard passage valley knight dare presume passe space eight dayes fortune allowe fauourable shielde surely lady answered knight sauage man haue seene miragarda combated knight kept shield fortunate power ouercome saide damosell dare take hardinesse vpon make large promise lady would faile vanquish knight could preuaile one knight marcy quoth presence lady affection beare shall sufficient enter combate conquer knight dare meddle see well saide damosell loue full incertaintie turning lady said might well agree request great desire see knight sauage man behauiour desired king giue consent mansia highly fauoured king arnedes beside willing see pastime gaue franke free licence whereupon foure ladyes graunted keepe passage would accompany eight dayes came damosell knight sauage man word haue much preuailed sir knight foure lady haue giuen consent fo request wherefore greatly desire see deed proue conformable braue word knight sauage man hearing damosell said came arlencea desiring reueale comming backe againe set downe order thus first ioust quoth shall mansia second telansia third latrania fourth shall honour torsia perceiue said king arnedes knight willing accomplish promise countie girarde desirous make knowne good bare telansia would need take field first encountring knight sauage man met force sent earth heeles vpward farre remembrance himselfe faine caried forth field sight king maruellously abashed countie gerard reputed best knight court mansia beganne thinke name three knight vanquished honor day adiudged prince would ouerlaboured could haue power vanquish three knight came countie gerard sooner carried field brialte seruant latrania gaue horse spurres burst launce brauely one prince gaue friendly welcome constrained fall ground one armes broken whereupon caried forth field countie gerard mansia glad could hide sate easily perceiue secret reioycing king arnedes seeing dangerous hurt brialte receiued beganne doubt straunge knight would iniurie aliart normandie seruant torsia ran brake lance gallantly strange knight shield sent keepe fellow company whereas offended started vp againe presently drawing sword came marching enemy fearing least knight would haue slaine horse lept beside casting eye vpon torsia making show sorie foile knight receiued vnder name yet acquite himselfe promise charged aliart roughly short time tumbled foot yet would offer take life damosell came granting victory three dayes sorie saide strange knight take paine lady see well answered damosell witnesse deedes promised word beginning knight sauage man counted himselfe called strange knight mounted horse againe taking launce came place lady sate entring speech see ready lady enter field vnder name madame telansia whose beautie sufficient make remaine victor ouer knightes dare speake lady mansia doe forget haue promised mee since see willing discharge bond wherein haue tyed selfe king arnedes well noting valour strange knight deuised might haue knowledge thinke bee one prince edwardes sonnes iudged would haue concealed himselfe queene beside aduertised palmerin england giuen ouer following aduentures knight sauage man realme spaine thus imagining straunge knight brian burgundie seruant mansia came field gallantly armed bearing deuise shield hope crowned garland flower field azure pausing little looking stedfastly lady mansia parled himselfe manner pray madame make doubt great prowesse strange knight could faile victory maintaining singular heauenly beautie presumeth change another doubt make loose seekes gladly purchase victory shall adiudged onely hath power winne remaine dutie liueth strange knight came speech haue done sir knight secret fancy perceiue one seekes content selfe silent discourse trust send companion meane telansia kn w saide brian burgandie ende couching lance add giuing signe strange knight ranne together couragiously brake lance force brian burgundie vnhorsed sors hurt yet would haue dissembled entred combat sword foure lady afraid strange knight would haue slaine caused proceede king much displeased seeing knight court handled yet themselues willing continue ioust whereupon monsier artois seruant latrania would wast time needlesse word cald strange knight defend himselfe would iudge sayd strange knight beautie lady cause regard somewhat since see repose assurance owne strength beautie whereby might enioy hope come welcome setting lance rest encountred together brauely albeit failed breake staues monsieuer artois receiued forcible arrant throwne dust sore shaken could scantly mooue himselfe strange knight caught hold helmet pausing spake mansia manner behold lady giue knight desiring let carrryed foorth field mansia caused two knight conduct lodging brian burgundie much offended would depart fought combat whereto ladyes would consent beside king began angrie whose commaundement reputed among vanquished brian departed place brisar gennes seruant torsia presented himselfe richly armed making shewe speech towards lady deed strange knight whome thought long deale withall made moued would speake strange knight perceyuing spake followeth pray sir contemplate beautie little whose sake bold enter combate end countenance may cause imagine griefe lesse fortune direct know well answered brisar gennes would gladly see mee shew feare fainting would thereby magnifie deed prouide selfe mee assure selfe hope repose lady fauour doubt ere go vnhorse vpon two knight met together force brisar gennes brake staffe though able remoue aduersary encountred brauely sent ground saddle betweene legges offered strike sworde damosell came stepped betweene strange knight could execute intent king arnedes extreamely grieued seeing victorie come fast disaduantage knight straunge knight beeing glad see fortune fauour well praunced till came latiania whome vsed language hee hath power performe hee promiseth companion hath lesse force quite himselfe whome iudge beautyfull cast eye madame mansia whose griefe hee might easily perceyue shee saw victory equall lady telansia latrania could assure selfe rength followed shee feared ouermuch trauell would weaken strength strange knight chap xxxix phow strange knight entred fielde ioust vnder name latrania straunge knight entred field againe came arlencea talked gomer benoit stayed letting vnderstand day passed apace wherfore behalfe mistresse telansia bade ioust strange knight entertained middest way gallantly aine keepe knightes companie hee knight good courage hee recouered himselfe quickly drew sword straunge knight beheld hee forsooke horse saluted cruell stroke ladyes glad send damosell separate asunder fearing least straunge knight would haue slaine damosell hauing sent gomer away seeing strange knight pleasant iocond though laboured himselfe demaunded would thinke himselfe haue trauelled enough marrie quoth lady whome commit selfe daunger thinke themselues haue neuer knight left doe seruice pray saide damosell would tell mee may make report king cannot quiet desire hath know name ladie quoth small estimation much ashamed knight vnexpert armes selfe discouered highnesse answered damosell valour may well abash best knight haue seene damosell gone forth lysts strange knight mounted squyres horse owne much trauelled king reioycing see victorious pittying destitute horse commaunded one esquiers bring best assured horse sight strange knight humbly thanking king gift mounting backe attending knight next enter benteier berlande seruant mansia misfortune vnhorsed likewise sore hurt fall vnable helpe himselfe king commanded carried field still practising might know strange knight rid end race seeing neuer knight ready ioust sate still great study came arlencea willed remember businesse knight ready trie haue done great pleasure madame answered strange knight mauellous conceite little regarde affairrs hand gaue horse spurres bertrand beaumont amorous seruant torsia sped according fellowes likewise carryed forth field afterward came lady speaking manner may see saire ladyes great afftction haue sustaine quarrell together remaine conquerour ouer seruants good good estimation loyall vnfained loue beare make forward seruice neuerthelesse see displeasant misfortune friend iudge shall haue slender recompence labour came madame torsia saluting speech acquited selfe madame towards lady thinke sweete mistresse would doe promise behaue selfe sort shall say selfe exceede promise concluding returned ioust wherein good fortune hee vnhorsed fiue knight together name alteo frieze dirdell burdeaux gualter dordonne dane picardie richard tolose king arnedes knew say seeing best knight court discomfited therefore would haue strange knight proceede whereat somewhat offended fearing king would suffer lady accomplish promised hee entred speechees highnesse forget right haue would know intent seeke accompany lady hardly affoord sent court please maiestie answered strange knight doubt made tryed ioust therfore take vnkindly highnesse depriue right seeing great trauaile sake see well quoth king ease troubled thought well therfore build vpon promise day declining apace king set forward way digeon thinking strang knight would come take lodging farre contrary wherefore lady tooke leaue company tarying strange knight seeing somwhat sad lost queen company tooke helmet made lady greatly abashed one could hardly iudge foure affectionate strange knight knight vnpossible make direct resolution matter mine eye equall iudgement foure cannot either loue affectione another haue sir said torsia time seene princesse miragarda yea madame haue answered strange knight pray good sir quoth shee would vouchsafe tell exceeding faire common bruite blazed abroad madame said strange knight may well assure selfe singular beauty hath dazeled iudgement neuer sawe liked better doe ah ha quoth mansia haue taken last wee may well perswade selues torsia make account neuer gaue good wordes v wherefore seeing shee hath power ouer preferre beautie aboue thought excuse himselfe commoditie doe knight mansia spake arriued one called sir menelao clermont monsieur arnar abashed see lady power stranger came vnderstand occasion sir clermont saide mansia word tooke lance esquier comming strange knight entred speech since haue sir receiued order knighthood offer iniurie displeasure lady wish may ac ursed bestowed selfe attempt chastise follie wrong informed sir answered strange knight perceiue mansia would gladly see brought danger would affoord like fauour lay power thinke shall gaine going busines tarrying long company clermont seeing himselfe launce rode arnar prepared himselfe reuenge shame fellow clermont receiued also desire fauour torsia good hope espouse strange knight ignorant affection met iustly sent keepe clermont company end lady might perceiue deserued ter account made alighted fro horse hauing drawne sword dealt brauely together made know went order good knight ought carefully keep esteeme strange knight desiring delight whose kindnesse mean slender brought knight bad estate would willingly haue little rest enemy would haue suffered mansia seeing knight great danger desired strange knight might please heare one word mean stayed heare would clermont arnar leisure breathe whereof little glad mansia began thus strange knight highly contented sir haue witnessed noble valour vpon two knight whome desire remit seeing may haue power qualifie lustinesse beauty faira madam said strange knight doth torment mee cannot wish greater punishment yet take thankfully comming body hand arnar sore wounded ladyes const ained chap xli complaint strange knight made night time vnder window chamber foure lady lodged lady brought againe chamber windowes knightes quiet calme faire might discerne part valley strange knight vehemently surprised loue great trauaile hee sustained day force sufficient cause giue mind rest euermore seene spirit troubled newe imagination heart must needes tormented infinite passion euen hee molested many newe care constrained come forth vnder ladyes chamber window hoping seme would take pitie laying downe among greene leaues folding armes crosse ouerthwart stomacke entred discourse know well loue enuious libertie haue seene dame england greece spaine nauarre without remaining affectionate fraunce suddenly inneigled foure ladyes onely delight depriue life tormenteth loue much affected one three regard one heart biddeth forsake yeeld beholding second finde selfe alteration would forgette vncertaine assaultes see readier extant maketh thinke cannot true loue doth tosse turmoyle many sorrowes yet doe imagine griefe lesse remembring endure sake thinkes case hard one seeme make account wherefore see well shall charged extreame care yet vnfortunate knight vnder name prepare selues giue combate lady window heard well complaint strange knight whereupon mansia spake rest manner thinke good friendes goe vnto spend little conference himfor seeing night long troublesome iudge cannot better driue away dare sayde torsia hardie goe visite man maketh account kill come presence aunswered telansia make shew fearefulnesse mischance happen v first shall voyde discoursing one another last complaint seeme hide demaunds v wee shall enforced cause loose without armes haue obtained armes indeed ladie answered strange knight one hath power sufficient vanquish shall offer great iniurie addresse selues foure trust syr saide telansia wee repute good knight hauing seene sufficient occasion cause v think v remaine yet doubt reason knowledge haue noble deedes deedes faire lady strange knight replyed accompanied shew estimation proceeded imployed seruice seeing agreeable shall attempt conquere knightes french courte vnder name see denie fauour hope euer purchase pray syr saide torsia let aske one question haue bene loue heeretofore certainly madam answered strange knight haue bene many time practising follow little god loue compelleth envenomed shaft god men loue haue bene quoth torsia greatly tormented seeme present madam qd hee gaue selfe seruice one whose loue hope enioy time trauels haue aduentured loue foure one seemeth forsake mee ende may deale sort assure madame neuer loued place seemed depriued life desire consumated fallen extreame occasion pray sir said torsia doe molest selfe accustomed trauaile country shake passion well enough warrant ye thinke good grant satisfie madame latraniaes desire would conduct castle almaroll must enter combate vnder fauour knight keepeth portraiture miragarda else tra e seeke knight sauage man must take force armes chap xlii happened strange knight second day guarded passage valley vntill two houres midday strange knight kept within tent hauing occasion arme lady perceiuing desirous gone mansia aduansing selfe chiefest setting foorth countenance vttermost day ordained honour shee behaued selfe brauely presence lady strange knight knew well intent mansia glad see triall beautie day wherevpon framed language manner would willingly madame discerne kinde imperfection courtly brauery thereby might receiue occasion respect somewhat pittie man extreamely afflicted thinking may compasse meanes win good opinion adorned rare exquisite beautie doe euen lengthen liues take pleasure behold good madame cannot happy one take delight conceale selfe day desire prepare selfe gallant may beauty may happen winne estimation aboue ladyes vnknowne knight come word strange knight well please mansia iudged would haue done tooke disdainfully gaue knight vnderstand reserued latrania seeing earnest contemplating beautie mansia spake vnto manner see well sir regard haue mansia causeth forgetfull rest lady aunswered straunge knight doe honour heare speake shall soone perceiue wrong opinion gainesay sayd hitherward satisfie therein may demaund yet containeth minde wherewith presented himselfe doe seruice strange knight vsed like speech latrania knight sphere lifting vppe helmet came tent saluted lady gratiously stood earnestly beholding latrania ladyes perceiuing three knight comming towards armed one manner three seruants mansia first english man called brauor second alter amiens third gualter honour mistresse three knight come sweete saint lady manner depriued wit beautie stately preferment eye knight sphere beholding noting well amorous passiens spake mansia manner cannot deny faire madame beholding strange knight hath kept company certaine dayes knight come seeke iudgement rather seeme yeeld themselues conquered present sight desire perceiue combat may braue apparel hath dazeled eye singular beautie sufficiency set whole world worke sir answered brauor busie descant meaning seeme iudge inward thought prepare selfe ioust fayle giue due chastisement lauish speech trust sir lay iudge shall neede trauaile selfe much perceiue answered brauor intent speech neuerthelesse hope gallant brauerie wherein haue day beheld mistresse mansia onely graunt conquest ouer also sufficient correct pride knight perceiue verie well saide straunge knight affection onely vpon gay cloathing mine sweete self weareth casting eye vpon mansia entred speech faire madame since honour day dedicated launce worthly strange knight encountred force hee pierced quite bodie fell beside horse ground dead companinions greatly abashed lady take heauily seeing misfortune brauor whose bodie carryed desire heartily good madame would suffer dye stranger hand onely liueth doe seruice well desire thinke mee extreamest occasion forsake mee word vttered gualter amboyse spoken manner knight sphere easily vnderstood wherevpon spake madame latrania manner knight iudgement faire mistris vnwoorthy loue gracious lady disdaineth enterprise begin hee stoode thus communing ladie two knight encountred spurres straunge knight could meete according would neuerthelesse alter amiens brake launce sorte peeces flewe strange knight horse head whereat horse fumed gallopped maister violently field wherevpon first strange knight handled order short time companion glad come helpe whereupon strange knight entred word come sir euen well heart wish determined lay claime horse mine runne away charged furiously knight sphere constraided pittying estate wherin brought desire mansia giue succour could well perswade selfe doe two knight came rendred themselues foot desiring pitty present case doubting would apply liues many wayes seruice straunge knight desirous see estimation mansia would make came vnto word shall vnderstand sir knight determined giue ouer without lady intreate behalfe selfe else shall promise graunt one request entend vtter assure sir knight aunswered mansia doe intende make promise giuing vnderstand ought beware passe selfe hope haue meanes shall haue perfect knowledge loue good seeme beare see well quoth strange knight desirous let know nature bent towardes aduenture themselues seruice shall receiue better entertainment vse towards whereat haue occasion greeue would onely receyue fauour practise meanes possible please see intent vse rigour would wish vse knight whose liues little profite count selfe happy life farre power thus sayd offered mount gualters horse lady gaue vnderstand much abuse knight offer iniurie meanes two knight rid presently away king france court made knowne misfortune happened vnto knight sphere tooke way vnto lodging lady monastery mansia greatly contented strange knight well acquitted himselfe towards three much maruell noble behauiour braue champion chap xliii happened strange knight third fourth day sight iousts lady hauing withdrawne themselues monastery strange knight entred tent refreshed himselfe viand nun sent somewhat sore trauailed hee desirous rest meane time esquire returned search horse could hardly take day master ad saw strange knight thinking lady would walk abroade done night tooke way greene tree againe came abroad vntill morning mounted theyr palfrayes mansia ridde foremost hauing garland flower heade signe victorie telansia followed next beeing good hope attaine selfe honour latrania torsia came somewhat behinde vsing maiestie theyr countenance knight enflamed towardes mansia come somewhat neere strange knight spake vnto manner trust syr weary company haue concluded return king court doubting shall aduertised thing happen absence whereto strange knight thus replied word good madame vse cannot thought welcome perswaded lawe lady france hath set downe first begun owne good willes cannot thus broken without great impeachment good syr answered torsia doe thus grieue offend selfe mansia speake onely trie gone soone warrant v breake promise till eight dayes fully compleate except knight come whose power shall sufficient cut determination thinke lady saide strange knight wish misfortune endureth much alreadie sweete sake thinkes rather wish victorie fall side others laudable commendation shall get thereby strange knight behaued himselfe amiably entertaining gallant lady knight spere arriued suddaine shewing obeysance madame latrania spake followeth faire mistresse neuer dayes troublesome vnto mee endure present earnestly thirsting desiring time sweete selfe may allow fauour neuerthelesse well perswaded knight honoureth seruice cannot easily vanquished beares great good doo adioyning hereto imagineth himselfe worthy loue may assure selfe highly affected knight may way equall neuerthelesse cannot chuse take heauily fearing allow like ingratitude perceiue vse word latrania replyed thus speech syr knight farre different offer made first arriued place liberall promise would sticke sake conquer whole world strange knight desirous make one offered aduaunce himselfe hindred damosell arriued instant desired show knight guarded passage valley disclosing himselfe aduised himselfe damosel word bare face couered hee answered manner would great estimation ladyes keepe mee captiue knight company vse fauour desire madam telansia may speed worse mansia hath done whose sake haue already conquered three knight pray sir said damosell shew foure lady ca telansia strange knight satisfied request entred word sooth sir beautie sufficient enterprise great matter yet imagine knight shall thing discouraged thereby doe seruice damosell came succour vanquished knight conquered strange knight king queenes presence straunge knight sped alwayes fortunately many knight sought seuerely iniurie queene would preuent much could causing damosell entice trie valour straunge knight sak thereto willingly consented neuerthelesse king forbidden enter combate sword cause damosell entreated straunge knight would hazard breaking one launce one champion damosell thus concluded foure knight bare seuerall deuises sheelds globe world figured siluer field beganne aduance themselues forward strange knight perceiuing coasted telansia speech world faire madam bigger quantity knight beareth sheeld iudge might easie trauaile ouercome make onely queene world without word ga e spurres horse encountred knight midst carreer brauely horse man went ground turning damosell conducted thither spake followeth cannot denie faire damosel haue seene throw world ground onely fauour madame telansia oh syr answered damosell doe yet beginne three knight knew well prowesse knight farre greater thought since great misfortune hath befallen see second knight desireth reuenge companion wrong faile likewise two knightes beare company perceiue well saide damosell must tried knight shall liue hope conquer yet may say thus much without offence courage emboldened presence foure lady taking maske strange night presently knew made beginne manner glad faire damosell witnes iustnesse stabilitie doe greatly abash selfe hope reposed foure knight thing see beare greater affection knight desired damosell suffer depart afraide least handled companion king arnedes commaunded night great dancing kept queenes chamber whereat aduertised sundry high good hope strange knight moued many lady intreate amorous seruants would bring place knight kept passage foure lady entred field accompanied champion knight sphere lady desired king offended entring combate strange knight residue seruants tentes encourage earnest desiring enter ioust promised vnto knight garland flower victory chanced side baldwin nainnis affectionate seruant faire albania first presented himselfe iust strange knight would suffer run first craued leaue lady might wils rowne garland flower remained victor lady contented themselues greatly request wherevpon strange knight spake thus telansia madame pitty golden locke gallantly garnished fragarant flower iniured garland worne tho sweete selfe desire lay garland tree doubt haue companion presently saying ran baldwin force sent horse man ground heape lady albanis garland presently sent strange knight immediatly presented telansia vsing language sweete mistresse doe much honour receiue worth present offer vnto faile enterprise gratious seruice decke tree flower surpassing beautie next baldwin dismounted bameran amorous seruant lady brisa whose garland flower set next lady albaniaes rion belze seruant madame vertuosa discomfited garland companion lady brisaes fourth called lusaman seruant lady zapella likewise sent keepe fellowes company next riant seruant vnto faire blas altar bayonne seruant manansina seeking reuenge friend iniurie cast foorth saddle arme broken garland beziers seruant montpensier forsian granoble seruant lady iurie brisar seruant lady bur sister telansia beside many knight vanquished strange knight garland hanged bowes tree sight whereof yeelded small contentment telansia lady found themselues greatly discontented thinking honour passed especially mansia indued day farre triumphant strange knight maintained vnder fauour latrania torsia hope attaine honour telansia done vanquished knight departed presently thence court digeon knight speare greatly abashed noting noble deed strange knight whereupon tooke leaue went accustomed lodging passe night away reioycing greatly day come last witnesse latrania prowesse affection strange knight transformed loue lady hee thought neuer leaue theyr company contemplating earnestly esquyre came told supper ready remembring also next day hee must enter combat knight sphere iudged one good hardy courage pray thee answered strange knight let alone hope repose lay sufficient make mee breake sphere hope likewise knight thou namest lady vnderstanding wordes theyr champyon gaue small commendation theyr knightly deedes meane knight layde rest vnquiet sleepe containe minde woont goe walke vnder ladyes chamber windowe vnderstand would come field againe assure ladyes parted little thence imagined amongst themselues casting lotte night goe lotte fell vnto latrania departed brauely garnished first night chap xliiii pof happened night straunge knight knight sphere entred combat day following meane strange knight slept foote tree latrania came wastcoate white taffatey breast whereof embrodered siluer twist hanged thicke aglet gold brauery whereof litle grace likewise couered greene silke mantle dew hurt order haue told latrania came downe sate b speaking one word thought speake first strange knight woont abashed thing presently caught hold mantle face couered spake manner desire sweete soule offended request see ace whereby may sort assure doubt yet remaine latrania put maske accompanyed milde affable countenance spake vnto followeth shall refuse syr knight graunt request haue continually desired hande ala fayre mistresse lay hotte assault daunted spirit aunswered straunge knight must yeelde victorie shall famous doth little reioyce haue thus take paine come alone comforte mee may perswade selfe power farre weake make resistaunce foure wordes latrania thus replyed haue oftentimes said sir knight one vpon earth hath greater desire doe seruice seke cannot conceiue opinion instant let know madame said straunge knight seruice might easily graunt request leaue thinke doe tomorrow must imployed ward doth little displease vnwilling regard fauour esteeme especiall fortune happen could attaine houre reioyce presence loue onely pillar stay life haue already witnessed companios may presume equall themselues albeit beauty deserue good yet worthie serued intend reueale name ende may haue knowledge haue enforced end great trauell worde gaue occasion latrania take aduantage might better attaine desire likewise triumph great fauour declared name vnderstood minde indifferently ased latrania time past heard inconstant vnfaithfull dealing seating least honour likewise might happen impeached failed presently depart thence promising discouer lady latrania thus departed deuised way hee might exclude remembrance great affection hee vowed conceyte delicate affection pleasing would suffer forget vehemently vexe torment vnpossible quietnesse latrania sustained vnruly passion shee slept soundly till morning making lady acquainted strange knight told wherevpon mansia spake manner knowe well latrania make v beleeue knight hath discouered name vnto wherefore intend goe prooue morrowe morning shall seene v hath power ouer fall hee reueale himselfe none v foure shall repute passion troublesome complaint seeme witnesse vpon determination lady rested soone sunne showne golden countenance earth certaine king court arriued fielde caused tent pauilions presently et vp king queene would come see iousts day lady wold yet come oorth chamber carely iousts begun king came long king queene came tent accompanied many honourable personage also lady damosel great calling iudges fielde caused table set vp valley couered cloathes maruellous estimation king queene refreshed themselues inuyting companie foure ladyes stately apparelled day beautie seemed excell ladyes come queene straunge knight went foorth tent might better behold sudden assemblie sitting downe roote tree esquyre brought victual breake fast withall king risen table foure ladyes according woont mounted theyr steedes tooke theyr way place straunge knight remained euen readie fall daylie exercise courteously saluting went queene
