tent king tent strange knight stoode expecting first beginne iouste king himselfe greatly delighted beholding garlandes fauours ladyes lost knight foyled began highly commend prowesse strange knight ieasting foure ladyes espyed last come along valley knight sphere armed day bearing lady garland creast good hope keepe well enough king arnedes espyed hee entered speech desire greatly see garland flower brought vanquished vnto whereby may bee better assured whether hee preuaileth conquest happily may find peere else n knight sphere comming king presence saluted humble obeysaunce afterwards taking garland helmet desired weare hee defended according merit beautie desired might bee placed among vanquished victorie happen side would seeke recompence hand garland might bee giuen bestow friend request latrania glad desirous reach high felicitie throughly perswading selfe likewise satisfie knight sphere put garland head earnestly beholding strange knight entred speech see sir day haue meane make known knightly deedes also desire haue doe seruice madame behaue selfe aunswered straunge knight shall perswaded knight iniurie great desire accomplish seruice may agreeable gratious nature afterward make regard doe woont thrust forgetfulnes must comfort selfe alone misfortune beare crosse others company knight sphere hauing vnderstood latrania made regard seruice seeing dice fortune hand either continuall honour present disgrace yet ignorant chance ranne couragiously straunge knight encountering together worthily compelled forsake stirrops vpon gallant beginning tooke new staues wherewith met againe together strongly piece flew whistling ayre passing forward knightes met furiously body constrained tumble ground sight king greatly abashed latrania contented selfe well seeing noble valiant behauiour knight shee thought good point stranger two knight sooner recouered themselues drew sword wherewith hacked hewed one another pittifully straunge knight desirous v passe day great renowne followed intent singular agillitie knight sphere witnesse earnest affection madame latrania behaue himselfe likewise worthily allowed name good hardie knight difficultie combate promising hope neither side doubtfull king esteemed lesse danger betweene edward england sonne end dramusiande giant prisoner custody enchauntresse eutropa king extreamely passioned fearing least two noble champion die presence fiercely continued fight constrained withdrawe themselues breath knight sphere seeing arme mangled began thinke estate hazard afterwards remembring beautie whose sake thrust himselfe danger hee comuned thus priuately himselfe greater good happen world allowed seruice whose beautie none french court may match meane two knight thus paused damosell woont come often field addressed selfe againe strange knight vsing vnto language desire see syr knight iustifie large promise haue made perswade selfe knight sphere restore lady losse life earnest victorie fall side reuenge offence haue offered vnto yeeld tree decked garland flower handes best deserue wordes strange knight thus answered e long enough faire damosell since perceiued small good bare since perceiue misfortune agreeable vnto desire make knowne vnto lady make account fauouring well assured woont vse recompence towards aduenture liues seruice wherefore shall well vnderstand force tooke nature time past gratious regard one singular lady desire keepe woonted couetousnesse beauty shall decen latrania vse fauour towards pleaseth make account thus said returned combate helde betweene long perceiued armor defaced flesh martyred themselues greatly feebled againe withdrewe themselues rest little king arnedes loth two hardy knight end liues desperate maner quarrell small estimation would haue parted asunder strange knight thinking discourteous entertainement latrania affoorded disdainedence looke knight sphere made account beauty silent thought vttered word would fortunate deedes worthy see coye accepting render soules subiect vnto breaking closed againe strange knight troth slowe receiuing assure liues beene great danger third triall beene arriuall damosell mounted white palfray haire hanging ouer shoulder came strange knight cry loude voice brought eccho whole forrest sight euery one suddainely abashed chiefely two knight separated themselues know th cause damosel lamentation came vtter seure lady desiring let v vnderstand reason two knight entred combate mansia tolde fought madame latrania wherevpon damosell approched ent ing speech madam life honor ought preferred vncertaine appetite affliction desire humbly allow aid uccor two distressed damosel farre place great danger loose honour esteeme greater price liues trouble shall soone deliuered may please let mee haue one knight endure hotte combatte loue thus spoken shed aboundaunce teares deliuered forth many scalding sighes latrania enforced misse desire thinking see ende combate betweene knight behalfe king seeing latrania make answer spake vnto damosell manner two knight faire damosell doe desire haue shall perceiue willingnes intreate please maiestie answered damosel good knight know well request neuerthelesse make choyse knight bereth sheeld couered latrania sooner heard damsells word shee presently came betweene two knightes giuing shewe straunge knight suffer refusall wherevpon spake thus syr knight succour afflicted armes first inuented pray teares damosell loue say beare may cause forsake combate moue goe helpe oppressed lady madame saide straunge knight obey cause fond vnaduised yet would doe busied especiall matter may perswade selfe bond wherein haue tyed selfe doth defend satisfying commaundement considered also madame torsia may finde selfe offended manner slip giue due beautie worthily deseruing pray sir quoth torsia would witnesse seruice loue place damosell conduct co tent obey commaundement answered strange knight likewife goe companie haue taken condition depriued companie limitted time guarding valley madame said damosel latrania knight doth perfectly let vnderstand obedient seruant loue selfe may well perceiue seeing preferreth pleasure wherefore desire intreate knight goe opinion shall finde affectionate yo haue reposed much hope latrania willing pleasure damosell beganne intreate knight sphere might stand pleasure giue ouer combate assist ayde great hazard madame answered knight sphere know great harme let alone combate mine enemy noble redoubted knight yet would haue one thinke respect feare dismaying selfe let passe thus know selfe sufficient enough greater matter marry concerning request earnest loue beare great content suffer whatsoeuer lay vppon onely satisfie content turning strange knight beganne againe manner pray sir thus imagine think earnest desire purchase loue madame latrania hath bene hinderance victory albeit made assurance thereof owne conceit indeede answered strange knight see hard man get aduantage without putting owne life great danger assure stroakes haue beene well laid haue made conceiue good opinion valour whereof since well assured doth little please good knight shall goe damosel cause ere depart would gladly vnderstand name end latrania may ha e knowledge necessitie must account selfe greatly indebted king himselfe lesse desirous know strange knight desired earnestly reueale himselfe knight sphere seeing king great importunitie tooke helmet kneeled downe kisse maiesties hand perceiuing friend dramusiande would permit casting armes necke embraced maruellous gratious courtesie sory suddaine departure would suffer regard willingly would hee would let part made knowne queene lady declare king benefite knowledge strange knight would alasse quoth king would willingly knowe much quiet selfe haue knowne oh syr saide dramusiande beseech expectt yet little longer vntill enterprise shall ended opinion seeke depart hence hee make himselfe first knowne grace damosell presented selfe declaring high e gone wherevpon tooke leaue latrania esteemed selfe aboue lady power bring obeysance good knight dramusiande departure king queene rode citie daily commended singular prowesse strange knight kept charge well lady court would depart thence first might haue garland seruants lost wherevpon came togither tree caught away violently strange knight daring resist chap xlv strange knight day following garding valley king courtly attendant thus departed foure lady tooke way monastery strange knight went tent sate downe rest himselfe afterward kept custome went walked vnder greene tree lady determined night goe visite amorous louer mansia night must go parley knight put wastcoate blew taffata wrought ouer body net worke gold wherein composed diuerse ranckes rich orient pearles placed stone inestimable value haire wound fine plat head couered imbrodered garland blewe veluet wherein set faire plume white feather beautifully adorned spangle gold order haue declared mansia came sate downe strange knight auoide suspition shee tooke garland fearing hurt impeached serena else desire perfecter seene laying hand vpon head beganne followeth syr time forbid manner complaint selfe shall deny paine past forgotten seruices recompenced gratious visitation especially seeing take pleasure fauour much time strange knight supprised exceeding ioy could possibly make answer beautie mansia rauished vnderstanding mindfull vsing gracious language wherewith ought haue entertained sodaine ioy somewhat calmed failed account maruellous honourably wherewith remained verie well contented giue occasson speech began court manner madame know wel good nature see desert doubtfull trauailes requited iudge otherwise vnworthie gracious visitation haue afforded assuring especiall recompence happen hauing meanes contemplate excellent beauty may presume paragon selfe haue opinion trust shew selfe ingratefull nature hath framed one may iustly called phoenix beautie haue deepely imprinted heart shall extreamely tormented shall depriued sweete company yet greatly abashed digest wel see suffer paine greefe deserueth better esteemed hauing power cause liue contentedly die presently pray sir saide mansia passe tell vse speech latrania trust lady quoth curiositie much make great account perhaps might forgetful many thing especially many knight bound mind else grounded amorous representation thrust obliuion madame towardes may altogether dispose seruitude euen hath power ouer seeing pray humbly good lady iudge foure affectionate haue wel aduised self seueral perfectios lady canot yet denie aduantaged aboue beautie grace authoritie esteeme selfe fortunate depriued libertie altogether vowed obey mansia able withhold selfe giuing credite strange knight golden word thinking vsed latrania manner beganne come neere laying hand shoulder shaped answer matter sir seeme make humbly desire tell end may greater assurance ioyne beleefe perswasions perceiue answered strange knight small assurance repose saying tooke hand suffered quietly amorous word last bewrayed himselfe vnto perswaded griping one another hand certaine beginning loue little fauour made somewhat bold furder would haue proceeded lady left departed glad knew left without hope purchase intent strange knight extreamely passioned seeing quicknes light regard loue wherewith accompanyed made scornefully entertained yet could blame alone vsed many sad conceit passed away night ripping vp intricate sorrowes bound suffer day appeared mounted horsebacke vowing reuenge iniurie receiued night knight happen deale withall found himselfe farre deceiued intent knight french court giuen ouer comming trouble whereat somewhat offended neuerthelesse dissembled greefe lady might behold wonted passion latrania much displeased iousts continued woont againe doubted least knight sphere sustained foyle damoselles cause reason ouercharged trauaile went would sorry fall prowesse giuen aduantage ouer companieos cause remained continually affectionate towards dramusiande concerning aduenture followed history maketh mantion damosell sent sage aliarts meanes onely succour liues two knight imployed ayding emperour constantinople place damosell caused dramusiande take way albeit loath forsake latrania sixe dayes thus past dedicated honor mansia telansia latrania two dayes reserued torsia come last whereof strange knight glad intended doe done rest first day chance haue aduenture one knight presented himselfe valley wherefore passed away time till night hee went accustomed place staied long telansia came taffata wastcoate indian collour richly spangled ouer bodie head iewells great estimation thus came strange knight desiring certifie whereto hee made aunswer perceiue madame loue altogether entendeth depriue life desirous doe seruice extreamely plague punish paine oppressed soules may compare mine hath made thus vnderstand seuerall visitation end onely gaine knowledge without desire pittie continuall dying spirit regard dangerous trauailes wherein seeke prolong loathed life though dayly desire breathe last iudge word sauour forgerie may compare continuall iustnesse present behauiour shall finde owne iudgement witnesse selfe ought disdaine kindnesse hath guarded passage vnder honour name whereby may triumph perpetuall renowne cause considered thinkes vse ingratitude knight hath beene occasion much esteemed also affectionate towards sir knight answered telansia know whether wordes forged albeit custome mingle many deceit among complaint would perswade belieue say grant haue refused companion tell faire lady answered strange knight tell shall greatly make daintie assuring durst reueale speciall seruice honour shall vnderstand called knight sauage man name truly may change honour called seruant sir florian answered telansia one signes whereby know small loue beare reuealing name know account lady doubt haue fained haue done therefore pray offended must need part company rising departed thence promising discouer end enterprise might hindered day following last trie valour torsiaes behalfe entred ielde hoping day purchase immortall renowne chap xvi happened strange knight last day guarded passage vnder name madame torsia strange knight stayed till noone forth tent yet one knight entred valley made report lady feare seruants guarding caused forget affection woont word beare wherof foure agreeued mounted thier palfrays al came commune knight vsed lesse pleasant behauiourr done whilst lady thus conferring strange knight espyed comming three knight armor colour white blacke scarlet one figured sheeld swan field sable one knight named alemant two italian alemant called himselfe lambort saxonie trauailing constantinople met two italian perswaded trauaile castle almaroll willing likewise approue aduenture soone intreated beare company complections different fell way hearing aduenture foure french l dy addicted iourney presently french court perswading themselues end aduenture wherein many good hardy knight fayled thus armed one manner arriued valley last day lady aduenture know well said strange knight soone espied fortune intend suffer day without shewing faire ladie great desire haue accepted among number best fauoured seruants may perswade selfe knight whatsoeuer hath power resist haue sweete lady presence straunge knight reposed torsia three knight arriued field aduisedly beheld beautie foure lady could iudge excell beautie affection contrarie two italian enterprised combate latrania alemant altogether inueigled beautie mansia lady well pleased possible could serued kinghts strange nation made vse great courtesie fauour towards done like king arnedes court whereat strange knight mooued presently prepared himselfe ioust brucie verona one italian first beganne pastime strange knight met sort sent ground heeles vpward italian perceiuing named trucie beroze gaue horse spurres encounter sent keepe fellowe company much displeased lambrot saxonie esteemed good knight setting launce rest two knight met together brauely lambrot vnhorsed saddle betweene legges strange knight forced forsake stirrops alemant calling combate sword strange knight alighted horse two italian would suffer alemant enter combate saide aduantage belonged first dismounted vpon fell much variance among themselues incontinently appeased foure lady ordained brucian verona begin combate first entertained strange knight trucie beroze constrained come helpe whereat strange knight mooued short time layde brucie verona feete trucie beroze sore hurt glad flie lady refuge desired strange knight saue life alemont desirous reuenge iniury two friend receiued drew sword buckling sheeld came fiercely assayle strange knight dealt roughly followed intent nimble braue behauiour alemant found dealt one stronger himselfe yet mind rather desired die hand demand succour lady greatly mooued pittie fearing see die came desired strange knight giue ouer combate request contented glad well accomplished promise giuing vnderstand seruice could perswaded easily enterprise aduenture night courteously tooke leaue went againe monasterie leauing great extremitie greefe done dayes passed must forget tel lady likewise gaue three knight friendly farewell withdrewe themselues also lodging day following tooke way whither fortune guided vnwilling go visite court againe much lesse returne lady whose sake receiued great shame straunge knight remembring himselfe torsiaes turne came visite made account passed trauaile went accustomed place hee long looked presence torsia albeit thought conceale himselfe yet possible doe hee onely bewrayed name vnto hee would haue discoursed whole life likewise bin disposed haue giuen hearing long totsia tooke way place lady bene night apparell wastcoate blacke taffata body richly wrought euer pasement lace gold oure finger bread betweene curry lace costly pearles stone set forth brauery would haue amazed reest knight world mantle blew veluet wrought round cure gold verie sumptvously manner came sate downe knight fearefull mooue effence way durst take hardinesse speake whereupon spake thus thinke sir hat comming would ender estimation perceiue make alwayes misdoubt therefore deceiued madame answered strange knight pleasure receiue arriuall great deprined vse speech whereat see offended reputed otherwise loyall seruant aduaunce selfe entertaine graciers behauiour excellencie well deserueth doe remember sweet mistresse spoken talke nothing else woonted greeuous complaint afraide commit light albeit haue iust occasion doubt faire madam displeasing ignorant answered torsia neuer want excuse knowes shift himselfe haue giuen forth selfe daily vnder name obedient seruant cannot beleeue much lesse abide accept knight seruice dare reueale name onely thing truely wherefore come hither time madame said strange knight know whether declare name vnto remaine passionate vnderstand knight whome beare fauour conceale selfe excellency continuing lfe still afflicted leauing vncontented assure make slender choyse either two extreames knowing may hurt yet must put aduenture since good hap tyed heeles mercurie therefore shall vnderstand madame called knight sauage man prince court haue receiued greater fauour ladyes hand haue done french court albeit haue done dutie seruice towards beare prize beautie especially honour affection aboue seeing haue thus discoursed name vnto desire thinke complaint iust occasion true loue woont enforce suffer trauaile serue fidelitie shall rest content well recompenced especiall good beare desire life may prolonged onely pleasure regarding often banishent hope despaire sundry vnsauorie sweetes wherewith must feed selfe onely froward rigorous stormes dayly hourely come therefore desire good madame somewhat regard pittie hath onely suffer euer lay would refuse torment knew fancie thinke well sir knight answered torsia deceiued faire plausible speech vnpossible hunne misfortune accompany two princess targiana arnalte know well would loath beare part complaint content time leaue thus said presently rose departed accounting assurance small company euerie one knew sundry prankes knight sauage man maruellously offended sodaine departure torsia brake forth complaint still though company albeit lady quoth remembrance vngentlenesse maketh despaire yet presence hath power helpe dolour reioycing troubled sight giuing comfort afflicted soule knitting vp complaint sweete companie depriued fainting armes fold vp dying coarse many deadly sigh accompany maister latter home moned pretty space manner concluded himselfe forget lady entring conceit crueltie slept soundly till next morning soone armed caused arlencea damosel sent remained monasterie nun giuing harty thankes friendes vsage set forward way knight sauage man would haue shield longer couered foure lady bare company little way palfrey glad could let king knowe hee faine would haue court perceiued labour vaine torsia smiling spake thus trust sir te te fall mine eye thinkes take parting heau ly euery teare bigge milstone lady quoth fire kindled stomach loue nature water cannot quench seeing make light account hath humbled himselfe much despise loue occasion misfortune may assure selfe gage heart present selfe another place trie shalbe better entertained haue beene hand parting set forward iourney desiring attaine citie constantinople chap xlvii knight sauge man arriued court constantinople dragonalt arnalte queene nauarre came likewise emperours court long trauailed knight sauage man till last hee came forrest somewhat neere citie constantinople espied number knight lady damosel made presently suspect emperor company indeede abroad see falcon flie age would suffer ride horsebacke coach accompanied empresse princesse court peroeiuing knight sauage man comming fiue damosel company knew soone beheld deuise shield came togither meete troupe knight sauage man ioyfull see himselfe welcome friend amongst brother palmerin england came embraced exceeding humanitie arlencea alighted horse tooke hand brought emperour kissed hand desired excellencie might pleasure remember much beholding lady saued falling handes cruell collambra mother arlencea humbled selfe emperour huge stature much wondred lady emperour shewed himselfe gracious vnto like manner empresse gridonia leonarda princesse thrace suspecting knight sauage man minde entertained arlencea euen meane lady thus ioyfully entertaining arlencea knight sauage man aduertised death king fredericke england grandfather tidings heauy enforced forsake company rode citie come pallace consumed certaine dayes mourning vntill time compelled goe visit princesse leonarda lady emperour caused arlencea mounted horsebacke againe making especiall estimation endued exquisite beautie adorned gratious maners liked euery one well beheld especially dramusiande farre loue quite forgotten latrania emperour returne cittie espyed come riding along forrest diuers ladyes damosel accompanyed diuers knight offered ioust attendant emperour principal knight company perceiuing desirous beside try valour assembly tooke strong lance clapping downe beuer helmet came presented himselfe lady company authoritie command hauing taken leaue gaue horse spur fortunate encounter sent bellizant saddle afterward another lance one knight gaue hand sent foure good especiall knight emperours court ground whereat emperour maruelled noting braue behauiour knight caused sent certaine lance could receiued damosell came saluted emperor knight maner renowmed emperour dragonalt king nauarre desirous content princesse arnalte queen wife hath thus presumed ioust knight vnderstood highnesse place commanded infourme maiestie hath left owne realme offer humble dutie excellencie emperour empresse hearing damoselles word supprised vnspeakeable pleasure entending entertaine dragonalt much honour could deuised well knowing sonne valiant prince nephew king frisoll also mooue affection queene arnalte ample maner without stay went meete dragonalt queene arnalte beheld alighted horse holding one another hand went meete empresse likewise greater honour came feete accompanied gridonia polinarda leonarda diuers lady imbracing humanitie letting vnderstand emperor court highly honored presence side sufficiently welcomed prince dragonalt arnalte mounted horsebacke palmerin alighted taking bridle arnaltes horse hand walked til came pallace wherat princesse polinarda beganne waxe somewhat iealous arnalte well noting beautie two princess polinarda faire leonarda thrace began thinke enterprised combate spaine fairest world witnesse manhood iust occasion albeit next two selfe esteemed third beautie emperours court princesse miragarda came thither constrained fourth number dragonalt queene arnalte lodged verie neere empresse chamber arlencea damosel guest duchesse lubicall chiefe lady empresse emperour caused dayly iousts tournements witnesse queene arnalte presence agreeable dramusiande conquered loue arlencea could rest place neither enioy quietnesse palmerin liued content long time yet thinke thing sound sure lone presenteth daily occasion feare amorous person vntill time desire perfectly contented meane great ioy continued pompides king scottes queene arriued emperor cour receiued maruellous great pompe honour prince primaleon desirous shewe himselfe thankefull diuerse occasion passed betweene prince edward himselfe ledde queene scottes palfray bridle till came pallace gate notwithstanding intreatie pompides selfe often contrarie queene scottes lodged princesse polinarda held selfe greatly contented shee neere alliance fauoured friend palmerin pomp de went comfort knight sauage man chamber kept would yet goe abroad heauily tooke death king fredericke grandfather court constantinople short time well furnished prince noble knight iudged needed entertaine whole puissance pagan king chap xlviii arnedes king fraunce queene recinde king spaine queene accompanied princesse miragarda giant almaroll arriued emperours court constantinople emperour seeing himselfe brought extremity age thought good enioyn nephewe marriage also prince knight beene nourished court might mooue generall good liking imparted intent empresse sonne primaleon hee vnderstood well thought matter hee writ presently arnedes king france sonne lawe would doe much honour come queene court like manner maiestie dispatched letter edward king england flerida daughter recinde king spaine desiring queene come court bring princesse miragarda company emperour vernar sent likewise tarnaes king lacedemonia daughter sidelia whose beautie caried credit time soldane bellagris maiortes many others emperour letter inuited court first came constantinople emperour vernar king edward england soone came soldane bellagris maiortes entertainement according noble estate deserued came king tarnaes queene sidelia daughter sorrowfull lady pandricia empresse lodged owne chamber two king arnedes recinde arriued shippes port constantinople sounded trumpet drummes gallantly people afraide cittie fearing left enemy come princesse came receiue great ioy might behold king france sumptuous galley couered cloath golde great value wherein himselfe queene florenda graciana two daughter many lady knightes beside another galion king recinde queene number knight guarde another galion fairest princesse miragarda giant almaroll prince florendos many knight king recinde aduertised emperour intended marry princesse nephewe florendos king arnedes consent doe honour caused galion march formost captaine ouer vesselles emperour glad tydings hee forsooke coatch brought chayre place prince land empresse queenes princess lady mounted horse clad rich costly harnesse ridde port citie stately emperour accompanied sonne primaleon king edward england emperour vernar allemaigne soldane bellagris maiortes ternaes king lacedemonia polendos estrelant pompides dragonalt little ioy aged yeeres see himselfe beloued puissant prince whole world albeit presence great personage pleasant yet could hee choose take heauily seeing preasse fore vppon long hee could bee companion king arnedes recinde prince florendos come land kneeled downe kisse emperours hand imbracing armes would suffer honour much came queene spaine queene france two daughter maiestie welcomed familiarly princesse miragarda came presence accepted maruellous graciously entring speech glad madame would vouchsafe come hither may requite great gentlenesse haue found hand prouiding detaine prince albayzar good securitie princesse miragarda made answere milde princely courtesie made showe well shee tooke emperours word assure presence abashed iudgements number whose eye seemed faicest creature earth giant almaroll likewise welcome emperour princesse polinarda courteously saluted miragarda shrunke aside brother florendos entertaining language perceiue new wel lord brother haue good cause thinke labour well bestowed haue trauelled lady singular beautie would heart good sister answered florendo due recompence labour hath deserued might better assurance oh brother said polinarda giant almaroll hath authoritie shut doore therefore promise princesse thrace orget enterprise meanes whereby shall doubt finde fauour emperour would delay time longer pallace rode altogether prince primalcon leading queene spaines horse bridle albeit king recinde loth suffer king polendos much honour queene fraunce king edward england afforded like faire princesse miragarda well content aged emperor honour kinseman prince florendos palmerin england like faire florenda florian forrest princesse gracia briefe princesse knight led lades palfra e till came pallace emperour caried chayre foure knight communing princesse miragarda way desiring fauour nephew florendos thinke one well deserued hand chap xlix conference emperour prince marriage appointed accomplished effect prince thus arriued constantinople rested themselues certaine dayes emperour desirous content euery one died bestowed seruice honouring reuealed intent emperor vernar king edward arnedes recinde primaleon would gladly see nephewes married prince beene nourished court would see matched according affection serued prince liked maruaellously emperours intent whereupon caused sunday following great feast ordained queene fleridaes chamber place conuenient pallace courtly disports lady euery one regarded degree pleasant ladyes sauoured seruants costly iunckets prouided banquet palmerin earnest affection towards lady iudged surpasse beautie florendos held opinion faire miragarda florian made estimation princesse thrace feared combate whatsoeuer beautie might carrie credite aboue rest prince platir behinde conceite towards sweete ladie sidelia daughter king tarnaes empresse bazilia gridonia fl rida francellina high estate cheefe next empresse queene flerida bare price beautie amongst sweete delicate time yeares table wishdra e departed place emperour weake sickely king edward expresse company giuen charge king edward willing obey emperor commandement arose table taking hat kissing emperours hand saluted present began thus gratious empres v benefit honor hath receiued lady marriage emperour owne court hath pleased bestow v allied excellency others prince lord empire wherby renowme christendom worthyly maintained cause expressing good nature continued florishing estate may therefore seeme good present publickely open gracious princely determination whereby may knowne highnesse queenes princess company shall thinke well aduice honourable councell seeketh put practise maiesty hath set downe decree young prince knight shal ioyne mariage ecompence noble trauels affectionate yet vnprouided lady maiesty allow continuance court whereby shall grew side euery one shall contented owne desire pausing attended empresse queenes ladyes would say also bethinke himselfe name person emperour appointed many young prince knight somewhat abashed doubting whether might giue credite king word iudged labor sufficiently rewarded might enioy sweet saint mistresse lady presence began blush change amiable countenance whereby bewrayed secret sudden ioy heart receiued speech king edward vttered polinarda often cast eye prince palmerin great feare offender awaiteth sentece iudge doubted least grandfather would bestow let enioy heart desired palmerin afflicted manner great vehemency sundry passion betweene hope feare constrained suffer thought infinite deale trouble father king edward following former intent began againe manner shall vnderstand sir florendos gratious lord emperour consent king recinde enioyneth espowse princesse miragarda iudgement bee thing offended bee matched shall syr florendos thinke selfe fully satisfied trauailes haue endured sake prince present looked florendos might well perceiue word king edward giuen ioy richest realme world possession princesse miragarda kept countenance demurely one could hardly iudge whether loue florendos acceptable thee sonne palmerin said king edward emperour prince primaleon willing thou shouldest knowe loue beare thee doe giue thee wife princesse polinarda doubting thou shalt imagine thy passed trauailes fully recompenced sweet reward princesse polinarda sooner heard wordes delicate rosiall colour dyed daintie countenance witnessed loue good bare prince palmerin england likewise abandoned former feare seeing enioy felicitie hee long wished father king edward perceiued made though espie proceeded former determination giuing prince gracian sonne king france vnderstand emperour bestowe niece claricias daughter king polendos syr berolde vertuous behauiour must enioy iewel heart faire onistalda daughter duke drapos normandie niece renowned king frisoll whereof father sure well contented sir francian shall match bernada daughter valiant prince belcar noble prince platir deedes worthy perpetuall memorie shall possesse faire sidelia daughter king tarnaes lacedemoni willingly bestowe vpon noble behauiour hath well deserued rosuel true inheriter prince belcar father shall honoured dramaciana daughter duke tirendos haue serued faithfully long shall enioy last desert labour bellizant brother prize lady denisa daughter duke sparta content requite loue hath endured many sharpe shower vnder name dramian shall haue guardon princesse clariana daughter di ea princesse hungaria frisoll right succeede duke father shall ioyned marriage leonarda daughter duke pera cause noble gentleman emperour councell call place end might perceiue good zeale loue beareth let forget maiestie hath ordained concerning noble sir dramusiande shall espouse madame arlencea well content desire loue also shewe himselfe thankefull bewraying treason alfernao excellency hath concluded bestowe profound isle sometime belonged ather brauorant custody sonne florian friend darmusiande supprised exceeding ioy word power attend till king edward finished discourse came humbled selfe emperor yeelding thousand thankes gracious courtesie king edward tooke vp armes desiring haue patience little till ended charge comming princesse thrace entred speech excellent princesse nature hath plentifully endued beautie courtesie emperour wich king noble lord company doe earnestly desire giue marriage son florian deedes might deserue well good liking likewise wished sonne palmerin tied point obedience according king sardamant grandfather appointed palmerin kept himselfe silent humbly desired king father vouchsafe word twaine granted came princesse thrace setting knee ground began followeth durst madam take hardnes present brother florian first time saw fearing least would thinke inclined regard pr fit honour willing driue till present might haue knowledge knightly deedes wherein perceiued take delight might bolder presenting husband easier entertaine let pray seeme acceptable iudgement emperor counsell hath determined perswaded heauenly power doe thinke well syr palmerin aunswered princesse shee alwayes couet meanes whereby might shew selfe dutifull vnto seeme vse selfe otherwise vnworthy receiue royall preferment king grandfather hath appointed beside subiects might well examine goe contrary hath houre ouer therefore resolue sel e shall content graunt thing imagine fulfilling promise mine honour palmerin kissing hand arose immediately little glad courteous answere princesse thrace made king edward turned knight beganne againe manner shall vnderstand noble gentleman emperor reueale accept opinion princess lady shal bewray intent empresse excellency would enterprise thing haue party well contented therewith marriage well thought euery one present knight lady told emperor contented especially knight aduanced themselues one another kisse emperours hand like emperor vernar bazilia gridonia king queenes present emperour embraced euery one palmerin came h ld armes spake thus sonne haue continually imagined selfe might worthily recompence deedes high estimation perswade selfe desire shall sufficiently contented giuing iewell blisse honour trauailes niece princesse polinarda whose name pray heauens imprint deepe heart empresse hath beene end bearing one name may alike happinesse good fortune neuer thought gracious lord answered palmerin deedes purchase high happy felicitie maiestie hath see goodnesse defect bound duty life primaleon gridonia imbraced louingly glad daughter bestowed honourably ioyfull motion one side somewhat pacified emperor returned counsell againe emperor vernar king edward primaleon king letting vnderstand intend forget ladie pandritia whereupon soldane bellagris called whome king edward bewrayed matter passed bellagris vnder name entred pandriciaes chamber begot syr blandidon euery one thought shee selfe king edward sonne may reade first volume history soldane bellagris knowing thy great error faith assured withall blandidon sonne remoued turkish opiuion wherein liued long time remaine friendship worthy prince hee concluded espouse pandritia great contentment many prince friend likewise conuersion came know lawe liuing god good hap emperor christian prince glad continue bellagris good mind emperor presently arose counsell went princesse chamber accompanied king edward maiestie declared pandritia passed betweene solean bellagris causing forget former opinio blandidon sonne king edward certifying likewise soldan receiued heathenish faith make amends marriage ought refuse well considering valour rich soldane mighty renowmed prince also son might know noble father pandritia heauily looking sore troubled great ere spake word better remembred selfe shee earnestly beheld king edward speaking maner hard destiny worthy prince hath concealed long last haue vouchsafed bewray life may heereafter pleasant hath beene may assure selfe knowne giuen due chastisement ignorant misfortune since come light time loue sonne saluation soldane subiects compelleth forget matter past considered also force loue made deceiue manner emperour liked well said empresse embraced hee many time glad could possible thing came happy end blandidon called presence sorry knew king edward father hope preferred soldanes dignitie made forget former occasion take content present l soldan bellagris baptized afterward emperor caused married pandritia prince court married also marriage thus agreed vpon emperour commaunded day following thing solemnizing honourable rite sho ld prepared decent maner would haue married great hall pallace archbishop constantinople sayd diuine seruice afterward made learned sermon giue soldane bellagris earnest affection law iesus christ publishing likewise openly passed betweene ladie pandritia suspition arise apt enough conceine euill opinion archbishop concluded sermon baptized soldane emperor king edward england godfather two empress godmother honour emperour would haue first married soldane bellagris pandritia thus knit together matrimonie blandidon humbled himselfe signe obedience soldane embracing tooke vp reioycing greatly good knight sonne hee leaue subiects worthy gouernour pandritia thus espoused soldane empresse lady walked emperour would haue florendos miragarda matched next done heart abandoned woonted care taking hand gaue place queenes england spaine walking along hall comfort new married folkes good counsell next entred prince polinarda led betweene empresse allemaigne queene fraunce palmerin going accompanied emperour vernar king tarnes lacedemonia next came faire princesse thrace betweene queene francelina thessalie queene flerida england glad see matched prince florian forrest two noble english prince wedded sweete friend prince gracian berold platir prince knight espoused vnto lady new queen thrace princesse polinarda entred leading arlencea betweene whose beautie shewed stately set foorth presence two princess prince primaleon king edward accompanied giant dramusiande married arlencea great royaltie departed place princesse miragarda humbly intreated emperour would giue cordigea daughter giant gatarin remaining seruice marriage giant almaroll whereto maister presently agreed vnderstood good cordigea gaue himselfe honour princesse miragarda giant almaroll cordigea may reade large second booke notable history edward brittaine giant almaroll lord another fortresse farre thence kept princesse miragarda fortresse called beauty bulwarke whereof hee made present espoused lady cordigea condition call castle owne name returne againe historie soone archbishop ended ceremony marriage emperor went queene flerides chamber dinner prouided honor prince withall lady came florenda graciana daughter king arnede germaine orleaunce affectionate seruant florenda thought himselfe vnworthy come presence hee counted subiect king france yet emperour make commendation knightly deedes germaine orleaunce king graunted marry daughter florenda albeit daughter graciana found selfe discontented could get husband ioy company feast serued magnificall honor new married prince made high account thought heauenly life married man florendos palmerin florian platir prince respected fauour emperor king exceedingly like manner miragarda leonarda polinarda sidelia princess honoured empress queenes stately beholde oftentimes would recreate themselues thorough city small delight content emperour marking frien seeing prince floraman absent company hee demanded become made answere hee little palace sitting mourning vnder tree florendos vnderstood hee left company went perswaded come reioyce floraman returned answere doe trauell selfe sir florendos haue partner pleasure enioy hath euer lost comfort great good vnfainedly beare doth deserue deale sorrowes would ten time doe would haue mee therefore desire let beare griefe quietly seeing hee fortune delighteth torment continually florendos deuised meanes possible change conceite seeing labour bestowed vaine returned emperor certifying griefe wherein left prince floraman newes emperour friendes heauily passioned continued commending prince floraman till gentlman vsher called supper supper ended table withdrawne new merried prince began dance greekish manner maskes pastime done night one went chamber receiue content caused endure long trouble chap li queene thrace conueied away strange aduenture knight continued pleasure constantinople prince delighting himselfe sweete lady whose sake hee endured many sharpe trauailes length determined diner others though attained ame felicitie yet witnesse good affection friend ordaine generall tournament whereto came many strange knight laboured much lay shew hardy valour prince appointed triumph meane sport continued arriued knight armed blacke bearing deadly hope figured sheeld coate armour blacke horse lance colour sad habite euery one coniectured small ioy knight himselfe neuerthelesse great fortune three dayes together remained victor dealt length would discouer name iudges field florian florendos went arme themselues desirous try combate knight dramusiande perswaded contrary giuing vnderstand prince floraman king edward son palmerin brought last emperor excellencie began comfort saying reason afflict himselfe sort especially thing could remedy moreouer leading life pensiuely end onely shorten owne time also offend iudgements especiall friendes would euerie one glad faine disswade greese torment word prince floraman thus replied know well gracious lord honour pleaseth vse neuer recompenced deed much lesse satisfaction made word beseech maiesty consider faithfull loue haue alwayes borne lady altea hath soueraigne power ouer suffer change humor albeit know dead small greefe continuall vexation yet either shall teares reuiue againe bring ghost keepe company thus resolued remember losse true loue ought remaine end end otherwise iudged light vnconstant therefore beseech maiestie suffer complaint well inured impossible liue otherwise emperour prince saw trauailed vaine perswading floraman forsake sorrowfull kinde life taking leaue emperour accompanyed king edward prince primaleon went chamber bring able endure sight heauinesse returned presently chamber presence iousts triumph ended prince would ride abroade ladyes forrest neere cittie might chase wilde bore hart beastes recreation whereof emperour glad taking coatch tooke way forrest company comming set vp faire tent table couered thing ready dinner sate downe take repast went sport dinner done hunter came certified emperour found mightiest wilde bore euer seene vppon newes prince immediately arose table mounting horse rode hunter finde gaine beginning follow chase bore euery one liked pleasantnesse pastime suddaine delight mingled suddaine mischance may reade discourse following prince knight earnestly pursuing heauens began suddaine troubled darknesse came vpon could discerne horse fumed fretted exceedingly veing afraide thundring lightning ayre maisters glad forsake walke foote beside emperours tent maruellous bruite noyse heauen earth would haue gone together abash tent wailing pittifull voyce woman heard crie greeuously calling ayde knight sauage man length knowne queene thracc could succoured knight present emperour darkenes none could see long darke cloude amounted sky againe making noyse departure florian riding vp downe maruailing hereat length aduertised losse queene wherevpon tooke way emperours tent finding maiestie great feare heauinesse yet would giue ouer rode presently citie hauing armed himselfe concluded search thorow country rest place whatsoeuer vntil might heare tydings whose losse heart extreamely passioned many friend presented themselues beare company trauaile emperour would agree thereto fearing least turkes would visite constantinople returned againe knight sauage man great griefe could imagined set forward iourney stayed till hee hindered darke night hee glad passe roote tree forrest morning hee mounted horsebacke many dayes hee wandered vp downe strange countreys yet hearing newes would gladly meete withall froward chaunce hee maruellously abashed intended shipping try fortune would wayes speede better hee embarbued himselfe putting himselfe euen vnto mercy sea trauailing place marriners could wish best auayle one day aboue hee assayled exceeding tempest waues tossing vessell sort sometime one would haue iudged touched firmament afterwards would fall downe hell trouble pilot marriners disstraughted memory could deuise partes euen run way fortune pleased space three dayes end whereof came mighty huge mountaine top thereof seeming touch cloud knight sauage man desirous know countrey caused marriners set shore mountaine trauelled horse back went vp foot comming last side mountaine entred goodly fayre field inclosed round huge rock like passed entrance middest field strong admirable castle beauty also height beeing founded rockes gate castle hanged garland tryumphe wherein letter golde written thus pallace queene melia knight sauage man seeing gate open tooke boldnes enter beheld meruailous height hall chamber castle belonging queene melia iudged stately mansion euer came assure tower gallery building ingenuously carued rocke one would haue thought whole castle haue consisted one peece whereupon knight sauage man much abashed fortresse vnknowne knight emperours court greece length thought good visit castle hee saw foure corner thereof foure gate entrance forbidden espied gate made fast two great stroug chaines iron vppon gate beeing engraued many auncient history vnknowen knight sauage man long hee stayed beholde gate perceiued trauelled iu vain offer enter therat theu passed one gate came goodly great hall middest wherof chased gold picture ancient woman deuised caused castle builded monument garnished either side goodly marble pillar behold sufficiently passed viewe rest castle turning goe forward hee espied hard mightie serpent brasse fashioned made artificially thing strange behold monstrous highnesse reached rafter held vp couerture hall serpent held necke stretched along countenaunce vigorous fearefull made singular workemanship cunning able affright behold knight sauage man whose heart terrour fearefull motion could dismay approached serpent hauing viewed circumspectly espied key tied necke chaine gold chaine wound necke great many foldes wherevpon presently imagined key consisted principall aduenture castle visited many place returned againe brazen serpent marke key would serue intent came take chaine key perceiued serpent necke little chinke creuise sight began somewhat comfort himselfe tooke key hauing meanes vse owne pleasure opened therewith little window made serpent necke looking might discerne hollownesse serpent round behold foure taper waxe stood foure candlestickes siluer two placed towards east two west burning maruellous spendant brightnesse yet waxe seemed diminish thing betweene foure light couched pallad faire leonarda queene thrace wife ouer head hung fayre cannapy greene veluet sight knight sauage man abashed doubted whether might giue credit motion eye taken good view apparell knowing carried forth forrest perswaded himselfe wherevpon called aloud desiring vse regard vnto neuer iote neerer purpose enchaunted sound sleepe power vnderstand knight sauage man perceiued earnest good bare spake manner madame glory contentment victory yeeld manifold perillous aduentures haue happily finished seeme forsake present aduersitie whereon honour life dependeth let good madame enter courteous minde since straunge departure emperour greece haue failed visite many prouinces finde euen time hope finde chanced place may behold yet small griefe cannot come neither wil vouchsafe heare extreame affliction poore heart pausing began waxe maruellous angry setting ha swoord snatching furiously foorth sheath layde many violent stroke serpent thinking destroy piece might come lady hee fa deceiued intent serpent conuerted flame fire passed suddenly away knight sauage man lost sight cleane fearing least lady abide cruell torment serpent changed away fier sate downe ground great heauinesse curssing ill fortune bitterly intending neuer depart castle without might haue company lady perplexitie brother friend sage aliart would forsake great necessitie entred hall attired english manner hauing armour leysure arme himselfe greatly pittied misfortune brother florian forrest sage aliart sooner come vnto saluted speech perceiue sir knight haue altogether forgotten especially place haue neede helpe word knight sauage man presently arose embracing sage aliart armes returned answer lord brother sure vnknown vnto one occasion greefe thorowly setled minde causeth party vexed commit thing else forgetfulnesse therefore think offended though remembrance sharpe extremity desire deliuered ayde woorthy sir answered aliart whose knowledge serued bring queene leonarda place hath done maruellous mean impossible recouer hence speedily fortune reseruing employ valour aduentures worthy high renowne suffer intent brought hither fully executed hath ordained sort arte shall end cruell enchantment neuerthelesse shall necessary keep company courage strength may much helpe case hee thus said hee commaunded knight sauage man shut window hang key place whence hee tooke first hee looked see estate queene leonarda florian hee laboured bustly extinguish light taper hee coulde suffer extreame shyninge brightnes dazell eye looked sweete queene wife light hinderance thought guard excellent beautie wherevpon aliart spake thus vnto perceiue well lord ignorant verture taper whose light onely maintaineth life queene leonarda looke soone shall extinguished consumed euen soone shall life fully compleate ended communication two knight went foorth castle soone come open field ayre began exceeding troubled time maruellous darkenesse ouershadowed yet last cleared againe knight sauageman greatly abashed seeing himselfe depriued sage aliart company huge monsterous bull seemed hee come top rockes vppon bulles necke knight sauage man cast himselfe brought immediately darke obscure caue bull left vanished away fearefull motion could dismay hardy knight imagine illusion sent purpose hinder determination therefore would make account looking caue light somewhat increasing beheld figure picture renowned knight carried arm time famous king amadis hee might discerne esplandian among moore spectacle delighted much hononrable place stood armato noble king persian hauing letter golde left shoulder declared name famous progenie knight sauage man earnestly beheld gallant image percyued enter caue aged woman weake feeble extremity age seemed ready fal earth whe shee looked knight sauage man started backe great amazement cry aloude pittifully demaunded aide succour grauen picture would helpe conquer knight come violate deface pallace cry olde encauntresse image began stirre themselues lay holde theyr swoordes speares knight sauage man made offer defend himselfe stood silent former estate old woman vanished sight wherevppon knight sauage man departed thence comming hall serpent beheld old woman standing windowe looked beheld queene thrace wife made presently coniecture place inclosed remedy trauailes whereto would gladly attaine grieued shewe force woman thrust shoulder strongly window length opened went turning close window againe made fast againe ingeniously one could iudge way made entrance knight sauage man could chuse laugh see grace olde woman maintained enchauntment comming windowe hee iudged entered knockt kept bounsing thereat olde woman came opened windowe presenting selfe accompanied foure knight clad armour costly sumptuous declared knight desart sought destroy ancient pallace foure knight lifted vp mace knight sauage man seemed defend himselfe olde woman vanished away incontinent straunge motion hee could chuse wonder sitting downe viewe brauery house hee perceiued middest hall candlesticke golde set brasen pillar costly workemanship candlesticke burned goodly white waxe taper whose light shewed straunge manner many wonderfull occasion presented eye wherevpon imagined castle beene founded onely maruellous especiall cause narrowly circumspectly looked place beheld number cofers round euery cofer hauing key gold hanging made open one another found library queene melia gorgeous apparell belonging woman melia caused made giue couzin daughter king armato brother knight sauage man found set downe writing library gad read beganne againe woonted griefe seeing himselfe hope recouer queene thrace wife affliction sage aliart presented himselfe againe entring speech lord brother since haue done ordained referre rest behind despight person delighteth torment thus recouer loue dearely know well answered knight sauage man alone restore felicity thinke otherwise vnworthy haue furtheraunce extreame trouble chap lii aide sage aliart obscure valley noble knight sauage man deliuered enchauntment wife queene thrace sage aliart would deliuer queene thrace enchauntment desired see place castle viewed hee made account thing onely library well worthy estimation hee made conueyance bookes arte perillous isle placed among bookes sage vrganda somewhat hath beene discoursed already knight sauage man rested himselfe great trauaile doe sage aliart thus sent book away tooke taper stood candlesticke gold spake knight sauage man manner shall vnderstand lord life queene leonarda consisteth onely vertue light impossible v saue redeeme despight targiana onely cause misfortune order matter heart shall ere long receiue contentment yet shall sage enchauntresse brought vnhappy estate haue power resist determination thus concluding went vnto serpent holding one hand fatal candle little booke found lying foote marble columbe knight sauage man opened little doore key sage aliart reade earnestly booke vertue wordes written booke taper waxe belley serpen begand letse light et extinshuish altogether beene put one instant life queene thrace beene brought great daunger framed artificiall pollicie sweetely flumbred life vertue light yet shee depriued nat rall sences iote impeached singular beautie soone one taper lost light sage aliart lighted againe candle owne hand consisted cotrary meane helpe purpose whe burned place safegard life contained queene thrace stretched armes one awaking sound sleepe taper extinct lighted againe started vp suddaine meruailing see selfe narrow place especially company husband noble knight sauage man beheld teares trickling downe cheekes knowing well strange case sage aliart seeing queene extreame heauinesse rehearsed thing happened assuring emperor court generall sadnes absence also certified knight sauage man departed day costantinople search wherat grieued much opinion person soeuer happened place brought danger might easisy get againe knight sauage man could endure see lady shut vp long serpent belly desired sage aliart deliuer extremitie vpon word sage aliart candle one serpent nostrels made lespe cast fire foorth mouth abundantly one would haue thought hall would haue shaken piece great noyse serpent made queene leonarda amazed fearefull motion brought againe former perpletitie sight knight sauage man mooued exceedingly hee came embraced sage aliart humbly desiring helpe neuer aliart approched serpent thrusting arme litle doore quenched light taper done serpent stood indifferently quiet knight sauage man pleased wherefore began afresh intreat brother would pittie distressed case queene wife said well pleased sage aliart seeing brother florian earnestly affected queene thrace remembring small estimation woont make woman become faithfull reuerent subiect god loue thorowly recounted matter himselfe fell reading looke ahaine deuoutly length queene thrace came foorth serpent rauished inwardly delight shee beheld louing lord husband ran caught armes maruellous ioyfully thinking thus selfe valour sufficient end aduenture whatsoeuer pleasant knight sauage man hauing sweete wife queene armes thought himselfe onely happy man world delighted themselues thus long pleased prince sage aliart went shew singularity castle queene leonarda bringing stately pillar marble likewise gallant library queene melia rich robe stately apparell presented view desired owne immediately thinking fully recompenced passed misfortune sumptuous garment might bestowed might carry constantinople earnest motion prouoked two knight depart place sage aliart giuing vnderstand uecessary minde fulfilled request neyther could carry thing thence albeit liked neuer well reason rich vesture reserued one queene meliaes daughter beautie excell time knight sauage man somewhat moued wordes fearing hee long enioy queene wife sage aliart seeing two louers restored liberty tooke leaue trauell constantinople presence long desired looked gaue charge knight sauage man would come thither speede possible friend might greatly furthered company let vnderstand occasion queene thrace thus enchanted history discourseth princesse targiana could forget anger heauy displeasure towards knight sauage man dayly thyrsting desiring reuengement entertained partner purpose enchantresse whose dwelling realme persia named drusia velonna targiana expecting time might open intent enchauntresse drusia length consented fulfill mind one day princesse bathing selfe fountaine drusia came suddainly thorow window high tower presenting selfe straungely princesse targiana amazed frighted thereat called seruants come helpe drusia reuealing selfe princesse quickly remooued feare whereupon rehearsed earnest desire reuenged knight sauage man requesting fauour furderaunce cause enchauntresse one loued princesse well glad compasse thing might yeeld content spake vnto manner madame haue well pondered matter wherewith haue made acquainted haue deuised meanes releaue ouercharged troubled thoughtes ea might reuenged knight sauage man brother sage aliart obscure vally whose great experience knowledge may hinderance v neuerthelesse haue found one practise wherby may bring great trouble daunger oh velon quoth targiana onely thing desire hinder offend way whatsoeuer know well madame aunswered drusia velonna slenderlie affected notwithstanding loue especial good yet amorous queene thrace wife possible man wherefore intend conuey secret place sage aliart shall haue power helpe vntill empire greece poyled brought confusion neyther shall knight sauage man bee able finde shall spend time seeking yet shall labour bestowed ende would targ ana well contented enchauntresse tolde wherevpon enchaunted queene thrace manner haue declared already afterwards returned princesse targiana likewise conducted arte castle queene melia time albayzar gone vnto babylon targiana sufficiently pleased selfe beholding rare strange alteration queene thrace desired drusia shut doore hang key chaine serpent necke wherevpon targiana departed thence place great turke father afterward tooke iourney persia opinion sage aliart could helpe pittiful estate queene thrace castle melia remained thus enchaunted vntill knight sauadge man sage aliart met together deliuered wee returne prince albayzar comming laye siege cittie constantinople whither knight sauadge man trauelled speedily reason noble redoubted knight absent place deerest friend assembled together chap liii pof christian citie constantinople time princesse targiana sent tydings courte emperour palmerin comming enemyes rehearsed chronicle emperour palmerin king england spayne france lacedemonia thessalia desirous depart theyr seuerall kingdomes triumphes sport mariages friend somewhat ouerblowne past euen preparing themselues iourney fortune would make partner emperor daungers towardes presented occasion constrained breake theyr former determination princesse targiana sent news instant emperour huge nauie albayzar prepared besiege constantinople withall moreouer shee gaue vnderstand armie great turke father arriued porte armenia stayed onely winde likewise turke father appointed albayzar chiefe captaine generall armie hee surpassed valour courage report armie caused great astonishment manie chiefly able endure trauell armes emperour palmerin himselfe ouercharged yeeres hee could walke chamber yet hee able comfort encourage deerest friend good counsell wherby troubled mindes greatly cased primaleon naturally giuen couragious brauely minded make account misfortune might happen rather valiant prince knight companie could summoned better time witnesse theyr nobilitie king court sent gouernours realmes signory leuey power could possible come thither speede assist chap liiii phow enemy sent embassadour emperours court answer made manner haue declared already emperour prouided entertaining enemy maiestie aduising himselfe affayres aduertised embassadour arriued porte cittie demaunded safe conduct hee would come shoare maiesty counsel king prince content graunt request wherevpon embassadour tooke landing accompanyed foure knight hee tooke way emperours pallace king prince determined embassadour rehearse cause arriuall prince primaleon would suffer come emperours presence diuerse contrary opinion affirming presence noble answere emperour himselfe would daunte terrifie enemie able doe vpon determination agreede emperour brought chayre great hall embassador stayed hauing viewed strength citie knew well bestow good labour could conquer emperour according milde noble nature receyued embassador enemie gratiously king prince theyr due appointed place generall silence amongst embassadour began speech illustrious puissant emperour could wish see thee flourishing estate thy yeares well participate many trouble imminent dare take vppon defende thy empyre also enlarge contentment shall happie gaine victorie fielde battell presented thy maiestie let thee vnderstand albayzar great soldan babylon prince turkie accompanyed soldans king puissant prince hath sent thee let thee know determined theyr strength power besiege citie reuenge death manie theyr especiall friendes receyued dishonour cittie neuerthelesse soldane albayzar hauing forgotten gracious courtesie thou didst sometimes vse towards oloricque alchidiana princesse targiana hath thus concluded fearing noted ingratitude make thee offer eyther surrender cittie constantinople knight sauage man king thrace thy nephew hand depart leaue thine empyre subiect power without offering resistance determination condition hee bring armie thine empyre hee thinketh necessary thee rather loose one cittie whole empyre better thee deliuer one man hand see death number thy especiall friend word emperour thus answered friend hardly endure let thee passe speech must needes answer thus account well profite follow counsell matter sending one man may make sure account safetie rest one man found good knight valour sufficient redeeme captiuitie must forgetfull honour render state assurance lordes mercie besides thing much reason duety yeelde cittie hand heathen infidells true god worshipped spirit truth truely cannot maruell much hee offer come thus empire considering promise hath past betweene mee opinion rather furthered aide assistance hindered impeached thus maliciously trust god shall prepare graue walles cittie haue done alreadie many predecessours without regarde theyr owne honour courtesie haue come assaile manner perceyue lord answered embassa fortune hath daily fauoured present dreade misfortune whereinto may suddenly fall therefore intend returne answere lord sent taking leaue returned galley lay anckor accompanyed many prince lord emperours court giuen friendly farewell galley set forward expedition short time came rest armie chap lv phow armie great turke arriued port constantinople noble valiant prowesse christian would suffer pagan take landing embassadour albayzar soldane babylon thus departed emperour palmerin called together prince noble courte giue present order euery one best speede possible prouide themselues armes forbidde entraunce enemie haue good regard affaire citie safety committed guard emperour vernar king polendos accompanyed thousand fiue hundreth knight horsebacke foure hundreth footemen king edward england chosen generall consent chiefe captaine gouernour fielde hauing vnder conduct two thousand knightes beside giant dramusiande noble behauiour expedition wonne great estimation maiortes pridos duke galles rosiande de la bronde sonne argolant duke horten pompides fifty knightes come theyr company diuiding theyr knight foure part number eight thousand euery thousand generall captain arnedes king france ordering fiue hundred attended likewise sonnes gracian guerin germaine orleance beside fifty good hardy french knight thousand fiue hundred conducted recinde king spayne prince berolde onstalde sonnes awayting giant almaroll one hundreth spanish knight soldane bellagris captaine ouer foure hundred knight owne subiects guard owne person prouided one hundred chiefest knight court among sonne blandidon whose noble behauiour deserued commendation belcar duke pontus durace committed like charge king recinde arnedes hauing guarde owne person rosuell bellizart sonnes king tarnaes lacedemonia ancient noble prince giuen guard pallace security empresse queenes ladyes hee attending two hundred knightes primaleon chosen lord generall cittie hauing charge seauen hundred knightes wherewith regarde well field cittie palmerin florendos platir diuers knight charge vtter wing armie lost child giue succour perceyued necessitie thus emperours court well stored noble renowmed knight yet maiestie king edward greatly desired presence prince florian forrest whose absence horseman footemen ordained haue alreadie declared next morning king edward commaunded strike vp allarum hee giuen vnderstand enemie within halfe league cittie prepared themselues take landing emperour caused himselfe carryed vp high tower pallace hee would see fortune disposed happinesse king edward sooner arriued enemie placed armie seashoare hinder enemie comming land therein deceyued multitude galley ship impossible doe would albayzar accompanied renowmed knight armie two ougly fearefull giant euer seene made offer take landing first emperor court stepped entertayned sorte diuers turkes christian dangerously wounded albayzar offended could haue libertie get foorth galley hee commaunded gyants step water whose commaundement pre ently obeyed theyr e iron began breake thorowe pre sse hindred albayzar comming shoare began giue place landing dramusiande perceiued hee stept water vp nauill couering himselfe shield hee encountered giant aduanced himselfe foremost king edward leaped sea hinder giant dealing dramusiande foure thus encountring together knight emperours court seeing captaine foote began follow albayzar constrained come neere giant thought would want ayde palmerin england busie side seeing horse round field without master doubted least misfortune fallen friend whereupon gaue horse spur galloped place saw greatest bickering seeing king edward father standing sea dealing ougly monsterous giant presently came stepping entred speech desire gracious lord father giue ouer enemy giue succour friend dramusiande misfortune happen losse would greeued christendome king edward esteeming light word sonne would leaue giant greatly hee desired remaine victor necessity wherein hee perceiued diuers friend caused step backe giue place noble palmerin england albayzar behaued braue manner diuers glad shunne presence florendos beheld hee aduanced himselfe knightly prowesse shewen eyther side began cruell dangerous combate dramusiande preuailed well enemy giant hee tumbled downe dead himselfe sore wounded king edward commaunded carried citie palmerin england slew giant likewise father left fighting withall himselfe dealt withall fiue dayes could weare armour albayzar sooner perceiuing giant slaine presently retired galley diuers turkes beside edward saw turkes betake themselues galley againe hee mounted horsebacke giuing signe company withdraw themselues desiring soldane lagris king arnedes king recinde prince belcar dealing another vessell sought take landing follow gaue vnderstand florendos platir blandidon giant almaroll carried citie sore hurt able sustaine themselues king recinde palmerin belcar likewise grieuously wounded made king edward desire goe citie meane primaleon entred field accompanied seauen hundred knight desiring earnestly king edward traine would withdraw themselues might come fresh assault enemy king edward would suffer therefore altogether went cittie much grieued principall knight armie sore wounded chap lvi griefe sorrowe made constantinople dangerous estate wherein giant dramussande brought turk placed campe citie constantinople emperor captaines thus come citie traines passed night vsiting sore wounded whose ill lucke primaleon greatly grieued iudged want helpe hope defend enemy entring land next day palmerin england florendos king recinde belcar berold rosuel bellizart case could endure beare armes againe soone vpon concluded let enemy take landing suffer b ild tent prouide field mea e wounded person would better disposition succour looked would likewise arriued wherewith good hope bid enemy braue battaile meane time daily gaue albayzar company sundry assault king edward going visite wounded person found prince palmerin talking faire polinarda whose company made forget griefe hurt alone consisted onely medicine restore health like manner found florandos miragarda platir sidelia polendos francelian berolde onistalda normandie gracian claritia rosuell dramatiana bellizant den sa francian bernarda guerin clariana diuers others knight bare affection dramusiande like case fortunate louers wound yangerous could enioy sweete company best beloued arlencea towards remained maruellous affectionate assure emperour court sorie misfortune citie selfe beene brought extreame danger king edward whose minde pleasure made account rest quietnesse kept friend dramusiande company hauing wife queene flerida onely comfort heauie pensiue estate arlencea whose sad case may easily iudged young married louers florendos miragarda visited giant almaroll whose danger almost estate dramusiande yet able walke behaue himselfe pleasant company whose case pittied lamented generall soone arriued sage aliart whose presence former feareful vncertaine doubt somewhat calmed certified emperour florian would long absence thence newes much ioy maiestie caught sage aliart armes embraced gracious countenance came empresse entertaine fauour like bazilia empresse allemaigne gridonia polinarda princess lady among queene flerida glad presence well perceiue loue king edward husband bare also sundry time preserued liue child knowledge day came emperours court prince floraman trauailed finde prince florian forrest aduertised enemy laid siege constantinople left realme sardignia giuing charge gouernours left leuey great armie expedition send constantinople may read large hereafter day likewise arriued king estrellant hungaria accompanied two thousand horseman tenne thousand footman vnder conduct prince frisoll sonne albayzar greatly grieued losse men wherfore gaue charge chirurgions campe bee carefull respectiue wounded commanded laine bee buried thing accomplished thought expedient called principall estate armie councell whome hee concluded person vigilant carefull themselues night next morning take landing certaine watchword would giue day sooner chased away vncomfortable obscure night ship gallies brigandine ga ots prouision war tooke landing league distance fro constantinople hindred forbidden whereupon sounded drum trumpet cornet clarion instrument wherewith made triumphant noyse people citie much amazed thereat sage aliart floraman desiring see campe enemie requested emperour would lycence goe thither maiestie would graunt yet hee assurance knowledge sage aliart place soeuer needed feare two knight thus departed citie armed defence onely swordes day faire cleare betooke themselues little hill might pleasure discerne enemy armie diuers thought good scout take might vnderstand strength citie albayzar would grant wherefore sent esquire vnto attended emperours court let vnderstand would come neere see campe authoritie commaund indifferent friend vnto might come depart without danger two knight gaue credit message albayzar sent went esquiers company albayzar perceiuing came forth two page rich apparrell attending receiue afterward hee went thorow campe see mightie strength thereof declared name prince companay among whome verie many giantes terrible ouglie slaine dramusiande palmerin england albayzar diligent regard two christian knight see sight showne could discourage feare doubt theyr wellfare contained stoute vndaunted countenaunce seemed disdayne occasion albayzar thought dismay whereat little maruaile seene whole army albayzar accompanied hem neere citie desiring salute emperour empresse taking leaue courteously returned campe walked sadly especially sage aliart hauing foreseene would happen could hide sorrow hee conceiued minde neuerthelesse behaued themselues pleasantly entraunce cittie would discourage mindes people come pallace emperor presence prince floraman commaundement maiestie entred speech gratious lord rich enemy hath brought cittie incredible rehearsall take vppon make rehearsall thereof wast great deale time may apply better purpose certifying excellencie enimies strength wherefore let maiestie vnderstand enimies lesse number two hundred thousand simplest whereof carryeth brauerie minde abide feeld latest houre death king aetolia thirtie yeeres age hath conduct day vnder charge tenne thousande horseman fortie thousand footemen brauely armed surely must necessity commend aboue rest pride prince albayzar doth much amaze small estimation made puissance himselfe gaue v sight whole armye graunting like assuraunce court hee v desire see garrison thing haue diligently noted cannot greatly profite himselfe rest whereof perhappes may forgetfull good lorde sage aliart large discourse vnto highnesse haue beh ued selues well friend sayd emperor possible bring v certaine assurance cause wherefore necessarie enter councell may auoyd enterprise alb yzar souldiours content shall likewise see cittie charge giuen captaines behaue themselues circumspection enemy may get sudden aduantage v emperour set downe determination prince betooke themselues seuerall charge might better respect practi e enimie chap lvii pof albayzar well prouided armie succour came emperour palmerin albayzar prouiding strength armye caused trench rampiers defence fortification bee made round camp imagined sufficient withstand resist furious batterie whatsoeuer would haue knowledge valour enemyes hee appoynted principall captain place importance assurance campe afterwards consent councell set galley shippes fire reseruing certain number swiftest brigandine sight f made astonishment constantinople fully resolued determined hazarde theyr liues subdue pompe glory enemy seeing presumed much themselues emperour sitting chaire one turret pallace perceyued well hee driue enemyes empyre without great effusion blood losse friend space seuen dayes continued burning theyr shippes leauing themselues destitute prouision depart thence fortune oppose selfe ende seuen dayes constantinople began skyrmish wounded prince recouered former estate except dramusiande giant almaroll yet chirurgions assured emperor greatest danger past likely doo well enough meane king edward primaleon endeuored themselues fortifie cittie gouernours realmes belonging king present constantinople sent good prouision strength force could possibly make ready sudden rehearse vnto necessitie chiefest succour sent theyr kingdomes signory first emperour nar allemaigne sent two thousand horseman twelue thousand footman king arnedes fraunce like number recinde king spayne two thousand light horseman eyght thousand footemen prince floraman foure hundred horseman foure thousand footemen tarnaes king lacedemonia foure hundred horsmen foure thousand footemen thrace honour king florian forrest came foure hundred knightes horsebacke foure thousand footemen england came foure hundred knight tenne thousand footman nauarre came two hundred light horseman denmarke came two hundred light horseman drapo duke normandie came thither two thousand knight horsebacke foure thou nd braue footemen prince belcar came foure hundred horseman one thousand footemen roramant king bohemia sent foure thousand footemen estrellant arriued accompanyed eyght thousand foure hundred gallant knightes horsebacke tenne thousand hardy fighting men foote ioyning cittie number twenty thousand horseman threescore thousand footemen emperour counsell appointed thus come assist rest themselues certain dayes sustained weary iourney time wounded person able beare armor ayde gaue battell enemy chap lviii pof aduenture happened arriuall straunge knight accompanied ladie prince albayzars campe come succour emperour reposed themselues young prince knight court constantinople gaue enemie sundry assault skirmish preuailing alwayes happily aduauntage still came theyr side time skirmished manner emperour empresse ladyes high tower see braue attempt perceyued enter cittie towardes enemyes campe knight seemed
