haue good opinion himselfe mounted braue gallant courser himselfe attired guylte armour whereon wrought diuerse ingenious knottes deuises siluer beside armour bloody many place gaue sufficient testimony knight daylie enioyed little rest shielde loue artificially figured roughly helde hayre head bloody minded tyrant knight seemed carry launce neck horse hauing point thereof little white ensigne hee wore signe peace quietnesse esquire bare another shielde couered ouer skinne wilde beast another launce hand rid lady blacke palfray shee attyred turkish manner robe white sattine cutte pinked many place blacke silkes lying vnder white gaue braue grace vnto apparell body sleeues thicke beset pearles stone great estimation lady haire spread abroad ouer shoulder face couered would knowne soone knight come neere prince albayzars tent stayed pretie space whereat turk somewhat abashed knewe part knight iudged armour christian apparell ladie turkish could imagine certaintie case meane prince campe thus regarding beholding knight perceyued sende esquyre prince albayzars tent hauing face couered least hee knowne hee beganne minde manner lorde knight see presumes neere campe mee giueth vnderstand hee hath many yeeres serued lady company yet able winne enioye loue shee could well dryue delayes excuse shee desired bring vnto place must enterprise io st foure knight behalfe fall fortune fauoureth victorie shee faile requite labour loue knightes camp shall refuse trie valour hath giuen leaue offer condition emperours knight constantinople refusall made likewise lady must consent recompence hee vanquished made challenge therefore lord may determine selues dare make tryall valour knight would gladly know said soldane persia gallaunt young prince braue armour recompence knight make victory may happen shall lord answered esquyre send owne esquier haue reported giuen charge without word hee returned maister accompanyed esquyre soldane persia whome knight came ladie made aunswere see well friend request thy lord standeth good reason wherefore thou may say vnto thy misfortune bee foure knightes chaunce vnhorse faile deliuer horse armour besides shew obeysance shall commaund condition lady may remaine libertie doo shee shall imagine conuenient herselfe pagan prince well contented could good offer knight wherefore ordained ioust foure young kinge brauely gallantly attyred rich costly armour first king second king trebisond th rd king caspia fourth hardie soldane persia king edward recinde arnedes palmerin england dramusiande departed cittie constantinople safe conduct prince albayzar see iousts came albayzar mounted horsebacke vnarmed except lance carryed hand accompanied iue prince giant neere prince came cittie al yzars saluted graciously knight came lady spake greeke tongue shuld apply mindes affaire wast saluting could affect fauour friendshyp thus said returned lady prouided himselfe enter ioust seemes said albayzar knight doubt hardy valiant make shew braue wherefore thinke best wee accord rather abide daunger owne liues concluding granted first ioust king tr b zonde mounted goodly aye courser armour greene colour shielde figured fielde sinople giant slayne witnesse hee conquered nobly combate king trebisund taken leaue albayzar presently ran strange knight encountred force launce slewe piece vp ayre neuerthelesse king trebisond sped vnfortunately hee sent measure length ground fore shaken amazed arried foorth field meane knight rid lady glad hee sped well king caspia presented elfe field carnation armour hart siluer portrayed shield fielde sable gaue horse spur e knight sent keepe king trebisond companie king bithinia perceyuing armed like king caspia ran strange knight valiantly meeting middest carrie broke launce brauely shield strange knight failed breaking lance yet hee mette king roughly iousting bodie throwne saddle straunge knight forced forsake styrrops hee recouered himselfe went ladie desiring thinke amisse little ayle would make amends fourth king soldan persia brauely mounted guilt armour bearing shielde fortune stately placed charryot tryumph golden fielde aduanced himselfe course albayzar honour clap downe helmet deliuering likewise launce hee carryed owne hand whereat straunge knight enemy made account taking leaue pricked foorth receyue soldane meeting together orce theyr launce broken middest yet themselues nothing pon ldane persia seeing prowresse enemy came vnto wordes thinke good syr knight wee yet hazard tryall ioust see destitute launce intreate prince albayzar bestowe one vpon syr answered strange knight content allow thing shall ordaine yet somewhat offended selfe make partaker fellowes misfortune marrye perswade selfe faulte consisted horse sore laboured trauell hee hardly performe dutie syr knight answered soldane shall complaine small matter therefore bestowe one owne horse vpon troth sir answered strange knight vnacquainted countrey knowe whose handes might request fauour yet want great offer courteous cannot good make choyse horse friend saide dramusiande thinke well behauiour gentlenesse pray accept horse whereon mounted good sir answered strange knight graunt courtesie straunger vnknowne good offer would highly impeach mee refuse hee alighted horse mounted dramusiande sent giuing signe soldane without delay defende himselfe taking launce encountred middest carriere brauely straunge knight loste styrrops soldane persia throwne earth sore hurt came foure knight carry foorth fielde straunge knight returning againe hee came vnto prince albayzar wordes see syr haue accomplished challenge presented vnto ladyes behalfe therefore syr albayzar graunt licence knightes deale triall attend ioust heere till night long horse able hold perceiue well sir aunswered prince albayzar pride wherewith accompanied maketh gallant speech assure youre selfe doth little greeue generall armie hinderance dealing neuerthelesse desire haue pull downe glorious stomacke content knightes shall hazard fortune king edward prince highly commend courage strange knight spake greeke language perfectly would haue iudged prince florian forrest long foure knight prince albayzar presented themselues field brauely armed whome strange knight vnhorsed one another presently whereat albayzar much offended hee desired knight rest himselfe wordes knight thus answered see sir haue two launce yet left willing bestow breaking therefore send giant standeth next trie fortune together ala sir answered albayzar forward wishing fortune turne face therfore pray thee framustant quoth giant thou wilt graunt knight honest request giant glad doe thing might content albayzar armed himselfe immediately giuing horse spurres knight met together forcibly knight constrained catch hold necke horse sorie receiue foyle presence many good knight wherefore reuenge himselfe enemie tooke second launce wherwith encountred giant worthily himselfe almost cast saddle fortune giant point launce entred beuere helmet whereby cast croup r horse giant thinking recouer himselfe pulde bridle horse strongly horse fell downe kackward vpon fall id astonish carried field depriued sens mishap disliked prince albayzar straunge knight came speech thou thinke good syr albayzar depart citie ladie desireth draweth towards night entertainement allowe heere iudge shall slender see well aunswered albayzar vse thing neuerthelesse pr wesse haue seene content accompanie lady gate citie doubting assurance beeing lycenced king rec nde prince king edward friend tooke ood part word albayzar brought gate city tooke leaue king recinde rest desiring strange knight tell demaund thing answered knight force greatly make knowne vnto wherefore shall vnderstand knight sauage man principal enemie lady queen thrace wife tooke helmet saying glad meete place would haue occasion deale th se wordes albayzar offended would speake night king edward friendes rode citty ioyfully certifying emperour arriuall florian queene thrac graciously entertayned empresse ladyes maruailed much strange apparrell w ich workmanship queene milium wherof make present one daughter king armato brother haue already declared emperour glad arriuall nephew hee would hardly suffer presence hee kissed hande empresse grandmother queene flerida mother hee saluted friend hee conducted chamber haue wound visited receiued ioust prince albayzars knight chap lix phere shall declared manner prince florian forrest arriued constantinople manie thing happened comming soone prince florian recouered queene wife ayde assistance sage aliart followed aduentures certaine time perceiue valiant noble disposition vnderstood hard case wherinto deere friendes constantinople brought changed former determination caused queene decke selfe turkish attyre tooke way place troubled friend remained could enter cittie must first passe campe enemyes disguised himselfe strangely couering shielde sauadge deuise carryed shielde whereof haue spoken alreadie found one chamber castle queene leonarda enchaunted manner hee presented himselfe albayzars tent sped iousting haue hearde rested himselfe two dayes desired emperour giue enemyes battell thought euery day yeare till might encounter prince albayzar maiesty deferred matter long could would assured good disposition armie turkes tooke strangely trauelled farre lay siege principall citie empire yet long ioyned battell albayzar knew wel aduantage city might get compassed wi hin strong walles defence besides cittie plentifully stored good hardie knightes would murther many ere would yeeld themselues therefore changed mind giuing assault made hauocke spoyle citie thereby prouoke emperour seeke reuenge meane continued spoyling soldane persia sent messenger emperour beeing brought maiesties presence setting knee ground began manner puissant emperour soldane persia soueraigne lord licence prince albayzar captaine consent whole turkish armie saith greatly offended hath happened seuerall iousts nephew florian would gladly hazard himselfe condition willl suffer twelue knight court come fielde morrowe morning ioust combate twelue turkes companie lord captaine thus much graunt combat shall fought empresse chamber windowe ende princess lady may see valour prowesse shall shewen side agree giue ouer ende combate ladyes shall thinke good command moreouer humbly desired empresse may stand pleasure iousts ended giue leaue daunce lady emperour returned answere thou maist friend say vnto thy lord content graunt request twelue knight court shal faile meete fielde two houres warning beside empresse shall giue leaue daunce ladyes trust agree determine albeit know theyr sworne enemy knight come companie twelue thou mayst say soldane thy lord forbidden come arm like doe promise knight court none themselues shall come armed field esquire returning answere soldane persia hee companion beganne presently prepare theyr deuises armour chap lx phowe combate betweene twelue turkes twelue christian begunne howe ladyes caused giuen ouer presently betweene knight emperours courte arose great controuersie euery one stroue number twelue hardly could quieted theyr earnest desire deale turkes yet ende glad obey determination florian chose twelue according named first palmerin england brother prince florendos gracian berolde floraman sardignia blandidon platir pompides king estrellant hungaria rosuell francian sonne king polendos rosian de la bronde twelue knight armed richly hauing theyr coates armes made theyr ladyes king edward arnedes recinde soldan bellagris giant dramusiande vnarmed accompanyed knight field place soldan persia appointed empresse ladyes might see theyr behauiour came soldane persia eleuen knight company honoured presence king gamba sparta armenia giant framustant vnarmed soldane persia desired greatly vnhorse prince florian forrest hee comming foremost king aetolia two thought valiaunt palmerin england determined ioust hee knew deuise sheelde golden tower field sable soldane persia clapt downe beuere helmet king armenia gaue launce readie ioust sound trumpet ran altogether couragiously met one another force part cast ground palmerin england enconntred king aetolia brauely sent measure length ground himselfe shaken forsooke stirrops florian soldane persia encountred force cast foorth saddle florendos vnhorsed prince arfasia named argelao breefe vnhorsed except palmerin platir king polendos desiring accompany friend alighted horse charge enemy soldane persia king aetolia offended misfortune presented themselues enemy aide companion beganne combate sword sped better thereby ioust lady pittying seeing soldane persia great daunger reason florian woonne aduantage ouer likewise palmerin florendos brought enemy subiection concluded princesse miragarda accompanied foure lady king tarnaes lacedemonia goe field separate soone combattants espied would suffer come farre gaue ouer combat come meete princesse miragarda thought selfe greatly honoured theyr forbearance combate hauing gratiously thanked shee returned backe againe holding prince florendos hand degree following decent manner come pallace soldane companie honorably entertained emperour empresse miragarda gridonia flerida prince gaue princesse polinarda vnderstand soldane persia thought maruellous well emperour caused brought chamber presence richly behanged cloathes inestimable value turk entred chamber mindes rauished beholding stately maner therof king edward recinde arnedes king entertained turkes singular humanitie made iudge courtesie bountie emperours court could matched world beside beheld rare excellent beauty lady imagined knightes preuailed theyr heauenly feature strength consisted themselues soldane persia still viewing princesse miragarda tooke faire polinarda length found deceyued saw florendos still company palmerin kept wife polinarda talke made presently recall error turkish prince whose mindes onely seeke spoyle cittie tooke leaue departed come theyr campe practised way worke theyr trayterous intent soldane persia tooke princesse polinarda daunce king aetolia tooke beautifull princesse miragarda soldane albayzar took queen leonarda knowing prince florian would scantlie bee pleased therewith king cospia albeit hee young himselfe yet refused ladyes tooke queene flerida falling courtlie pastime daunced much pleased themselues courteous manner departed thence going foorth chamber giant framustant well viewed arlencea rauished affection towards hee challenged combate dramusiande morrow would dally either side threw downe theyr gage emperour caused taken vp assuring fielde behalfe soldane albayzar made promise maner tooke leaue one another euery one wishing night past good hope see notable combat shall vnderstand waye framustant onely giant whose force albayzar wholly reposed himselfe chap lxi pof noble valiant combate betweene dramusiande giant framustant next morrow dramusiande addressed himselfe place combat bee fought accompanyed emperor vernar king edward sonnes whome loued honoured long giant framustant came attended diuers companion friendes hee armour rich strong necessary dealing one valour giant dramusiande whome exceeded farre hugenesse stature beeing mounted lusty courser made albayzar friend imagine victory would happen side acquainted noble prowesse dramusiande iudged contrarie certaine word vttered eyther side continued long dramusiande beeing earnest desire chastise proude behauiour framustant gaue horse spurres likewise prepared himselfe entertain encountred exceeding force glad catche holde neck horse shunne fall immediately recouered saddle againe drawing theyr swordes scabbard began charge one furious stroakes surely combat seemed dangerous could meete closely together horsebacke would alighted dramusiande behaued himselfe expert nimble dexteritie fight framustant could fasten stroakes hee layd loade enemy eagernesse theyr quarrell eyther side could hardly bee iudged whome aduantage would happen long endured combate shield broken defaced could find little defence theyr armour cruelly cut mangled theyr bodyes wounded many place made regardants minde combate deserued great commendation euer yea combat dramusiande giant barocant might compare framustant shewed himselfe sufficient power briefe doubtfulnes combat victorie hoped eyther side fortune reserued champyons action greater moment would suffer combate endure longer instant time arriued fielde princesse targiana accompanyed princesse armenia diuers worthy knight aduertised famous cittie constantinople besieged desired trauell thither see prince albayzar came foorth theyr kingdomes left sufficient gouernours take charge afterward accompanyed two thousand knightes iourneyed vntill came walles constantinople princesse targiana bearing great good emperour honour hee bestowed court beganne weepe take heauily seeing friend troubled brought danger knowledge combate betweene framustant dramusiande would alight horse entred field prince albayzar beeing little glad arriuall princesse armenia soldane persia sundry king companie manner shee came two giant fought combate approaching dramusiande shee layde hand right shoulder taking maske fro face spake vnto manner think reason syr dramusiande former quarrel set apart ended presence loyall vnfained friend dramusiande calling remembrance length returned answer certainely madame might accounted vngentle minde would refuse vanquished condition thought agreeable nature iudge doe aduantage much wishing mee giue ouer combate especially seeing matched strong puissant enemie knowe well said framustant glozing wordes spoken heart onely flowte orne neuerthelesse hope make finde true ende pray thee framustant answered dramusiande shew thy selfe instant somewhat obedient madame targiana considering wee place may time trie selues together albayzar commaunded framustant withdraw himselfe meane emperor vernar king edward diuers prince came princesse targiana florian forrest shruncke away cittie would haue knowe saluted dignitie deserued willed doo humble dutie emperor empresse princess friend tooke leaue returning cittie dramusiande departing albayzar prince campe receyued meruailous statelie side glad haue company lady well prince cittie emperor allemaigne king edward spent time discoursing beauty princesse armenia exceeded farre princesse targiana continuing commendation fayre lady came pallace emperor reioycing greatly arriuall princesse targiana empresse bare great good vnto princesse lady sought desire lycence might goe welcome princesse targiana self flattered prince albayzar obtained lycence goe shew reuerence empresse lady next morning rode brauely cittie accompanied princesse armenia soldane persia diuers prince brought citie entraunce wherof emperour sate chayre brought thither honour targiana tooke armes bene owne daughter like princesse armenia soldane persia kinges came company princesse targiana caried pallace entring empresse chamber entertained gratious courtesie company beside imbraced one another princesse polinarda presented queene flerida targiana whome held hand vsing many gentle salutation knowledge miragarda leonarda perceiued verie well beautie might compare greeuing leonarda escaped well place caused enchaunted came princesse miragarda speech cannot chuse madame esteeme meruailous well paine aduenture honour field defence beautie cause must take good part labour prince albayzar bestowed behalfe queen leonarda would speak one word married prince florian whome condemned mortall enemie princesse armenia sitting betweene miragarda leonarda much abashed acquainted lady emperor court notwithstanding entertained honourablie thus continued princelie courtesy one another till night drawing targiana tooke leaue emperor desiring maiestie excuse warre commenced contrary empresse lady brought pallace gate eche side parted heauinesse could speake one another emperor himselfe accompanied without cittie targiana excused selfe warre albayzar enterprised maiestie tooke hand speaking manner promise madame little griefe cannot time witnesse le th iudged vngratefull vnto deserues honoured gratious seruice malicious dealing albayzar trust cannot diminish one iote good beare assure may dispose court pleasure may make selfe bolde welcome heere great turke father court breaking saluting eche great courtesie emperour carryed backe pallace targiana conducted camp accompanied emperour vernar king england fraunce spayne many prince emperor court hauing brought campe tooke leaue returned citty deuising seuerally among themselues whose lotte targiana ladyes fall victory chanced theyr side oftentimes nature souldiers share diuide spoyle among themselues fortune hath deliuered theyr hand chap lxii pof battell betweene christian turk happened many dayes arriuall princesse targiana prince well one side concluded ioyne battell marrie christian desirous thereto turk victual beganne waxe scant within cittie besides albayzar came oftentimes prouoked also standard ensign displayed vrged knight cry call theyr comanders captain suffer saillie foorth cittie griefe enclosed within theyr enemyes come daring boldely without vppon primaleon would gladly haue issued foorth prince would haue bin ruled would aduenture rashly many weake sickly trauelling sea therefore determined recouer themselues perfect assurance health would thuste themselues face daunger well rested recouered themselues found strong able deale enemie commaunders summoned traines field king edward generall whole force commaunded horseman footemen prepare themselues battell first squadron conducted soldane bellagris whome committed fiue thousand good soldier owne subiects second giuen charge recinde king spaine conduct three thousand sent kingdome spayne third led arnedes king fraunce charge like number king spaine two thousand souldiers sent france fourth vnder conduct polendos king thessalie attending like number fift charge emperour vernar allemaigne sixt last foure thousand conducted king edward england primaleon would day take vpon charge might better giue succour place perceiued daunger iudged pollicie vsed warre followe brauely seene fielde day belcar drapos normandie maiortes otherwise called great dog palmerin england florian forrest florendos platir blandidon berolde prince spayne floraman sardignia gracian france rosuell bellizart onistalde tenebrant francian pompides sage aliart king estreliant frisoll albanis frieze rodamont dragonalt king nauarre luyman burgundie germaine orleance tremoran resiran de la bronde dramusiande almaroll renowmed knightes emperor court squadron vnder conduct soldane bellagris concluding themselues soone battell begunne would take part side theyr dutie affection best serue king tarnaes accompanyed many valiaunt knight committed charge defence cittie footemen chosen fiftie thousand accounted wisest expert souldiers vnder conducting king tarnaes helpe preuent danger imminent cittie king edward himselfe braue gallantly armed ceased visite charge horseman likewise hee came among young prince knightes encouraging noble speech countenance bewraying inuincible minde conquerour desiring remember theyr knightly deedes passed might occasion stirre vp nobly defence flower christendome like speech animate embolden traine fearefull least minde deale enemy seemed willing forward battell hee brauest souldier field king perceiued withdrew himselfe company commanding soldane bellagris giue first assault albayzar diuided horseman ten companyes giuing euery squadron fiue thousand men first squadron conducted soldan persia accompanied giant framustant fiue hundred wel approued souldiers second giuen charge king trebizonde third king caspia fourth king armenia fift king gamba sixt king sparta seuenth king bithinia eight prince argelo arfasia tenth last conducted soldane albayzar himselfe whome seauen giant guard person soon framustat espied dramusiande forefront christian armie desirous approoue himselfe onely hee went licence albayzar foremost squadron turkes hee thought meanes encounter dramusiande young prince albayzars campe diuided foure part part contained fiue twenty thousand left beside sent pauillons safegarde princesse targiana princesse armenia richnesse armour ingenious deuises knight well one side bare conflict would trouble eloquent tongue marcus tullius cicero make true sufficient discourse thereof yeelde greater contentment friendely gentleman take delight reading famous hystorie rehearse name brauest fielde first begin christian wherof sometimes two three together whose armour deuises like colour proportion king edward emperour vernar soldane bellagris theyr armour scarlet white blacke colour mightie chaynes golde crossing theyr bodyes theyr shieldes bare flying griffon fielde siluer vnderneath written letter golde name esteemed bee best beloued famous friend primaleon king polendos white armour theyr shieldes portrayed shielees sifiphus tumbling restlesse stone field sable sage aliart obscure valley rosian de la bronde white armour maner deuises shieldes sage aliart figure god apollo shield field sinople rosian shielde tower nemrod whence hee lineally descended maiortes giant almaroll blacke armour theyr shieldes colour without maner deuise giant dramusiande strong armour ier shielde manner whome christian countenance chap lxiii pof first battell betweene christian turkes successe thereof armye eyther side appointed good decent maner potentate king prince person authoritie would need goe place themselues formost rancke holding opinion renowmed battell wherein perill christendom consisted presented themselues foremost fight deserue greatest honor glory field consideration made captaines leaue theyr charge lieutenant come place themselues face battell drummes trumpet sounding gallantly either side soldane persia marched traine receiue first squadron christian meeting togither primaleon encountred king casp brake launce brauely himselfe forsooke stirrops king caspia forcible stroake hee sent headlong earth sore wounded palmerin england serued king aetolia manner albeit reputed amongst turkes especiall good knight armes florendos king armenia fayled ioust met forceably togither theyr bodyes horse tumbled ground prince florendos recouered himselfe againe quickly turke amazed fall hee could hardly tell whereupon two couzins came vnto conducted betweene tent berolde spaine floraman sardignia addressed themselues prince argelao king bithinia encountred furiously cast forth saddle able mount themselues againe number great fight h te recinde arnedes ranne king gamba sparta vnhorsed except king recinde kept horse valiantly soldane bellagris king trebisonde mette together brake launce verie brauely beeing thing shaken encounter soldane persia desired haue himselfe seene field sooner espied knight sauadgeman gaue horse spurres encountred nobly knight sauadgeman lost stirrops recouered againe presently soldane sore shaken lay along necke horse tumbled ground one traine immediatly succoured among dealt first encounter dramusiande framustant regarded fayling breaking launce met couragious manner together body horse men sent ground recouering themselues nimbly againe beganne furious cruell combate example knight charged one another puissant stroakes prince emperours court first encounter except king edward emperour vernar king polendos would depart squadron fearing least would disparse themselues order giant almaroll kept company likewise saw giant foremost rancke framustant whome dramusiande fought gallantly thyy thus encountred launce many knight throwne earth slaine outright little better case drew sword side began cruell battaile euer seene captaines returned againe seuerall charge would haue fall order argelao king bithinia fighting foote floraman sardignia berolde spaine succoured soldane persia like noble captaine praunced among ranckes animate encourage mindes friend assembling sundrie company hee came foure continued fight still fiercely soldane bellagris traine shewed prowesse fresh commers soldane persia himselfe companie brought enforced giue place willes leauing argelao king bithinia danger king trebisonde come vpon second turkish squadro beene slaine hand floraman prince berolde soldane persia greatly greeued seeing men vanquished left heart cried succour king trebisonde whose aide returned recouer lost length made meanes get argelao king bithinia thorow preasse seene prince primaleon might plainly haue discerned willing e preuails enemy laide loade euerie side following vpon traine nobly one durst stand endure fury meanes recouered horse againe floraman berolde wounded glad get forth battell primaleon palmerin england florian forrest traynes helde king trebisondes second squadron h te play wished themselues little furder left hand squadron daungerous battaile betweene framustant dramusiande gotten great aduantage enemy reason framustantes sword broken hand albayzar sent two hundred knight foote helpe giant primaleon perceiued spake palmerin england manner pray sir goe succour friend dramasiande neuer returne cittie except haue mee without word layd lustily knockt downe euery one stood vntill came dramusiande thither likewise came defend enemy knight sauageman florendos platir polinard pompides sage aliart maiortes frisoll blandidon rosiran de la bronde belcar sonnes likewise accompanied twentie renowmed knight armie aide framustant came soldan persia king trebisond accompanied hundred knight great authoritie valour foote primaleon saw friend without horse alighted likewise prince palmerin christian knight heard primaleon fought foote forsooke horse came hastily running defend beganne cruell fierce battell side remained doubtfull dangerous dramusiande framustant layde vpon pommils sword length sore trauailed stroakes could little hurt primaleon king trebisonde buckled together fiercenesse fight end constrained pause like happened palmerin england soldane persia knight sauage man slew two knight came traiterously strooke behinde back florendos rest companion stuck closely tackling many enemy ranne like dogges away maiortes compassed enemy none friend might come helpe greeuous wound giuen hauing slaine many enimies durst abide hee fell downe dead ground himselfe florian forrest grieued saw fall teares trickled downe cheek albeit extreame heauinesse yet followed kilde maiortes reuenged death nobly death braue noble man much lamented knew valiaunt minde especiallie sonne dridan anguish mind cast himselfe amongst enemy within behaued himselfe well turkes knew cost extreame griefe death father yet vnhappie fortune end beset among thickest enimies many cruell wound giuen diuerse place body fell ground vitall spirite forsaking made follow father dead ghost small griefe noble king edward england respect great friend shippe loue remayned long time betweene maiortes iudged fighting thus foote would death many deere friendes commaunded hard horse breake ranckes whereto presentlie obeyed scattered troupe enemy sort friendes mounte horsebacke againe dramusiande framustant separated sunder second encounter king trebisonde slaine hand noble palmerin england dramusiand framustant daungerously wounded able hold fight longer wherefore conueied thence one turkes tentes cittie tendered present regard according dangerous estate required conflict thus broken diuers entred first squadron retired take breathing primaleon palmerin many emperor court beside pleasure endure trauaile armes small account made hurt enemy empresse lady seeing great cruelty losse many noble gentleman withdrew themselues chamber lamented greeuous maner seene enimie entred citie whervpon many lady great authorite hearing pittifull lamentatios came vnto pallace reposing altogither hope aged emperor knightes field fayle victorie king tarnaes would haue denied lady entraunce pallace could well doo hardlie man gouerne common people especiallie generall feare liues threatned eye emperour whose debilitie yeeres griefe minde conceyued vnlooked stratageme depriued woonted good iudgement pollitique meanes preuent great mischeefe could imagine himselfe remedie suddaine misfortune euen woman stomacke rather inuincible minde alwayes borne heeretofore fel pusillanimitie doubtful feare himselfe vtterlie forgetting auncient adage audaces fortuna iuuat targiana princesse armenia lady turkes campe fearefull doubtfull victorie lady emperours court king edward generall christian armie desiring witnesse noble valour fielde hauing rested himselfe pretie space dismounted three knight one another one launce afterward drawing sworde charged enimes side valiauntlie glad auoide giue place prince albayzar likewise seeking honour himselfe day renowme field came vppon christian incredible prowesse resistaunce made fresh company battaile endured long time blody cruell man could iudge side aduantage came newe assault vpon christian great number turkes left wing among whome sixe monstrous terrible giant assault hote time christian enforced retyre giant almaroll kept companie king recinde lorde seeing christian withdrawe themselues addressed himselfe one giant called dramorant mighty mace hee gotten battell hee kept rough playe could passe forward willinglie would haue done king recinde seeing another giant named trafamor coming strike almaroll behinde backe stepped hinder determination hee aged feeble able resist mercilesse stroaks bloodyminded giant trafamor pittifully wounded fell downe giant feete tooke sword thrust heart king recinde prince palmerin perceyued hee ry sorrie comming rage giant trafamor neuer left vntill time hee layde downe dead ground sore himselfe glad get foorth battell commandement prince primaleon hee carryed cittie made great doubt life reason lost aboundance blood almaroll dramorant sundred whervpon death recinde k spayne blazed army heauy newes arnedes king france couzin singular good friend making account life hee threw amongst enemy seeking reuenge death king spayne hee lost owne life slaine onistalde sonne king recinde followed arnedes reuenge father death king edward prince offended sawe theyr deerest friendes thus cast ground ranne amongst thickest enemyes layd loade like desperate men knight sauadgeman likewise whose shield manner deuise could discerned hackt broken piece came vnto giant dramorant handled knightly order made tumble downe dead belcar king polendos entring king aetoliaes troupe ende enforced paye sharpe tribute death demaundeth nature dutie vnfortunate successe caused little heauines among christian especilly prince berolde spayne vnderstanding king recinde father onistalde brother slaine enimies rushed fiercely vppon determining eyther reuenge theyr losse leaue life among company prince floraman sardignia followed close butchering turkes euery side whereby hee manifested prince berolde entyre good affection bare valiaunt florendos iniury enemie day knightly stroakes bee seene shield deliuered true testimony great danger escaped made account earnest desire reuenge death deere friend battell may reputed moste cruell perillous euer seene many grieuous tragicall spectacle seene dismall day losse number famous prince renowmed knightes might haue seene rosuell bellizart breake hardily preasse theyr enemyes without eyther feare regarde theyr owne liues looke theyr noble father prince belcar francian side came searche father king polendos enemy perceyuing knowing neere allyed emperor followed fiercely see could first murther prince berolde sooner come place father lay slayne hee sawe giant almaroll lost helmet face pittifully besmiered blood great griefe behelde hee place laid seuen hardy knight slaine foot determined forsake dead body prince lost owne life likewise place enemy resisted prince berolde strongly beene succour emperor vernar primaleon florendos blandidon beene sent keepe father company primaleon laboured earnestly get giant almaroll foorth battaile destritute helmet armour broken much body wounded many place loue fidelitie bare prince impossible primaleon cause withdraw himselfe vpon reskew prince berolde enemy came running amaine place soldane persia conducting hearing almaroll continued manfully killing came galloped thorow rancke till came almaroll seene gallant behauiour primaleon florendos sonne defending almaroll enemy fury would haue imagined type knightly valour consist two famous champion little grieued see almaroll willing seeke owne death could bee perswaded minde friend giant gramato came company soldane persia aduanced himselfe deale almaroll hardy florendos stepped slaine outright almaroll caught body grieuously wounded succour whatsoeuer would saue life fell dead giant gramato berolde afterward charged roughly gramato ended life accompany giant almaroll began courage christian encrease worthily stronger place turkes soldane persia conueyed foorth battaile reason wound receiued throate push sword soldane bellagris found good opportunitie carry body king recinde onistalde sonne forth field prince berolde helping conduct body himselfe lost much blood could scantly hold longer primaleon hauing regard troupe men dispersed field beheld king edward traine driuen retire albayzar accompanied three giant number knight seeing christian fore trauailed came vpon fresh charge king edward met proud enemie puissance glad draw backe rest himselfe assuring king england behaued himselfe nobly field whole christian campe reposed themselues pompides basiliart sage aliart platir frisol germain orlnance luyman burgundie rodamont albanis frize dragonalt rosiran de la bronde tremoran tenebrant rosuell bellizart diuers christian knight resisted enemy verie valiantly followed fast vpon albayzar company fresh supply still come made notable conquest aduersaries primaleon left gouerne soldane bellagris blandidon went florendos floraman noble king edward england would haue approched espyed emperour vernar polinard brother foote enclosed number turkes liues greatly feared king bythinia slaine emperour vernars horse falling ground brake one maisters legges fall emperour faine stand vppon one legge defend himselfe hard case hee verie neare death brother polinard stept presently defended manly prowesse enemy could way come hurt emperour primaleon seeing misfortune emperour allemaigne turkes sought euery way take life ouercome inward griefe teares trickled downe cheekes fearing vtter ruine constantinople ran courage vpon enemy downe tumbled dead groud euery side florendos thought armour shiuered sheeld defend himselfe yet accompanied prince floraman folowed father shewing incredible prowesse floraman setled himselfe king bithinia preuailed well sent headlong groud depriued life primaleon seeing floraman bee somewhat sore hurt desired withdrawe himselfe battell turkes conducted king bythinia sawe theyr captain slaine beganne retire speedily meanes primaleon recouered mounted polinard horsebacke againe hee could imagine howe got emperour vernar field made aduenture men daunger doubtfull haue fallen enemy hand king armenia came vppon againe foure thousand men hoping recouer king lost primaleon faine alight horse defence emperour vernar like manner prince knight fearing least harme come vnto prince emperour many slaiue newe assault king armenia fiue hundred best tryed soldyers emperour vernar seeing death ready entertaine meanes shun embraced mildely patiently young prince saw emperour slaine carryed foorth fielde brought great heauinesse cittie become manner desolate vertuous valiant king edward seeing himselfe left alone soldane albayzar whome hee dealt stoutly withall pompides platir prince might rest themselues cause friend slaine transported thence ende hee brought albayzar estate kilde fielde hee bene sooner reskued giant came neuerthelesse hee taught dutie well hee tooke english prince sharpe schoolemaister king edward albayzar continued theyr fight night drawing apace trumpet sounded retrait euery one hasted vnto ensigne king edward summoned men together thinking well theyr generall iudged themselues happy vnder leading gouernment bellagris primaleon brought traines likewise place array christian betooke themselues cittie turkes returend theyr campe chap lxiii pof constantinople gaue enemy second battell great misfortune hapned citty amongst chanced vntimely death aged emperour palmerin christian pagan prince theyr force eyther side thus retyred theyr seuerall hold consent albayzar palmerin prince knight slaine battell carryed thence interred theyr funeralls performed grieuous complaint made cittie losse many noble renowned prince leaue iudgement courteous reader must needes thinke griefe great christendome receiued losse many yeeres could recoured againe consideration entred deepe aged emperours heart forsooke earthly vale misery yeelding soule god body bowelles mother whence came first time enchaunted bird kept pallace sung three time together pittifull note olde young court alittle maruaile thereat birde may reade large notable famous history emperour palmerins life booke called palmerin doliue history plentifully stored discourse singular delight worthinesse thereof esteemed many nation history likewise therefore excellency aforesaide history respect dependeth matter briefely touched booke accounted parcell history entend god ayding publish shortly doubt gentle reader shall finde worthy commendation haue vsed place obsequies funeralles emperour solemnized great pompe dignitie like manner honour emperour allemainge king slaine battaile many dayes wounded prince found themselues good disposition againe weerevpon determined enter field enemy demaunded battaile first prouided safegard city committed charge king tarnaes lacedemonia sage aliart obscure valley hauing conduct fiue hundred knight horsebacke foure thousand able footemen rest christian deuided sixe seuerall band first conducted pr nce primaleon atiending two thousand fiue hundred knight second band number committed prince floraman sardignia third king estrellant fourth albanis frieze fifth drapos duke normandie fiue hand like number sixt vnder charge noble king edward came rest christian souldiers soldane bellagris traine charge vtter wing giue ayde saw neede required knight departed citie toward field blacke armour shield colour without deuices horse likewise trapped blacke expresse inward heauinesse would haue neither drumme trumpet kind instrument vsed warre neuerthelesse albeit sad proceeding battaile declared owne heaninesse yet likewise feare terror enemy seeing comming farre euery man closed beuer helmet enemy perceiue mournfull countenance come place battaile fought spread themselues abread field deuice captaines without making maner noyse footemen came attired black likewise without either drum phifes trumpet wherby gaue enemy vnderstand vnfained loue affection bare emperour could forget gracious friendly entertainement woont make enemy thing prince ought haue regard remembring great vertue famous emperour gouerne kingdomes sort people may rather know greeuous losse haue death prince behaue themselues manner subiects shall reioyce rid gouernour turk greatly abashed seeing enemy come marching order knew well mourning habit would battell make account liues albayzar seeing astonishment souldiers came encourage like noble captaine laying renowme victorie recompence trauailes sufficient reuenge death many parent friendes lost liues walles constantinople cause warre first enterprised good space vsed like speech strange sight field christian sad mournefull habites blacke king edward seeing men placed decent order backwings regard hee thought meetest hee gaue charge primaleon giue consent company noble lacedemonia sage aliart obscure valley finding art cittie constantinople would bee brought destruction king edward england prince primaleon rest prince knight maintained warre would stand great hazard loosing liues able auoyd cruelty turk would get cittie possession vpon aforesaid consideration determined prouide safety princess lady high authority great childe neare ime deliuerance wherefore fruit bodyes might perish extremity raised darke obscure cloude shadowed light firmament sort onely field couered therewith also cittie wrapt cloud possible discerne meane army remained great amazement darkenesse power meete together aliart conueyed da ke cloud empresse princesse polinarda princess ladyes beside perillous isle prince palmerin england bestowed shaddowed isle likewise enchantment manner remained inuisible vntill aliart conceiued well time reason thought good discouer lady surprised maruellous admiration wh n found themselues constantinople strange land could haue company wil leaue empresse lady perillous isle returne king tarnaes constantinople cloude vanished away day cleare againe seeing empresse lady sage aliart forsaken companie conceyued extreame griefe within himselfe doubting least mischaunce befallen amidde pittifull lamentation hee yeelded vp ghost leauing cittie comfortlesse dispayring within themselues desired finish liues forsaking quite hope fielde whome happened fortune ordained may read chapter following chap lxv pof second battell betweene christian turkes happened therein darke cloud gone fight sage aliart hauing brought empresse lady perillous isle day began waxe cleere againe armie marched forward meete together enter skyrmish heard lamentable pittifull outcrye made staye hand looking see cause noyse saw great many ladyes damosells come foorth cittie haire dispersed abroade ouer theyr shoulder wringing handes grieuous manner lost king tarnaes sage aliart knew left succour defence came christian campe husband brother sonnes kinsman seeing could promise themselues assurance cittie would liue die fielde king edward primaleon amazed clamor woman caused theyr ensignes stay commanded horseman breake theyr array till vnderstood cause disorder told king tarnaes sage aliart forsaken cittie driuen great admyration themselues whereupon sent pompides platir cittie bring certaine tydings vnlooked mischaunce two knightes come cittie heard manner king tarnaes dyed also howe sage aliart gone man could tell whether beganne thinke within themselues theyr traine brought extremitie fortune concluded finish memorie theyr knightly deedes deliuering theyr liued sword theyr enemy likewise perswade themselues sage aliart absented himselfe occasion onely perceyued theyr generall destruction hand respect iudged hee prouided refuge empresse lady enemy might triumph theyr misfortune great discontentment theyr lordes husbandes heauy newes returned camp againe certifying king edward primaleon sage aliart departed whervpon concluded generall determination withdraw themselues cittie make prouision defence thereof would enter battell enemy assure pittifull sight behold men woman child came fell prince feete yea ancient citizen gray head white beard weake feeble age glad support themselues staues made humble request might rather enter battell thereto end liues destroyed home wiues child enemie king edward primaleon prince little abashed finding pallace desolate manner neyther empresse princess ladyes founde vexed mindes vnexpressable griefe went theyr accustomed chamber finding whome affectionate soules ready forsake theyr bodyes young prince enioying theyr sweet ladyes short time whose sake suffered many bitter brunt thought themselues able liue long time depriued company honored pure vnfained affection paine greater euer beene mishap irkesome danger past lady rewardes knightly victory hauing thus lost sodaine hope enioy sight wherefore seemed men depriued sences looking gastly fearefully one vpon knowing way comfort redr sse present heauinesse case christian prince remained space three day hauing minde giue enemy battaile time primaleon maide conueiance aged men wiues child night time diuers castle fortress neere adioyning knowing farre vnable helpe extremitie caused wals cittie beaten flat ground thought good aduice euery one bee done two especiall cause first would animate imbolden christian time battaile seeing themselues dispoyled place wherein reposed assurance safety enemy vaunt destroyed city defaced christian themselues fortune suffered enioy victorie citie seeing walles spoyled euen first foundation f conceiued hatred turkes whome reputed cause subuersion strongest defence prepared themselues altogether enter field reuenge themselues proud vsurping enemy marched prince field went manner aliart conueied empresse lady constantinople perillous isle albayzar knowing well intent enemy comanded captaines place men aray afterward trumpet summoning brauely battaile commanded king aetolia giue onset band enemy whereto king presently obeyed comming gallantly troupe men prince primaleon prepared himselfe receiue giuing horse spurres preuailed fortunately encounter made king aetolia measure length ground hee quickly succoured men otherwise primaleon giuen death wounde palmerin england ran prince argelao met puissance launce pierced cleane thorowe body fell ground starke dead like knight sauage man valiant knight named richard esteemed singular captaine amongst turkes prince florendos platir gracian berolde knight slew outright likewise encountred ioust dramusiande framustant brake launce yet kept horse valiantly whereupon drew swordes began charge furiously christian behaued themselues worthily first encounter king aetolia whose traine twise many number prince primaleon glad retyre able endure hardy stroakes prince palmerin florian florendos faine betake themselues refuge second squadron conducted king caspia came brauely vpon primaleon company yet able enforce retyre one foote back palmerin prince maintained sight sharply copelled recoyle backeward soldane persia perceiuing came assist company sooth made great slaughter wearied christian beene prince floraman seeing soldane persia come fast forward squadron rushed vpon band men resisted gallant manner palmerin bare great malice soldane persia amorous princesse polinarda wife wherefore ran fiercely brake launce brauely soldane tumbled headlong backward saddle turkes laboured earnestly mount king againe primaleon went ayde prince floraman likewise cast beside horse thus helping one another neerest hand forgotten dramusiande framustant hauing forsaken horse fought long together cruell manner body wounded many place dramusiande like sustaine worst framustant assisted another knight named grantor dramusiande beene slaine betweene beene prince florian deere friend came buckled grantor sort laide dead foote immediatly turkes beheld grantor slaine enuironed prince florian dramusiande terrible euerie side line brought daunger king estrellant hungaria charge third christian squa ron entred vpon tu e droue backe perforce till saw friendes brought safetie againe framustant neere discharged life soldane albayzar seeing daunger commaunded altogether runne christian like king edward men helpe fellowes necessitie florian seeing albayzar comming launce charged rest gaue horse spurres meete two worthy knight encountred together nobly albayzar glad catch holde necke horse shun fall prince florians horse starke trauaile fell ground vnder maister leapt saddle quickly sustained harme fall albayzar laboured earnestly get dramusiande prince florian within rankes men hee sawe cruelly hacked hewed turkes thought himselfe happiest could auoid presence yet company men albayzar hemd withall losse liues determined soldan bellagris polinarda arriued expedition walking vp downe bandes men giue aide perceiued necessitie required saw dangerous estate dramusiande florian thrusting vpon turkes great puissance reskewed dramusiande brought foorth armie rest himselfe mounted florian horsebacke againe notwithstanding practises enemy contrary glad conuey framustant foorth battaile likewise sawe sore trauailed scant able stand feete two giant field greatest hurley burly prince psimaleon palmerin england soldane persia foote fought maruellous fiercely togither like polinard stout turke named ferrebrocque caused men side hasten conflict king aetolia accompanied fiue hundred knight foote came reskew soldan persia berolde spaine remembring death king recinde father ioyned fight king aetolia king edward came thither troupe men assist friend albayzar behalfe soldane persia bringing many knight beside foure stoute cruel giant whose presence much terrifie christian many durst enter fight monster yet could knight giant dismay noble palmerin englad continued fight brauely soldane persia would leaue till saw slaine hia foote whose death tha turkes lamented much principall captaine vnder prince albayzar likewise tooke soldanes death heauily came men vpon christian like mad man victorie prince palmerin soldane little comfort saw ye prince polinard fought still ferrebrocque fall downe dead ground ferrebrocque diuers turkes fall downe slaine side likewise death polinard greeuous friend companion emperor vernar brother kilde first battail empresse bazilia seeing lord husband gon reposed al hope comfort prince polinard florendos whose griefe could expressed death friend polinard bene nourished al youth together emperor court reuenge death deere friend companion ran fiercely amongst thickest enemy first met withal giant pandolfo holding mightie mace hand aduanced himselfe receiue prince florendos began fierce terrible combat betweene within whyle giant pandolfo railed exclaimed god horribly finding himselfe able resist force one knight woont vanquish euery one entred fight florendos regarding railling word brought feeble estate length fell downe knee florendos taking helmet strooke head shoulder berolde spaine lekewise slew king aetolia albayzar perceiued hee came running berolde twentie knight murdred spanish prince amongst soldane bellagris hindered determination came band men reskewed commanding foure knight carrie forth battaile seemed rather dead man one life left order brought pacentio emperor cheefe chamberlaine charge giuen wounded person verie skilfull therein man auncient time iudged fit enter fight prince beroldes misfortune griefe friendes rather desired beare company liue hope vncertain victorie ye doubtfull remembred losse emperor vernar king recinde prince knight sauageman seeing great slaughter albayzar made friendes pricked thorow place came vnto wordes time albayzar alloweth v opportuuitie satisfie long desired reuenge eche two occasion trouble pray thee let quarrell ended betweene thee mee let innocent matter loose liues offence glad aunswered albayzar good happe meete
